Description: APPLICATION PURPOSE: ORIGINAL APPLICATION - THIS IS WYDOTS APPLICATION TO OBLIGATE A TOTAL OF $1201881 IN SECTION 5310 FEDERAL FUNDS. THE FUNDS ARE COMPRISED OF THE FOLLOWING AMOUNTS:5310 STATEWIDE FUNDING - A TOTAL OF $585049 IN:LAPSING FY2021 SECTION 5310 STATEWIDE FORMULA FUNDS OF $239523.FY2022 BIL SECTION 5310 STATEWIDE FORMULA FUNDS OF $345526.5310 URBAN FUNDING - A TOTAL OF $616832 IN URBAN FORMULA FUNDS IN:LAPSING FY2021 SECTION 5310 URBAN FORMULA FUNDS OF $251101.FY2022 BIL SECTION 5310 URBAN FORMULA FUNDS OF $365731.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THIS GRANT WILL FUND THE FOLLOWING CATEGORIES OF ACTIVITIES BY TYPE OF FUND:STATEWIDE FUNDING:MOBILITY MANAGEMENT - $321778OPERATING//VOUCHER PROGRAM - $204767STATE ADMINISTRATION - $58504TOTAL STATEWIDE FUNDING - $585049URBAN FUNDING:MOBILITY MANAGEMENT - $339259OPERATING//VOUCHER PROGRAM - $215890STATE ADMINISTRATION - $61683TOTAL URBAN FUNDING - $616832; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS AWARD WILL CONTINUE FUNDING BOTH THE EXISTING MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND VOUCHER PROGRAMS THAT BENEFIT TRANSPORTATION NEEDS ACROSS ALL COUNTIES IN THE STATE OF WYOMING AND ALSO ENHANCES THE USE AND ACCESSIBILITY OF TRANSPORTATION NETWORKS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS AND PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION RIDERS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THIS AWARD WILL FUND MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND OPERATING/VOUCHER PROGRAMS FOR 23 COUNTIES ACROSS THE STATE OF WYOMING. STATE ADMINISTRATION IS ALSO BEING DEDUCTED AND USED TO ADMINISTER THE PROGRAMS.

PURPOSE:THIS IS WYDOTS FFY2021 ARP FUNDING APPLICATION IN THE AMOUNT OF $84504 WHICH IS THE SUM OF THE RURAL AND SMALL URBAN APPORTIONMENTS FOR THE STATE: STATEWIDE/RURAL - $40430 (FULL APPORTIONMENT) AND SMALL URBAN - $44074 (FULL APPORTIONMENT). THE FUNDS ARE PROVIDED AT A 100% FEDERAL MATCHING RATIO.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES ARP FUNDING TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR THE EXISTING VOUCHER PROGRAMS IN THE STATE. THE VOUCHER PROGRAMS ARE CURRENTLY PART OF A LOCALLY DEVELOPED COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT-HUMAN SERVICE TRANSPORTATION PLAN. (THE FTA APPROVAL LETTER FOR THIS PLAN IS ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION.) THE GRANT SCOPE OF WORK IS ORGANIZED INTO TWO PROJECTS IN ORDER TO CORRELATE WITH THE TWO TYPES OF FUNDING:PROJECT #1 - STATEWIDE/RURAL FUNDING OF $40430 FOR THE EXISTING VOUCHER PROGRAM OPERATED BY THE WYOMING SERVICES FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING PROJECT #2 - SMALL URBAN FUNDING OF $44074 FOR THE EXISTING VOUCHER PROGRAM OPERATED BY THE WYOMING INDEPENDENT LIVING EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THESE PROJECTS WILL SUPPORT THE EXISTING VOUCHER PROGRAMS WHICH SERVE THE ENTIRE STATE WITH TRANSPORTATION THAT OTHERWISE MIGHT NOT BE AVAILABLE BY UTILIZING VOLUNTEER DRIVERS OR EXISTING PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS WITH A CHECK SYSTEM.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:TRANSIT PASSENGERS LOCATED THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF WYOMING.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THE SUBRECIPIENTS FOR THIS APPLICATION ARE WYOMING SERVICES FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING AND WYOMING INDEPENDENT LIVING AND THIS APPLICATION WILL FUND OPERATING COSTS FOR TRIPS PROVIDED.OTHER INFORMATION:WYDOT AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.THESE ACTIVITIES ARE INCLUDED IN THE COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES PLAN AND THE 55% TRADITIONAL SERVICES REQUIREMENT IS MET IN THIS APPLICATION. REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION INCLUDING THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS IS UPLOADED UNDER THE DOCUMENTS SECTION. MORE DETAILS ARE PROVIDED IN THE PROJECT DESCRIPTIONS. THERE IS NO LOCAL MATCH REQUIRED FOR THIS APPLICATION.PER ARP THE PROJECTS IN THIS APPLICATION ARE NOT REQUIRED TO BE PROGRAMMED IN THE STIP. HOWEVER WYDOT INCLUDED THE ACTIVITIES IN THE APPROVED FFY2022 STIP. THE APPROVAL LETTER IS UPLOADED TO THIS APPLICATION.PRE-AWARD STATEMENT: WYDOT IS REQUESTING PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY FOR THE ENTIRE AMOUNT OF THE AWARD ($84504) STARTING OCTOBER 1 2021.

PURPOSE:THIS IS WYDOTS FFY 2021 CRRSAA FUNDING APPLICATION IN THE AMOUNT OF $84502 WHICH IS 100% FEDERAL SHARE OF THE TOTAL ELIGIBLE AMOUNTS: RURAL - $40429 AND SMALL URBAN - $44073 APPORTIONMENTS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES CRRSAA FUNDING TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS FOR OPERATING FUNDS FOR THE EXISTING VOUCHER PROGRAMS IN THE STATE. THE VOUCHER PROGRAMS ARE CURRENTLY PART OF A LOCALLY DEVELOPED COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT-HUMAN SERVICE TRANSPORTATION PLAN. (THE FTA APPROVAL LETTER FOR THIS PLAN IS ATTACHED IN TRAMS.) THE GRANT SCOPE OF WORK IS ORGANIZED INTO TWO PROJECTS IN ORDER TO CORRELATE WITH THE TWO TYPES OF FUNDS: 1. RURAL FUNDING FOR THE EXISTING VOUCHER PROGRAM - PROJECT #1 - RURAL - $40429 FEDERAL FUNDS - WYOMING SERVICES FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING WHICH SERVICES THE 10 COUNTIES OF WESTERN WYOMING FOR THE VOUCHER PROGRAM - $40429 OPERATING. 2. SMALL URBAN FUNDING FOR THE EXISTING VOUCHER PROGRAM PROJECT #2 - SMALL URBAN - $44073 FEDERAL FUNDS - WYOMING INDEPENDENT LIVING WHICH SERVICES THE 13 COUNTIES OF EASTERN WYOMING FOR THE VOUCHER PROGRAM - $44073 OPERATING.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THESE PROJECTS WILL SUPPORT THE EXISTING VOUCHER PROGRAMS WHICH SERVICE THE ENTIRE STATE WITH TRANSPORTATION THAT OTHERWISE MIGHT NOT BE AVAILABLE BY UTILIZING VOLUNTEER DRIVERS OR EXISTING PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS WITH A CHECK SYSTEM.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:TRANSIT PASSENGERS LOCATED THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF WYOMING.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THE SUBRECIPIENTS FOR THIS APPLICATION ARE WYOMING SERVICES FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING AND WYOMING INDEPENDENT LIVING AND THIS APPLICATION WILL FUND OPERATING COSTS FOR TRIPS.OTHER INFORMATION:WYDOT AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.PER THE CRRSAA THE PROJECTS IN THIS APPLICATION ARE NOT REQUIRED TO BE PROGRAMMED IN THE STIP BUT THEY WERE INCLUDED IN THE APPROVED FFY2022 STIP. THE INDIVIDUAL PROJECTS ARE LISTED ON THE LAST PAGE (PAGE 24) OF THE STIP COUNTY TRANSIT PROJECT PAGES - WHICH IS UPLOADED UNDER THE DOCUMENTS SECTION.ADDITIONAL DOCUMENTS INCLUDING A PROGRAM OF PROJECTS ARE ALSO UPLOADED UNDER THE DOCUMENTS SECTION. MORE DETAILS ARE PROVIDED IN THE PROJECT DESCRIPTIONS. THERE IS NO LOCAL MATCH REQUIRED FOR THIS APPLICATION.PRE-AWARD STATEMENT: WYDOT IS REQUESTING PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY FOR THE ENTIRE AMOUNT OF THE AWARD STARTING OCTOBER 1 2021.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO ELIGIBLE RECIPIENTS TO MEET THE TRANSPORTATION NEEDS OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES THROUGHOUT WEST VIRGINIA.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THIS APPLICATION WILL FUND THE PURCHASE OF REPLACEMENT AND EXPANSION VANS AS WELL AS STATE PROGRAM ADMIN FUNDS MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND FUNDING FOR THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: CONTINUED SAFE AND EFFECTIVE OPERATION OF TRANSIT SERVICES FOR ALL AREAS OF WEST VIRGINIA NOTABLY THE RURAL AREAS WHICH IS MOST OF THE STATE.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: WVDOT TRANSIT AGENCIES AND CITIZENS IN THE 5310S PROGRAMS DEFINITION OF RURAL AND SMALL URBAN AREAS OF THE STATE. NOTE: WEST VIRGINIA DOES NOT HAVE ANY URBAN AREAS BY PROGRAM STANDARDS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE FOLLOWING NINE (9) PRIVATE NON-PROFITS AND TWO (2) LEAD AREA TRANSIT PROVIDERS IN THE SMALL URBANS AREAS AND NINETEEN (19) PRIVATE NON-PROFITS IN THE RURAL AREAS OF WEST VIRGINIA. THE PROJECTS INCLUDED IN THIS APPLICATION WERE DERIVED FROM THE 2019 COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT - HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLANS (PLANS) AND/OR FROM CURRENT PARTICIPATION IN THE CURRENT 2023 PLANS BEING UPDATED AND DEVELOPED BY VARIOUS WEST VIRGINIA PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT COUNCILS LOCATED THROUGHOUT THE STATE. THE WEST VIRGINIA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION DIVISION OF PUBLIC TRANSIT (WVDOT) SECTION IS APPLYING FOR FFY 2022 SECTION 5310 ENHANCED MOBILITY OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES PROGRAM FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $2830061 ($1307284 FOR RURAL APPORTIONMENT AND $1522777 FOR SMALL URBAN APPORTIONMENT) TO SUPPORT THE STATE DOTS FFY 2022 PROGRAM OF PROJECTS (POP). THE WVDOT IS APPLYING FOR FUNDING FOR BOTH RURAL AND SMALL URBAN AREAS FOR THE FOLLOWING PROJECTS:RURAL PROJECTS INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING:PURCHASE OF EIGHT (8) REPLACEMENT VANSPURCHASE OF FOUR (4) EXPANSION VANS3RD PARTY CONTRACTED SERVICESSMALL URBAN PROJECTS INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING:STATE PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION FUNDS3RD PARTY CONTRACTED SERVICESPURCHASE OF ONE (1) REPLACEMENT SUVPURCHASE OF EIGHT (8) REPLACEMENT VANSPURCHASE OF ONE (1) EXPANSION VANALL PROJECTS IN THE CURRENT POP ARE IN CATEGORY A STATUS AND ARE FOR TRADITIONAL SECTION 5310 PROJECTS AND THUS MEET THE REQUIREMENT TO SPEND 55% OF THE APPORTIONMENT TOWARD TRADITIONAL CAPITAL PROJECTS.THE STATES FY 2022 SECTION 5310 POP IS ATTACHED TO THIS GRANT UNDER APPLICATION DOCUMENTS. THE TOTAL NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS FUNDED IN THE POP IS TWELVE (12) PRIVATE NON-PROFITS IN THE SMALL URBANS AREAS AND TWENTY (20) PRIVATE NON-PROFITS IN THE RURAL AREAS. THE PROJECTS INCLUDED IN THIS APPLICATION WERE DERIVED FROM UPDATED COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT - HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLANS DEVELOPED BY VARIOUS WEST VIRGINIA PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT COUNCILS LOCATED THROUGHOUT THE STATE. IN ADDITION EACH PLAN HAS BEEN APPROVED BY THE WEST VIRGINIA DIVISION OF PUBLIC TRANSIT.THE STATE MANAGEMENT PLAN FOR THE STATE FY 2022 SECTION 5310 PROGRAM WAS APPROVED BY FTA ON MARCH 7 2019.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO ELIGIBLE RECIPIENTS TO MEET THE TRANSPORTATION NEEDS OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES THROUGHOUT WEST VIRGINIA.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS APPLICATION WILL FUND THE PURCHASE OF REPLACEMENT AND EXPANSION VANS AS WELL AS STATE PROGRAM ADMIN FUNDS AND FUNDING FOR THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: CONTINUED SAFE AND EFFECTIVE OPERATION OF TRANSIT SERVICES FOR RURAL AREAS OF WEST VIRGINIA. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: WVDOT TRANSIT AGENCIES AND CITIZENS IN THE RURAL AND NON-URBANIZED AREAS OF THE STATE. THE STATE MANAGEMENT PLAN FOR THE STATE FY 2021 SECTION 5310 PROGRAM WAS APPROVED BY FTA ON MARCH 7 2019.THE CORONAVIRUS RESPONSE AND RELIEF SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS ACT (CRRSAA) PERMITS PREVIOUSLY APPROPRIATED NON-CRRSAA FUNDS FROM FY 21 AND PRIOR YEARS TO BE AWARDED AT 100% FEDERAL SHARE. THEREFORE THIS GRANT WILL BE AWARDED AT 100% FEDERAL.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE WEST VIRGINIA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION DIVISION OF PUBLIC TRANSIT (WVDOT) ON BEHALF OF SOUTHERN HIGHLANDS COMMUNITY MENTAL HEALTH CENTER INC. IS APPLYING FFY 2018 ACCESS AND MOBILITY PARTNERSHIP (ICAM) FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $194944 FOR THE FOLLOWING:MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PURCHASE OF ONE (1) 12 PASSENGER VAN FOR NON-EMERGENCY MEDICAL TRANSPORTATIONPURCHASE OF FIVE (5) CROSSOVER AWD VEHICLES FOR NON-EMERGENCY MEDICAL TRANSPORTATIONON MAY 22 2019 A NOTICE WAS PUBLISHED ANNOUNCING THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATIONS SELECTION OF PROJECTS FUNDED UNDER THE ACCESS MOBILITY PARTNERSHIP PROGRAM. IN THIS NOTICE AS DETAILED ON PAGE 12 SOUTHERN HIGHLANDS COMMUNITY MENTAL HEALTH CENTER INC WAS SELECTED TO RECEIVE $194944 IN FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) FFY 2018 ACCESS MOBILITY PARTNERSHIP COMPETITIVE PROGRAM FUNDS. A COPY OF THE COMPETITIVE APPLICATION PROPOSAL IS ATTACHED.THE NON-FEDERAL SHARE WILL BE PROVIDED BY SOUTHERN HIGHLANDS COMMUNITY MENTAL HEALTH CENTER INC.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: PURCHASE FIVE AWD VEHICLES FOR SERVICE AREA BUY ONE 12 PASSENGER VAN PROVIDE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT SERVICES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: IMPROVED SERVICES TO THE CLIENTS WITHIN THE SERVICE AREA.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: CLIENTS WITHIN THE SERVICE AREA OF SOUTHERN HIGNLANDS INITIATIVE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: PROVIDE MEDICAL TRANSPORT FOR THEIR CLIENTS

APPLICATION PURPOSE: SUPPORT TO ELDERLY AND DISABLED USERS OF THE TRANSIT SYSTEM INCLUDING OUTREACH TO INFORM USERS OF NEW FEATURES AND TRAINING OPERATORS ON SAFETY FEATURES.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: CREATION OF AN ON-CALL CONTRACT FOR STRANDED RIDERS OF THE FIXED ROUTE SYSTEM;PUBLIC OUTREACH AND MARKETING TO APPLICABLE RIDERS RELATING TO VAN SERVICE CHANGES BUS RAPID TRANSIT NEW FARE SYSTEM AND PLANNED CHANGES TO THE SYSTEM AND ITS ROUTES;SUPPORT FOR THE ID CARD DATABASE FOR ELDERLY AND DISABLED SYSTEM USERS;BUS OPERATOR TRAINING ON SAFETY RESTRAINTS FOR RIDERS IN WHEELCHAIRS ON THE NEW BUS RAPID TRANSIT ROUTE;SURVEY FOR PARATRANSIT USERS AND BENCHMARKING DATA;SUBSCRIPTION FOR ON-DEMAND VISUAL-INTERPRETATION SERVICES FOR VISION-IMPAIRED USERS; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: BETTER EDUCATED USERS AND OPERATORS OF THE TRANSIT SYSTEM FOCUSING ON ELDERLY AND DISABLED RIDERS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: USERS OF THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY TRANSIT SYSTEM WHO ARE ELDERLY OR HAVE DISABILITIES.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

APPLICATION PURPOSE: VALLEY TRANSIT INTENDS TO COMBINE FUNDS WITH OTHER ALLOCATED GRANTS TO COMPLETE A REMODEL/CONSTRUCTION PROJECT OF ITS WHITMAN ADMINISTRATION AND MAINTENANCE BUILDING (WHITMAN FACILITY). THE WHITMAN FACILITY WAS CONSTRUCTED IN 1983 AND IS IN NEED OF MAJOR RENOVATIONS TO MEET CURRENT AND FUTURE SERVICE NEEDS. IT IS LOCATED AT 801 S. WHITMAN AVE. APPLETON WI. THE EXISTING FACILITY IS NOT ONLY IN DISREPAIR BUT ALSO NEEDS TO BE EXPANDED TO ACCOMMODATE CURRENT STAFFING LEVELS. THE FACILITY IS ESSENTIAL TO THE PROVISION OF SERVICE FOR VALLEY TRANSITS TRANSPORTATION NETWORK. THESE 5310 FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR A PORTION OF THE CONSTRUCTION THAT IS DESIGNATED OFFICE SPACE FOR VALLEY TRANSITS MOBILITY MANGER AND FUTURE EXPANSION OF DEMAND RESPONSE ADA DISPATCH.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: VALLEY TRANSIT WILL USE FUNDS TO RENOVATE AND EXPAND ITS CURRENT ADMINISTRATION AND MAINTENANCE BUILDING (WHITMAN FACILITY). THE NEW/RENOVATED FACILITY PLANS INCLUDE NEW OFFICE SPACE FOR VALLEY TRANSITS MOBILITY MANAGER AND FUTURE EXPANSION OF DEMAND RESPONSE ADA DISPATCH ALONG WITH ADDITIONAL OFFICE SPACE CONFERENCE AND TRAINING ROOMS AND A RENOVATED EMPLOYEE BREAK AREA. THE NEW FACILITY WILL IMPROVE ACCESS FOR ALL EMPLOYEES VISITORS INCLUDING INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. THIS PROJECT CONTAINS NEEDED ADA COMPLIANCE UPGRADES FOR WATER FOUNTAINS MEETING SPACE BATHROOM FIXTURES PATHS OF TRAVEL TO THE FRONT DOOR AND THROUGHOUT THE FACILITY FRONT SALES COUNTER LOCKER ROOMS AND EMPLOYEE SHOWERS. THE FACILITY PLAN ALSO INCLUDES SEVERAL GREEN FEATURES SUCH AS A RAINWATER TANK ROOFTOP SOLAR PANELS GEOTHERMAL SYSTEM AND A WASTE OIL BURNER. SIXTY SEVEN PERCENT OF THE RENOVATION FOOTPRINT WILL FOCUS ON THE EXISTING BUILDING STRUCTURE AND REUSE MATERIALS ALREADY IN PLACE. VALLEY TRANSIT IS READY TO BEGIN CONSTRUCTION ON THIS PROJECT. THE PROJECT IS IN THE CITY MASTER PLAN AND HAS COMPLETED ALL PRE-CONSTRUCTION PHASES INCLUDING THE FTAS SECTION 106 PROCESS (NEPA) AND AE WORK. VALLEY TRANSIT HAS INVESTED RESOURCES ON ADDED OVERSIGHT INCLUDING A CONSTRUCTABILITY REVIEW AND VALUE ENGINEERING COMPLETED BY AN INDEPENDENT PARTY. THE CONSTRUCTION DOCUMENTS HAVE BEEN PREPARED AND APPROVED BY VALLEY TRANSITS GOVERNING BOARDS. GRANT DOLLARS WILL BE USED TO FUND THE CAPITAL CONSTRUCTION PROJECT.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE AN UPDATED AND MORE EFFICIENT AND SECURE BUILDING THAT ADHERES TO ADA REGULATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS ALONG WITH A NEW SPACE FOR VALLEY TRANSITS MOBILITY MANAGER AND FUTURE EXPANSION FOR ADA DEMAND RESPONSE DISPATCH. RENOVATION PROJECTS TO UPGRADE PORTIONS OF THE FACILITY OR SYSTEMS WITHIN THE BUILDING HAVE BEEN PROPOSED OVER THE PAST 10 YEARS. WITH LIMITED CAPITAL FUNDS THESE PROJECTS HAVE GONE UNFUNDED AS VALLEY TRANSIT NEEDED TO PRIORITIZE ALL AVAILABLE FUNDING TO COMPLETE THE MOST IMPORTANT PROJECTS FIRST SUCH AS VEHICLE REPLACEMENT. THIS PROJECT WILL COMPLETE ALL THE PROJECTS THAT WERE DELAYED OR UNDERWENT A TEMPORARY REPAIR SUCH AS REHAB OR REPLACEMENT OF THE FACILITIES HVAC SYSTEM BUS WASH PARKING LOT SURFACES ADMINISTRATION OFFICE EXPANSION AND REPAIR AND UPDATING OF THE LOCKER ROOMS AND REST ROOM AREAS. THE NEW/RENOVATED FACILITY WILL HAVE ADDITIONAL OFFICE SPACE FOR VALLEY TRANSITS MOBILITY MANAGER CONFERENCE/TRAINING ROOMS AND OFFICE SPACE FOR FUTURE EXPANSION OF DEMAND RESPONSE ADA DISPATCH. CURRENTLY THE OPERATIONS STAFF SHARE WORK AREAS WITH CITY DISPATCH AND THE MOBILITY MANAGER SHARES AN OFFICE WITH THE TRAVEL TRAINER. VALLEY TRANSITS SINGLE CONFERENCE/TRAINING ROOM HAS A 6-PERSON CAPACITY. WITH WELL OVER 36 FULL-TIME DRIVER POSITIONS VARIABLE PART-TIME DRIVERS 4 FULL-TIME MECHANICS 3 DISPATCHERS AND REMAINING 9 ADMIN/SUPERVISORY STAFF THIS SPACE IS NOT SUFFICIENT FOR TRAINING OR EVEN BASIC MANAGEMENT STAFF MEETINGS. DRIVERS OFTEN REVIEW TRAINING MATERIALS AND WATCH TRAINING VIDEOS IN A SMALL COMMON SPACE THAT IS MULTI-PURPOSE(BREAK ROOM EMPLOYEE MAILBOXES MESSAGE BOARD PUNCH CLOCK AND VENDING AREA). THE CURRENT FACILITY ALSO CANNOT ACCOMMODATE ANY FUTURE PLANS FOR SERVICE EXPANSION. SIGNIFICANT SECURITY UPGRADES ARE PLANNED. THE PUBLIC/CUSTOMER ENTRY DOES NOT RESTRICT ACCESS TO ENSURE BUILDING SAFETY. A REDESIGNED CUSTOMER TRANSACTION AREA IS PLANNED ALONG WITH UPDATED SURVEILLANCE CAMERAS AND IMPROVED CAMERA COVERAGE IS PLANNED.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE VALLEY TRANSIT EMPLOYEES CUSTOMERS AND VISITORS AND FUNDING PARTNERS. AS STATED PREVIOUSLY THE NEW FACILITY WILL IMPROVE ACCESS FOR ALL EMPLOYEES VISITORS INCLUDING INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. THIS PROJECT CONTAINS NEEDED ADA COMPLIANCE UPGRADES THROUGHOUT THE FACILITY. THE PROJECT HAS ADDED SPACE TO ACCOMMODATE CURRENT AND FUTURE STAFFING. CURRENT STAFF THAT SHARE A WORKSPACE WILL HAVE THEIR OWN WORK ENVIRONMENTS ALONG WITH A NEW DISPATCH AREA FOR FUTURE ADA SERVICES. THE PROJECT INCLUDES IMPROVEMENTS FOCUSED ON VALLEY TRANSIT EMPLOYEES WITH UPGRADED LOCKER ROOMS SHOWERS AND BREAK ROOM. NEW AREAS INCLUDE A QUIET ROOM AND A MOTHERS ROOM. VALLEY TRANSIT IS ANTICIPATING THAT THE GREEN FEATURES PLANNED FOR THIS RENOVATION WILL HELP TO MAINTAIN OPERATING EXPENSES AT CURRENT LEVELS. VALLEY TRANSIT WORKS CLOSELY WITH THE CITY OF APPLETONS FACILITIES MANAGEMENT STAFF FOR ALL AREAS OF FACILITIES MAINTENANCE. ANNUAL FACILITY MAINTENANCE EXPENSES AVERAGE OVER $110000 EACH YEAR. BETWEEN 2017 AND 2020 FACILITY MAINTENANCE COST ROSE OVER 20%. WHILE THE FACILITIES TEAM HAS DONE EXCELLENT WORK MAINTAINING THE FACILITY OVER ITS ENTIRE LIFE THE NEEDED IMPROVEMENTS ARE ONLY AVAILABLE THROUGH MAJOR RENOVATION AND/OR REPLACEMENT. ; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO SUPPORT THE PROJECTS THAT WERE SELECTED BY THE MADISON MPO THROUGH THE PROCESS DESCRIBED IN THE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT PLAN (PMP) THAT IS ATTACHED. THESE PROJECTS ARE THE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS FOR THE CITY OF MADISON--METRO TRANSIT AND DANE COUNTY OPERATING ASSISTANCE AND PURCHASE OF SOFTWARE FOR THE YWCA AND PURCHASE OF VEHICLES FOR DCATS NEWBRIDGE MADISON OPTIONS IN COMMUNITY LIVING AND THE YWCA ALL OF WHICH ENHANCE THE PUBLIC TRANSIT EXPERIENCE FOR SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS UNDER THIS GRANT WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT THE PROJECTS THAT WERE SELECTED BY THE MADISON MPO THROUGH THE PROCESS DESCRIBED IN THE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT PLAN (PMP) THAT IS ATTACHED. THESE PROJECTS ARE THE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS FOR THE CITY OF MADISON--METRO TRANSIT AND DANE COUNTY OPERATING ASSISTANCE AND PURCHASE OF SOFTWARE FOR THE YWCA AND PURCHASE OF VEHICLES FOR DCATS NEWBRIDGE MADISON OPTIONS IN COMMUNITY LIVING AND THE YWCA ALL OF WHICH ENHANCE THE PUBLIC TRANSIT EXPERIENCE FOR SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES. THE 2023 PROGRAM OF PROJECTS WILL ALSO BE PARTIALLY FUNDED BY OLDER GRANT FUNDS FROM GRANT WI-2022-028 IN ORDER TO CLOSE IT OUT.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL ALLOW THE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS AT THE CITY OF MADISON--METRO TRANSIT AND DANE COUNTY TO CONTINUE OPERATING ASSISTANCE AND PURCHASE OF SOFTWARE FOR THE YWCA AND ENABLE DCATS NEWBRIDGE MADISON OPTIONS IN COMMUNITY LIVING AND THE YWCA TO PURCHASE MUCH NEEDED ACCESSIBLE VEHICLES TO PROVIDE MORE RELIABLE TRANSIT SERVICE FOR SENIOR AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFIT FOR THE CITY OF MADISON AND DANE COUNTY RIDERS WILL BE THE CONTINUED MOBILITY MANAGEMENT ASSISTANCE AND IMPROVED TRANSIT OPTIONS WHICH ENHANCE THE PUBLIC TRANSIT EXPERIENCE FOR SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: DANE COUNTY MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM YWCA OPERATING ASSISTANCE AND PURCHASE OF SOFTWARE AND DCATS NEWBRIDGE MADISON OPTIONS IN COMMUNITY LIVING AND THE YWCA ACCESSIBLE VEHICLES PROCUREMENT PROJECTS.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO SUPPORT THE PROJECTS THAT WERE SELECTED BY THE MADISON MPO THROUGH THE PROCESS DESCRIBED IN THE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT PLAN (PMP) THAT IS ATTACHED. THE PROJECT SELECTED IS THE EMERGENCY RELIEF OPERATING ASSISTANCE (PAYROLL) FOR DANE COUNTY ACCESSIBLE TAXI SERVICE (DCATS) WHICH ENHANCE THE PUBLIC TRANSIT EXPERIENCE FOR SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES. PURPOSE: THIS APPLICATION REQUESTS THE FULL $1677087 WISCONSIN FFY 2021 5310 SMALL URBAN (SU) ALLOCATION AND THE FULL $1528503 WISCONSIN FFY 2021 5310 RURAL (RU) ALLOCATION WHICH WILL BE USED TO FUND THE CY22 WISCONSIN 5310 PROGRAM INCLUDING OPERATING MOBILITY MANAGEMENT ADMINISTRATIVE AND VEHICLE PURCHASE PROJECTS. THE TOTAL GRANT AMOUNT IS $3205590 IN FY21 5310 FUNDS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THESE FUNDS ARE FOR REPLACEMENT VEHICLE PURCHASES ($332000 SU; $286400 RU; $618400 (TOTAL) EXPANSION VEHICLE PROJECTS ($146400 SU: $43200 RU; $189600 TOTAL) MOBILITY MANAGEMENT ($443996 SU; $512089 RU; $956085 TOTAL) OPERATING ASSISTANCE ($586982 SU; $533964 RU; $1120946 TOTAL) AND ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES ($167709 SU; $152850 RU; $320559 TOTAL).THIS APPLICATION COMPLIES WITH THE 55% TRADITIONAL MINIMUM AND MAXIMUM 45% NON-TRADITIONAL/ADMINISTRATION REQUIREMENT FOR SECTION 5310 GRANT UTILIZATION BOTH IN TERMS OF RURAL AND SMALL URBAN FUNDING BY FISCAL YEAR AND THE GRANT AS A WHOLE:PROJECTS INCLUDED WITHIN THIS GRANT APPLICATION ARE INCLUDED ON LOCALLY-DEVELOPED TRANSPORTATION COORDINATED TRANSIT AND HUMAN SERVICE AGENCY PLANS.LOCAL CASH MATCH OF $425731 WILL BE PROVIDED BY LOCALITIES WHERE THE SEPARATE PROJECTS WILL BE IMPLEMENTED. ADDITIONAL IN-KIND MATCH OF $1136237 WILL ALSO BE PROVIDED BY THOSE LOCALITIES. THE LOCAL MATCH DOCUMENTS ARE ATTACHED.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:FUNDING WILL PERMIT WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (WISDOT) AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE VITAL TRANSIT SERVICES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS IN CALENDAR YEAR 2022.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND THE ELDERLY IN WISCONSINS SMALL URBAN AND RURAL AREAS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:40 SUBRECIPIENT TRANSIT PROVIDERS WERE CHOSEN TO UNDERTAKE THE WISCONSIN CY2022 5310 PROGRAM INCLUDING PURCHASING REPLACEMENT BUSES AND VANS PURCHASING EXPANSION BUSES AND VANS OPERATING ASSISTANCE AND MOBILITY MANAGEMENT. SEE ATTACHED POP FOR DETAILS.IN EXECUTING THIS GRANT WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (WISDOT) AGREES TO ABIDE BY SECTION 3011 OF THE FAST ACT (49 U.S.C. 5323(J)(2)(C) REGARDING THE PHASED INCREASE IN DOMESTIC CONTENT UNDER THE BUY AMERICA STATUTE FOR ROLLING STOCK.AS GRANT AGREEMENT INCLUDES AN FTA FUNDED TRANSIT VEHICLE PURCHASE WISDOT AGREES TO COMPLY WITH THE RELATED REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN 49 CFR 26.49(A). SPECIFICALLY WISDOT MUST ENSURE AS A CONDITION OF BEING AUTHORIZED TO BID OR PROPOSE ON FTA ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE PROCUREMENTS THAT EACH TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURER CERTIFIED THAT IT COMPLIED WITH DOT REQUIREMENTS FOR SUBMITTING A DBE PROGRAM AND GOAL TO FTA PRIOR TO BIDDING. WISDOT IS ALSO REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE NAME OF THE SUCCESSFUL BIDDER AND THE TOTAL DOLLAR VALUE OF THE CONTRACT WITHIN 30 DAYS OF MAKING A FTA ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE AWARD USING THE REQUIRED FTA REPORTING TOOL. WISDOT UNDERSTANDS THAT FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THESE REQUIREMENTS MAY RESULT IN FORMAL ENFORCEMENT ACTION OR APPROPRIATE SANCTION AS DETERMINED BY FTA INCLUDING REIMBURSEMENT OF FTA FUNDS USED FOR THE VEHICLE PROCUREMENT.ADDITIONAL ATTACHMENTS INCLUDE FTA APPROVALS ON THE WISDOT STIP JANUARY 2022 AMENDMENT SEVERAL TIP AMENDMENTS FROM MPOS AND CORRESPONDING PROGRAM OF PROJECTS.

THIS IS A FY 2020 SECTION 5310 ENHANCED MOBILITY OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES GRANT IN THE AMOUNT OF $185265 FOR THE CITY OF APPLETON VALLEY TRANSIT. THE TOTAL PROJECT COST IS $250948. LOCAL SHARES WILL BE PROVIDED BY PRIVATE DONATIONS (CASH MATCH) AND TAX LEVIES FROM MUNICIPALITIES AND COUNTIES IN THE SERVICE AREA. ALL PROJECTS ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE LOCAL COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN.THE FOLLOWING PROJECTS ARE PROPOSED:MOBILITY MANAGEMENT SUB-RECIPIENT PROGRAM: FUNDING WILL BE AWARDED TO A SUB-RECIPIENT FOR A MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM. THE SUB-RECIPIENT IS NON-PROFIT LUTHERAN SOCIAL SERVICES OF WISCONSIN AND UPPER MICHIGAN. PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM IS TO COORDINATE ACTIVITIES IN THE RURAL AREAS SURROUNDING THE FOX CITIES AND OTHER NEIGHBORING COUNTIES. THE MOBILITY MANGER WORKS WITH THE VALLEY TRANSIT MOBILITY MANGER TO COORDINATE TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS THROUGHOUT THE RURAL COMMUNITY. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE LLS MOBILITY MANAGER WILL PARTICIPATE IN LOCAL TRANSPORTATION COORDINATION MEETINGS. THE MOBILITY MANAGER WILL ALSO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION EDUCATION TO THE COMMUNITY THROUGH PRESENTATIONS WRITTEN ARTICLES AND ONE-TO-ONE CONTACTS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: INCREASED COORDINATION BETWEEN AGENCIES AND TRAVELERS ALONG WITH IMPROVED ACCESS TO TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS FOR THE INDIVIDUAL RIDER.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROGRAM IS THE ELDERLY POPULATION AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES.TOTAL PROJECT: $53283FTA FUNDS: $42706LOCAL FUNDS: $10577VOLUNTEER DRIVER SUB-RECIPIENT PROGRAM: FUNDING WILL BE AWARDED TO A SUB-RECIPIENT FOR A VOLUNTEER DRIVER PROGRAM (MAKING THE RIDE HAPPEN). THE SUB-RECIPIENT IS NON-PROFIT LUTHERAN SOCIAL SERVICES OF WISCONSIN AND UPPER MICHIGAN. PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THE VOLUNTEER DRIVER PROGRAM IS TO PROVIDE RIDES TO SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHO DO NOT FIT THE CRITERIA FOR OTHER ESTABLISHED AVAILABLE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE MAKING THE RIDE HAPPEN PROGRAM MAINTAINS A CALL CENTER THAT KEEPS A COMPREHENSIVE DATABASE OF TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS AVAILABLE IN THE FOX CITIES TRANSPORTATION MANAGEMENT AREA. THE DATABASE IS USED TO RECOMMEND AN ARRAY OF SERVICES AVAILABLE TO CALLERS. WHEN THERE ARE LIMITED OPTIONS AVAILABLE THE VOLUNTEER DRIVER PROGRAM CAN BE UTILIZED. MAKING THE RIDE HAPPEN USES VOLUNTEER DRIVERS TO PROVIDE RIDES TO PEOPLE WHO LIVE IN RURAL AREAS ARE TRAVELING ACROSS COUNTY LINES OR ARE NOT ABLE TO USE OTHER ESTABLISHED TRANSPORTATION SERVICES IN THE AREA. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: INCREASED SERVICES AND CAPACITY AVAILABLE TO SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES FOR TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROGRAM IS THE ELDERLY POPULATION AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES.TOTAL PROJECT: $85211FTA FUNDS: $42605LOCAL FUNDS: $42606OUTAGAMIE COUNTY RURAL AND EMPLOYMENT TRANSPORTATION SERVICES: VALLEY TRANSIT PROVIDES A RURAL PARATRANSIT SERVICE THAT EXCEED ADA REQUIREMENTS (SERVICE BEYOND THE MILE REQUIREMENT). THIS IS A TURN-KEY PURCHASED TRANSPORTATION PROJECT ELIGIBLE UNDER CAPITAL COST OF CONTRACTING.PURPOSE: VALLEY TRANSITS RURAL DEMAND RESPONSIVE SERVICE IS A SHARED RIDE SERVICE FOR ELDERLY AND DISABLED PASSENGERS IN THE NON-URBANIZED AREAS OF OUTAGAMIE COUNTY. THE SERVICE PROVIDES RIDES TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS SHOPPING JOB SITES AND MUCH MORE. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: SHARED RIDE DEMAND RESPONSIVE ORIGIN TO DESTINATION TRANSPORTATION. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: INCREASED SERVICES AND CAPACITY AVAILABLE TO SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES FOR TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROGRAM IS THE ELDERLY POPULATION AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES.TOTAL PROJECT COST: $62500FTA FUNDS: $50000LOCAL FUNDS: $12500MOBILITY MANAGEMENT ADMINISTERED BY VALLEY TRANSIT: MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROJECT ADMINISTERED BY VALLEY TRANSIT TO COORDINATE AND EXPAND MOBILITY OPTIONS THROUGHOUT THE FOX CITIES. THIS PROJECT INCLUDES SALARIES AND BENEFITS FOR VALLEY TRANSITS MOBILITY COORDINATOR. THE POSITION WORKS EXTENSIVELY WITH THE REGIONAL ADRCS (AGING AND DISABILITY RESOURCE CENTER).PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM IS TO PROMOTE ENHANCE AND FACILITATE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES IN THE FOX CITIES. THE MOBILITY MANAGER SUPPORTS LOCAL REGIONAL AND STATE COORDINATION POLICES THROUGH THE PROVISION OF COORDINATION SERVICES AND MANAGEMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF TRAVEL TRAINING IN THE FOX CITIESACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: VALLEY TRANSITS MOBILITY MANAGER REPRESENTS VALLEY TRANSIT BY SPEAKING WITH OR ON BEHALF OF INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO ENSURE EQUITABLE TRANSPORTATION FOR ALL. THIS IS DONE THROUGH EDUCATION MARKETING AND BUILDING RELATIONSHIPS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY SUCH AS BUSINESSES NON-PROFITS HUMAN SERVICES AGENCIES HEALTHCARE INSTITUTIONS SCHOOLS ETC. TO HELP THEIR RIDERS MEET THEIR TRANSPORTATION NEEDS. THE MOBILITY MANAGER WORKS WITH INDIVIDUALS TO IDENTIFY AND ELIMINATE BARRIERS TO TRANSPORTATION. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: INCREASED COORDINATION BETWEEN AGENCIES AND TRAVELERS ALONG WITH IMPROVED ACCESS TO TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS FOR THE INDIVIDUAL RIDER.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROGRAM IS THE ELDERLY POPULATION AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES.TOTAL PROJECT COST: $49954FTA FUNDS: $49954 (100% MATCH)

THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST SECTION 5310 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE GREEN BAY METRO UZA IN THE AMOUNT OF $373524 REPRESENTING 100% FEDERAL SHARE OF THE TOTAL ELIGIBLE AMOUNT. THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES FY2020 $187515 AND FY2021 $186009 FUNDS FOR (1) MOBILITY MANAGEMENT FY21- $83704 (2) PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION FY20 - $18751 FY21 - $18600 AND (3) CAPITAL FOR PURCHASE OF REPLACEMENT VEHICLES FOR SUBRECIPIENT FY20 - $168764 FY21 - $83705.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE THE GREEN BAY METRO UZA AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS FUNDS FOR ELIGIBLE EXPENSES TO FUND A MOBILITY MANAGER AND TO ADMINISTER THE PROGRAM AS WELL AS FOR CAPITAL FUNDING TO REPLACE VEHICLES IN ORDER TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER (1) MOBILITY MANAGER POSITION (2) 10% PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION AND (3) PURCHASE TO REPLACEMENT FOUR VEHICLES FOR SERVICE PROVIDER - (1) VAN (1) MINIBUS (2) MEDIUM BUSES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT GREEN BAY METRO AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SERVICE FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: POPULATIONS SERVED INCLUDE INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: CURATIVE CONNECTIONS OPERATES BROWN COUNTY SPECIALIZED TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM WHICH PROVIDES SPECIALIZED TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS. TRIPS PRIORITIZE MEDICAL NUTRITION AND EMPLOYMENT. TRIPS OCCUR WITHIN THE GREATER GREEN BAY AREA MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. CURATIVE CONNECTION WILL RECEIVE CAPITAL TO PURCHASE (4) FOUR REPLACEMENT VEHICLES. FY2020 SECTION 5310 FORMULA FUNDS ($187515) WILL BE UTILIZED FOR:10% PROGRAM ADMIN $18751 (100% FEDERAL)(2) TWO REPLACEMENT VEHICLES FOR SERVICE PROVIDER $168764 (100% FEDERAL)FY2021 SECTION 5310 FORMULA FUNDS ($186009) WILL BE UTILIZED FOR:10% PROGRAM ADMIN $18600 (100% FEDERAL)(1) ONE MOBILITY MANAGER $83704 (100% FEDERAL)(2) TWO REPLACEMENT VEHICLES FOR SERVICE PROVIDER $83705 (100% FEDERAL)ALL PROJECTS ARE DERIVED FROM THE CURRENT COORDINATED PLAN AND PROGRAM OF PROJECTS (ATTACHED).DOCUMENTS ATTACHED:PROGRAM OF PROJECTS AWARD LETTERSLETTER TO FTA - REQUEST OF WAIVER OF 55/45 PROGRAM REQUIREMENTSGREEN BAY METRO 10% DE MINIMUS APPROVAL LETTERIN EXECUTING THIS GRANT THE GREEN BAY METRO UZA AGREES TO ABIDE BY SECTION 3011 OF THE FAST ACT (49 U.S.C. 5323(J)(2)(C) REGARDING THE PHASED INCREASE IN DOMESTIC CONTENT UNDER THE BUYAMERICA STATUTE FOR ROLLING STOCK.AS GRANT AGREEMENT INCLUDES AN FTA-FUNDED TRANSIT VEHICLE PURCHASE RECIPIENT AGREES TO COMPLY WITH THE RELATED REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN 49 CFR 26.49(A). SPECIFICALLY RECIPIENT MUST ENSURE AS A CONDITION OF BEING AUTHORIZED TO BID OR PROPOSE ON FTA-ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE PROCUREMENTS THAT EACH TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURER CERTIFIED THAT IT COMPLIED WITH DOT REQUIREMENTS FOR SUBMITTING A DBE PROGRAM AND GOAL TO FTA PRIOR TO BIDDING. RECIPIENT IS ALSO REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE NAME OF THE SUCCESSFUL BIDDER AND THE TOTAL DOLLAR VALUE OF THE CONTRACT WITHIN 30 DAYS OF MAKING AN FTA- ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE AWARD USING THE REQUIRED FTA REPORTING TOOL. RECIPIENT UNDERSTANDS THAT FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THESE REQUIREMENTS MAY RESULT IN FORMAL ENFORCEMENT ACTION OR APPROPRIATE SANCTION AS DETERMINED BY FTA INCLUDING REIMBURSEMENT OF FTA FUNDS USED FOR THE VEHICLE PROCUREMENT.GREEN BAY METRO UZA CERTIFIES ALL VEHICLES PURCHASED ARE ACCESSIBLE PURCHASED FROM AN FTA APPROVED TVM AND REPORTED TO FTA WITHIN 30 DAYS AFTER CONTRACT IS SIGNED.GREEN BAY METRO UZA WILL CHECK CURRENT LISTING OF TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURERS (TVM) (HTTPS://WWW.TRANSIT.DOT.GOV/REGULATIONS-AND-GUIDANCE/CIVIL-RIGHTS-ADA/ELIGIBLE-TVMS-LIST) TO ENSURE EACH IS LISTEN AS A CERTIFIED TVM IN COMPLIANCE WITH FTA REGULATIONS.THE RECIPIENT OR SUB-RECIPIENT WILL FOLLOW ALL 3RD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE).THE RECIPIENT OR SUB-RECIPIENT WILL ENSURE CONTRACTORS PROCURED WILL NOT BE ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST.

THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST SECTION 5310 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE CITY OF MADISON WISCONSIN IN THE AMOUNT OF $280948. THE CITY OF MADISON/METRO TRANSIT IS REQUESTING THE REMAINING $80840 OF FFY 2020 AND $200108 OF FFY 2021 FOR A TOTAL OF $280948 SECTION 5310 ENHANCED MOBILITY OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES FORMULA FUNDS APPORTIONMENT FOR MADISON METRO BASED ON THE FEDERAL REGISTER APPORTIONMENT. THESE PROJECTS ARE THE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS FOR THE CITY OF MADISON--METRO TRANSIT AND DANE COUNTY AS WELL AS PURCHASE OF VEHICLES FOR DCATS ALL OF WHICH ENHANCE THE PUBLIC TRANSIT EXPERIENCE FOR SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES. SPECIFICALLY RECIPIENT MUST ENSURE AS A CONDITION OF BEING AUTHORIZED TO BID OR PROPOSE ON FTA-ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE PROCUREMENTS THAT EACH TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURER CERTIFIED THAT IT COMPLIED WITH DOT REQUIREMENTS FOR SUBMITTING A DBE PROGRAM AND GOAL TO FTA PRIOR TO BIDDING. RECIPIENT IS ALSO REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE NAME OF THE SUCCESSFUL BIDDER AND THE TOTAL DOLLAR VALUE OF THE CONTRACT WITHIN 30 DAYS OF MAKING A FTA- ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE AWARD USING THE REQUIRED FTA REPORTING TOOL. RECIPIENT UNDERSTANDS THAT FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THESE REQUIREMENTS MAY RESULT IN FORMAL ENFORCEMENT ACTION OR APPROPRIATE SANCTION AS DETERMINED BY FTA INCLUDING REIMBURSEMENT OF FTA FUNDS USED FOR THE VEHICLE PROCUREMENT. MILWAUKEE COUNTY IS APPLYING FOR $1229053 IN FY2019 SECTION 5310 FUNDS AND $1251474 IN FY2020 FUNDS. WITH LOCAL CONTRIBUTIONS TOTALING $958182 THE TOTAL PROJECT COST IS $3438709. FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR MOBILITY MANAGEMENT VEHICLE PURCHASE OPERATING ASSISTANCE AND PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION. FOLLOWING A COMPETITIVE SELECTION PROCESS BY SOUTHEASTERN WISCONSIN REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION FUNDS WERE AWARDED TO THE FOLLOWING RECIPIENTS/PROJECTS:PURPOSE OF THE AWARD: THIS AWARD IS INTENDED TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SUPPORT TO THE ELDERLY AND DISABLED POPULATION OF MILWAUKEE COUNTY AND SURROUNDING AREAS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS AWARD WILL HELP PROVIDE NEW VEHICLES (VANS AND SMALL/MINI-BUSES) TO NON-PROFIT GROUPS WHO ASSIST WITH THE TRANSPORTATION OF ELDERLY AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS AS WELL AS PROVIDING DRIVERS AND EDUCATION REGARDING THE TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS AND RESOURCES AVAILABLE TO SENIORS AND THOSE WITH DISABILITIES THROUGH MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: EXPANDED MOBILITY AND TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS AND SERVICES FOR THE ELDERLY AND DISABLED RESIDENTS OF MILWAUKEE AND THE SURROUNDING AREAS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE AWARD ACTIVITIES ARE INTENDED TO BENEFIT MILWAUKEE-AREA ELDERLY AND DISABLED RESIDENTS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE SUBRECIPIENTS PROVIDE THE ELDERLY AND DISABLE POPULATION OF THE MILWAUKEE AREA WITH TRANSPORTATION SERVICES USING VANS AND SMALL/MINI-BUSES VOLUNTEER DRIVERS AND TRAINING/EDUCATION/INSTRUCTION IN THE UTILIZATION OF THE TRANSPORTATION RESOURCES AVAILABLE. APPROVAL LETTER IS ATTACHED.IN EXECUTING THIS GRANT THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY AGREES TO ABIDE BY SECTION 3011 OF THE FAST ACT (49 U.S.C. 5323(J)(2)(C) REGARDING THE PHASED INCREASE IN DOMESTIC CONTENT UNDER THE BUY AMERICA STATUTE FOR ROLLING STOCK.AS GRANT AGREEMENT INCLUDES AN FTA-FUNDED TRANSIT VEHICLE PURCHASE RECIPIENT AGREES TO COMPLY WITH THE RELATED REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN 49 CFR 26.49(A). SPECIFICALLY RECIPIENT MUST ENSURE AS A CONDITION OF BEING AUTHORIZED TO BID OR PROPOSE ON FTA-ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE PROCUREMENTS THAT EACH TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURER CERTIFIED THAT IT COMPLIED WITH DOT REQUIREMENTS FOR SUBMITTING A DBE PROGRAM AND GOAL TO FTA PRIOR TO BIDDING. RECIPIENT IS ALSO REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE NAME OF THE SUCCESSFUL BIDDER AND THE TOTAL DOLLAR VALUE OF THE CONTRACT WITHIN 30 DAYS OF MAKING AN FTA- ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE AWARD USING THE REQUIRED FTA REPORTING TOOL. RECIPIENT UNDERSTANDS THAT FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THESE REQUIREMENTS MAYRESULT IN FORMAL ENFORCEMENT ACTION OR APPROPRIATE SANCTION AS DETERMINED BY FTA INCLUDING REIMBURSEMENT OF FTA FUNDS USED FOR THE VEHICLE PROCUREMENT.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS APPLICATION IS TO USE FY2021 SECTION 5310 FUNDS FOR ONE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROJECT THAT WILL ASSESS TRANSPORTATION NEEDS INCREASE AWARENESS OF TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS AND COORDINATE CONNECTIVITY BETWEEN TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS AND PROGRAMS FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. THIS APPLICATION SCOPE OF WORK ALSO INCLUDES OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR THREE TRANSPORTATION PROGRAMS THAT WILL IMPROVE TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THIS GRANT WILL FUND MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS FOR SPECIAL MOBILITY SERVICES (SMS) A TRADITIONAL PROJECT AND OPERATING ASSISTANCE PROJECTS FOR CANCER CANT COAST TRANSPORTATION AND SPOKANE NEIGHBORHOOD ACTION PARTNERS (SNAP) THREE OTHER PROJECTS. ALL PROJECTS WILL BENEFIT SENIORS AND/OR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: PROVIDING ENHANCED TRANSPORTATION SERVICES NOT CURRENTLY AVAILABLE TO SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO OR FROM THE SPOKANE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION BENEFIT AREA (PTBA) FROM AREAS IN SPOKANE COUNTY RURAL COUNTIES SOUTH OF SPOKANE COUNTY WASHINGTON AND IDAHO.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE SENIORS AND/OR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES FOR SERVICES BEGINNING OR ENDING IN THE SPOKANE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION BENEFIT AREA (PTBA).; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE:- SPECIAL MOBILITY SERVICES (SMS) PROJECT WILL ASSESS TRANSPORTATION NEEDS INCREASE AWARENESS OF TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS AND COORDINATE CONNECTIVITY BETWEEN TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS AND PROGRAMS FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. THIS IS A TRADITIONAL PROJECT THAT SATISFIES THE 55% REQUIREMENT.- CANCER CANT PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR CANCER PATIENTS BY PROVIDING PRE-SCHEDULED AND SAME-DAY SERVICES FOR ONCOLOGY CARE APPOINTMENTS. THIS IS AN OTHER PROJECT.- COAST TRANSPORTATION WILL PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES LIVING IN OR NEAR RURAL COMMUNITIES SOUTH OF SPOKANE WHO CANNOT OTHERWISE ACCESS PUBLIC TRANSIT. THIS IS AN OTHER PROJECT.-SPOKANE NEIGHBORHOOD ACTION PARTNERS (SNAP) NEIGHBORS ON THE GO DEMAND RESPONSE PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHEN PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IS NOT AVAILABLE OR APPROPRIATE. THIS IS AN OTHER PROJECT.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO USE ARP - FY2021 SECTION 5310 LU FUNDS TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO THE CORONAVIRUS. FUNDS PROGRAMMED IN THIS GRANT WILL BE USED FOR THE PURCHASE OF APPROXIMATELY ONE (1) REPLACEMENT PARATRANSIT VEHICLE USED BY NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS FOR TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOCUSED ON THE ELDERLY AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES WHO ARE OTHERWISE UNABLE TO UTILIZE BFTS REGULAR FIXED-ROUTE SERVICE.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: PURCHASE OF APPROXIMATELY ONE (1) PARATRANSIT LESS THAN 30-FT REPLACEMENT BUSES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THESE REPLACEMENT BUSES WILL IMPROVE SYSTEM RELIABILITY TO THE BENTON FRANKLIN PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION BENEFIT AREA.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC LOCATED IN THE CITIES OF KENNEWICK PASCO RICHLAND WEST RICHLAND BENTON CITY PROSSER AND CERTAIN UNINCORPORATED AREAS OF BENTON AND FRANKLIN COUNTIES.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS TO THIS AWARD.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THE GRANT IS TO ASSIST WITH ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES NECESSARY TO OPERATE MANAGE AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES WHILE RESPONDING TO COVID-19.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO ASSIST WITH ELIGIBLE OPERATING ACTIVITIES NECESSARY TO OPERATE MANAGE AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO HELP PREVENT RESPOND TO AND RECOVER FROM THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS FUNDING WILL HELP TO MAINTAIN AN ADEQUATE LEVEL OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICE AND ENABLE GENERAL PUBLIC AND PEOPLE WITH SPECIAL NEEDS TO ACCESS DESTINATIONS ESSENTIAL FOR THEIR DAILY LIVES SAFETY AND WELLBEING.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION CUSTOMERS WHO UTILIZE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES INCLUDING THE ELDERLY PERSONS WITH SPECIAL NEEDS LOW-INCOME AND GENERAL PUBLIC.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE SUSTAINING THE THURSTON BUS BUDDIES PROGRAM WHICH HELPS COMMUNITY MEMBERS INCLUDING SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES LEARN ABOUT THE FIXED ROUTE SERVICES THROUGH CATHOLIC COMMUNITY SERVICES OF WESTERN WASHINGTON - PIERCE COUNTY.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO MAINTAIN OPERATING SERVICES IN SMALL URBAN AREAS ACROSS THE STATE IN ADDITION TO PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION. THE ENHANCED MOBILITY FOR SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES PROGRAM SECTION 5310 IS A CRITICAL FUNDING SOURCE FOR THE PROVISION OF TRANSPORTATION TO OLDER ADULTS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES. THE PURPOSE OF THE GRANT IS TO ASSIST WITH ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES NECESSARY TO OPERATE MANAGE AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES WHILE RESPONDING TO COVID 19.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO ASSIST WITH ELIGIBLE OPERATING ACTIVITIES NECESSARY TO OPERATE MANAGE AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO HELP PREVENT RESPOND TO AND RECOVER FROM THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: MAINTAINING AN ADEQUATE LEVEL OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICE IN SMALL URBAN AREAS. RESPOND TO COVID 19 AND ENABLE PEOPLE TO ACCESS DESTINATIONS ESSENTIAL FOR THEIR DAILY LIVES SAFETY AND WELLBEING.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION CUSTOMERS INCLUDING SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHO UTILIZE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES ACROSS THE STATE OF WASHINGTON.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: PROJECT WORK INCLUDES CONTINUED COMMUNICATION COORDINATION IDENTIFYING AND WORKING ON LOCALLY PRIORITIZED MOBILITY PROJECTS AND OUTREACH TO SENIORS INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND PERSONS IN NEED. THIS PROJECT WILL COORDINATE WITH TRANSPORTATION SERVICE PROVIDERS AND HUMAN SERVICE PROVIDERS IN THE REGION TO INCREASE THE AWARENESS OF AVAILABLE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES HOW TO USE THOSE SERVICES AND HOW TO MAKE CONNECTIONS BETWEEN SERVICES.SUBRECIPIENTS INCLUDE:LINK TRANSIT IN CHELAN DOUGLAS PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION BENEFIT AREA

START INITIAL APPLICATION (00)THIS GRANT APPLICATION APPLIES A PARTIAL APPORTIONMENT AMOUNT OF $1944953 IN FY 2022 SECTION 5310 SMALL URBAN FUNDING FOR OPERATING CAPITAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE ACTIVITIES FOR SERVICES PROVIDED TO ELDERLY AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES IN SMALL URBAN AREAS ACROSS WASHINGTON STATE. THE REMAINING FY 2022 SECTION 5310 SMALL URBAN APPORTIONMENT WILL BE APPLIED FOR AT A LATER DATE AND WILL INCLUDE ADDITIONAL TRADITIONAL CAPITAL PROJECTS AS REQUIRED TO MEET THE MINIMUM 55% THRESHOLD UNDER THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM.END INITIAL APPLICATION (00)PURPOSE: THE ENHANCED MOBILITY FOR SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES PROGRAM SECTION 5310 IS A CRITICAL FUNDING SOURCE FOR THE PROVISION OF TRANSPORTATION TO OLDER ADULTS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES. THE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO ASSIST WITH ELIGIBLE ADMINISTRATIVE OPERATING AND CAPITAL EXPENSES INCLUDING VEHICLES SOFTWARE AND OTHER ITEMS NECESSARY TO OPERATE MANAGE AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES IN SMALL URBAN AREAS SUCH AS:- INSTALL A SOFTWARE FEATURING AN INTERACTIVE VOICE RESPONSE MODULE TO TRANSLATE CUSTOMER SERVICE INFORMATION IN THE SPANISH LANGUAGE.. - SUSTAIN ACCESSIBLE GENERAL PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES INCLUDING SERVICES TO THE ELDERLY AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES.- IMPLEMENT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND RELATED SUPPORT SERVICES TAILORED TO MEET THE SPECIFIC NEEDS OF TRANSIT OPERATORS IN RURAL AREAS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:SUSTAIN/MAINTAIN CURRENT OPERATING SERVICE LEVELS IN THE DIFFERENT SMALL URBAN AREAS ACROSS THE STATE OF WASHINGTON. ENHANCE HERE TO THERE (H2T) ACCESSIBLE WEBSITE TO INCREASE ACCESSIBILITY TRANSLATION OPTIONS AND PROVIDE MORE INFORMATION FOR PEOPLE WITH SPECIAL TRANSPORTATION NEEDS AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC. SUSTAIN FIXED-ROUTE AND ON-DEMAND ADA-ACCESSIBLE PUBLIC TRANSIT COMMUTER SERVICES TO SPECIAL NEEDS RESIDENTS; SUSTAIN MOBILITY MANAGEMENT SERVICES TO LOW-INCOME TRANSIT USERS PROVIDING EDUCATION/AWARENESS AND LIMITED FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE; AND CONTINUE TO OFFER A MEAN OF TRANSPORTATION TO PEOPLE TO CONTINUE TO ACCESS JOBS MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS SCHOOLS AND OTHER DESTINATIONS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:MAINTAINING AN ADEQUATE LEVEL OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICE IN SMALL URBAN AREAS AND ENABLING PEOPLE TO ACCESS DESTINATIONS ESSENTIAL FOR THEIR DAILY LIVES SAFETY AND WELLBEING. SUSTAINING CURRENT OPERATING SERVICE LEVELS TO PASSENGERS WITH DISABILITIES OTHER SPECIAL NEEDS POPULATIONS AND GENERAL PUBLIC. PROVIDING COORDINATION AND OUTREACH FOR THE GENERAL PUBLIC AND SPECIAL NEEDS POPULATIONS IN SMALL URBAN AREAS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION CUSTOMERS WHO UTILIZE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES IN SMALL URBAN AREAS ACROSS THE STATE OF WASHINGTON INCLUDING THE ELDERLY PERSONS WITH SPECIAL NEEDS AND LOW-INCOME AND GENERAL PUBLIC. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:OPERATE MANAGE AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES. ENSURE ADEQUATE FUNDING AND FINANCIAL PLANNING TO SUPPORT THE ANNUAL OPERATING NEEDS OF SMALL URBAN PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES. OFFER TRANSIT SERVICES PROVIDING ACCESS TO MEDICAL RETAIL AND SOCIAL SERVICES. PROVIDE ACCESSIBLE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO ELDERLY PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES AND GENERAL PUBLIC. RECIPIENT:WSDOTSUBRECIPIENTS: SKAGIT TRANSITTHURSTON COUNTY PUBLIC BENEFIT TRANSPORTATION AREA (INTERCITY TRANSIT)THURSTON REGIONAL PLANNING COUNCILEND INITIAL APPLICATION (00)

START INITIAL APPLICATION (00)THIS GRANT APPLIES FOR $364242 IN FY 2020 AND $373496 IN FY 2021 SECTION 5310 LARGE URBANIZED AREA FORMULA FUNDING. FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR THE PURCHASE OF RESERVE-A-RIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES MOBILITY MANAGEMENT SERVICES COMMUNITY ACCESS VAN/VOLUNTEERS IN MOTION SERVICES AND A VOLUNTEER DRIVER PROGRAM. END INITIAL APPLICATION (00)PURPOSE:FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR THE PURCHASE OF RESERVE-A-RIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES MOBILITY MANAGEMENT SERVICES COMMUNITY ACCESS VAN/VOLUNTEERS IN MOTION SERVICES AND A VOLUNTEER DRIVER PROGRAM.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE RESERVE-A-RIDE PROGRAM PROVIDES TRANSPORTATION FOR NON-AMBULATORY INDIVIDUALS THAT DO NOT QUALIFY FOR MEDICAID AND ARE TRAVELLING OUTSIDE C-TRANS SERVICE BOUNDARY. MOBILITY MANAGEMENT WILL EVALUATE AND WORK TO HELP SOLVE TRANSPORTATION OBSTACLES FOR AT RISK POPULATIONS FOCUSING ON SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES. THE COMMUNITY ACCESS VAN/VOLUNTEERS IN MOTION SERVICES WILL OPERATE AS A MULTIFACETED VOLUNTEER DRIVER PROGRAM OFFERING ADDITIONAL WAYS TO ENGAGE COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS TO SUPPORT THE TRANSPORT OF SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES. THE VOLUNTEER DRIVER PROGRAM USES VOLUNTEER DRIVERS AND VEHICLES TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION TO POPULATIONS INCLUDING LOW-INCOME AND/OR ISOLATED ELDERLY AND DISABLED ADULTS WITH TRANSPORTATION CHALLENGES INCLUDING THOSE LIVING OUTSIDE OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICE AREAS AND HOURS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:FUNDING WILL PROVIDE SERVICES TO ASSIST CLARK COUNTY RESIDENTS THROUGH MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND THE PROVISION OF OTHER ADA TRANSIT SERVICES THAT GO BEYOND WHAT C-TRAN PROVIDES AS PART OF ITS COMPLEMENTARY ADA SERVICE C-VAN.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE POPULATION TRAVELING WITHIN C-TRANS SERVICE AREA.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THE SERVICES DESCRIBED IN THIS GRANT AGREEMENT ARE PROVIDED THROUGH TWO SUBRECIPIENT CONTRACTS ONE WITH VOLUNTEERS IN MOTION (FORMERLY THE HUMAN SERVICES COUNCIL) AND THE OTHER WITH CATHOLIC COMMUNITY SERVICES.

START INITIAL APPLICATION (00)THIS FEDERAL AWARD INCLUDES $2016606 IN FY 2021 SECTION 5310 SMALL URBAN FUNDING FOR OPERATING CAPITAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE ACTIVITIES FOR SERVICES PROVIDED TO ELDERLY AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES IN SMALL URBAN AREAS ACROSS THE WASHINGTON STATE.ALL PROJECTS WILL BE UTILIZING 100% FEDERAL SHARE AUTHORIZED FOR UN-OBLIGATED SECTION 5310 FUNDING UNDER THE CORONAVIRUS RESPONSE AND RELIEF SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS ACT OF 2021 (CRRSAA) (H.R.133). SPECIAL LANGUAGE FOR FURLOUGH CERTIFICATIONTHE RECIPIENT CERTIFIES THAT IT AND ANY SUBRECIPIENT OR CONTRACTOR THAT IS A PROVIDER OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION: (A) INTEND TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT POSSIBLE TO USE CARES ACT OR CRRSAA FUNDS TO BRING BACK ANY EMPLOYEES PREVIOUSLY FURLOUGHED AS A DIRECT RESULT OF FINANCIAL DIFFICULTIES CAUSED BY THE COVID-19 PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY; (B) INTEND TO USE CARES ACT OR CRRSAA FUNDS TO REHIRE ANY POSITIONS OF EMPLOYEES WHO WERE LAID OFF AS A DIRECT RESULT OF FINANCIAL CHALLENGES CAUSED BY THE COVID-19 PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY; AND (C) WILL EXPLAIN HOW THEY HAVE SPENT CARES ACT OR CRRSAA FUNDS ON PAYROLL OPERATIONS OR PAYROLL AND EXPENSES OF PRIVATE PROVIDERS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT POSSIBLE. SPECIAL CONDITION FOR EMERGENCY RELATED FUNDINGTHE RECIPIENT AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.END INITIAL APPLICATION (00)PURPOSE: THE ENHANCED MOBILITY FOR SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES PROGRAM SECTION 5310 IS A CRITICAL FUNDING SOURCE FOR THE PROVISION OF TRANSPORTATION TO OLDER ADULTS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES. THE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO MAINTAINING TRANSPORTATION SERVICES IN SMALL URBAN AREAS ACROSS THE STATE PROVIDING SAFE EFFICIENT AND RELIABLE TRANSPORTATION FOR DEMAND-RESPONSE AND FIXED-ROUTE SERVICES AND SUSTAINING COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICE TO THE ELDERLY AND SPECIAL NEEDS POPULATIONS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:MAINTAINING CURRENT OPERATING SERVICE LEVELS IN THE DIFFERENT SMALL URBAN AREAS ACROSS THE WASHINGTON STATE. SUSTAINING PLANNING AND OPERATIONAL SUPPORT TO IMPROVE ACCESSIBLE TRANSPORTATION IN THE REGION. IMPROVING MOBILITY FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES BY REMOVING BARRIERS TO TRANSPORTATION SERVICE AND EXPANDING TRANSPORTATION MOBILITY OPTIONS. PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO MEDICAL CARE AND BASIC SERVICE DESTINATIONS FOR SENIORS PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND INDIVIDUALS WITH SPECIAL TRANSPORTATION NEEDS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:MAINTAINING AN ADEQUATE LEVEL OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICE IN SMALL URBAN AREAS. PROVIDING ESSENTIAL SERVICES AND SUPPORTING A CRITICAL LIFELINE TO INDIVIDUALS WHO CANNOT USE FIXED-ROUTE SERVICE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION CUSTOMERS INCLUDING SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHO UTILIZE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES IN SMALL URBAN AREAS ACROSS THE STATE OF WASHINGTON. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITY:PROJECT WORK INCLUDES CONTINUED COMMUNICATION COORDINATION IDENTIFYING AND WORKING ON LOCALLY PRIORITIZED TRANSPORTATION NEEDS TO SENIORS INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND PERSONS IN NEED. THIS PROJECT WILL SUSTAIN ACCESSIBLE GENERAL PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICE ON THE I-5 CORRIDOR BETWEEN THURSTON AND PIERCE COUNTIES AND PROVIDE ADA COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICE TO THE ELDERLY AND SPECIAL NEEDS POPULATION IN THE KELSO/LONGVIEW URBANIZED AREA.RECIPIENT:WASHINGTON STATE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (WSDOT)SUBRECIPIENTS: CITY OF LONGVIEW (RIVERCITIES TRANSIT) THURSTON COUNTY PUBLIC BENEFIT TRANSPORTATION AREA (INTERCITY TRANSIT)HUMAN SERVICES COUNCIL

START INITIAL APPLICATION (00)THIS GRANT INCLUDES FY 2021 SECTION 5310 RURAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $1166478 FOR OPERATING ADMINISTRATIVE CAPITAL AND MOBILITY MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES FOR SERVICES TO ELDERLY AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES IN RURAL AREAS THROUGHOUT WASHINGTON STATE. ALL PROJECTS WILL BE UTILIZING 100% FEDERAL SHARE AUTHORIZED FOR UN-OBLIGATED SECTION 5310 FUNDING UNDER THE CORONAVIRUS RESPONSE AND RELIEF SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS ACT OF 2021 (CRRSAA) (H.R.133). SPECIAL LANGUAGE FOR FURLOUGH CERTIFICATIONTHE RECIPIENT CERTIFIES THAT IT AND ANY SUBRECIPIENT OR CONTRACTOR THAT IS A PROVIDER OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION: (A) INTEND TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT POSSIBLE TO USE CARES ACT OR CRRSAA FUNDS TO BRING BACK ANY EMPLOYEES PREVIOUSLY FURLOUGHED AS A DIRECT RESULT OF FINANCIAL DIFFICULTIES CAUSED BY THE COVID-19 PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY; (B) INTEND TO USE CARES ACT OR CRRSAA FUNDS TO REHIRE ANY POSITIONS OF EMPLOYEES WHO WERE LAID OFF AS A DIRECT RESULT OF FINANCIAL CHALLENGES CAUSED BY THE COVID-19 PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY; AND (C) WILL EXPLAIN HOW THEY HAVE SPENT CARES ACT OR CRRSAA FUNDS ON PAYROLL OPERATIONS OR PAYROLL AND EXPENSES OF PRIVATE PROVIDERS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT POSSIBLE. SPECIAL CONDITION FOR EMERGENCY RELATED FUNDINGTHE RECIPIENT AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.END INITIAL APPLICATION (00)PURPOSE: THE ENHANCED MOBILITY FOR SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES PROGRAM SECTION 5310 IS A CRITICAL FUNDING SOURCE FOR THE PROVISION OF TRANSPORTATION TO OLDER ADULTS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES. THE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO ASSIST WITH ELIGIBLE OPERATING AND CAPITAL EXPENSES NECESSARY TO OPERATE MANAGE AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES IN RURAL AREAS SUCH AS:- ASSIST IN THE MAINTENANCE DEVELOPMENT IMPROVEMENT AND USE OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS IN RURAL AREAS ACROSS THE STATE IN ADDITION TO PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION. - SUSTAIN PARATRANSIT SERVICES TO ELDERLY AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES.- IMPLEMENT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND RELATED SUPPORT SERVICES TAILORED TO MEET THE SPECIFIC NEEDS OF TRANSIT OPERATORS IN RURAL AREAS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:SUSTAIN/MAINTAIN CURRENT OPERATING SERVICE LEVELS IN THE DIFFERENT RURAL AREAS ACROSS THE STATE OF WASHINGTON. SUSTAIN FIXED-ROUTE AND ON-DEMAND ADA-ACCESSIBLE PUBLIC TRANSIT COMMUTER SERVICES TO SPECIAL NEEDS RESIDENTS; SUSTAIN MOBILITY MANAGEMENT SERVICES TO LOW-INCOME TRANSIT USERS PROVIDING EDUCATION/AWARENESS AND LIMITED FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE; AND CONTINUE TO OFFER A MEAN OF TRANSPORTATION TO PEOPLE TO CONTINUE TO ACCESS JOBS MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS SCHOOLS AND OTHER DESTINATIONS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:MAINTAINING AN ADEQUATE LEVEL OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICE IN RURAL AREAS AND ENABLING PEOPLE TO ACCESS DESTINATIONS ESSENTIAL FOR THEIR DAILY LIVES SAFETY AND WELLBEING. SUSTAINING DEMAND-RESPOND DIAL-A-RIDE SERVICES TO PASSENGERS WITH DISABILITIES AND OTHER SPECIAL NEEDS POPULATIONS. PROVIDING COORDINATION AND OUTREACH FOR THE GENERAL PUBLIC AND SPECIAL NEEDS POPULATIONS IN RURAL AREAS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION CUSTOMERS WHO UTILIZE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES IN RURAL AREAS ACROSS THE STATE OF WASHINGTON INCLUDING THE ELDERLY PERSONS WITH SPECIAL NEEDS AND LOW-INCOME AND GENERAL PUBLIC. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:OPERATE MANAGE AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES. ENSURE ADEQUATE FUNDING AND FINANCIAL PLANNING TO SUPPORT THE ANNUAL OPERATING NEEDS OF RURAL PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES. OFFER TRANSIT SERVICES PROVIDING ACCESS TO MEDICAL RETAIL AND SOCIAL SERVICES. PROVIDE FIXED-ROUTE AND ADA COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICES TO ELDERLY AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES. RECIPIENT:WSDOTSUBRECIPIENTS: CLALLAM TRANSITCOMMUNITY ACTION OF SKAGIT COUNTYPEOPLE FOR PEOPLERURAL RESOURCES

THIS APPLICATION INCLUDES $71213 IN FY2021 CRRSAA LARGE URBANIZED AREA FUNDING FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO THREE (3) TRANSPORTATION PROGRAMS THAT WILL PROVIDE NEW OR IMPROVED/ENHANCED TRANSPORTATION FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. ALL PROJECTS WILL BE UTILIZING 100% FEDERAL SHARE FOR ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES TO HELP PREVENT RESPOND TO AND RECOVER FROM THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.PURPOSE: THE APPLICATION SCOPE OF WORK INCLUDES OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO THREE (3) TRANSPORTATION PROGRAMS WHICH PROVIDE SERVICES TO SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHO CANNOT OTHERWISE ACCESS PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: (1) SPECIAL MOBILITY SERVICES (SMS) SPOKANE SHOPPER PROJECT - THIS PROJECT WILL SERVE SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHO REQUIRE ADDITIONAL ASSISTANCE TRANSPORTING PACKAGES TO AND FROM GROCERY STORES AND PHARMACIES THAN WHAT IS TRADITIONALLY PROVIDED BY PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION; (2) CANCER CANT TRANSPORTATION SUPPORT FOR CANCER PATIENTS PROJECT - THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION FOR CANCER PATIENTS BY PROVIDING PRE-SCHEDULED AND SAME-DAY SERVICES FOR ONCOLOGY CARE APPOINTMENTS; AND (3) COAST DEMAND RESPONSE TRANSPORTATION - THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES LIVING IN OR NEAR RURAL COMMUNITIES SOUTH OF SPOKANE (INTO THE SPOKANE PTBA) WHO CANNOT OTHERWISE ACCESS PUBLIC TRANSIT. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:PROVIDING ENHANCED TRANSPORTATION SERVICES NOT CURRENTLY AVAILABLE TO SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WITHIN THE SPOKANE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION BENEFIT AREA (PTBA) SPOKANE COUNTY WASHINGTON.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES IN THE SPOKANE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION BENEFIT AREA (PTBA) SPOKANE COUNTY WASHINGTON. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE A SPOKANE SHOPPER PROGRAM TRANSPORTATION SUPPORT FOR CANCER PATIENTS AND DEMAND RESPONSE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES.SPECIAL CONDITION FOR EMERGENCY RELATED FUNDINGSPOKANE TRANSIT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS HEREBY AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.SPECIAL LANGUAGE FOR FORLOUGH CERTIFICATIONTHE RECIPIENT CERTIFIES THAT IT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS AND CONTRACTORS THAT ARE PROVIDERS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION HAVE NOT FURLOUGHED ANY EMPLOYEES SINCE MARCH 27 2020 (THE ENACTMENT OF THE CARES ACT).

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE APPLICATION INCLUDES ARP ACT FY2021 SECTION 5310 FUNDS FOR SPOKANE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION BENEFIT AREA SUBRECIPIENT SPECIAL MOBILITY SERVICES (SMS) PROJECTS FOCUSED ON THE ELDERLY AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES: 1) SPOKANE SHOPPER PROVIDES TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHO CANNOT OTHERWISE ACCESS PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION. 2) MOBILITY TRAINING PROGRAM FOCUSES ON TRANSPORTATION TRAINING SERVICES FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH COGNITIVE DISABILITIES WHO CANNOT OTHERWISE ACCESS PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THIS GRANT WILL FUND OPERATING ASSISTANCE AND MOBILITY TRAINING FOR SPECIAL MOBILITY SERVICES (SMS) BOTH OTHER PROJECTS THAT WILL BENEFIT SENIORS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: PROVIDING ENHANCED TRANSPORTATION AND MOBILITY TRAINING SERVICES NOT CURRENTLY AVAILABLE TO SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO OR FROM THE SPOKANE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION BENEFIT AREA (PTBA) FROM AREAS IN SPOKANE COUNTY RURAL COUNTIES SOUTH OF SPOKANE COUNTY WASHINGTON AND IDAHO.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE SENIORS AND/OR INDVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES FOR SERVICES BEGINNING OR ENDING IN THE SPOKANE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION BENEFIT AREA (PTBA).; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: SPECIAL MOBILITY SERVICES IS THE ONLY SUBRECIPIENT AND WILL COMPLETE THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:1) SPOKANE SHOPPER - PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO AND FROM GROCERY STORES AND PHARMACIES WHEN PUBLIC TRANSIT IS NOT AVAILABLE OR APPROPRIATE. 2) MOBILITY TRAINING PROGRAM - PROVIDE WRAP-AROUND SUPPORTIVE SERVICES AND TRANSPORTATION MOBILITY TRAINING TO INDIVIDUALS WITH COGNITIVE DISABILITIES TO INCREASE THE ACCESS TO COMMUNITY RESOURCES AND NEEDED SERVICES.

THIS GRANT INCLUDES FY 2021 SECTION 5310 LARGE URBAN FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $2704477. THE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR OPERATING CAPITAL MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND ADMINISTRATIVE ACTIVITIES FOR SERVICES TO ELDERLY AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE SEATTLE URBANIZED AREA. ALL PROJECTS WILL BE UTILIZING 100% FEDERAL SHARE AUTHORIZED FOR UN-OBLIGATED SECTION 5310 FUNDING UNDER THE CORONAVIRUS RESPONSE AND RELIEF SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS ACT OF 2021 (CRRSAA) (H.R.133). THE RECIPIENT CERTIFIES THAT IT AND ANY SUBRECIPIENT OR CONTRACTOR THAT IS A PROVIDER OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION: (A) INTEND TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT POSSIBLE TO USE CARES ACT OR CRRSAA FUNDS TO BRING BACK ANY EMPLOYEES PREVIOUSLY FURLOUGHED AS A DIRECT RESULT OF FINANCIAL DIFFICULTIES CAUSED BY THE COVID-19 PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY; (B) INTEND TO USE CARES ACT OR CRRSAA FUNDS TO REHIRE ANY POSITIONS OF EMPLOYEES WHO WERE LAID OFF AS A DIRECT RESULT OF FINANCIAL CHALLENGES CAUSED BY THE COVID-19 PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY; AND (C) WILL EXPLAIN HOW THEY HAVE SPENT CARES ACT OR CRRSAA FUNDS ON PAYROLL OPERATIONS OR PAYROLL AND EXPENSES OF PRIVATE PROVIDERS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT POSSIBLE. PURPOSE:THE ENHANCED MOBILITY FOR SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES PROGRAM SECTION 5310 IS A CRITICAL FUNDING SOURCE FOR THE PROVISION OF TRANSPORTATION TO OLDER ADULTS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES. THE PURPOSE OF THIS FEDERAL AWARD IS TO ASSIST WITH MEETING THE TRANSPORTATION NEEDS AND IMPROVE MOBILITY FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES BY REMOVING BARRIERS TO TRANSPORTATION SERVICE AND EXPANDING TRANSPORTATION MOBILITY OPTIONS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:MAINTAIN CURRENT TRANSPORTATION SERVICE LEVELS AND OFFER ESSENTIAL SERVICES TO PRESERVE PUBLIC SAFETY AND WELLBEING IN LARGE URBAN AREAS OF THE WASHINGTON STATE. SUSTAIN STAFFING PLANNING AND CAPITAL AND OPERATIONAL SUPPORT TO IMPROVE ACCESSIBLE TRANSPORTATION IN THE REGION INCLUDING A FREE OF CHARGE SERVICE TO LOW-INCOME OLDER ADULTS AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES AND DOOR-TO-DOOR SERVICE BEST SUITED TO THE RIDERS UNIQUE NEEDS INCLUDING MEDICAL AND NON-MEDICAL RIDES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:MAINTAIN AN ADEQUATE LEVEL OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICE IN LARGE URBAN AREAS. PROVIDE TRAVEL INSTRUCTION AND INFORMATION ABOUT TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS VIA PRESENTATIONS AND INDIVIDUAL AND GROUP COMMUNICATION. ENABLE THE ELDERLY AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES TO ACCESS DESTINATIONS CRUCIAL FOR THEIR DAILY LIVES SAFETY AND WELLBEING INCLUDING TRIPS TO FOOD BANKS GROCERY STORES AS WELL AS COUNSELING PHYSICAL THERAPY DIALYSIS AND OTHER MEDICALLY NECESSARY APPOINTMENTS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION CUSTOMERS INCLUDING SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHO UTILIZE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES IN LARGE URBAN AREAS ACROSS THE STATE OF WASHINGTON. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITY:PROJECT WORK INCLUDES A FREE OF CHARGE SERVICE TO LOW-INCOME OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHO DO NOT QUALIFY FOR STATE-PAID CHORE SERVICES; FINDING SOLUTIONS FOR SPECIAL NEEDS RIDERS WHO ARE FACING TRANSPORTATION CHALLENGES IDENTIFYING WHICH NEEDS ARE NOT BEING MET AND FILLING THE GAPS SO THAT EVERYONE WHO NEEDS A RIDE GETS A RIDE; PROVIDING A COMMUNITY-BASED DEMAND-RESPONSE PARATRANSIT SERVICE FOR SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES; AND SUPPORTING THE REGIONAL ALLIANCE FOR RESILIENT AND EQUITABLE TRANSPORTATION (RARET) PROJECT WHICH INCREASES TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS TO CRITICAL SERVICES FOR SPECIAL NEEDS POPULATIONS IN THE EVENT OF A DISASTER.

THIS PROJECT WILL COORDINATE WITH TRANSPORTATION SERVICE PROVIDERS AND HUMAN SERVICE PROVIDERS IN THE REGION TO INCREASE THE AWARENESS OF AVAILABLE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES HOW TO USE THOSE SERVICES AND HOW TO MAKE CONNECTIONS BETWEEN SERVICES.

RESPOND TO COVID 19 AND ENABLE PEOPLE TO ACCESS DESTINATIONS ESSENTIAL FOR THEIR DAILY LIVES SAFETY AND WELLBEING INCLUDING TRIPS TO FOOD BANKS GROCERY STORES AS WELL AS COUNSELING PHYSICAL THERAPY DIALYSIS AND OTHER MEDICALLY NECESSARY APPOINTMENTS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION CUSTOMERS INCLUDING SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHO UTILIZE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES IN LARGE URBAN AREAS ACROSS THE STATE OF WASHINGTON. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:PROJECT WORK INCLUDES A FREE OF CHARGE SERVICE TO LOW-INCOME OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHO DO NOT QUALIFY FOR STATE-PAID CHORE SERVICES; STAFFING OF THE PIERCE COUNTY COORDINATED TRANSPORTATION COALITION THAT FINDS SOLUTIONS FOR SPECIAL NEEDS RIDERS WHO ARE FACING TRANSPORTATION CHALLENGES IDENTIFIES WHICH NEEDS ARE NOT BEING MET AND FILLS THE GAPS SO THAT EVERYONE WHO NEEDS A RIDE GETS A RIDE; AND THE ONGOING OPERATION OF THE DISABLED VETERANS TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM WHICH PROVIDES DISABLED VETERANS WITH NO-COST TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL DENTAL AND OTHER ESSENTIAL APPOINTMENTS.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES 5310 FUNDS FOR THE ENHANCED MOBILITY OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES PROGRAM WHICH IS AUTHORIZED BY 49 UNITED STATES CODE (U.S.C.) 5310.THE GOAL OF THE FTA 5310 PROGRAM IS TO IMPROVE THE MOBILITY OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES BY REMOVING BARRIERS TO TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND EXPANDING THE TRANSPORTATION MOBILITY OPTIONS AVAILABLE. THIS PROGRAM PROVIDES GRANT FUNDS FOR CAPITAL MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND OPERATING EXPENSES FOR: PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROJECTS PLANNED DESIGNED AND CARRIED OUT TO MEET THE SPECIAL NEEDS OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHEN PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IS INSUFFICIENT INAPPROPRIATE OR UNAVAILABLE; PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROJECTS THAT EXCEED THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES ACT (ADA); PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROJECTS THAT IMPROVE ACCESS TO FIXED-ROUTE SERVICE AND DECREASE RELIANCE ON COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT; AND ALTERNATIVES TO PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROJECTS THAT ASSIST SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND WITH TRANSPORTATION. ALL PROJECTS ARE INCLUDED IN A LOCALLY DEVELOPED COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT-HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN WHICH WAS LAST UPDATED IN DECEMBER 2020. THE FUNDING WILL BE USED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE START AND THE END OF THE VERMONT STATE FISCAL YEAR (SFY22).; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: VTRANS IS REQUESTING $542504 SFY23 5310 FEDERAL PROGRAMS INCLUDING REPLACEMENT VEHICLES AND MOBILITY MANAGEMENT. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE FEDERAL SUBRECIPIENTS AND THE RIDING PUBLIC. PURPOSE:THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES 5310 FUNDS FOR THE ENHANCED MOBILITY OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES PROGRAM WHICH IS AUTHORIZED BY 49 UNITED STATES CODE (U.S.C.) 5310.THE GOAL OF THE FTA 5310 PROGRAM IS TO IMPROVE THE MOBILITY OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES BY REMOVING BARRIERS TO TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND EXPANDING THE TRANSPORTATION MOBILITY OPTIONS AVAILABLE. THIS PROGRAM PROVIDES GRANT FUNDS FOR CAPITAL MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND OPERATING EXPENSES FOR: PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROJECTS PLANNED DESIGNED AND CARRIED OUT TO MEET THE SPECIAL NEEDS OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHEN PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IS INSUFFICIENT INAPPROPRIATE OR UNAVAILABLE; PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROJECTS THAT EXCEED THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES ACT (ADA); PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROJECTS THAT IMPROVE ACCESS TO FIXED-ROUTE SERVICE AND DECREASE RELIANCE ON COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT; AND ALTERNATIVES TO PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROJECTS THAT ASSIST SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND WITH TRANSPORTATION. ALL PROJECTS ARE INCLUDED IN A LOCALLY DEVELOPED COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT-HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN WHICH WAS LAST UPDATED IN DECEMBER 2020. THE VIRGINIA DEPARTMENT OF RAIL AND PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION (VDRPT) IS APPLYING FFY 2021 INNOVATIVE COORDINATED ACCESS AND MOBILITY (ICAM) PILOT PROGRAM FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $100500.THE VIRGINIA TRANSPORTATION NAVIGATOR VERSION 2.0 PROJECT WILL BUILD UPON VIRGINIAS RECENT SUCCESS IN DEVELOPING A STAGE ONE ONE-CALL/ONE-CLICK TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM WHICH LAUNCHED ON OCTOBER 27 2021. THE PROJECT WILL ELEVATE THE VIRGINIA TRANSPORTATION NAVIGATOR TO A STAGE TWO SYSTEM AND WILL INCLUDE NEW FEATURES THAT ALLOW USERS TO PLAN TRIPS OR DIRECTLY CONNECT WITH TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS FROM A SINGLE PORTAL. THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE DEVELOPING A CUSTOM ONE-CALL/ONE-CLICK DASHBOARD AND EXPANDING THE COMMONWEALTHS GENERAL TRANSIT FEED SPECIFICATION (GTFS) DATA TO COVER RURAL ON-DEMAND AND DIAL-A-RIDE PROVIDERS USING NEW GTFS-FLEX STANDARDS. DRPT WILL LEVERAGE EXISTING RELATIONSHIPS WITH INDUSTRY PARTNERS TO EXPAND THE EXISTING PORTAL AND DEVELOP THE NECESSARY INDEX DATA. BEYOND THE ONE-CALL/ONE-CLICK FUNCTIONALITY THE SYSTEM WILL INCLUDE CAR SHARE AND VOLUNTEER TRIP INFORMATION AS WELL AS PARK AND RIDE LOTS BIKE SHARES ELECTRIC VEHICLE CHARGING STATIONS BIKE PATHS AND TRAFFIC DATA.ON JUNE 16 2022 A NOTICE WAS PUBLISHED ANNOUNCING THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATIONS SELECTION OF PROJECTS FUNDED UNDER THE INNOVATIVE COORDINATED ACCESS AND MOBILITY GRANTS (ICAM). IN THIS NOTICE VIRGINIA DEPARTMENT OF RAIL AND PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION (VDRPT) WAS SELECTED TO RECEIVE $100500 IN FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) FFY 2021 INNOVATIVE COORDINATED ACCESS AND MOBILITY (ICAM) PILOT PROGRAM FUNDS.THE DISCRETIONARY ID FOR THIS PROJECT IS D2022-ICAM-020. A COPY OF THE COMPETITIVE APPLICATION PROPOSAL IS ATTACHED.THE NON-FEDERAL SHARE WILL BE PROVIDED BY THE COMMONWEALTH OF VA. PURPOSE: MAINTAIN THE EXISTING STATEWIDE STAGE 1.0 ONE-CALL-ONE-CLICK TRANSPORTATION RESOURCE FINDER WHILE DEVELOPING A NEW STAGE 2.0 SYSTEM.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS PROJECT WILL SUSTAIN THE STAGE 1.0 SYSTEM WHILE TRANSITIONING TO A STAGE 2.0 SYSTEM INTEGRATING THE FOLLOWING ENHANCEMENTS GTFS FLEX DEVELOPMENT IT SYSTEM DESIGN AND USER EXPERIENCE.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: MAINTAINING A STAGE 1.0 SYSTEM FOR SPECIALIZED POPULATIONS INCLUDING SENIORS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES. CREATING A NEW FEATURE RICH WEB-BASED TRANSPORTATION FINDER RESOURCE THAT INCLUDES COMPREHENSIVE DATA FOR MOST 5307 5311 AND 5310 FUNDED PROVIDERS OPERATING IN THE COMMONWEALTH OF VIRGINIA.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: RESIDENTS AND TRAVELERS WITHIN/TO THE COMMONWEALTH OF VIRGINIA.SUB-RECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE. WORK WILL BE PERFORMED BY TECHNICAL CONSULTANTS OVERSEEN BY DRPT STAFF.

BUDGET REVISION #2- 3/20/2020- PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE END DATE CHANGED TO SEPTEMBER 30 2020.THE VIRGINIA DEPARTMENT OF RAIL AND PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION (VDRPT) IS APPLYING SECTION 5310 ENHANCED MOBILITY OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES PROGRAM FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $4955002 FEDERAL ($7129889 TOTAL) TO SUPPORT THE VDRPT FY 2016 PROGRAM OF PROJECTS (POP). VDRPT IS APPLYING FOR FUNDING IN RURAL SMALL URBAN AND LARGE URBAN AREAS IN VIRGINIA AS FOLLOWS: RURAL AREA = $ 1275243 (FFY14 $24743; FFY15 $1250500)SMALL URBANIZED AREAS= $1208754 (FFY14 $282875; FFY15 $925879)HAMPTON ROADS (VIRGINIA BEACH LARGE UZA) = $1260514 (FFY14 $1049184; FFY15 $211330)RICHMOND = $945204 (FFY13 $419250; FFY14 $525954; FFY15 $0)ROANOKE (LARGE UZA) = $265287 (FFY14 $82146; FFY15 $183141)TOTAL AMOUNTS = $4955002PROJECTS INCLUDE THE PURCHASE OF 75 VANS (56 REPLACEMENTS 19 NEW/EXPANSION) MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND OPERATING FUNDS. VDRPT IS APPLYING FOR A PORTION OF THESE APPORTIONMENTS FOR FFY13 FFY14 AND FFY15 AND WILL SUBMIT AN AMENDMENT IN THE FUTURE FOR THE BALANCE OF FUNDS. ALL PROJECTS IN THE CURRENT POP ARE IN CATEGORY A. $3731197 OF FEDERAL FUNDING IS APPLIED TO TRADITIONAL SECTION 5310 PROJECTS AND APPLY TO THE REQUIRED 55% OF THE TOTAL APPORTIONMENT.VDRPTS FFY 2016 SECTION 5310 POP IS ATTACHED TO THIS GRANT UNDER PROJECT BUDGET. THE TOTAL NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS FUNDED IN THE POP IS 29 PRIVATE NON-PROFITS (8 RURAL 9 SMALL URBANIZED AND 12 URBANIZED) 11 GOVERNMENTAL AUTHORITIES (5 RURAL 6 URBANIZED) AND TWO CAB COMPANIES (BOTH URBANIZED). THE PROJECTS INCLUDED IN THIS APPLICATION ARE INCORPORATED IN COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES PLANS ADOPTED IN 2013 AND 2014 BY PLANNING DISTRICTS THROUGHOUT VIRGINIA AND APPROVED BY VDRPT. THE POP ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION INCLUDES DETAILED INFORMATION INCLUDING THE PAGE NUMBER OF THE SPECIFIC COORDINATED PLAN FROM WHICH EACH INDIVIDUAL PROJECT IS DERIVED. ALL PROJECTS ARE IN THE APPROVED FY15-18 STIP DATED 9/30/2014 AND ATTACHED IN TEAMNON-FEDERAL MATCH WILL BE PROVIDED BY LOCAL MUNICIPALITIES FOR 5310 VEHICLES. THE STATE AND LOCAL MUNICIPALITIES WILL PROVIDE MATCH FOR OPERATING AND MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROJECTS.HAMPTON ROADS RICHMOND AND ROANOKE MPOS HAVE DESIGNATED VDRPT TO APPLY FOR THEIR 5310 ALLOCATIONS AS THE ELIGIBLE DIRECT RECIPIENT OF SECTION 5310 FUNDS. LETTERS NOTING THIS DESIGNATION FROM EACH MPO ARE ATTACHED.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: TO SUPPORT HUMAN SERVICE TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS IN MEETING THE NEEDS OF SENIORS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE SALT LAKE-WEST VALLEY AREA.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: PURCHASE OF REPLACEMENT EXPANSION VEHICLES OPERATING ASSISTANCE TRAVEL TRAINING MOBILITY MANAGEMENT COMMUNICATION EQUIPMENT VEHICLE MONITORING SYSTEM AUTOMATIC SECURITY GATE TABLETS/PHONES RADIO/COMMUNICATIONS DEVICES PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE AND PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: IMPROVED SERVICES TO SENIORS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES BY KEEPING VEHICLES AND EQUIPMENT IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR AND FUNDING TRANSPORTATION SERVICES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ADMINISTRATION STAFF SENIORS INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND HUMAN SERVICE TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: SEVEN SUBRECIPIENTS HAVE BEEN SELECTED FOR AWARDS IN SUPPORT OF TRANSIT FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES INCLUDING: 1) WORK ACTIVITY CENTER 2) UNITED WAY OF SALT LAKE 3) FIRST STEP HOUSE 4) THE ROAD HOME 5) KOSTOPULOS DREAM FOUNDATION 6) TURN COMMUNITY SERVICES 7) BEAR O CARE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: CAPITAL METROPOLITAN TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (CAPMETRO) IS SUBMITTING THIS APPLICATION FOR $2650112 IN SECTION 5310 FEDERAL FUNDS ON BEHALF OF ITSELF AND 9 SUBRECIPIENTS. FUNDS FROM THE FOLLOWING APPORTIONMENT YEARS:FY2022 APPORTIONMENT: $1503490;FY2023 APPORTIONMENT: $1146622. FUNDS TO BE APPLIED FOR LATER: $431739 FROM THE FY2023 APPORTIONMENTCAPITAL METRO CERTIFIES THAT THESE FUNDS WERE AWARDED ON A FAIR AND EQUITABLE BASIS; THE PROJECTS HAVE BEEN DERIVED FROM A REGIONALLY COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT-HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN; TO THE EXTENT FEASIBLE SERVICES ARE COORDINATED WITH TRANSPORTATION SERVICES PROVIDED BY OTHER FEDERAL AGENCIES; AND THE PLANNING PROCESS INCLUDED REPRESENTATIVES OF PUBLIC PRIVATE AND NON-PROFIT TRANSPORTATION AND HUMAN SERVICE PROVIDERS PARTICIPATION BY THE PUBLIC AND REPRESENTATIVES ADDRESSING THE NEEDS OF OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THIS GRANT INCLUDES ALL THE PROJECTS SELECTED FOR SECTION 5310 FUNDING THROUGH THE FY2023 CALL FOR PROJECTS ADMINISTERED BY THE CAPITAL AREA METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATION (CAMPO). FUNDING ALLOCATED TO CAPITAL METROPOLITAN TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (CAPMETRO) INCLUDES $80000 FOR MOBILITY MANAGEMENT. THE REST OF THE FUNDS IN THIS APPLICATION $2570112 HAS BEEN SUBAWARDED TO 9 SUBRECIPIENTS TO CARRY OUT PROJECTS TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. ; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL RECEIVE EXPANDED TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND MOBILITY OPTIONS ENABLING THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AVOID SOCIAL ISOLATION AND INCREASE THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE AUSTIN URBANIZED AREA.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: AUSTIN GROUP FOR THE ELDERLY OF CENTRAL TEXAS ($105270) AUSTIN GROUP FOR THE ELDERLY OF CENTRAL TEXAS PROVIDES ACCESSIBLE TRANSPORTATION FOR OLDER ADULTS AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES THROUGH ITS INNOVATIVE THRIVE SOCIAL AND WELLNESS CENTERS AND THE HEALTHY CONNECTIONS AGREEMENT WITH FAMILY ELDERCARE. FTA FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE WILL ALLOW THE SUBRECIPIENT TO CONTINUE PROVIDING THESE CRITICAL TRANSPORTATION SERVICES.BLUEBONNET TRAILS COMMUNITY MHMR CENTER D.B.A. BLUEBONNET TRAILS COMMUNITY SERVICES ($294189) THE BLUEBONNET TRAILS COMMUNITY MHMR CENTER SERVES INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES LIVING IN WILLIAMSON COUNTY WHO ARE UNABLE TO DRIVE INDEPENDENTLY AND ARE WITHOUT ACCESS TO OTHER TRANSPORTATION. FTA FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE WILL ALLOW THE SUBRECIPIENT TO PURCHASE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES THROUGH CONTRACTS WITH ONE OR MORE TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS. CAPITAL AREA RURAL TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM ($340000) - CAPITAL AREA RURAL TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM (CARTS) WILL PURCHASE TWO (2) REPLACEMENT VEHICLES FOR THE MANOR PICKUP DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICE. THESE UNITS WILL REPLACE TWO UNITS CURRENTLY IN SERVICE THAT ARE AT THE END OF THEIR USEFUL LIFE.
