APPLICATION PURPOSE: PARTIAL VEHICLE PURCHASE OF ONE ADA COMPLIANT VAN. DUE TO INCREASING ENROLLMENT IN NEW DANVILLES (SUBRECIPIENT) PROGRAM THE TRANSPORTATION NEEDS HAVE GROWN ENLARGING THE GEOGRAPHIC AREA OF THE TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM. NEW DANVILLE IS A 42-ACRE RURAL NONPROFIT COMMUNITY IN WILLIS FOR ADULTS WITH INTELLECTUAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES AND THOSE WHO NEED SIMILAR SERVICES.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: NEW DANVILLE WILL PURCHASE ONE ADDITIONAL ADA COMPLIANT VEHICLE TO HELP WITH THE TRANSPORTATION NEEDS OF GROWING ENROLLMENT IN THE DAY PROGRAM IN TERMS OF TRANSPORTATION TO AND FROM NEW DANVILLE AS WELL AS TO HANDLE THE VARIETY OF CLASSES THAT UTILIZE TRIPS INTO THE COMMUNITY. NEW DANVILLE CURRENTLY HAS FOUR VEHICLES AND TWO VEHICLES ARE LEASED FOR $0 FROM BRAZOS TRANSIT DISTRICT. HOWEVER; THOSE TWO LEASED VEHICLES WILL NO LONGER BE AVAILABLE. PURCHASING ONE MORE NEW VEHICLE WILL HELP NEW DANVILLE MEET THEIR RIDERSHIP/ENROLLMENT DEMAND.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THE GRANT AWARD TO NEW DANVILLE WOULD BE TO INCREASE THEIR PROGRAM OPERATIONAL EFFICIENCY INCREASING THE NUMBER OF REGISTRANTS WHO CAN PARTICIPATE IN THE PROGRAM. ALSO RELIABLE TRANSPORTATION ALLOWS NEW DANVILLE TO INCREASE CLASS EXPERIENCES. TRANSPORTATION IS VITALLY IMPORTANT TO INCREASE INDEPENDENCE FOR RIDERS. THE NEW VEHICLE WILL ALLOW NEW DANVILLE TO BE MORE EFFICIENT AND COST EFFECTIVE WHEN TRANSPORTING INDIVIDUALS ACROSS MONTGOMERY COUNTY. TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS ARE PROVIDED FOR CLIENTS AS FAR NORTH AS HUNTSVILLE AND AS FAR SOUTH AS LOUETTA ROAD IN HOUSTON.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES IN THE COMMUNITY ARE ADULTS WITH INTELLECTUAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES AND THOSE WHO NEED SIMILAR SERVICES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES MIGHT ALSO INCLUDE NEW RIDERS THAT NEW DANVILLE CURRENTLY DOES NOT HAVE CAPACITY FOR DUE TO LACK OF NECESSARY VEHICLES.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE SUBRECIPIENT ORGANIZES TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR REGISTRANTS TO COMMUTE TO WORK DAILY LIFE ACTIVITIES SUCH AS GROCERY SHOPPING SOCIAL OUTINGS AND RECREATION. OUTSIDE OF TRANSPORTATION NEW DANVILLE PROVIDES A VARIETY OF SERVICES INCLUDING A DAY PROGRAM AND AFFORDABLE INDEPENDENT LIVING. THE DAY PROGRAM CURRENTLY HAS MORE THAN 100 REGISTRANTS; THERE ARE 36 RESIDENTS WITH A WAITING LIST OF 30 PROSPECTIVE REGISTRANTS. TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS ARE CRITICAL TO BOTH DAY PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS AND THE RESIDENTS.

THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST FY 2020 AND FY 2021 SECTION 5310 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE MCALLEN URBAN AREA IN THE AMOUNT OF $1222804. THIS PROJECT APPLICATION UTILIZES THE SECTION 5310 FY 2020 CALL FOR PROJECTS. FUNDING BREAKDOWN:FY 2020 TOTAL FEDERAL APPORTIONMENT: $602553FY 2021 TOTAL FEDERAL APPORTIONMENT: $620251PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO UTILIZE FEDERAL FUNDS FOR ADMINISTRATION MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND TO CONSTRUCT SIDEWALKS FOR THE WESLACO PEDESTRIAN 2022 PROJECT. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL PROVIDE INCREASED TRANSPORTATION FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND ENHANCE THEIR MOBILITY OPTIONS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: ADMINISTRATION - FY 2020 $60255 AND FY 2021 $62025 WILL BE USED FOR ADMINISTRATIVE COSTS AT 100%.MOBILITY MANAGEMENT - FY 2020 142298 AND FY 2021 558226 WILL BE FOR MOBILITY MANAGEMENT WITH TDCS AS LOCAL MATCH. THE CALL CENTER WILL MANAGE THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS AND TRANSPORTATION ARRANGEMENTS FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. THE REGIONAL CALL CENTERS INCLUDE ACQUISITION OF INTELLIGENT TRANSPORTATION TECHNOLOGIES TO HELP PLAN AND OPERATE COORDINATED SYSTEMS INCLUSIVE OF GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEMS (GIS) MAPPING GLOBAL POSITIONING SYSTEM TECHNOLOGY COORDINATED VEHICLE SCHEDULING DISPATCHING AND MONITORING TECHNOLOGIES AS WELL AS TECHNOLOGIES TO TRACK COSTS AND BILLING IN A COORDINATED SYSTEM AND SINGLE SMART CUSTOMER PAYMENT SYSTEMS. WESLACO PEDESTRIAN 2022 PROJECT - FY 2020 5310 FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $400000; THIS PROJECT IS TO ENHANCE MOBILITY TO NEARBY AREAS THROUGH THE UTILIZATION OF ADA-COMPLIANT SIDEWALKS FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. THE PROJECT ELIMINATES GAPS IN PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION BY PROVIDING A SAFE PASSAGE FOR PEOPLE TO NAVIGATE FROM BUSINESS 83 TO PIKE BLVD. THE WESLACO PEDESTRIANS 2022 PROJECT WAS DEVELOPED AS A PHASE 2; A PREVIOUS GRANT AWARDED IN APPLICATION TX-16-X028-00 THE 5310 PROGRAM FOR ENHANCE MOBILITY FOR SENIORS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES. PHASE 2 PROPOSES A CONTINUATION OF THE ADDITION OF ACCESSIBLE SIDEWALKS ON BRIDGE AVE. WITH CONNECTION TO TWO SCHOOLS IDEA WESLACO (AMERICA ST.) AND FD ROOSEVELT ELEMENTARY (AGOSTADERO ST.) AND THE NEW FIRE AND POLICE STATION AND TWO NEARBY CITY PARKS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: IMPROVE MOBILITY IN THE AREA INCREASE PEDESTRIAN TRAFFIC AND ACCESS TO NEARBY PUBLIC SERVICES. THE PROJECT IMPLEMENTS THE 2019-2024 LOWER RIO GRANDE VALLEY REGIONAL STRATEGIC PLAN BY TARGETING ITS PRIORITIES INCLUDING ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES PUBLIC SAFETY COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES AND TRANSPORTATION. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE CITY OF WESLACO IS A SUBRECIPIENT. THE WESLACO PEDESTRIAN 2022 PROJECT WILL BE SPEARHEADED BY THE CITY OF WESLACO AND LRGVDC WILL OVERSEE THE PROJECT PROGRESS ACTIVITIES. THIS PROJECT WAS INCLUDED IN THE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PLAN (TIP) PG. 27-28. PROJECT IS LOCATED IN STIP ON PAGES 983 986; STIP/TIP ARE UPLOADED IN APPLICATION DOCUMENTS.THE ALLOCATION OF THESE FUNDS TO THE SUBRECIPIENT WAS AWARDED ON A FAIR AND EQUITABLE BASIS; THE PROJECT HAS BEEN DERIVED FROM A REGIONALLY COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT PLAN TO THE EXTENT FEASIBLE; SERVICES ARE COORDINATED WITH TRANSPORTATION SERVICES PROVIDED BY OTHER FEDERAL AGENCIES; AND THE PLANNING PROCESS INCLUDED REPRESENTATIVES OF PUBLIC PRIVATE AND NONPROFIT TRANSPORTATION ON HUMAN SERVICE PROVIDERS PARTICIPATION BY THE PUBLIC AND REPRESENTATIVE ADDRESSING THE NEEDS OF OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. LRGVDC CERTIFIES THAT THERE ARE NO NONPROFITS READILY AVAILABLE TO PROVIDE THE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT SERVICES. TRADITIONAL PROJECTS EXCEED THE 55% MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS.LOCAL MATCH WILL BE PROVIDED BY TDCS AND THE CITY OF WESLACO.

GULF COAST TRANSIT DISTRICT HAS BEEN AWARDED $57600 IN FTA FY2020 SECTION 5310 FUNDING BY HOUSTON METRO FOR TO UTILIZE 100% OF THEIR 5310 FUNDS FOR SUPPORT ON-GOING TRANSIT OPERATIONS IN THE HOUSTON AREA THAT WE SERVICE AND ENABLE THE ABILITY TO ENHANCE MOBILITY OF PASSENGERS AND AID IN THE PURCHASE OF ROLLING STOCK. THIS PURCHASE WILL BE AN ADA VEHICLE THAT WILL BE USED IN OUR HIGH DEMAND AREA FOR SENIOR CITIZEN AND DISABLED PASSENGERS. THIS ACTIVITY IS 100% TRADITIONAL 5310.CRRSAA WAIVES THE REQUIREMENT FOR LOCAL SHARE FOR PREVIOUSLY APPORTIONED (FY21 AND PRIOR) UNOBLIGATED SECTION 5310 FUNDS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER APPROXIMATELY 33% OF A VEHICLE THAT GCTD IS SEEKING TO REPLACE. THE REMAINING PORTION WILL BE COVERED BY 5307 FUNDS THAT GCTD WILL ALLOCATE (FY22 ALLOCATION) TO THE VEHICLE REPLACEMENT. THE VEHICLE GCTD IS SEEKING TO REPLACE OF VEHICLE UNITS 2407 (VIN 1FDFE4FS4ADA11181) THAT IS USED TO SUPPORT VEHICLES FOR HARRIS COUNTY UZA (HOUSTON URBANIZED AREA). MILEAGE IS 357861. GCTD WILL REPLACE ALL LEASED VEHICLES WITH AGENCY-OWNED. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: NEW SUPPORT VEHICLES WILL BE USED TO ENHANCE THE GENERAL SAFETY OF THE BUS FLEET IN ADDITION TO PROVIDING ADA SERVICES TO OUR PASSENGERS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: NEW VEHICLES WILL IMPROVE BASIC ACCESSIBILITY TO THE COMMUNITY - THEY WILL BE MORE RELIABLE AND ABLE TO SERVE MORE RIDERS WITH EACH TRIP AND PROVIDE ENHANCED ADA SERVICES. THERE IS A LARGE POPULATION WHO RELY ON THESE SERVICES TO FULFILL THEIR BASIC NEEDS - ACCESS TO MEDICAL FACILITIES SCHOOL JOBS RETAIL. THESE VEHICLES WILL HELP TO IMPROVE THE RELIABILITY OF THE SERVICE AND PROVIDE A BETTER CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE ESPECIALLY FOR ROUTES WITH HIGH DISABLED AND SENIOR CITIZEN RIDERSHIP. SUBRECIPIENTS: NONETHIS REPLACEMENT VEHICLE ACTIVITY FALLS WITHIN THE GROUPED PROJECT OF THE TX STIPALL PROJECTS ARE DERIVED FROM A CURRENT COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES PLAN. METRO PMP ATTACHED.

DRIVE A SENIOR AUSTIN TEXAS: $226331EXPECTED OUTCOMES:SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL RECEIVE EXPANDED TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND MOBILITY OPTIONS ENABLING THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AVOID SOCIAL ISOLATION AND INCREASE THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE AUSTIN URBANIZED AREA.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:BLUEBONNET TRAILS COMMUNITY MHMR CENTER D.B.A. BLUEBONNET TRAILS COMMUNITY SERVICES ($295320) BLUEBONNET TRAILS COMMUNITY SERVICES (BTCS) WILL SERVE INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES LIVING IN WILLIAMSON COUNTY WHO ARE UNABLE TO DRIVE INDEPENDENTLY AND ARE WITHOUT ACCESS TO OTHER TRANSPORTATION. INDIVIDUALS IN BTCS SERVICES HAVE QUALIFYING DISABILITY DIAGNOSES AND ARE ALSO COMPRISED OF SENIORS VETERANS AND TITLE VI POPULATIONS. THIS PROJECT WILL USE PREPAID VOUCHERS WITH ESTABLISHED PUBLIC TRANSPORT PROVIDERS AS WELL AS INTERNAL VOUCHERS FOR MORE SPECIFIC TRANSPORT NEEDS. THESE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES ALLOW INDIVIDUALS TO ATTEND MEDICAL SERVICES EMPLOYMENT AND HOUSING APPOINTMENTS AND INCREASE THEIR COMMUNITY INTEGRATION. BY REDUCING THE BARRIERS TO ACCESSING NEEDED SERVICES INDIVIDUALS WILL HAVE A BETTER OPPORTUNITY TO ACHIEVE THEIR PERSONAL GOALS.SENIOR ACCESS ($374000) SENIOR ACCESS PROVIDES VOLUNTEER-BASED TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO OLDER FRAIL ADULTS IN THE AUSTIN AREA INCLUDING ROUND ROCK PFLUGERVILLE HUTTO MANOR AND EAST AUSTIN. THESE RIDES ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF LIFE AND FOSTER INDEPENDENT LIVING IN OLDER ADULTS. SENIOR ACCESS FACILITATES ACCESS BY PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL SERVICES AND TRIPS THAT HELP ALLEVIATE ISOLATION INCLUDING GROCERY SHOPPING AND SOCIAL ACTIVITIES. THE FUNDING WILL HELP SERVE EVEN MORE OF OUR FRAGILE OLDER POPULATION BY PROVIDING FOR A PURCHASE OF A NEW 14 PASSENGER VAN TO EXPAND OUR FIXED ROUTES A SMALL VAN FOR EMERGENCY RIDES WHEN VOLUNTEERS ARE NOT AVAILABLE VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT COSTS EMERGENCY RIDES VAN MAINTENANCE AND MOBILITY MANAGEMENT SERVICES.FAITH IN ACTION GEORGETOWN ($431295) FAITH IN ACTION GEORGETOWN (FIAG) PROVIDES TRANSPORTATION FOR INDIVIDUALS 65 YEARS+ WHO NO LONGER DRIVE DUE TO HEALTH REASONS AND OR CANNOT AFFORD A CAR. WITH A VOLUNTEER MODEL FIAG PROVIDES TRANSPORTATION GROWING BOTH IN SIZE AND NUMBERS SERVED AND BY ADAPTING PROCESSES TO HELP SENIORS LIVE INDEPENDENTLY LONGER. A VAN PROGRAM WAS ADDED IN 2018 TO HANDLE GROCERY TRIPS MORE EFFICIENTLY AND TO SUPPLEMENT VOLUNTEER AVAILABILITY TO COVER 1-ON-1 MEDICAL TRIPS. AS VOLUNTEERS HAVE BEEN SLOW TO RE-ENGAGE SINCE THE SPREAD OF COVID-19 THIS PROJECT WILL INTRODUCE 2 NEW PROGRAMS TO MEET THE CONTINUED GROWTH THAT GEORGETOWN HAS EXPERIENCED. THE PURCHASE OF A MINI-VAN WILL EXPAND SERVICES FOR SOUTHEAST GEORGETOWN OFFERING RIDESHARE. SECOND A VOUCHER PROGRAM WILL BE IMPLEMENTED TO INCREASE RIDERSHIP.DRIVE A SENIOR CENTRAL TEXAS ($410000) THE DRIVE A SENIOR CENTRAL TEXAS (DASCTX) PROGRAM ADDRESSES THE TRANSPORTATION NEEDS OF SENIORS IN THE AUSTIN AREA --IT ALLOWS THEM TO AGE IN PLACE OPTIMIZING PHYSICAL AND SOCIAL HEALTH THROUGH INDIVIDUAL AND GROUP RIDES TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS GROCERY SHOPPING FOOD BANKS SENIOR CENTERS PLACES OF WORSHIP SOCIAL OUTINGS RESPITE CARE AND MORE. VOLUNTEER DRIVERS PROVIDE DOOR-TO-DOOR SERVICE FOR ONE-WAY OR ROUNDTRIP RIDES DEPENDING ON THE CLIENTS NEED. SENIORS CALL TO SCHEDULE A RIDE OR CAN TEXT OR EMAIL THEIR REQUEST. VOLUNTEERS USE AN ONLINE PLATFORM TO SIGN UP TO DRIVE AT THEIR CONVENIENCE; GROUP RIDES ARE SCHEDULED AND DRIVEN BY PAID STAFF. DASCTX IS COMMITTED TO SERVING 550 CLIENTS IN 2022 AND OVER 900 IN 2023.DRIVE A SENIOR AUSTIN TEXAS ($226331) DRIVE A SENIOR AUSTIN TEXAS (DASATX) MISSION IS TO ENABLE OLDER ADULTS TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AVOID SOCIAL ISOLATION AND AGE IN PLACE BY PROVIDING FREE VOLUNTEER-BASED TRANSPORTATION AND OTHER SUPPORT SERVICES. IT PROVIDES COST-EFFECTIVE HIGH-QUALITY AND SAFE TRANSPORTATION FOR HOME-BOUND SENIORS IN THE AUSTIN METRO AREA. 100% OF ITS SERVICES ARE FOR TRANSIT DEPENDENT POPULATIONS INCLUDING SENIORS LOW-INCOME HOUSEHOLDS VETERANS/SPOUSES OF VETERANS AND OLDER ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES. SPECIFICALLY FUNDING WILL HELP IN THE FOLLOWING AREAS: 1. INFRASTRUCTURE STRENGTHENING AND EXPANSION OF EXISTING PROGRAMS 2. OUTREACH TO UNDERSERVED MINORITY NEIGHBORHOODS AND LOW-INCOME SENIORS.

OUTREACH TO UNDERSERVED MINORITY NEIGHBORHOODS AND LOW-INCOME SENIORS.AUSTIN GROUP FOR THE ELDERLY (AGE) OF CENTRAL TEXAS ($125500) - AGE OF CENTRAL TEXAS PROVIDES ACCESSIBLE TRANSPORTATION FOR OLDER ADULTS AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES THROUGH ITS INNOVATIVE THRIVE SOCIAL AND WELLNESS CENTERS AND ITS HEALTHY CONNECTIONS AGREEMENT WITH FAMILY ELDERCARE. RIDERS UTILIZING AGES TRANSPORTATION SERVICES MOSTLY CONSIST OF LOW-INCOME OLDER ADULTS WITH PHYSICAL AND/OR COGNITIVE NEEDS WHO ARE DEPENDENT ON AGE TO ACCESS CARE AND ESSENTIAL RESOURCES BECAUSE THEY ARE NOT ABLE TO DRIVE OR UTILIZE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION. TRANSPORTATION OFFERED BY AGE IS ONE OF THE SAFEST TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS AVAILABLE TO THOSE SERVED BECAUSE DRIVERS ARE SPECIALLY TRAINED IN DRIVER SAFETY EMERGENCY ROADSIDE AND ACCIDENT PROCEDURES AND WORK WITH OLDER ADULTS WITH DEMENTIA AND PHYSICAL DISABILITIES.AUSTIN PARKS AND RECREATION DEPARTMENT ($1343) - AUSTIN PARKS AND RECREATION DEPARTMENT (PARD) SENIOR TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM HAS BEEN OPERATING FOR OVER 30 YEARS AND EXISTS TO DIRECTLY SUPPORT SENIORS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES WHO FACE TRANSPORTATION CHALLENGES ESPECIALLY THOSE FROM AUSTINS LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES. PARD HAS ALREADY INVESTED IN A FLEET OF VEHICLES TO SHUTTLE PATRONS; HOWEVER THE VEHICLES ARE NOT BEING USED TO THEIR FULLEST CAPACITY DUE TO A SHORTAGE OF DRIVERS. THE REQUESTED FUNDING WILL SUPPORT CURRENT STAFFING AND NEW HIRES TO MEET THE INCREASING DEMAND FOR RIDES TO CONGREGATE MEAL SITES AND FOR PERSONAL ERRANDS.

PURPOSE:THIS COLLABORATIVE PROJECT WILL ENSURE ENHANCED SIDEWALKS AND ADA RAMPS ARE EITHER IMPROVED OR INSTALLED TO CONNECT ALL INDIVIDUALS REGARDLESS OF AGE AND/OR DISABILITY TO METRO TRANSIT WITHIN THE AREA (ALONG WEST GRAY (SHEPHERD DRIVE TO DUNLAVY STREET) AND CONNECTING STREETS).ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE MONTROSE REDEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY HAS BEEN AWARDED A SUBALLOCATED AMOUNT OF $242406 IN FTA FY2019 SECTION 5310 FUNDING BY HOUSTON METRO. THE CRRSAA PROVISION FOR UNUSED 5310 FUNDS WILL BE UTILIZED IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION. FUNDS ARE BEING USED FOR NON-TRADITIONAL EXPENSES WHICH CANT EXCEED 45% OF THE FULL UZA APPORTIONMENT. ALL PROJECTS ARE DERIVED FROM A CURRENT COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES PLAN. THESE FUNDS WILL SUPPORT REBUILDING INCOMPLETE AND DETERIORATING SIDEWALKS ALONG WEST GRAY (SHEPHERD DRIVE TO DUNLAVY STREET) AND CONNECTING STREETS (~24000 SQUARE FEET) TO HIGHER STANDARDS THAN REQUIRED BY ADA WIDEN SIDEWALKS IN PLACES WITH MORE WALKING ACTIVITY (~25%) AND REBUILD OR INSTALL HIGHER STANDARD ADA WHEELCHAIR RAMPS INCLUDING ADA TRUNCATED DOMES (~75 NEW RAMPS) AND ASSOCIATED PAVEMENT MARKINGS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THESE IMPROVEMENTS WILL INTEGRATE THE METRO SERVICE (ROUTE 32 ROUTE 27) INTO THE SURROUNDING NEIGHBORHOOD ALONG WEST GRAY AND DIRECTLY ABUTTING WEST GRAY. MONTROSE ENHANCED INFRASTRUCTURE WOULD MAKE ACCESS TO TRANSIT AND LOCAL DESTINATIONS EASY AND SAFE. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO ENHANCE ACCESS FOR SCHOOLS AND TRANSIT ROUTES SERVING RESIDENTS AND VISITORS TO MONTROSE. MOBILITY CHOICES WILL BE GREATER SUPPORTED BY PROVIDING BETTER CONNECTED NETWORKS OF SIDEWALKS ADA RAMPS AND ASSOCIATED PAVEMENT MARKINGS. THE WEST GRAY (SHEPHERD DRIVE TO DUNLAVY STREET) ENHANCED PEDESTRIAN-TRANSIT CONNECTIVITY PROJECT FURTHER ENHANCES METROS VISION TO BE AN INDUSTRY LEADER IN DELIVERING TIMELY AND EFFICIENT SERVICE THAT IS TRANSFORMATIVE BY PROVIDING MULTI-MODAL INTERACTIONS FOR COMMUNITIES TO CONNECT TO EVERYDAY WORK AND LIFE OPPORTUNITIES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:MONTROSE IS A NEIGHBORHOOD WHERE PEOPLE WALK BIKE AND CONNECT TO SEVEN (7) NEARBY METRO BUS LINES. RESIDENTS AND VISITORS TO MONTROSE INCLUDING SENIORS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES WILL HAVE ENHANCED ACCESS TO SCHOOLS AND TRANSIT ROUTES MAKING IT EASIER AND SAFE TO ACCESS TRANSIT AND LOCAL DESTINATIONS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:N/AAS A RESULT OF THE SUB-ALLOCATION HARRIS COUNTY FT. THIS IS AN FY 2021 SECTION 5310 CRRSA ACT APPLICATION IN THE AMOUNT OF $615514.00. THE SPLIT LETTER DATED 06-30-21 IS ATTACHED. CRRSA ACT FUNDS ARE AVAILABLE AT 100% FEDERAL SHARE DO NOT HAVE AN EXPIRATION DATE AND CAN BE USED EXPEDITIOUSLY FOR OPERATING AND PAYROLL EXPENSES THAT WERE INCURRED ON OR AFTER JANUARY 20 2020. PER THE FTA CRRSA ACT FTA PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY BEGINS ON JANUARY 20 2020. THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES CRRSA ACT FUNDING TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO COVID-19. THE AWARD WILL COMPENSATE FOR PRIOR PAYROLL AND OPERATING AS WELL AS PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES (NET FARE REVENUES). PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE IS CONSIDERED AN OPERATING EXPENSE FOR THE PURPOSES OF CRRSAA REIMBURSEMENT. OPERATING EXPENSES USUALLY INCLUDE SUCH COSTS AS DRIVER SALARIES FUEL AND ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR INCLUDING PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT AND CLEANING SUPPLIES. PAYROLL AND OPERATIONAL NEEDS WILL BE PRIORITIZED TO THE EXTENT NECESSARY TO OPERATE MAINTAIN AND MANAGE METROS ADA COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICE.THIS CRRSA ACT GRANT WILL ALLOW METRO TO BE IN A BETTER POSITION TO MEET OPERATING COSTS AND MAINTAIN SERVICE EVEN THOUGH REVENUE HAS DECREASED DUE TO REDUCTIONS IN SERVICE. THE GRANT WILL ALSO ALLOW METRO TO RECOVER FROM THE FINANCIAL IMPACTS OF THE GLOBAL COVID-19 PANDEMIC.PURPOSE AND INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE AWARD IS TO HELP ENSURE THAT METROS ADA COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICE KNOWN AS METRO LIFT CONTINUES TO PROVIDE AN UNINTERRUPTED ORIGIN-TO-DESTINATION SERVICE PROGRAM. THIS SHARED-RIDE PROGRAM PROVIDES RIDES TO INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHO OTHERWISE WOULD NOT BE ABLE TO WALK OR ACCESS NORMAL METRO BUS STOPS. SAFE TRANSIT SERVICES MUST BE AVAILABLE FOR RIDERS TRAVELING TO JOBS HEALTH CARE AND OTHER ESSENTIAL SERVICES WITHIN THEIR RESPECTIVE COMMUNITIES. THE RELIEF WILL ALSO MAKE THE METRO TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM MORE RESILIENT.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE AWARD WILL COMPENSATE FOR PRIOR PAYROLL AND OPERATING AS WELL AS PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES (NET FARE REVENUES). PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE IS CONSIDERED AN OPERATING EXPENSE FOR THE PURPOSES OF CRRSAA REIMBURSEMENT. OPERATING EXPENSES USUALLY INCLUDE SUCH COSTS AS OPERATORS/CONDUCTORS OPERATING CREW MEMBERS ROUTE SCHEDULERS DISPATCHERS INSTRUCTORS TIMEKEEPERS SERVICE STAFF (E.G. CLEANERS FUELERS) MAINTENANCE PERSONNEL (E.G. MECHANICS BODY SHOP WORKERS) AND ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT STAFF. FUEL AND ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR INCLUDING PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT AND CLEANING SUPPLIES ARE ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS CRRSAA GRANT AVAILABLE AT A 100 PERCENT FEDERAL SHARE WILL ALLOW METRO TO BE IN A BETTER POSITION TO MEET OPERATING COSTS AND MAINTAIN SERVICE EVEN THOUGH REVENUE HAS DECREASED DUE TO REDUCTIONS IN SERVICE. MOBILITY FOR SENIORS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES WILL BE IMPROVED BY REMOVING BARRIERS TO TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND EXPANDING THE AVAILABILITY OF TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS. THE GRANT WILL ALSO ALLOW METRO TO RECOVER FROM THE FINANCIAL IMPACTS OF THE GLOBAL COVID-19 PANDEMIC.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NO SUBRECIPIENTS TO THE AWARDSUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS TO THE AWARD.THE METROPOLITAN TRANSIT AUTHORITY OF HARRIS COUNTY TEXAS AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.THIS PROJECT INCLUDES ONLY OPERATIONS PLANNING AND/OR CAPITAL PROJECTS WITH NO SUBSTANTIAL FUNCTIONAL LOCATION OR CAPACITY CHANGE. THEREFORE PER CRRSA ACT REQUIREMENTS NO STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM (STIP) OR TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PLAN (TIP) DOCUMENTATION IS NEEDED.

PURPOSE OF AWARDTHE KNOXVILLE REGIONAL HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION COORDINATION PLAN IDENTIFIED SEVERAL GAPS IN SERVICES IN THE KNOXVILLE URBAN AREA. MANY OF THESE GAPS DEALT WITH THE LACK OF TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE COMMUNITY. THERE ARE TIMES AND/OR LOCATIONS WITHIN THE URBAN AREA THAT THE FIXED-ROUTE MASS-TRANSIT SERVICE AND THE REQUIRED ADA COMPLIMENTARY PARATRANSIT DOES NOT SERVE. IN FACT GEOGRAPHICALLY THE MASS-TRANSIT SERVICE AND THE REQUIRED ADA COMPLIMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICE COVER APPROXIMATELY 25-30% OF THE URBAN AREA. THIS LEAVES APPROXIMATELY 70-75% OF THE URBAN AREA WITH LIMITED DEMAND RESPONSE TRANSIT SERVICES. THEREFORE THE HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION COORDINATION PLAN LIST AS STRATEGIES TO ADDRESS THE IDENTIFIED NEEDS AND GAPS IN SERVICES WITH THE USE OF SECTION 5310 FUNDING. THIS INCLUDES HELPING TO PROVIDE EXPANDED SERVICES THROUGHOUT THE URBAN AREA. ONE WAY THE PLAN RECOMMENDS ACCOMPLISHING THIS IS TO PROVIDE SECTION 5310 CAPITAL FUNDING TO NON-PROFITS AND HUMAN RESOURCES SERVICE AGENCIES TO PURCHASE VANS AND MINI-BUSES. ANOTHER STRATEGY IS THE USE OF MOBILITY MANAGEMENT TECHNIQUES TO EXPAND MORE TRANSIT OPTIONS AND TO BETTER COORDINATE THE EXISTING SERVICES. A FINAL STRATEGY IS TO USE SECTION 5310 OPERATING FUNDING FOR VOLUNTEER ASSISTED TRANSPORTATION PROGRAMS AND EXPANDED DEMAND RESPONSE TRANSIT SERVICES. THE BENEFIT OF DOING THESE STRATEGIES ARE MORE SENIORS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES HAVE ACCESS TO TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS WHICH PROVIDES THEM THE FREEDOM TO TRAVEL TO TAKE JOBS AND TO PARTICIPATE IN SOCIETY. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE GRANT FUNDS TO SUB-RECIPIENTS TO IMPLEMENT BOTH CAPITAL AND OPERATING PROJECTS TO PROVIDE MORE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO SENIORS AND PERSONS WHO ARE DISABLED IN THE KNOXVILLE URBAN AREA.2. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED - THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:(1) SEVEN (7) AWARDS TO SEVEM (7) DIFFERENT NON-PROFITS AND HUMAN SERVICE AGENCIES TO PURCHASE OF ELEVEN (11) VANS AND TWO (2) MINI-BUSES (CUTAWAYS);(2) TWO (2) AWARDS TO TWO (2) DIFFERENT AGENCIES TO PROVIDE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT SERVICES;(3) FOUR (4) AWARDS TO AGENCIES FOR OPERATING FUNDS IN WHICH THREE (3) AGENCIES WILL PROVIDE VOLUNTEER ASSISTED TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND ONE (1) AGENCY WILL PROVIDE DEMAND RESPONSE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES; AND(4) ADMINISTRATION FUNDING TO THE TPO TO HELP MANAGE THE OVERALL REGIONAL SECTION 5310 PROGRAM.3. EXPECTED OUTCOMESTHE HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION COORDINATION PLAN IDENTIFIED SEVERAL GAPS IN SERVICES IN THE KNOXVILLE URBAN AREA. MANY OF THESE GAPS DEALT WITH THE LACK OF TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE COMMUNITY. ONE WAY THE PLAN RECOMMENDS ACCOMPLISHING ELIMINATING GAPS IS TO PROVIDE CAPITAL FUNDING TO NON-PROFITS AND HUMAN RESOURCES SERVICE AGENCIES TO PURCHASE VANS AND MINI-BUSES. THIS GRANT AWARDS FUNDING TO SEVEN (7) NON-PROFITS/HUMAN SERVICE AGENCIES TO PURCHASE ELEVEN (11) VANS AND (2) MINI-BUSES. THE FEDERAL LIFE EXPECTANCY FOR A VAN IS FOUR (4) YEARS AND FIVE (5) FOR A MINI-BUS (RECOGNIZING MOST VEHICLES WILL REMAIN IN SERVICE LONG AFTER THE FEDERAL LIFE EXPECTANCY). FOR THIS GRANT THE ELEVEN (11) VANS AND TWO (2) MINI-BUSES SHOULD PROVIDE APPROXIMATELY 700000 ONE-WAY TRIPS OVER THEIR FEDERAL LIVE EXPECTANCY (FOUR/FIVE YEARS) TO SENIORS AND PERSONS WHO ARE DISABLED IN THE KNOXVILLE URBAN AREA.THE HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION COORDINATION PLAN IDENTIFIES AS A CRITICAL NEED THE FUNDING OF OPERATING SERVICES FOR GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES NON-PROFITS HUMAN RESOURCES SERVICE AGENCIES AND PRIVATE PROVIDERS TO HELP FILL IN THE GAPS OF NEEDED TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. MOST OFTEN THIS REQUIRES PROVIDING SERVICES THROUGH VOLUNTEER DRIVER TYPE PROGRAMS (MOBILITY MANAGEMENT) AND PROVIDING STRATEGICALLY LOCATED DEMAND RESPONSE TRANSIT SERVICES (OUTSIDE REGULAR FIXED-ROUTE MASS-TRANSIT SERVICE AREA AND BEYOND ADA COMPLIMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICE REQUIREMENTS). THE OPERATING PROJECTS PROVIDE AN INVALUABLE SERVICE TO SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE TPOS URBAN AREA. THE VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS PROVIDE SERVICES FOR THOSE WHO NEED THAT EXTRA LEVEL OF ASSISTANCE OFTEN THE FRAILEST IN THE COMMUNITY. THE DRIVER ACCOMPANIES THE RIDER THROUGHOUT THE ENTIRE TRIP AND CAN HELP THEM WITH CERTAIN ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CARRYING GROCERIES OR HELPING THEM TO THEIR DOCTORS OFFICE (NOT JUST DROPPING OFF AT CURB). IT IS PROJECTED THE OPERATING SERVICES FUNDED THROUGH THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE APPROXIMATELY 44000 TRIPS PER YEAR. THE PROGRAMS ARE FUNDED BETWEEN 12-24 MONTHS DEPENDING ON EACH AGENCYS APPLICATION FOR FUNDING. 4. INTENDED BENEFICIARIESTHE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS GRANT ARE SENIORS AND PERSONS WHO ARE DISABLED IN THE KNOXVILLE URBAN AREA. THIS GRANT PROVIDES TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO SENIORS AND PERSONS WHO ARE DISABLED THAT MIGHT NOT OTHERWISE HAVE ANY OTHER TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS. OFTEN THE SENIORS TRANSPORTED ARE THE FRAILEST IN THE COMMUNITY AND REQUIRE AN EXTRA LEVEL OF CARE. THE PERSONS WHO HAVE DISABILITIES MOST OFTEN ARE INTELLECTUALLY DEVELOPMENTAL AND PHYSICALLY CHALLENGED. THESE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES HELP PROVIDE THEM ACCESS TO THERAPY DOCTORS APPOINTMENTS WORK AND SOCIAL OPPORTUNITIES. WITHOUT THESE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES MOST WOULD BE HOMEBOUND. 5. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIESTHE TPO (EXCEPT FOR ADMINISTRATION FUNDING) AWARDS ALL FUNDING/PROJECTS TO SUB-RECIPIENTS. FOR THIS GRANT THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENTS ARE AWARDED FUNDS (WITH ACTIVITIES LISTED).CAPITAL SUB-RECIPIENT #1 SERTOMA CENTER FOR THE PURCHASE OF UP TO FOUR (4) ACCESSIBLE VANS FOR FLEET EXPANSION TO COVER A RECENT INCREASE IN SERVICES. SERTOMA CENTER IS A NON-PROFIT AGENCY THAT SERVES KNOXVILLE URBAN AREA ADULTS WITH INTELLECTUAL DISABILITIES THROUGH THE HIGHEST QUALITY OF RESIDENTIAL VOCATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICES THAT EMPOWER THE PERSONS SERVED TO REACH THEIR FULLEST POTENTIAL. CAPITAL SUB-RECIPIENT #2 EMORY VALLEY CENTER FOR THE PURCHASE OF UP TO FOUR (4) ACCESSIBLE VANS FOR FLEET EXPANSION TO COVER A RECENT INCREASE IN SERVICES. THE EMORY VALLEY CENTER IS A NON-PROFIT AGENCY SUPPORTING ADULTS WITH INTELLECTUAL DEVELOPMENTAL AND PHYSICAL DISABILITIES. CAPITAL SUB-RECIPIENT #3 - ARC KNOX COUNTY - SUNSHINE INDUSTRIES FOR THE PURCHASE OF ONE (1) VAN FOR FLEET EXPANSION TO COVER A RECENT INCREASE IN SERVICES AND THE PURCHASE OF ONE (1) NON-ACCESSIBLE 14 PASSENGER VAN AS A REPLACEMENT. SUNSHINE INDUSTRIES IS A NON-PROFIT THAT PROVIDES VOCATIONAL TRAINING FOR INTELLECTUAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL DELAYED INDIVIDUALS WHO NEED TO IMPROVE THEIR WORK SKILLS IN PREPARATION FOR COMMUNITY EMPLOYMENT. CAPITAL SUB-RECIPIENT #4 KNOX COUNTY CAC TRANSIT (CAC) FOR THE PURCHASE OF ONE (1) ACCESSIBLE MINI-BUS (UNDER 30 FT.) TO REPLACE ONE THAT HAS MET ITS USEFUL LIFE. THE CRRSSA FUNDING IS SUPPLEMENTAL FUNDING TO PROVIDE SERVICES ABOVE-AND-BEYOND WHAT THE ANNUAL ALLOCATION PROVIDES.OMB 5 ELEMENTS NARRATIVES1). PURPOSE OF AWARD: THE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD IS TO PROVIDE RELIEF FUNDING TO THE SUB-RECIPIENTS IN THE KNOXVILLE URBANIZED AREA. ALL THREE OF THESE AGENCIES ARE LONG-TERM SECTION 5310 FUNDING SUB-RECIPIENTS OF THE KNOXVILLE REGIONAL TPO/MPC AND ARE IN GOOD STANDING WITH THE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT PLAN. THE SUB-RECIPIENTS ARE: (#1) KNOXVILLE KNOX COUNTY CAC VOLUNTEER ASSISTED TRANSPORTATION (VAT) PROGRAM (#2) BLOUNT COUNTY COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY (CAA) SMILES PROGRAM (VOLUNTEER DRIVER) AND (#3) THE EAST TENNESSEE HUMAN RESOURCE AGENCY (ETHRA) A PUBLIC TRANSIT PROVIDER OF DEMAND-RESPONSE TRANSPORTATION IN THE OUTER PORTIONS OF THE URBANIZED AREA.MORE DETAILS ARE AS FOLLOWS.THE KNOXVILLE KNOX COUNTY CAC VAT PROGRAM IS A VOLUNTEER ASSISTED DRIVER PROGRAM IN WHICH VOLUNTEERS ARE RECRUITED TO HELP PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION FOR SENIORS AND/OR PERSONS WHO ARE DISABLED. THE CAC VAT PROGRAM PRIMARILY SERVES KNOX COUNTY TENNESSEE. THE CAC VAT PROGRAM HELPS PROVIDE SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES ACCESS TO TRANSPORTATION FOR MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS GROCERY SHOPPING OTHER ESSENTIAL ERRANDS AND SOCIAL OUTINGS. MANY OF THE RIDERS SERVED HAVE NO OTHER WAY TO TAKE THESE TRIPS IF IT WERE NOT FOR THE CAC VAT PROGRAM. THE CAC VAT PROGRAM WAS IMPACTED BY COVID-19 RESULTING IN REDUCED RIDERSHIP AND A LOSS OF VOLUNTEER DRIVERS. TO HELP BOLSTER THE PROGRAM AND RETURN IT TO PRE-COVID SERVICE LEVELS THIS GRANT WILL ASSIST IN FUNDING ONE FULL-TIME AND TWO PART-TIME STAFF PERSONS FOR APPROXIMATELY 12 MONTHS. DURING COVID-19 MANY OF THE VOLUNTEER DRIVERS WHO ARE OFTEN RETIRED SENIORS THEMSELVES WERE NOT COMFORTABLE PROVIDING THE ONE-ON-ONE AUTOMOBILE TRIPS. CAC VAT EMPLOYEES OFTEN ACT AS BACK-UP DRIVERS WHEN A VOLUNTEER DRIVER SCHEDULED CANCELS OR NONE ARE AVAILABLE FOR A CRITICAL TRIP. THESE TEMPORARY EMPLOYEES WILL ALLOW FULL-TIME CAC VAT EMPLOYEES TO CONCENTRATE ON ADMINISTERING THE OVERALL PROGRAM AND CONDUCTING VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT. THE FUNDING WILL PROVIDE SALARIES FRINGE SUPPLIES TRAINING FUEL AND OTHER EXPENSES. THE CAC VAT PROGRAM PROVIDES AGENCY OWNED VEHICLES FOR THE VOLUNTEER DRIVER TO USE. AGENCY OWNED VEHICLES HELPS THE CAC VAT PROGRAM MAINTAIN QUALITY CONTROL BY MAKING SURE THEY ARE CLEAN MAINTAINED AND INSURED.THE BLOUNT COUNTY CAA SMILES PROGRAM SERVES BLOUNT COUNTY TENNESSEE PROVIDING VOLUNTEER-DRIVEN SENIOR-FRIENDLY TRIPS TO NON-DRIVERS OVER AGE 60. SMILES IS ONE OF ONLY TWO TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS IN BLOUNT COUNTY AND WAS SPECIFICALLY DEVELOPED TO ASSIST THE SENIOR POPULATION. DUE TO COVID-19 THE SMILES PROGRAM HAD TO BE COMPLETELY SHUT DOWN FROM MID-MARCH TO MID-JUNE OF 2020 AND RAN AT REDUCED SERVICE THROUGHOUT. SINCE REOPENING MANY DRIVERS WHO ARE SENIORS THEMSELVES HAVE REMAINED CAUTIOUS ABOUT RETURNING TO GIVE RIDES. THUS SMILES HAS THE LARGEST WAITING LIST OF ITS HISTORY SINCE THERE ARE A LIMITED NUMBER OF DRIVERS THAT ARE CURRENTLY ACTIVE. AS BUSINESSES HAVE OPENED UP SMILES SENIORS HAVE BECOME ANXIOUS TO TRAVEL AGAIN. IT IS A CHALLENGE TO FILL ALL THE RIDER REQUESTS WITH THE CURRENT NUMBER OF ACTIVE DRIVERS AND STAFF. ALSO DUE TO COVID-19 SMILES WAS UNABLE TO HOLD SEVERAL OF ITS COMMUNITY FUND RAISERS LOSING IMPORTANT FUNDING. THIS CRRSSA STIMULUS FUNDING WILL HELP SMILES IN SEVERAL WAYS. SMILES STAFF CAN SPEND TIME RE-RECRUITING PAST VOLUNTEER DRIVERS WHO NO LONGER ARE PROVIDING TRIPS DUE TO BEING FEARFUL OF BEING IN CLOSE PROXIMITY TO RIDERS. SMILES CAN ALSO CONCENTRATE ON RECRUITING NEW VOLUNTEERS TO HELP EXPEND THE POOL OF DRIVERS. VOLUNTEER DRIVERS ARE THE LIFE BLOOD OF ANY VOLUNTEER DRIVER PROGRAM. AND SOME CURRENT VOLUNTEERS WHO ARE NOT READY TO PROVIDE ONE-ON-ONE AUTOMOBILE TRIPS ARE STILL WILLING TO ASSIST CLIENTS WITH VITAL ERRANDS SUCH AS GROCERY SHOPPING OR PRESCRIPTION PICK-UPS. WITH THE CRRSSA FUNDS BEING REQUESTED A PART-TIME STAFF MEMBER WILL BE ADDED AS A BACKUP DRIVER WITH THE ABILITY TO ALSO PERFORM VARIOUS OFFICE AND OUTREACH DUTIES. THE ADDITIONAL STAFF PERSON WILL HELP SMILES REDUCE THE NUMBER OF PEOPLE ON THE WAITING LIST. AND THE PART-TIME PERSON CAN ALSO ASSIST WITH VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT. THE INFUSION OF FUNDING CAN HELP THE FULL-TIME STAFF FOCUS ON ADMINISTERING THE PROGRAM AND VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT WHICH WILL INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF SMILES AND MEET THE NEED FOR THE GROWING DEMAND FOR SENIOR-FRIENDLY TRANSPORTATION. ETHRA PROVIDES DEMAND-RESPONSE TRANSPORTATION IN THE KNOXVILLE URBAN AREA WITH A FOCUS ON THE OUTER COUNTIES WELL OUTSIDE THE LOCAL PUBLIC TRANSIT FIXED-ROUTE SYSTEM. THIS STIMULUS FUNDING WILL HELP PROVIDE ADDITIONAL TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR SENIORS AND/OR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE OUTER URBANIZED AREA SERVING THE COUNTIES OF ANDERSON BLOUNT KNOX LOUDON AND SEVIER. DURING THE EARLY STAGES OF COVID-19 ETHRA RIDERSHIP DROPPED BY 50% RESULTING IN LOSS OF FARE REVENUES THIRD PARTY CONTRACT REVENUES AND FUTURE GAS TAX REVENUES. IN ADDITION ETHRA ALSO EXPERIENCED UNEXPECTED HIGHER COSTS DUE TO: PURCHASES OF ADDITIONAL PERSONAL PROBATIVE EQUIPMENT (PPE) INCREASES IN CLEANING AND DISINFECTING OF VEHICLES ABSENCES OF STAFF DUE TO COVID-19 CONTACT TRACING LIMITED VEHICLE CAPACITY DUE TO PHYSICAL DISTANCING AND SOME DISPLACEMENT OF WORK LOCATIONS AND BUSINESS CLOSINGS DURING THE PANDEMIC.2). ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES WILL BE PERFORMED.KNOXVILLE KNOX COUNTY CAC VAT PROGRAM WITH THE CRRSSA FUNDS REQUESTED THREE TEMPORARY EMPLOYEES WILL BE HIRED TO HELP THE PROGRAM IN A VARIETY OF WAYS. THE MAIN FOCUS WILL BE PROVIDING TRIPS TO HELP MEET THE HIGH-LEVEL OF SERVICE REQUESTS ALLOWING THE FULL-TIME STAFF TO CONCENTRATE ON ADMINISTERING THE OVERALL PROGRAM AND BOOSTING VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT. VOLUNTEER DRIVERS ARE THE LIFE BLOOD TO ANY VOLUNTEER ASSISTED DRIVER PROGRAM. HOWEVER WHEN NOT PROVIDING TRIPS THE TEMPORARY STAFF CAN HELP WITH CLEANING AND MAINTAINING THE AGENCY OWNED VEHICLES TRAINING INFORMATION DISSEMINATION AND VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT. THE FUNDING ALSO HELPS PROVIDE SUPPLIES TRAINING FUEL AND OTHER EXPENSES. AS NOTED THE CAC VAT PROGRAM PROVIDES AGENCY OWNED CARS FOR THE VOLUNTEERS TO USE (INSTEAD OF THEIR OWN) AND THEREFORE THE PROGRAM PURCHASES FUEL FOR THOSE AUTOMOBILES.BLOUNT COUNTY CAA SMILES PROGRAM - WITH THE CRRSSA FUNDS BEING REQUESTED A PART-TIME STAFF MEMBER WILL BE ADDED AS A BACKUP DRIVER WITH THE ABILITY TO ALSO PERFORM VARIOUS OFFICE AND OUTREACH DUTIES. THE ADDITIONAL STAFF PERSON WILL ALLOW SMILES TO REDUCE THE NUMBER OF PEOPLE ON THE WAITING LIST. THE PART-TIME PERSON CAN ALSO ASSIST WITH VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT. AND BY TAKING PRESSURE OFF OF THE FULL-TIME STAFF THEY CAN FOCUS MORE ON ADMINISTERING THE OVERALL PROGRAM AND VOLUNTEER DRIVER RECRUITMENT. VOLUNTEER DRIVERS ARE THE LIFE BLOOD OF ANY VOLUNTEER ASSISTED DRIVER PROGRAM. THE INFUSION OF FUNDING CAN HELP INCREASE CAPACITY OF SMILES AND MEET THE NEED FOR THE GROWING DEMAND FOR SENIOR-FRIENDLY TRANSPORTATION. ETHRA WITH THE CRRSSA FUNDS REQUESTED ETHRA WILL PROVIDE ADDITIONAL DEMAND RESPONSE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR SENIORS AND/OR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHO LIVE IN THE OUTER PORTIONS OF THE KNOXVILLE URBANIZED AREA. IN THESE AREAS THERE ARE VERY LITTLE OTHER TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS. IN ADDITION THE FUNDING WILL HELP OFFSET THE UNEXPECTED HIGHER COSTS OF: PURCHASING PERSONAL PROBATIVE EQUIPMENT (PPE) ADDITIONAL VEHICLE CLEANING AND DISINFECTING ABSENCES OF STAFF DUE TO COVID-19 AND LIMITED VEHICLE CAPACITY DUE TO PHYSICAL DISTANCING.3). EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES ARE EXPECTED:KNOXVILLE KNOX COUNTY CAC VAT PROGRAM IN TOTAL THE CAC VAT PROGRAM WAS AWARDED $141350 FROM THE CRRSSA AND ARP KNOXVILLE URBAN AREA FUNDING. ANOTHER TANGENTIAL BENEFIT IS 60 HOMEBOUND SENIORS WILL RECEIVE VITAL GROCERIES FROM VOLUNTEER DRIVERS HELPING TO ADDRESS FOOD INSECURITIES. THESE VOLUNTEER DIVERS ARE WILLING TO RETURN TO THE PROGRAM IN A PARTIAL WAY IN THAT THEY WILL HELP WITH ERRANDS BUT THEY ARE NOT READY TO TRANSPORT CLIENTS ONE-ON-ONE IN AN AUTOMOBILE.ETHRA THE CRRSSA FUNDS WILL HELP PROVIDE ADDITIONAL DEMAND-RESPONSE TRANSPORTATION OVER AN APPROXIMATE 12-MONTH PERIOD. THE KNOXVILLE KNOX COUNTY CAC VAT PROGRAM WAS AWARDED A TOTAL OF $141350 TO BE DIVIDED BY $101991 FROM ARP AND $39359 FROM CRRSSA (WHICH IS IN A SEPARATE GRANT). ALSO AT THE SAME TIME OF BOTH THE CRRSSA AND ARP GRANT SUBMITTALS THE TPO/MPC HAS AWARDED ITS REGULAR ANNUAL FFY2020 AND FFY2021 SECTION 5310 FUNDING. THE KNOXVILLE KNOX COUNTY CAC VAT PROGRAM IS RECEIVING GRANT FUNDS FROM ARP AND CRRSSA AND THE REGULAR ANNUAL 5310 URBAN AREA FUNDS. THE ARP AND CRRSSA AWARDS ARE SUPPLEMENTAL WORK (ABOVE-AND-BEYOND) TO THE REGULAR ANNUAL SECTION 5310 FUNDED PROJECTS AND ARE NOT DUPLICATIVE.SUB-RECIPIENT: KNOXVILLE KNOX COUNTY CAC VAT PROGRAM IS RECEIVING ALL OF THE KNOXVILLE URBAN AREAS ARP FUNDING (IN THIS GRANT 6770-2022-1) AND A PARTIAL AMOUNT OF FUNDING FROM THE CRRSSA GRANT (6779-2022-1). CAC VAT IS ALSO RECEIVING THEIR NORMAL OPERATING FUNDING FROM THE ANNUAL SECTION 5310 FUNDING (6779-2020-1) WHICH AWARDS BOTH THE URBAN AREAS FFY2020 AND FFY2021 FUNDS. CAC VAT HAS BEEN A LONG TIME RECIPIENT OF THE KNOXVILLE URBAN AREAS SECTION 5310 FUNDING AND IS IN GOOD STANDING WITH THE TPO/MPCS PROGRAM MANAGEMENT PLAN. THE ARP AND CRRSSA FUNDING IS SUPPLEMENTAL FUNDING TO PROVIDE SERVICES ABOVE-AND-BEYOND WHAT THE ANNUAL ALLOCATION PROVIDES. THESE GRANTS ARE NOT DUPLICATIVE AND FUND DIFFERENT WORK.OMB 5 ELEMENTS NARRATIVES1). PURPOSE OF AWARD: THE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD IS TO PROVIDE RELIEF FUNDING TO THE KNOXVILLE KNOX COUNTY CAC VOLUNTEER ASSISTED TRANSPORTATION (VAT) PROGRAM. THE CAC VAT PROGRAM IS A VOLUNTEER ASSISTED DRIVER PROGRAM IN WHICH VOLUNTEERS ARE RECRUITED TO HELP PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION FOR SENIORS AND/OR PERSONS WHO ARE DISABLED. THE DRIVER STAYS WITH THE PASSENGER THEIR ENTIRE TRIP. THE PASSENGER MUST NEED ASSISTANCE FROM THE DRIVER. IF A PASSENGER CAN USE REGULAR TRANSIT THEY MUST. THE CAC VAT PROGRAM HAS BEEN A LONG-TERM RECIPIENT OF SECTION 5310 FUNDING FROM THE TPO/MPC. THE MISSION OF THE CAC VAT PROGRAM IS TO PROVIDE AFFORDABLE ACCESSIBLE TRANSPORTATION TO KNOX COUNTY RESIDENTS WHO HAVE BARRIERS TO INDEPENDENT TRAVEL AND REQUIRE SOME SORT OF ASSISTANCE IN ORDER TO TRAVEL SAFELY. THE CAC VAT PROGRAM ASSISTS SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES BY HELPING THEM ACCESS TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS GROCERY SHOPPING OTHER ESSENTIAL ERRANDS AND SOCIAL OUTINGS. MANY OF THE RIDERS HAVE NO OTHER WAY TO ACCESS THESE TRIPS IF IT WERE NOT FOR THE CAC VAT PROGRAM. THE CAC VAT PROGRAM HELPS ALLEVIATE SOCIAL ISOLATION AND ALSO HELPS KEEP THE RIDER HEALTHIER AND ACHIEVE A BETTER QUALITY OF LIFE AND LIVE A MORE INDEPENDENT LIFESTYLE.THE CAC VAT PROGRAM WAS IMPACTED BY COVID-19 RESULTING IN REDUCED RIDERSHIP AND A LOSS OF VOLUNTEER DRIVERS. TO HELP BOLSTER THE PROGRAM AND RETURN IT TO PRE-COVID SERVICE LEVELS THIS GRANT WILL ASSIST IN FUNDING ONE FULL-TIME AND TWO PART-TIME STAFF PERSONS FOR APPROXIMATELY 12 MONTHS. DURING COVID-19 MANY OF THE VOLUNTEER DRIVERS WHO ARE OFTEN RETIRED SENIORS THEMSELVES WERE NOT COMFORTABLE PROVIDING THE ONE-ON-ONE AUTOMOBILE TRIPS. CAC VAT EMPLOYEES OFTEN ACT AS BACK-UP DRIVERS WHEN A VOLUNTEER DRIVER SCHEDULED CANCELS OR NONE ARE AVAILABLE FOR A CRITICAL TRIP. THESE TEMPORARY EMPLOYEES WILL ALLOW FULL-TIME VAT EMPLOYEES TO CONCENTRATE ON ADMINISTERING THE OVERALL PROGRAM WITH A FOCUS ON VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT. THE FUNDING WILL PROVIDE SALARIES FRINGE SUPPLIES TRAINING FUEL AND OTHER EXPENSES. THE CAC VAT PROGRAM PROVIDES AGENCY OWNED VEHICLES FOR THE VOLUNTEER DRIVER TO USE. AGENCY OWNED VEHICLES HELPS THE CAC VAT PROGRAM MAINTAIN QUALITY CONTROL BY MAKING SURE THEY ARE CLEAN MAINTAINED AND INSURED.2). ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: WITH THE ARP FUNDS REQUESTED THREE TEMPORARY EMPLOYEES WILL HELP THE PROGRAM IN A VARIETY OF WAYS. THE MAIN FOCUS WILL BE PROVIDING TRIPS TO HELP MEET THE HIGH-LEVEL OF SERVICE REQUESTS WHILE THE FULL-TIME STAFF CAN CONCENTRATE ON VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT. VOLUNTEERS ARE THE LIFE BLOOD OF THE CAC VAT PROGRAM. HOWEVER WHEN NOT PROVIDING TRIPS THE TEMPORARY STAFF CAN HELP WITH CLEANING AND MAINTAINING THE AGENCY OWNED VEHICLES TRAINING INFORMATION DISSEMINATION AND VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT. THE FUNDING ALSO HELPS PROVIDE SUPPLIES TRAINING FUEL AND OTHER EXPENSES. AS NOTED THE CAC VAT PROGRAM PROVIDES AGENCY OWNED CARS FOR THE VOLUNTEERS TO USE (INSTEAD OF THEIR OWN) AND THEREFORE THE PROGRAM PURCHASES FUEL FOR THE AUTOMOBILES.3). EXPECTED OUTCOMES: IN TOTAL THE CAC VAT PROGRAM WAS AWARDED $141350 FROM THE ARP AND CRSSA FUNDING. THIS ARP GRANT IS FOR $101991 (72.2%) AND $39359 (27.8%) WILL COME FROM A COMPANION CRRSSA GRANT. THE TOTAL CAC VAT APPLICATION TO THE TPO/MPC FOR THIS PROJECT STATED IT WILL HELP PROVIDE 160 ADDITIONAL MONTHLY TRIPS TO AN ADDITIONAL 40 RIDERS. SO WHEN PRORATED BY THE PERCENTAGES THIS EXACT ARP FUNDING WILL PROVIDE 116 ADDITIONAL MONTHLY TRIPS TO AN ADDITIONAL 29 RIDERS. BY HAVING THE ADDITIONAL WORKERS THE MAIN STAFF CAN CONCENTRATE ON VOLUNTEER DRIVER RECRUITMENT. IT IS A GOAL THAT CAC VAT WILL BE ABLE TO RECRUIT AN ADDITIONAL 40 VOLUNTEERS (PRORATED FOR THIS ARP GRANT TO 29) THROUGHOUT THIS GRANT. 4). INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SENIORS AND/OR PERSONS WHO ARE DISABLED IN THE KNOXVILLE TENNESSEE UZA.5). SUB-RECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: 100% OF THIS FUNDING WILL BE DISTRIBUTED (BY SUB-AWARD) TO THE KNOXVILLE KNOX COUNTY CAC VOLUNTEER ASSISTED TRANSPORTATION (VAT) PROGRAM LOCATED AT 2247 WESTERN AVENUE KNOXVILLE TN 37921. THE CAC VAT PROGRAM IS A LONG-TERM SECTION 5310 SUB-RECIPIENT OF THE TPO/MPC AND IS IN GOOD STANDING WITH THE OVERALL PROGRAM MANAGEMENT PLAN REQUIREMENTS.

THIS APPLICATION OBLIGATES A TOTAL OF $435233 IN SECTION 5310 FUNDS COMPOSED OF THE REMAINING $39112 IN LAPSING FFY 2020 FUNDS AND $396121 IN FFY2021 FUNDS (A PORTION OF THE FULL APPORTIONMENT). APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE THE SDDOT AND ITS SMALL URBAN SUBRECIPIENTS CAPITAL FUNDING AND OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS. THIS APPLICATION OBLIGATES $332660 IN LAPSING FFY 2020 SECTION 5310 SMALL URBAN FORMULA FUNDS. SDDOT COMMITS TO MEETING THE 55% REQUIREMENT FOR TRADITIONAL SERVICES WITH THE FUTURE AMENDMENT TO OBLIGATE THE REMAINING FY 2020 FUNDS.(SPECIFICALLY THE BALANCE OF $39112 OF FFY2020 FUNDS WILL REMAIN TO BE OBLIGATED WITH $30622 OF THIS AMOUNT REQUIRED TO BE DEVOTED TO TRADITIONAL ACTIVITIES.)FFY20 (LAPSING)$196572 CAPITAL VEHICLE PURCHASES -TRADITIONAL $136088 OPERATING ASSISTANCE$332660 TOTAL; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS DRIVER SALARIES FUEL AND ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR IN ORDER TO CONTINUE SERVICE FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS. FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED FOR THE PURCHASE OF THREE TRANSIT VEHICLES. (THE TWO REPLACEMENT VEHICLES ARE ALSO RECEIVING FROM SD-2020-018.); EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT SDDOT AND ITS SMALL URBAN SUBRECIPIENTS TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SERVICE FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS IN SOUTH DAKOTA SMALL URBAN AREAS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: PROJECT 1: THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENTS WILL RECEIVE VEHICLES UNDER THIS GRANT AMENDMENT: RCPT AND BLACK HILLS WORKS.PROJECT 2: THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENTS WILL RECEIVE OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO MAINTAIN SERVICES: RCPT AND AVERA MCKENNAN.

PURPOSE OF THE AWARD: THIS FFY 2021 SECTION 5310 ARP APPLICATION OBLIGATES THE FULL AMOUNT OF THE $71676 OF THE SMALL URBAN FUNDS APPORTIONED FOR THE STATE. AS ALLOWABLE FOR ARP APPLICATIONS THE FEDERAL SHARE FOR THIS APPLICATION IS 100 PERCENT AND NO LOCAL MATCH IS REQUIRED. THE ALLOWABLE TEN PERCENT OF THE FULL APPORTIONMENT WILL BE USED FOR ADMINISTERING THE PROGRAM.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE ARP FUNDING WILL BE USED BY ELIGIBLE SUBRECIPIENTS IN THE RAPID CITY AND SIOUX FALLS SMALL URBAN COMMUNITIES (AS IDENTIFIED IN THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS ATTACHED) TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS. THE SCOPE OF WORK INCLUDES FUNDS FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE STATE ADMINISTRATION AND PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT. THE AMOUNT INCLUDED IN THIS APPLICATION IS THE FULL APPORTIONMENT FOR SOUTH DAKOTA SMALL URBAN AREAS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS AWARD WILL ASSIST IN FUNDING OPERATING COSTS FOR TRANSIT AGENCIES DURING FY2022 TO ASSIST IN RECOVERING FROM COVID-19. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE TRANSIT PATRONS AND EMPLOYEES OF THE VARIOUS TRANSIT AGENCIES IN THE URBAN AREAS OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS AWARD. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THIS GRANT WILL FUND ELIGIBLE ACTIVITIES FOR THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENTS: RIVER CITIES PUBLIC TRANSIT BLACK HILLS WORKS AND PRAIRIE HILLS TRANSIT. OTHER: THIS APPLICATION REQUESTS PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY AS OF NOVEMBER 1 2021 FOR THE FULL AMOUNT FOR FUNDING OPERATIONS AS IS ALLOWABLE UNDER ARP. PLEASE NOTE: THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE FOR THIS APPLICATION OVERLAPS TO THAT FOR THE CORRESPONDING CRRSAA 5310 APPLICATION. THIS IS NEEDED AS NEITHER APPLICATION IS SUFFICIENT TO COVER ALL THE EXPENSES FOR THE PERIOD.THE RECIPIENT AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION IS ATTACHED INCLUDING THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS (POP). PER THE ARP THE PROJECTS IN THIS APPLICATION ARE NOT REQUIRED TO BE PROGRAMMED IN THE LONG-RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLAN STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION PLAN OR STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM. THIS APPLICATION IS CONSISTENT WITH THE STATEWIDE COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES PLAN.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE SOUTH CAROLINA AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR THE ELDERLY AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AFTER THE OUTBREAK OF THE CORONAVIRUS PANDEMIC RETROACTIVE TO JANUARY 20 2020.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER OPERATING EXPENSE SUCH AS DRIVERS SALARIES FUEL AND PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE IN ORDER TO CONTINUE SERVICE FOR THE SUBRECIPIENTS AND THEIR CLIENTS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THESE FUNDS WILL OFFSET ANY SHORTAGE OF FUNDS AND STAFF THE AGENCY WAS/IS FACING SINCE THE START OF THE CORONAVIRUS PANDEMIC. THIS GRANT WILL ADDRESS THE TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS SHORTFALL DURING THESE TRYING TIMES OF THE COVID PANDEMIC AND ASSIST IN SUSTAINABLE MOBILITY FOR THOSE INDIVIDUALS WHO WHERE IN CARE OF THE AGENCY IT WILL HELP THE SUBRECIPIENT MAINTAIN THEIR AGENCYS SUSTAINABILITY.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: EXPECTED BENEFICIARIES: ASSIST WITH HUMAN SERVICES AGENCIES THAT PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND THE ELDERLY IN THE SMALL URBAN AREAS OF SOUTH CAROLINA.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: SUBRECIPIENTS ACTIVITIES: SENIOR SOLUTIONS WILL USE FUNDS FOR OPERATION/PAYROLL ASSISTANCE.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE THE SCDOT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS CAPITAL FUNDING TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS IN THE SMALL URBAN AREAS OF THE STATE.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE CAPITAL PROJECTS SUCH AS ONE (1) REPLACEMENT PURPOSE-BUILT VEHICLES TWO (2) EXPANSION PURPOSE-BUILT VEHICLE AND TWO (2) CUTAWAY EXPANSION VEHICLES FOR THE ELDERLY AND DISABLED IN THE STATE.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL ALLOW SCDOT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICE FOR THE ELDERLY AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: BENEFICIARIES: INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND THE ELDERLY IN THE SMALL URBAN AREAS OF SOUTH CAROLINA.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: SUBRECIPIENTS ACTIVITIES: THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENTS WILL RECEIVE CAPITAL ASSISTANCE FOR CAPITAL ASSISTANCE FOR VEHICLE PURCHASES SENIOR SOLUTIONS FLORENCE COUNTY DSNB SUMTER COUNTY DSNB AND YORK COUNTY DSNB. STATE ADMINISTRATION FUNDS ($143372) ARE ALSO BEING REQUESTED. SCDOT WILL NOT BE UTILIZING THE 100% FEDERAL OPTION FOR THIS APPLICATION. LOCAL MATCH WILL BE APPLIED. WE HAVE MET THE 55-45% REQUIREMENT FOR THIS GRANT. AFTER THE 10% OF THE APPORTIONMENT WAS SET ASIDE FOR STATE ADMINISTRATION COST WE HAVE MET 100% PERCENT OF THE TRADITIONAL PROJECTS AS NO NON-TRADITIONAL PROJECTS WERE REQUESTED (STATE ADMINISTRATION - 10%; TRADITIONAL PROJECTS 90%; NON-TRADITIONAL - 0%). NO FUNDS ARE BEING SPENT ON NEW FREEDOM PROJECTS. 100 PERCENT OF THE 5310 FUNDS ARE ALLOCATED TO TRADITIONAL 5310 PROJECTS: ONE (1) REPLACEMENT PURPOSE-BUILT VEHICLES TWO (2) EXPANSION PURPOSE-BUILT VEHICLE AND TWO (2) CUTAWAY EXPANSION VEHICLES.

HAVING WELL MAINTAINED RELIABLE TRANSIT INFRASTRUCTURE WILL HELP ENSURE SAFE DEPENDABLE AND ACCESSIBLE SERVICES A PERMITTING WORKERS TO GET TO WORK AND FURTHER ECONOMIC PRODUCTIVITY IN THE COMMUNITY.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: ACTIVITIES ENCOMPASS OPERATING ASSISTANCE AND VEHICLE EXPANSION OR VEHICLE REPLACEMENT PROJECTS TO NAMED SRS IN THIS APPLICATION.ALL PROJECTS ARE PRESENTED IN THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS (POP). THE FEDERAL EXPENDITURE ON TRADITIONAL SECTION 5310 PROJECTS IS $479482. ALL PROJECTS FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE TOTALING $28767 IN FEDERAL ASSISTANCE COMPRISE THE NON-TRADITIONAL SECTION 5310 PROJECTS. THIS WELL EXCEEDS THE MINIMUM REQUIREMENT FOR TRADITIONAL PROJECTS AT 92%.THIS APPLICATION DOES NOT INCLUDE FUNDS FOR RESEARCH AND/OR DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES.BCDCOG IS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT OF FTA SECTION 5310 FUNDING. PURPOSE: THIS IS AN APPLICATION FOR FFY 2021 SECTION 5310 SUPPLEMENTAL AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN ACT OF 2021 (ARP) APPORTIONMENT IN THE AMOUNT OF $86435. PER THE ARP ACT THE GRANT REQUESTS 100% FEDERAL SHARE. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE APPLICATION SCOPE OF WORK CONSISTS OF THE ACQUISITION OF CAPITAL ITEMS. ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS APPLICATION ENCOMPASS THE ACQUISITION OF AIR FILTRATION APPARATUS AND ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT TO REDUCE TRANSMISSION OF RESPIRATORY ILLNESS SUCH AS THOSE CAUSED BY THE NOVEL CORONAVIRUS (COVID-19). EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT CARTA TRANSIT SYSTEM TO CONTINUE TO OPERATE WITH THE HIGHEST SAFETY MEASURES AS WE CONTINUE TO RESPOND TO THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: CARTA TRANSIT SYSTEM AND ITS CUSTOMERS THAT RELY ON TRANSIT SERVICE WILL BENEFIT FROM CONTINUED SERVICES PERMITTING WORKERS TO GET TO WORK AND FURTHER ECONOMIC PRODUCTIVITY IN THE COMMUNITY.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONECARTA UNDERSTANDS THAT THE EXPENSES REQUESTED IN THIS APPLICATION ARE SUBJECT TO REVIEW AS PART OF THE AGENCYS NEXT TRIENNIAL/STATE MANAGEMENT REVIEW.CARTA CERTIFIES THAT EXPENSES WERE INCURRED FOR OPERATIONS AT THE TIME OF THE EVENT AND FOR TRANSIT-RELATED PURPOSES. THE RECIPIENT CERTIFIES THAT IT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS AND CONTRACTORS THAT ARE PROVIDERS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION HAVE NOT FURLOUGHED ANY EMPLOYEES SINCE MARCH 27 2020 (THE ENACTMENT DATE OF THE CARES ACT).CARTA CONFIRMS THAT THE PROJECT IS CONSISTENT WITH THE BCDCOGS COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN FOR THE REGION.THE TOTAL FEDERAL FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE CHARLESTON-NORTH CHARLESTON UZA IS $86435 AS PRESENTED IN THIS APPLICATION. THE SPLIT LETTER DATED 09/17/2021 IS ATTACHED IN THIS APPLICATION.THIS APPLICATION DOES NOT INCLUDE FUNDS FOR RESEARCH AND/OR DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES.NO PROJECT IN THE APPLICATION WILL LEAD TO A FUNCTIONAL LOCATION OR CAPACITY CHANGE. PER THE ARP ACT PROJECTS IN THIS APPLICATION ARE NOT REQUIRED TO BE PROGRAMMED IN THE STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM.CARTA WILL FOLLOW ALL 3RD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F.CARTA WILL ENSURE CONTRACTORS PROCURED WILL NOT BE ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST.AN INSURANCE CLAIM TO COLLECT FUNDS HAS NOT BEEN FILED FOR ANY ITEM IN THIS APPLICATION AND INSURANCE PROCEEDS FROM DAMAGES HAVE NOT BEEN RECEIVED. INSURANCE FUNDS HAVE NOT BEEN APPLIED TO THE PROJECT. CARTA AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE RI TRAVEL TRAINING NETWORK CURRICULUM GRANTED THROUGH THE 2021 INNOVATIVE COORDINATED ACCESS AND MOBILITY DISCRETIONARY PROGRAM.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED UNDER THIS AWARD ARE: DEVELOPMENT OF RESOURCES FOR TRAVEL TRAINING PROGRAM INCLUDING THE CONSULTANT COSTS FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE TRAINING CURRICULUM AND THE DEVELOPMENT/PRODUCTION OF TRAINING RESOURCES (PRINTED MATERIALS AND VIDEOS).; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT RIPTA TO BRING PARTNERS TOGETHER TO OFFER CUSTOMIZED TRANSPORTATION SUPPORT TO THE STATES OLDER ADULTS INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND LOW-INCOME GROUPS. WORKING COLLABORATIVELY WITH A FACILITATOR STATE AGENCIES AND NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS WILL DEVELOP A NEW TRAINING CURRICULUM THAT WILL PROVIDE CUSTOMERS WITH INFORMATION ABOUT THE COMPLETE BREADTH OF TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AVAILABLE IN THEIR COMMUNITIES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: RIPTA AND PASSENGERS IN RHODE ISLAND SPECIFICALLY THE STATES OLDER ADULT POPULATION INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND LOW-INCOME GROUPS WILL BENEFIT FROM THE DEVELOPMENT OF THIS TRAINING NETWORK AND WILL LEAD TO INCREASED COMFORT IN USING RIPTAS TRANSIT SYSTEM FOR THESE RIDERS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE.

ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:-ACQUISITION OF SPECIAL VEHICLES FOR FOR ELDERLY PERSONS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES-PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE FOR 5310 FLEET-OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR 5310 PROGRAM-DRUG AND ALCOHOL TEST FOR 5310 PROGRAM - ACQUISITION OF SUPPORT EQUIPMENT (I.E.: P.A. SYSTEM GPS AUTOMATIC PASSENGER COUNTER) FOR 5310 PROGRAMEXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT WILL ALLOW TO MEET THE SPECIAL TRANSPORTATION NEEDS OF THESE CITIZENS IN AREAS WHERE THE SERVICES ARE INAPPROPRIATE INSUFFICIENT OR UNAVAILABLE. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ELDERLY INDIVIDUALS AND/OR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES. SUBRECIPIENTS ACTIVITIES: -ACQUISITION OF SPECIAL VEHICLES FOR FOR ELDERLY PERSONS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES-PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE FOR 5310 FLEET-OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR 5310 PROGRAM-DRUG AND ALCOHOL TEST FOR 5310 PROGRAM - ACQUISITION OF SUPPORT EQUIPMENT (I.E.: P.A. SYSTEM GPS AUTOMATIC PASSENGER COUNTER) FOR 5310 PROGRAMTHE OFFICE OF THE OMBUDSMAN FOR THE ELDERLY PERSONS AND THE OFFICE OF THE OMBUDSMAN FOR THE PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES MEETS PERIODICALLY WITH THE PRHTA TO EXCHANGE INFORMATION ABOUT THE AREAS THAT HAVE SPECIAL TRANSPORTATION NEEDS. THIS INFORMATION IS BENEFICIAL IN THE ESTABLISHMENT OF APPLICANTS/ EVALUATION COORDINATION PLAN. THE COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT-HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN (CPT-HSTP) WAS APPROVED BY PRMPO ON FEBRUARY 26-27 2020.-THE MINIMUM OF 55% OF THE 5310 APPORTIONMENTS IS DEDICATED TO THE TRADITIONAL 5310 ACTIVITIES. -ALL PROJECTS INCLUDED IN THIS APPLICATION HAVE BEEN DERIVED FROM A LOCALLY COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN.-PRHTA/SUBRECIPIENTS WILL ENSURE THAT ALL VEHICLES PURCHASED ARE ACCESSIBLE PURCHASED FROM AN FTA-APPROVED TVM AND REPORTED TO FTA WITHIN 30 DAYS AFTER THE CONTRACT IS SIGNED.-PRHTA/SUBRECIPIENTS WILL CHECK THE CURRENT LISTING OF TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURERS (TVM) (HTTPS://WWW.TRANSIT.DOT.GOV/REGULATIONS-AND-GUIDANCE/CIVIL-RIGHTS-ADA/ELIGIBLE-TVMS-LIST) TO ENSURE EACH IS LISTENING AS A CERTIFIED TVM IN COMPLIANCE WITH FTA REGULATIONS.- PRHTA/SUBRECIPIENTS WILL FOLLOW ALL 3RD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE).- PRHTA/SUBRECIPIENTS WILL ENSURE CONTRACTORS PROCURED WILL NOT BE ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST.PROJECTS SELECTION CRITERIA: THE PRHTA UTILIZES THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA FOR THE EVALUATION AND SELECTION OF APPLICANTS: 1. THIS APPLICATION IS FOR FY 2022 SECTION 5310 NON-URBANIZED AREA APPORTIONMENT FOR THE PRHTA IN THE TOTAL AMOUNT $106457. THE LOCAL SHARE WILL BE MATCH WITH TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT CREDITS (TDC). PURPOSETHIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR ELDERLY PERSONS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO MEET THE SPECIAL TRANSPORTATION NEEDS OF THESE CITIZENS IN AREAS WHERE THE SERVICES ARE INAPPROPRIATE INSUFFICIENT OR UNAVAILABLE. THE COVERED AREA FOR THESE MUNICIPALITIES INCREASED THE ELDERLY POPULATION AS A RESULT IT HAS BECOME MORE IMPORTANT TO EXPAND THESE SERVICES.SUBRICIPIENT ACTIVITIES- ACQUISITION OF VEHICLESNTENDED BENEFICIARIESTHE USERS WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PERFORMANCE ESPECIALLY OLDER CITIZENS AND HEALTH PATIENTS THAT RELY ON PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES. PRHTA IS THE FTA DESIGNATED RECIPIENT TO RECEIVE THE ALLOCATION OF FUNDS FOR SECTION 5310 AS THE STATE.THIS APPLICATION HAS AN INCREASE AS AN ADMINISTRATIVE AMENDMENT FOR THE INCREASE OF BUSES COST (SEE THE MOST RECENT QUOTATIONS RECEIVED IN OUR OFFICES). PRHTA MADE THE ADMINISTRATIVE DECISION OF INCREASE IN $12285 FOR EACH BUS. FOR A TOTAL AMOUNT OF $98280 OF INCREASE. THIS AMOUNT IS LESS THAN 25% PERMITTED BY OUR RULES AND OPERATING PROCEDURES OF PUERTO RICO METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATION TO BE USED IN ADMINISTRATIVE MODIFICATIONS.GRANT TOTAL: $ 2394704TDCS: $ 632561ACTIVITIES TOTAL COST: $ 2185938STATE ADMINISTRATION: $ 208766 CAPITAL PROJECTS: $ 1358983 NON-CAPITAL PROJECTS: $ 826955THE PURPOSE OF THIS APPLICATION IS TO PROVIDE SUBRECIPIENT OF THE URBANIZED AREA UNDER 200000 IN POPULATION (UZA) OF THE NECESSARY BUSES PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE FOR FLEET OTHER CAPITAL PROJECTS AND OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO IMPROVE MOBILITY FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO MEET THE SPECIAL TRANSPORTATION NEEDS OF THESE PERSONS IN AREAS WHERE THE SERVICES ARE INAPPROPRIATE INSUFFICIENT OR UNAVAILABLE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ALL ELIGIBLE OPERATING ASSISTANCE SUCH AS DRIVER SALARIES FUEL ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR (OCTOBER 1 2022 - SEPTEMBER 30 2023). SECTION 5310 FY 2017/FY 2018-AGUADILLA URBANIZED AREA (AUA)- APPORTIONED FOR THE ACQUISITION OF SPECIAL VEHICLES FOR ELDERLY AND PERSON WITH DISABILITIES PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE AND OPERATING ASSISTANCE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR ELDERLY PERSONS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO MEET THE SPECIAL TRANSPORTATION NEEDS OF THESE CITIZENS IN AREAS WHERE THE SERVICES ARE INAPPROPRIATE INSUFFICIENT OR UNVIABLE; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: EACH OF THESE PROJECTS ARE OPERATED BY A SUB GRANTEE AND SUPERVISED BY THE PUERTO RICO HIGHWAY AND TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY DISTRIBUTED AS FOLLOW:-ACQUISITION OF VEHICLES-OPERATING ASSISTANCE-PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: ACQUISITION OF BUS FOR EXPANSION TO EXPAND EXISTING TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND TO PROVIDE MORE OPTIONS THAT CAN MEET THE TRANSPORTATION NEEDS OF THE ELDERLY OR DISABLED POPULATION. THE COVERED AREA FOR THESE MUNICIPALITIES INCREASED THE ELDERLY POPULATION AS A RESULT IT HAS BECOME MORE IMPORTANT TO EXPAND THESE SERVICES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE MOBILITY FOR SENIOR AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES THROUGHOUT THE MUNICIPALITIES BY REMOVING BARRIERS TO TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND EXPANDING THE TRANSPORTATION MOBILITY OPTIONS AVAILABLE TO MAKE THE MOST EFFICIENT USE OF FEDERAL RESOURCES AIDING. THE USERS WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PERFORMANCE ESPECIALLY OLDER CITIZENS AND HEALTH PATIENTS THAT RELY ON PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES. THE BETTER PERFORMING ROUTE SERVICE WILL ALLOW FOR MORE PEOPLE INCLUDING WORKERS AND VISITORS TO RELY ON THIS SERVICE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: -ACQUISITION OF VEHICLES-OPERATING ASSISTANCE-PREVENTIVE MAINTENAN
FY 16 ACQUISITION OF SPECIAL VEHICLES FOR ELDERLY AND PERSON WITH DISABILITIES PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE AND OPERATING EXPENSES - SECTION 5310

THE PENNSYLVANIA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (PENNDOT) IS APPLYING FFY 2021 SECTION 5310 ARP FUNDS THE AMOUNT OF $2197872 REPRESENTING 100% FEDERAL SHARE OF THE TOTAL ELIGIBLE AMOUNT FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE. THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES ARP FUNDING TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS.OPERATING ASSISTANCE WILL BE UTILIZED FOR EXPENSES INCURRED FOR EXISTING SERVICES INCLUDING EXPENSES RELATED TO THE CORONAVIRUS BEGINNING 01/20/2020 UNTIL 12/31/2024. PENNDOT IS APPLYING FOR FUNDING IN RURAL SMALL URBAN AND LARGE URBAN AREAS IN PENNSYLVANIA AS FOLLOWS:RURAL AREAS: $2486415SMALL URBAN AREAS: $1203200ALLENTOWN: $666253HARRISBURG: $457313LANCASTER: $437016PHILADELPHIA: $3639135PITTSBURGH: $1904747READING: $281498SCRANTON: $448625YORK: $243084YOUNGSTOWN (MERCER): $106137THE ALLOCATION LETTERS FOR THE YOUNGSTOWN FUNDING IS ATTACHED IN THE APPLICATION DOCUMENTS. PROJECTS INCLUDE THE PURCHASE OF ONE HUNDRED THIRTY-SIX (136) ACCESSIBLE UNDER 30-FOOT REPLACEMENT BUSES THIRTY-FIVE (35) ACCESSIBLE REPLACEMENT VANS AND ONE (1) OPERATING PROJECT. THE FFY 2020 AND FFY 2021 SECTION 5310 POP FOR THE COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA IS ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION UNDER APPLICATION DOCUMENTS.THE TOTAL NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS FUNDED IN THE POP IS FORTY-TWO (42) SUBRECIPIENTS WHICH INCLUDE TWENTY (20) PUBLIC BODIES APPROVED BY THE STATE TO COORDINATE SERVICES FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. ALL 42 SUBRECIPIENTS WILL BE PROVIDING DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICE WITH THE NEW VEHICLES. THE PROJECTS IN THIS APPLICATION ARE INCLUDED IN THE COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT - HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLANS DEVELOPED BY VARIOUS PENNSYLVANIA PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT COUNCILS LOCATED THROUGHOUT THE COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA AND APPROVED BY PENNDOT. ALL THE PROJECTS LISTED IN THE POP ARE UNDER CATEGORY A. THE PROJECTS IN THIS GRANT MEET THE REQUIREMENT TO SPEND AT LEAST 55% ON TRADITIONAL CAPITAL PROJECTS.THE STATE MANAGEMENT PLAN FOR THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM WAS APPROVED BY FTA ON 12/29/2017 AND IS ATTACHED TO THIS GRANT UNDER APPLICATION DOCUMENTS. PLEASE NOTE THAT THE REVISED STATE MANAGEMENT PLAN THAT IS CURRENTLY BEING REVIEWED BY FTA REGION 3 IS ALSO ATTACHED.THE NON-FEDERAL SHARE WILL BE PROVIDED BY THE COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA AND/OR THE LOCAL GOVERNMENT.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE THE STATE OF PENNSYLVANIA AND ITS 5310 SUBRECIPIENTS FUNDING FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE AND ACCESSIBLE VEHICLES (CAPITAL). THE PROGRAM PURPOSE OF THIS FUNDING IS TO IMPROVE MOBILITY FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES BY REMOVING BARRIERS TO TRANSPORTATION SERVICE AND EXPANDING TRANSPORTATION MOBILITY OPTIONS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE FUNDS BEING REQUESTED UNDER THIS GRANT APPLICATION WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE OPERATING AND CAPITAL EXPENSES SUCH AS THE PURCHASE OF ACCESSIBLE ROLLING STOCK FOR PARATRANSIT OPERATIONS. THESE FUNDS ARE NEEDED SO THAT THE SUBRECIPIENTS CAN CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SAFE AND RELIABLE TRANSPORTATION AS WELL AS MAINTAIN THE VEHICLES IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: CONTINUED SAFE AND EFFECTIVE OPERATION OF TRANSIT SERVICES FOR ALL AREAS OF PENNSYLVANIA THAT PROVIDE PARATRANSIT SERVICES TO INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND SENIOR CITIZENS. REPLACE CAPITAL EQUIPMENT THAT HAS MET ITS USEFUL LIFE TO MAINTAIN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR AND SAFE AND ACCESSIBLE OPERATIONS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: PENNSYLVANIA STATE TRANSIT AGENCIES PRIVATE NON-PROFIT AGENCIES SENIOR CITIZENS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN ALL AREAS OF THE STATE (RURAL SMALL URBAN AND URBAN).SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE SUBRECIPIENTS LISTED IN THE ATTACHED POP WILL RECEIVE CAPITAL FUNDING FOR THE ACQUISITION OF ACCESSIBLE ROLLING STOCK TO MEET STATE OF GOOD REPAIR. THESE SUBRECIPIENTS WILL PROVIDE SAFE AND RELIABLE PARATRANSIT SERVICE TO INDIVIDUAL WITH DISABILITIES AND SENIOR CITIZENS THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF PENNSYLVANIA. ALSO ONE SUBRECIPIENT WILL RECEIVE OPERATING FUNDS TO PROVIDE PARATRANSIT SERVICE.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS GRANT APPLICATION INCLUDES $335180 IN FY 2021 SECTION 5310 ARP ACT FUNDS FOR SMALL URBANIZED AND RURAL AREAS IN OREGON. IT IS 100% FEDERALLY FUNDED TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS AND CONTINUE SUBSEQUENT ECONOMIC RECOVERY. THE EXPENSES TO BE REIMBURSED WILL BE INCURRED BY SUBRECIPIENTS DURING THE PERIOD OF JULY 1 2023 TO JUNE 30 2024.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: ARP FUNDS WILL HELP SUBRECIPIENTS RECOVER FROM THE PANDEMIC BY PROVIDING OPERATING ASSISTANCE. THIS INCLUDES DRIVER/WORKER COMPENSATION AND PANDEMIC-RELATED LEAVES FUEL MAINTENANCE PERSONAL SAFETY DEVICES SUPPLIES CLEANSERS AND ANY OTHER EXPENSES INCURRED SUPPORTING OPERATIONS AND RIDERSHIP. MARKETING WILL BE INCREASED TO HELP RECOVER RIDERSHIP LOST DUE TO THE PANDEMIC.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: ANY INFUSION OF CASH IS ALWAYS BENEFICIAL. THESE FUNDS WILL HELP SUBRECIPIENTS RECOVER FROM THE PANDEMIC NOT JUST ADDITIONAL FUNDS TO SUPPORT ROUTINE OPERATIONAL EXPENSES. THE PANDEMIC CAUSED REDUCED RIDERSHIP WHICH MEANT REDUCED FARES. THESE FUNDS CAN HELP TO RECOVER RIDERSHIP BY USING MARKETING AND PROMOTING THE TRANSIT SERVICES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS GRANT WILL SUPPORT THE SMALL URBANIZED AREAS WITHIN BENTON LINN DESCHUTES COLUMBIA JOSEPHINE UMATILLA AND JACKSON COUNTIES AND RURAL OREGON AREAS AND ELDERLY AND DISABLED CITIZENS WITHIN THESE AREAS OF THE STATE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THIS INCLUDES DRIVER/WORKER COMPENSATION AND PANDEMIC-RELATED LEAVES FUEL MAINTENANCE PERSONAL SAFETY DEVICES SUPPLIES CLEANSERS AND ANY OTHER EXPENSES INCURRED SUPPORTING OPERATIONS AND RIDERSHIP. MARKETING WILL BE INCREASED TO HELP RECOVER LOST RIDERSHIP DUE TO THE PANDEMIC.

THIS APPLICATION INCLUDES $42464 IN FY 2021 SECTION 5310 CRRSAA FUNDS WHICH REPRESENTS THE FULL AMOUNT OF THE TOTAL ELIGIBLE AMOUNT ALLOCATED TO SALEM AREA MASS TRANSIT DISTRICT (SAMTD). THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED AT 100% FEDERAL SHARE TO HELP PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE APPLICATION SCOPE OF WORK INCLUDES BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO OPERATIONS AND CONTRACTED OPERATIONS SALARIES AND WAGES INCLUDING ADMINISTRATIVE LEAVE SIGNAGE PRINTED MATERIALS PURCHASE OF MATERIALS TO KEEP OPERATORS AND PASSENGERS SAFE PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT (PPE) AND DISINFECTING SUPPLIES FOR BUSES STOPS TRANSIT STATIONS AND TRANSIT FACILITIES.SPECIAL LANGUAGE FOR FURLOUGH CERTIFICATIONSAMTD CERTIFIES THAT IT AND ANY SUBRECIPIENT OR CONTRACTOR THAT IS A PROVIDER OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION: (A) ARE CURRENTLY NOT FURLOUGHING ANY EMPLOYEES; (B) HAVE TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT POSSIBLE BROUGHT BACK ANY EMPLOYEES PREVIOUSLY FURLOUGHED AS A DIRECT RESULT OF FINANCIAL CHALLENGES CAUSED BY THE COVID-19 PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY; OR (C) HAVE REHIRED OR POSTED TO REHIRE ANY POSITIONS OF EMPLOYEES WHO WERE LAID OFF AS A RESULT OF FINANCIAL CHALLENGES CAUSED BY THE COVID-19 PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY.SPECIAL CONDITION FOR EMERGENCY RELATED FUNDINGSAMTD AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.PURPOSEFUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS DRIVER SALARIES AND OPERATING EXPENSES IN ORDER TO CONTINUE TRANSIT OPERATIONS DURING THE PERIOD OF 7/01/2021 TO 6/30/2022.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMEDFUNDING WILL PERMIT SALEM AREA MASS TRANSIT DISTRICT (SAMTD) TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE OPERATIONS AND EQUIPMENT THAT WOULD OTHERWISE HAVE TO BE CUT DUE TO LACK OF FUNDING. EXPECTED OUTCOMESIT IS EXPECTED THAT THESE FUNDS WILL HELP MINIMIZE DISRUPTION TO SAMTDS OPERATIONS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIESSAMTD AND THE RIDERS THAT RELY ON ITS SERVICE WILL BENEFIT FROM CONTINUED SERVICES PERMITTING WORKERS TO GET TO WORK AND RIDERS TO GET TO ESSENTIAL SERVICES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIESSAMTD DOES NOT HAVE SUBRECIPIENTS.

THIS GRANT INCLUDES $229802 IN FY 2021 ARP SECTION 5310 PROGRAM FUNDS WHICH REPRESENTS THE FULL AMOUNT THAT WAS SUB-ALLOCATED TO TRIMET FROM THE PORTLAND OR-WA URBANIZED AREA (UZA) ALLOCATION. FUNDS WILL HELP TRIMET PREVENT RESPOND TO RECOVER FROM THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC AND WILL BE USED FOR THE PURCHASE OF OPERATING SERVICES FOR TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR THE ELDERLY AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES AT 100% FEDERAL SHARE.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE PURCHASE OF OPERATING SERVICES FOCUSED ON THE ELDERLY AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS DRIVER SALARIES (INCLUDING ADMINISTRATIVE LEAVE FOR EMPLOYEES DUE TO REDUCTIONS IN SERVICE OR REQUIRED FOR A QUARANTINED WORKER) FUEL AND ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT (PPE) AND CLEANING SUPPLIES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT TRIMET TO SUSTAIN TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES AND THE ELDERLY SAFELY DURING THE PANDEMIC.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND THE ELDERLY WITHIN THE PORTLAND OR-WA URBANIZED AREA (UZA).SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONETHIS APPLICATION FOR SECTION 5310 FEDERAL ASSISTANCE IS CONSISTENT WITH THE SUB-APPORTIONMENT LETTER SIGNED BETWEEN TRIMET C-TRAN AND SMART DATED 7.7.2021. ***SPECIAL CONDITION FOR ARP ACT GRANTS*** THE RECIPIENT AGREES THAT IF THEY RECEIVE FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT THEY WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THESE 5310 FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT THE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM AND TO PROVIDE MARKETING SUPPORT MATERIALS TO MEET THE TRANSPORTATION NEEDS OF THE ELDERLY DISABLED AND LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS IN BUTLER COUNTY. MARKETING WILL INCLUDE EDUCATION AND INFORMATION MATERIALS CUSTOMIZED FOR EACH TARGETED SEGMENT OF THE POPULATION. THE MATERIALS WILL INCLUDE BOOKLETS HOW-TO VIDEOS SOCIAL MEDIA CAMPAIGNS AND ADDITIONAL ITEMS AS NEEDED.THE PROGRAM REQUIRES FUNDING TO CONTINUE TO EDUCATE AND TRAIN OUR COMMUNITY ON ALL CURRENT TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS INCLUDING PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PRIVATE TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS NON-EMERGENCY MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION ACTIVE TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS AND MEDICAID FUNDED TRANSPORTATION. THE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM ACTS AS A LIAISON BETWEEN CUSTOMER AND PROVIDER TO FIND A SOLUTION TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE INDIVIDUAL.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: A MARKETING PROFESSIONAL WILL BE HIRED TO HELP CREATE PRINT MATERIALS AND ASSIST WITH OUTREACH EFFORTS INCLUDING DESIGN CONTENT MANAGEMENT MESSAGING AND PRINTING. MOBILITY MANAGEMENT WILL ASSIST WITH BCRTAS SHORT RANGE PLANNING STUDY TO COMPLETION WITH THE GOAL OF REDESIGNING THE CURRENT FIXED ROUTE SYSTEM TO BEST FIT THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY. OUTREACH EFFORTS TO CONNECT WITH ADDITIONAL ORGANIZATIONS THAT SERVE THE ELDERLY AND DISABLED POPULATIONS WILL CONTINUE TO ADVANCE THE PROGRAM AND INCREASE THE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS TRAVEL TRAINED. EFFORTS TO PROVIDE SEAMLESS TRAVEL OPTIONS FOR THE ELDERLY AND DISABLED POPULATIONS THROUGHOUT OUR REGION WILL EXPAND. INCREASE USAGE OF THE TABC ACCESS BUTLER COUNTY (ABC) SUBSIDIZED FARE PROGRAM AND DEVELOP A TRAIN-THE-TRAINER TRAVELING TRAINING PROGRAM TO ALLOW FOR ADDITIONAL TRANSPORTATION SUPPORTS WITHIN OUR COMMUNITY.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE EFFECTIVE REDESIGN OF FIXED ROUTES TO BETTER MEET THE NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITY INCREASED OUTREACH TO ORGANIZATIONS THAT SERVE ELDERLY AND DISABLED (ED) POPULATIONS SEAMLESS TRAVEL OPTIONS FOR ED POPULATIONS THROUGHOUT OUR REGION INCREASED USAGE OF THE TABC ABC SUBSIDIZED FARE PROGRAM AND A FUNCTIONAL TRAIN-THE-TRAINER TRAVELING TRAINING PROGRAM.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE ELDERLY AND DISABLED POPULATIONS OF BUTLER COUNTY AND THE SURROUNDING REGION AS WELL AS LOW-INCOME POPULATIONS AND SERVICE AGENCIES WHOSE GOALS ARE TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THESE POPULATIONS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE FFY 2021 SECTION 5310 ARPA FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $69410. WRTA SOLICITED PROJECTS FOR THE FY 2018 2019 2020 AND 2021 FUNDING (INCLUDING CRRSSA AND ARPA). FIVE APPLICATIONS WERE RECEIVED THREE OF THOSE APPLICATIONS WERE APPROVED AS TRADITIONAL PROJECTS TOTALING $908091. THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE PARTIAL FUNDING (WITH THE REMAINING FUNDS COMING FROM FORMULA 5310 AND ARPA 5310). THIS PROJECT IS FROM LIBERTY TOWNSHIP FOR A SIDEWALK ADDITION TO A TRANSIT CORRIDOR IN THE AMOUNT OF $446796. OF THAT TOTAL $69410 IS BEING FUNDED IN THIS GRANT USING ARPA FUNDS. IN A SEPARATE CRRSSA GRANT OF $69409 AND A FORMULA 5310 GRANT OF $307387 WILL FUND THE REMAINING COST. THIS AWARD WILL CONTINUE THE FOCUS ON ENHANCEMENTS TO BRING BETTER ACCESS TO PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IN TRUMBULL COUNTY. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE THE CONSTRUCTION AND REPLACEMENT OF SIDEWALKS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: BETTER ACCESS TO RELIABLE TRANSPORTATION AND CONNECTION TO THE WRTA SYSTEM. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFICIARIES OF THIS AWARD ARE THE SENIORS AND DISABLED PERSONS AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN TRUMBULL COUNTY. SUB RECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE SUB RECIPIENT LIBERTY TOWNSHIP WILL CONSTRUCT AND REPLACE SIDEWALKS ALONG A TRANSIT CORRIDOR THAT ARE UNUSABLE OR NON-EXISTENT. PROJECTS SELECTED FOR FUNDING UNDER THIS PROGRAM MEET THE 45%/55% SPLIT BETWEEN NON-TRADITIONAL AND TRADITIONAL PROJECTS ALLOWED BY THE ANNUAL APPORTIONMENT AND ARE INCLUDED IN A LOCALLY DEVELOPED COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT-HUMAN SERVICE TRANSPORTATION PLAN AND THE PLAN WAS DEVELOPED AND APPROVED THROUGH A PROCESS THAT INCLUDED PARTICIPATION BY SENIORS; INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES; REPRESENTATIVES OF PUBLIC PRIVATE NON-PROFIT TRANSPORTATION AND HUMAN SERVICE PROVIDERS; AND OTHER MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC. WRTA AND THE SUBRECIPIENTS AWARDED FOR FUNDING UNDER THIS PROGRAM HAVE NOT FURLOUGHED EMPLOYEES DURING THE CORONAVIRUS PANDEMIC AS REQUIRED BY SECTION 5310 ARP PROGRAM.ATTACHMENTS TO THIS APPLICATION CONSIST OF THE FOLLOWING: TIP/STIP AMENDMENT 7 AND FHWA/FTA APPROVAL LETTER COORDINATED PLAN SPLIT AGREEMENT FOR SECTION 5310 ARPA FUNDS AND THE SHPO LETTER.

PURPOSE: THE CENTRAL OHIO TRANSIT AUTHORITY (COTA) IS SUBMITTING THIS GRANT APPLICATION FOR USE OF $574725 IN FY 2020 SECTION 5310 FOR THE PERIOD OF MARCH 2022 THROUGH MARCH 2028 AS A DIRECT RECIPIENT. MORPC IS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT FOR SECTION 5310 FUNDING FOR THE COLUMBUS UZA. MORPC SOLICITED PROJECTS AND SELECTED COTA TO RECEIVE FUNDING TO EXERCISE THE OPTION TO UTILIZE THE COLUMBUS UZAS SECTION 5310 FUNDING FOR NON-TRADITIONAL PROJECTS (OPERATING COSTS). THE LOCAL MATCH FOR THIS PROJECT WILL COME FROM A DEDICATED LOCAL SALES TAX IN THE AMOUNT OF $574725. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:COTAS NON-ADA SERVICE IS DEFINED AS ANY ORIGIN OR DESTINATION LOCATION MORE THAN THREE-FOURTHS OF A MILE FROM A FIXED-ROUTE BUS LINE OR TRIPS MADE OUTSIDE OF THE FIXED-ROUTE HOURS OF OPERATION IN ANYWHERE WITHIN COTAS SERVICE AREA. NON-ADA SERVICE IS PROVIDED UPON SPACE AVAILABILITY AND IS NOT A REQUIRED SERVICE MANDATED BY THE AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES ACT. CUSTOMERS ARE REQUIRED TO CALL TO SCHEDULE AT LEAST 24-HOURS IN ADVANCE OF THEIR TRIP REQUEST. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:SECTION 5310 OPERATING FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUBSIDIZE COTAS NON-ADA SERVICE DEFINED ABOVE. THE FUNDS WILL NOT BE USED TO SUBSIDIZE ANY COST OF OUR COMPLIMENTARY ADA SERVICE. THIS PROJECT IS DERIVED FROM THE FRANKLIN COUNTY COORDINATED TRANSPORTATION PLAN WHICH WAS ADOPTED JULY 5 2012. AN UPDATE TO THE COORDINATED TRANSPORTATION PLAN WAS ADOPTED IN APRIL 2018. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:ELIGIBLE CUSTOMERS WHO MAY WANT TO TRAVEL OUTSIDE OF COTAS ADA SERVICE AREA. ELIGIBLE CUSTOMERS MUST BE PRE-APPROVED.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONEATTACHMENTS INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: SECTION 5310 PROGRAM OF PROJECTS; STIP APPROVAL LETTER AND PROJECT LISTINGS. THE FUNDS WILL NOT BE USED TO SUBSIDIZE ANY COST OF OUR COMPLIMENTARY ADA SERVICE. SECTION 5310 FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUBSIDIZE COTAS NON-ADA SERVICE DEFINED BELOW. THIS PROJECT IS DERIVED FROM THE FRANKLIN COUNTY COORDINATED TRANSPORTATION PLAN WHICH WAS ADOPTED APRIL 2018.AS COTA IS APPLYING FOR SECTION 5310 FUNDS AS A DIRECT RECIPIENT WE WILL ASSUME RESPONSIBILITY FOR GRANT REPORTING AND MANAGEMENT. MORPC WILL BE RELEASED FROM ANY LIABILITY PERTAINING TO DIRECT RECIPIENT SECTION 5310 GRANTS AS STATED ON PAGE 11 OF THE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT PLAN. REFERENCE PAGE III-13(B.)(1.)(A.) OF THE FTA C9070.1G - ENHANCING PARATRANSIT BEYOND MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS OF ADA. EXPANSION OF PARATRANSIT SERVICE PARAMETERS BEYOND THE THREE-FOURTHS MILE REQUIRED BY THE ADA.COORDINATED PLAN ADOPTED JULY 5 2012 UPDATED APRIL 2018 MPO CONCURRENCE APRIL 3 2015

PURPOSE OF THE AWARD ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS APPLICATION REQUEST FUNDING TOTALING $75940 (INCLUDING FEDERAL AND LOCAL SHARE) FOR TRANSIT COMPUTER HARDWARE/SOFTWARE AND ACCESSIBILITY IMPROVEMENTS TO SUPPORT THE NOACA HUMAN TRANSPORTATION SERVICE PLAN FOR MEDINA COUNTY. THE TOTAL FEDERAL SHARE REQUEST IS $60752 FROM FY2021 SECTION 5310 WITH LOCAL MATCHING FUNDING OF $15188 FROM FARE AND LOCAL AGENCY CONTRACT REVENUE TO SUPPORT THE COMPLETION OF THE PROJECTS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: MEDINA COUNTY PUBLIC TRANSIT IS CURRENTLY WORKING TO LEVERAGE TECHNOLOGY TO IMPROVE DISPATCH/DRIVER COMMUNICATIONS AND DATA COLLECTION METHODS REQUIRED BY THE FTA AND ODOT FOR REPORTING COMPLIANCE. WE HAVE PARTNERED WITH NOACA TO SECURE FUNDING TO PURCHASE AND INSTALL ONBOARD MOBILE DATA TERMINALS (SAMSUNG TABLETS) AND TRIPSPARK (DRIVERMATE) SOFTWARE FOR INTEGRATION WITH CURRENT TRIPSPARK (NOVUS) SCHEDULING SOFTWARE. OUR AGENCY HAS RECEIVED REQUESTS FROM OUR LOCAL AGENCIES AND PUBLIC PASSENGERS REGARDING BUS SHELTERS FROM THE ADVERSE ELEMENTS. THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE IMPROVED SAFETY AND SECURITY AT KEY PASSENGER WAITING AREAS AND TRANSFER POINTS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: EACH OF THESE TECHNOLOGY SOLUTIONS WILL FULLY UTILIZE THE MOST UP-TO-DATE HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE TO PROVIDE OPTIMUM OPERATIONAL EFFICIENCY FOR MEDINA COUNTY PUBLIC TRANSIT. THE ACCESSIBILITY IMPROVEMENTS WILL SUPPORT THE NOACA HUMAN TRANSPORTATION SERVICE PLAN FOR MEDINA COUNTY BY PROVIDING PASSENGER TRANSFER POINT SHELTERS AND SECURITY ENHANCEMENTS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: WITH THESE COMMUNICATION AND ACCESSIBILITY PROJECTS WE WILL SEE GREATER TRANSIT SERVICE SATISFACTION AND POTENTIALLY ADDITIONAL RIDERSHIP IN OUR COMMUNITY.INCLUDED IN THE APPLICATION ARE THE STIP APPROVAL LETTER STIP PROJECT LISTINGS AND THE NORTHEAST OHIO AREAWIDE COORDINATING AGENCY HUMAN TRANSPORTATION SERVICES PLAN.
