THIS GRANT WILL BE USED TO ADMINISTER THE FISCAL YEARS 2013 AND 2014 SECTION 5310 PROGRAM FUNDS ALLOCATED TO THE CINCINNATI UZA. TEN PERCENT OF THE TOTAL AVAILABLE FUNDS IN EACH YEAR WILL BE USED BY OKI (DESIGNATED RECIPIENT) AND SORTA (DIRECT RECIPIENT) FOR ADMINISTRATION AND VEHICLE PROCUREMENT. OKI WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR SOLICITING REVIEWING AND AWARDING FUNDS TO ELIGIBLE RECIPIENTS; SORTA WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR VEHICLE PROCUREMENT AND REQUIRED FOLLOW-UP TO MAINTAIN CONTROL OF CAPITAL EQUIPMENT UNTIL IT REACHES THE END OF ITS USEFUL LIFE. GIVEN THE LENGTH OF THE SECTION 5310 CAPITAL EQUIPMENT THE ESTIMATED END DATE OF THIS ADMINISTRATIVE GRANT IS SET 10 YEARS AFTER THE ESTIMATED START DATE.THE REMAINING 90 PERCENT OF THE TOTAL AVAILABLE FUNDS EACH YEAR WILL BE USED FOR PROJECT AWARDS TO ELIGIBLE RECIPIENTS AND WILL BE UNDER A SEPARATE GRANT MANAGED BY SORTA.THE OKI COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT-HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN (COORDINATED PLAN) IS THE BASIS FOR REQUESTS FROM SECTION 5310 APPLICANTS. APPLICATIONS MUST INDICATE WHAT GAPS IN SERVICES IDENTIFIED IN THE COORDINATED PLAN THEY ARE ADDRESSING AND STRATEGIES TO FILL THESE GAPS MUST BE DESCRIBED. THE COORDINATED PLAN WAS UPDATED IN 2012 AND THE NEXT UPDATE WILL BE IN 2016 TO COINCIDE WITH THE OKI LONG RANGE PLAN UPDATE. AN OVERSIGHT TEAM THAT MET TO REVIEW PREVIOUS JARC AND NEW FREEDOM APPLICATIONS WILL REVIEW THE SECTION 5310 APPLICATIONS AND PROVIDE GUIDANCE TO OKI STAFF.OKI HAS A LONG HISTORY OF PUBLIC PARTICIPATION IN VARIOUS TRANSPORTATION PLANS AND ACTIVTIES UNDERTAKEN BY THE AGENCY. THESE ADMINISTRATIVE FUNDS WILL ALSO ENSURE PUBLIC PARTICIPATION CONTINUES WITH THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAMS IN THE CINCINNATI URBANIZED AREA.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE THE AWARDED SUBRECIPIENTS OPERATING ASSISTANCE AND CAPITAL FUNDING TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS IN NEW YORK STATE.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS DRIVER SALARIES FUEL ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR IN ORDER TO CONTINUE SERVICE FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS. FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED FOR ELIGIBLE CAPITAL INVESTMENT INCLUDING THE PURCHASE OF BUSES FROM THE NYS OFFICE OF GENERAL SERVICES (OGS) ADULT BUS CONTRACT. PROJECTS TO FACILITATE MOBILITY OPTIONS AND IMPROVE ACCESSIBILITY TO DESTINATIONS WILL BE SUPPORTED BY MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROJECTS ACROSS THE STATE.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT NYSDOT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SERVICE FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS IN THE STATES RURAL AND SMALL URBAN AREAS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE FOLLOWING OVERVIEW OF THE PROJECTS EXPLAINS HOW THE FUNDING WILL SUPPORT THE TARGET POPULATIONSECTION 5310 FUNDING WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT FORTY-EIGHT (48) PROJECTS FOR 35 SUBRECIPIENTS WHOSE SERVICES HAVE MET ALL THE FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS (CATEGORY A); AND FOR PROJECT ADMINISTRATION. SPECIFICALLY:33 VEHICLE PROJECTS (75 VEHICLES) 20 ARE CONSIDERED EXPANSION AND 55 ARE REPLACEMENTS ($4.860 MILLION IN FEDERAL FUNDS)3 MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROJECTS ($0.728 MILLION IN FEDERAL FUNDS)10 OPERATING ASSISTANCE PROJECTS ($1.485 MILLION IN FEDERAL FUNDS)2 NON-VEHICLE CAPITAL PROJECTS ($0.149 MILLION IN FEDERAL FUNDS)STATE ADMINISTRATION FUNDING ($0.466 MILLION) WHICH IS WITHIN THE PERMITTED 10 PERCENT OF THE GRANT AT 4.4 PERCENT. NYSDOT ENSURES THE CONTINUING CONTROL OF THE ASSETS PURCHASED UNDER THIS GRANT PROGRAM THROUGH REGULAR COMMUNICATION WITH THE SUB-RECIPIENTS INCLUDING SEMI-ANNUAL VEHICLE AND OTHER ASSET REPORTING; QUARTERLY MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND OPERATING ASSISTANCE REPORTING; AND THROUGH ON-SITE VISITS AND DOCUMENTATION REVIEW.GRANTS PERFORMANCE PERIOD: JANUARY 1 2022 THROUGH DECEMBER 31 2027.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE THE AWARDED SUBRECIPIENTS OPERATING ASSISTANCE FUNDING TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS IN NEW YORK STATE.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS DRIVER SALARIES FUEL ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR TO CONTINUE SERVICE FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS. THIS COVID FUNDING (ARPA) IS AWARDED ALONG WITH CRRSSA FUNDING AND CORE OPERATING ASSISTANCE IN OTHER GRANTS TO SUPPORT THE PERFORMANCE OF PROVIDING OPERATING SERVICES TO ADDRESS THE IMPACTS OF THE PANDEMIC ON THESE SERVICES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT NYSDOT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SERVICE FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: ALL FOUR PROJECTS IN THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE OPERATING ASSISTANCE BASED ON THE AVAILABLE FUNDING ALLOCATED TO NEW YORK STATE. THERE ARE CURRENTLY 8 AWARDS IN THE NYMTC URBAN AREA; 7 AWARDS IN THE FIVE OTHER TMA AREAS IN THE MID-HUDSON AND UPSTATE AREA; 7 AWARDS IN THE SMALL URBAN AREAS IN NEW YORK STATE (SUZAS); AND 10 AWARDS IN THE NON-URBANIZED AREA IN THE STATE. EACH OF THESE AWARDS WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO SUPPORT THE OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO THE SUB-RECIPIENTS TO SUPPORT THE MOBILITY AND NECESSARY SUPPORT TO THE TARGET POPULATION.

OPERATION OF PARATRANSIT SERVICE BEYOND 3/4 OF A MILE FROM FIXED ROUTE SERVICE. REQUESTED FUNDS ARE FFY 2019 SECTION 5310 FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $1853636.THIS APPLICATION IF APPROVED WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE COUNTY TO CONTINUE ITS PROGRAM OF PROVIDING WESTCHESTER COUNTY BEE-LINE PARATRANSIT BUS SERVICE BEYOND THE THREE-QUARTER MILE AREA REQUIRED UNDER THE AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES ACT (ADA) IN ORDER TO BETTER MEET THE NEEDS OF ELDERLY INDIVIDUALS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. TTDS BUDGET FOR OPERATING COSTS WAS ESTIMATED BY USING PRIOR YEAR ACTUALS WITH ADJUSTMENTS FOR CURRENT YEAR ANTICIPATED ACTIVITIES. 1. THIS IS AN APPLICATION FOR THE PARTIAL FFY 2022 APPORTIONMENT OF SECTION 5310 FUNDS (UZA#32000) IN THE AMOUNT OF: TOTAL FEDERAL FUNDS: $363556TOTAL LOCAL MATCH $64793TOTAL ELIGIBLE PROJECT COST: $428349THE LOCAL SHARE IS PROVIDED BY PENNINGTON FOUNDATION COUNTY GRANTS AND FUNDRAISING EVENTS. 1) PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE (PM)ESTIMATED PM COSTS; THE GRANT APPLIES $8652 IN FY22 SECTION 5310 FUNDS FOR PM FOR THE PERIOD BETWEEN 10/1/2022 AND 9/30/2023. 2) VEHICLE REPLACEMENT THIS GRANT APPLIES $108714 IN FY22 SECTION 5310 FUNDS TO BUS REPLACEMENT. THESE VANS WILL MEET THE CLEAN AIR ACT STANDARDS (CAA) AND THE AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES ACT (ADA) REQUIREMENTS. 3) VEHICLE EXPANSION THIS GRANT APPLIES $246190 IN FY22 SECTION 5310 FUNDS TO BUS REPLACEMENT. THESE BUSES WILL MEET THE CLEAN AIR ACT STANDARDS (CAA) AND THE AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES ACT (ADA) REQUIREMENTS.ANY FUNDS NOT EXPENDED ACCORDING TO PROJECTIONS WILL BE REALLOCATED AND EXPENDED DURING A FUTURE SUBRECIPIENT AGREEMENT CYCLE.THE FEDERAL SHARE IS 85 PERCENT FOR THE ACQUISITION OF VEHICLES AND 80 PERCENT FOR THE PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE OF VEHICLES FOR PURPOSES OF COMPLYING WITH OR MAINTAINING COMPLIANCE WITH THE AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES ACT (ADA; 42 U.S.C. 12101 ET SEQ.) OR THE CLEAN AIR ACT (CAA; 42 U.S.C. 7401 ET SEQ.). THE VEHICLE TO BE PURCHASED WITH THESE FUNDS IS COMPLIANT WITH THE AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES ACT. AWARD PURPOSE: TO MAINTAIN AND EXPAND RURAL TRANSIT SERVICE THROUGHOUT NEVADA THROUGH CAPITAL ASSET REPLACEMENT AND ACQUISITIONACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS AWARD WILL FUND TRANSIT CAPITAL PROJECTS INCLUDING THE ACQUISITION OF VEHICLES AND EQUIPMENT. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS AWARD IS EXPECTED TO PRODUCE AND PRESERVE MOBILITY AMONG VISITORS TO AND RESIDENTS OF THE STATE. WITH THE PASSING OF AND ADJUSTMENT TO THE PANDEMIC IT IS EXPECTED THAT RIDERSHIP NUMBERS WILL GROW THROUGHOUT THE AWARD PERIOD OR AT LEAST DURING THE FIRST PHASE. THIS GRANTS FUNDING COMBINED WITH FUNDING FROM ADDITIONAL GRANTS WILL HELP TO ACHIEVE A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FOR THE STATES RURAL TRANSIT FLEET OVER THE NEXT FOUR YEARS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: MOBILITY IN RURAL AREAS IS PARTICULARLY IMPORTANT FOR THOSE POPULATIONS CLASSIFIED AS MOST VULNERABLE ALTHOUGH ALL FUNDED SERVICES UNDER THIS AWARD WILL SERVE THE GENERAL PUBLIC TRANSIT PROPENSITY WILL BE A KEY DETERMINANT IN THE LEVEL OF BENEFIT REALIZED BY EACH DEMOGRAPHIC. SERVICE PROVIDER STAFF WILL ALSO BENEFIT FROM HAVING ACCESS TO NEWER AND MORE EFFICIENT EQUIPMENT.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE GRANT WILL FUND THE ACTIVITIES GENERALLY STATED UNDER THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED SECTION. A MORE DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF THESE ITEMS CAN BE DESCRIBED AS ACQUISITION OF REPLACEMENT VEHICLES OF VARIOUS VARIETIES INCLUDING PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE. PLEASE SEE THE ATTACHED NDOT PROGRAM YEAR 2023 5310 POP (FFY22 FULL APPORTIONMENT) AND 5310 PAGES OF THE FFY22 STIP 53105339 PROJECT LIST FOR DETAILED INFORMATION ACTIVITIES ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN.

CAMPO IS SUBMITTING THIS APPLICATION TO REQUEST THE FULL APPORTIONMENT OF THE FY 2020 FEDERAL SECTION 5310 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE STATE OF NEVADA IN THE AMOUNT OF $148573 AND THE FULL APPORTIONMENT OF THE FY 2021 FEDERAL SECTION 5310 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE STATE OF NEVADA IN THE AMOUNT OF $143471 . FY2020 FUNDS WILL BE USED IN THE PROCUREMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF A CONTACTLESS PAYMENT SYSTEM FOR THE JUMP AROUND CARSON (JAC ASSIST) COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT SYSTEM. CAMPO INTENDS TO USE THE FY2021 FUNDS TO SUPPORT PARATRANSIT IN THE CARSON CITY SMALL URBANIZED AREA THROUGH CAPITALIZED OPERATING. CAMPO IS REQUESTING $148573 IN FY 2020 5310 APPORTIONMENT FUNDS AND $143471 IN FY 2021 5310 APPORTIONMENT FUNDS. CONTACTLESS FARE PAYMENT SYSTEM PROJECT PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROCURE AND IMPLEMENT A CONTACTLESS FARE PAYMENT SYSTEM FOR THE JAC ASSIST PARATRANSIT SYSTEM. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: JAC WILL FOLLOW CAMPO PROCUREMENT POLICIES FOR A CONTACTLESS FARE PAYMENT SYSTEM FOR THE JAC ASSIST TRANSIT SYSTEM. JAC WILL THEN FOLLOW FTA PROCUREMENT REGULATIONS TO SELECT THE BEST SYSTEM TO BE IMPLEMENTED AT JAC ASSIST PARATRANSIT. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE CONTACTLESS FARE PAYMENT SYSTEM WILL BE IMPLEMENTED INTO JAC ASSIST PARATRANSIT SERVICES AND WILL SUPPLEMENT THE CASH FARE PAYMENT SYSTEM ALREADY IN USE AND WILL ALLOW MORE METHODS OF FARE PAYMENT ON JAC ASSIST PARATRANSIT AND WILL ALSO DECREASE BOARDING TIME AND INCREASE ON-TIME PERFORMANCE WHILE PROVIDING A SAFER METHOD FOR FARE PAYMENT THAT DOES NOT REQUIRE CONTACT BETWEEN RIDERS AND DRIVERS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ALL RIDERS OF JAC ASSIST TRANSIT INCLUDING SENIORS AND RIDERS WITH DISABILITIES WILL BENEFIT FROM THE FUNDS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE FOR THE CONTACTLESS FARE PAYMENT PROJECT.CAPITALIZED OPERATING PURPOSE: THIS GRANT WILL UTILIZE THE 5310 FUNDS TO CONTINUE TO SUPPORT THE JAC ASSIST PARATRANSIT SERVICE IN CARSON CITY THROUGH CAPITALIZED OPERATING.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: CAMPO WILL UTILIZE THESE FUNDS FOR THE CONTRACTED SERVICES OF A 3RD-PARTY OPERATOR FOR THE JAC ASSIST PARATRANSIT SERVICE IN CARSON CITY.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL BE USED TO CONTINUE TO SUCCESSFULLY OPERATE THE JAC ASSIST PARATRANSIT SERVICE WITHIN THE CAMPO BOUNDARY.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ALL RIDERS OF JAC TRANSIT INCLUDING SENIORS AND RIDERS WITH DISABILITIES WILL BENEFIT FROM THE FUNDS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: CAMPO WILL UTILIZE THESE FUNDS FOR THE CONTRACTED SERVICES OF A 3RD-PARTY OPERATOR FOR THE JUMP AROUND CARSON (JAC) TRANSIT SYSTEM OPERATING IN CARSON CITY.

THIS IS AN APPLICATION FOR FFY 2021 SECTION 5310 FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $176117 (PARTIAL APPORTIONMENT). ALL PROJECT EXPENSES ARE TO BE FUNDED AT 100% FEDERAL. THE CRRSAA WAIVES THE REQUIREMENT FOR LOCAL SHARE FOR PREVIOUSLY APPORTIONED (FY21 AND PRIOR) UNOBLIGATED SECTION 5310 FUNDS. ANY UNOBLIGATED SECTION 5310 FUNDS MAY BE OBLIGATED AT A 100PERCENT FEDERAL SHARE. THE APPLICATION SCOPE OF WORK INCLUDES MOBILITY MANAGEMENT OPERATIONS AND PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE FOR TWO SUBRECIPIENTS. ANY FUNDS NOT EXPENDED ACCORDING TO PROJECTIONS WILL BE REALLOCATED AND EXPENDED DURING A FUTURE SUBRECIPIENT AGREEMENT CYCLE.THE BREAKDOWN OF EXPENSES PROVIDED BELOW WERE DERIVED BY SUBRECIPIENT AGENCIES BASED ON CURRENT AND HISTORICAL SPENDING IN THE RESPECTIVE CATEGORIES. BUDGET ESTIMATES ALSO TOOK INTO ACCOUNT INFLATION FACTORS AND OTHER ADJUSTMENTS TO COSTS BASED ON THE CHANGING LANDSCAPE OF INDIVIDUAL EXPENSES (I.E. HIRING ADDITIONAL STAFF ETC.). FORMULA SUMMARY (ALL 100% FEDERAL):TOTAL FEDERAL FUNDING $176117OPERATING -- $1656 (NON-TRADITIONAL)MOBILITY MANAGEMENT -- $101707 (TRADITIONAL)PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE -- $72754 (TRADITIONAL)THIS GRANT SHALL FUND TRADITIONAL AND NON-TRADITIONAL PROJECTS WITH THE OVERALL FUNDING FOR TRADITIONAL PROJECTS MEETING THE REQUIRED 55 PERCENT MINIMUM (REGARDLESS OF WHAT THE ADDITIONAL PROJECT(S) WILL BE FOR THE APPORTIONMENT BALANCE) FOR THE FFY2021 APPORTIONMENT OF 5310 FUNDS. APPROVAL OF THIS GRANT/PROJECT WILL PRODUCE A CURRENT SPLIT OF 99/1 FOR TRADITIONAL/NON-TRADITIONAL PROJECTS. THE CURRENT SHARE OF FUNDS ALLOCATED TO TRADITIONAL PROJECTS RELATIVE TO THE ENTIRE YEARS APPORTIONMENT ($262402) IS STILL 66 PERCENT WHICH ENSURES THE 55 PERCENT MINIMUM HAS/WILL BE MET. ALL PROJECTS ARE CONSISTENT WITH NDOTS 2018 COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN GOALS AND OBJECTIVES.THIS AWARD IS BEING FUNDED AT 100% FEDERAL AND DOES NOT INCLUDE MATCH DOLLARS. HOWEVER THE ATTACHED NDOT PROGRAM YEARS 2022-2023 5310 POP (FFY21 PARTIAL APPORTIONMENT) AND NEVADA PROGRAM YEARS 2022-2023 STIP (5310) PROVIDE DETAILED MATCH SOURCE/FUNDING BREAKDOWN INFORMATION.- AWARD PURPOSE: TO PROVIDE RELIEF TO RURAL TRANSIT OPERATORS TO MAINTAIN TRANSIT SERVICE THROUGHOUT NEVADA- ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS AWARD WILL FUND TRANSIT OPERATIONS MOBILITY MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES AND PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE.- EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS AWARD IS EXPECTED TO PRODUCE AND PRESERVE MOBILITY AMONG VISITORS TO AND RESIDENTS OF THE STATE. WITH THE RESIDUAL EFFECTS OF THE PANDEMIC COMBINED WITH THE SERVICE BEING NEWLY IMPLEMENTED IT IS EXPECTED THAT RIDERSHIP NUMBERS WILL TAKE SOME TIME TO FULLY DEVELOP. THE FUNDED MOBILITY MANAGER WILL OVERSEE IMPLEMENTATION OF AN INTEGRATED SCHEDULING/DISPATCH SOFTWARE PROJECT (ALSO BEING FUNDED THROUGH NDOT/FTA) TO ENSURE APPROPRIATE INCLUSION IMPLEMENTATION AND USE (BY INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL USERS) OF THE SOFTWARE PROGRAM. THIS GRANTS FUNDING WILL ALSO HELP TO ACHIEVE A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FOR THE STATES RURAL TRANSIT FLEET THROUGH PROPER VEHICLE MAINTENANCE. - INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: MOBILITY IN RURAL AREAS IS PARTICULARLY IMPORTANT FOR THOSE POPULATIONS CLASSIFIED AS MOST VULNERABLE. THE FUNDED AGENCIES UNDER THIS AWARD WILL FOCUS SERVICES ON SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES BUT WILL ACCOMMODATE OTHER DEMOGRAPHICS AS APPROPRIATE. DIRECT SERVICE TO THOSE SEEKING VACCINES OR OTHER COVID-RELATED MEDICAL ATTENTION IS ALSO EXPECTED AS A RESULT OF THIS AWARD.- SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: AWARD FUNDING WILL SUPPORT SUBRECIPIENT TRANSIT OPERATIONS MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE. COORDINATION OF SERVICES AMONG ADJACENT/REGIONAL PROVIDERS WILL BE ONGOING.NDOT AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: AWARD EXECUTIVE SUMMARYSECTION 3006(B) OF THE FAST ACT AUTHORIZES THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) TO AWARD FUNDING FOR THE MOBILITY FOR ALL (M4A) PILOT PROGRAM (CFDA #20.513). ON JUNE 5 2020 FTA ANNOUNCED ON THE FTA WEBSITE THE SELECTION OF 17 PROJECTS IN 16 STATES. THE REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION COMMISSION OF SOUTHERN NEVADA (RTC) WAS AWARDED $128624 TO BUILD A MOBILE LEARNING LAB TO TRAIN AND EDUCATE TRANSPORTATION DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS ON TECHNOLOGY AND RESOURCES TO IMPROVE MOBILITY ACCESS TO SERVICES IN OUR COMMUNITY.THE REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION COMMISSION OF SOUTHERN NEVADA (RTC) IS SUBMITTING THIS APPLICATION IN ITS CAPACITY AS THE TRANSIT AGENCY AND DESIGNATED RECIPIENT OF FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION FUNDS FOR THE LAS VEGAS URBANIZED AREA IN NEVADA WHICH HAS A POPULATION OF MORE THAN 2.2 MILLION RESIDENTS ACCORDING TO U.S. CENSUS DATA (2018). RESIDENTS ARE 42% WHITE 31% HISPANIC 11% BLACK 10% ASIAN 4% TWO OR MORE RACES AND 1% ISLANDER; AND MORE THAN ONE THIRD (34.6%) SPEAK A LANGUAGE OTHER THAN ENGLISH MORE THAN 1.5 TIMES THE RATE OF THE U.S. (21.9%).THE RTC IS NOT ONLY THE TRANSIT AUTHORITY BUT ALSO THE METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATION AND REGIONAL TRAFFIC MANAGEMENT AGENCY FOR SOUTHERN NEVADA. THE RTCS VISION IS TO PROVIDE A SAFE CONVENIENT AND EFFECTIVE REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM THAT ENHANCES MOBILITY AND AIR QUALITY FOR CITIZENS AND VISITORS. THE RTC ENCOURAGES RESIDENTS AND VISITORS TO USE A VARIETY OF TRANSPORTATION CHOICES TO REDUCE TRAFFIC CONGESTION AND IMPROVE AIR QUALITY AND THE QUALITY OF LIFE IN SOUTHERN NEVADA.PROJECT TITLE: RTC MOBILE LEARNING LAB IMPROVING MOBILITY AND ACCESS TO SERVICESTHE PROJECT WILL BUILD A MOBILE LEARNING LAB TO TRAIN AND EDUCATE TRANSPORTATION DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS ON TECHNOLOGY AND RESOURCES TO IMPROVE MOBILITY ACCESS TO SERVICES IN OUR COMMUNITY. PROCUREMENT FOR THE LOW-FLOOR VEHICLE THAT WILL HOUSE THE MOBILE LAB IS PLANNED TO PIGGYBACK ON A COMPETITIVELY BID OKLAHOMA STATE CONTRACT. THE RTC MOBILE LEARNING LAB IMPROVING MOBILITY AND ACCESS TO SERVICES IS LOCATED IN THE 2020-2024 STIP: TIP ID XS20200031 APPROVED 8/28/2020.THE RTC IS THE METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATION (MPO) FOR SOUTHERN NEVADA. THEREFORE SEPARATE MPO CONCURRENCE IS NOT REQUIRED.THE $69259 LOCAL MATCH IS PROGRAMMED IN THE RTCS CAPITAL IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM. ANY COST OVERRUNS FOR THE PROJECT WILL BE FUNDED FROM AVAILABLE APPORTIONMENT FORMULA FUNDING AT THE SAME FEDERAL RATE. THE RTC AGREES THAT IT WILL OPERATE THIS GRANT AS A PILOT FOR UP TO 18 MONTHS FROM THE INITIAL FEDERAL REIMBURSEMENT OF EXPENSES UNDER THIS AWARD. THE RECIPIENT AGREES TO DEVELOP AN EVALUATION PLAN WITH PERFORMANCE MEASURES OF THE SUCCESS OR FAILURE OF THEIR PROJECT AND DESCRIBE ANY PLANS FOR BROAD-BASED IMPLEMENTATION OF SUCCESSFUL PROJECTS. FTA THROUGH THE NATIONAL AGING AND DISABILITY TRANSPORTATION CENTER WILL REQUEST QUARTERLY DATA REPORTS AND A FINAL REPORT ON THESE PERFORMANCE MEASURES AND PROJECT OUTCOMES.DUE TO DELAYS ASSOCIATED WITH THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC AND COORDINATION OF ESTIMATES FROM MULTIPLE CONTRACTORS FOR VEHICLE CUSTOMIZATION THE ORIGINAL TIMELINE FOR THIS PROJECT HAS BEEN EXTENDED. BUDGET REVISION: THIS PROPOSED AWARD BUDGET REVISION IS TO EXTEND THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE END DATE FROM 7/1/2023 TO 2/28/2025 DUE TO DELAYS IN MANUFACTURING OF THE VEHICLE.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: AS RTC HAS TAKEN STEPS TO IMPLEMENT UP-TO-DATE TECHNOLOGY/PROVIDE UNIQUE TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS THERE IS AN UNMET NEED TO INCREASE AWARENESS AND PROVIDE TRAINING IN HOW TO UTILIZE THESE SYSTEMS. THE MOBILE LEARNING LAB WILL TARGET DISADVANTAGED POPULATIONS SUCH AS DISABLED PERSONS SENIORS VETERANS LOW-INCOME AND MEDICAID RECIPIENTS WHO MAY NOT HAVE THE ABILITY TO INDEPENDENTLY ACCESS THE PROJECT DESCRIPTIONAS RTC HAS TAKEN STEPS TO IMPLEMENT UP-TO-DATE TECHNOLOGY/PROVIDE UNIQUE TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS THERE IS AN UNMET NEED TO INCREASE AWARENESS AND PROVIDE TRAINING IN HOW TO UTILIZE THESE SYSTEMS. THE MOBILE LEARNING LAB WILL TARGET DISADVANTAGED POPULATIONS SUCH AS DISABLED PERSONS SENIORS VETERANS LOW-INCOME AND MEDICAID RECIPIENTS WHO MAY NOT HAVE THE ABILITY TO INDEPENDENTLY ACCESS THE INFORMATION THEY NEED TO SUCCESSFULLY NAVIGATE RTCS TRANSIT SYSTEM. RTC IS IMPLEMENTING THIS PILOT PROJECT TO EXPAND TRAINING AND INCREASE AWARENESS OF SERVICES UNDERSTANDING THAT AVAILABILITY IS NOT THE SAME AS ACCESSIBILITY. WHILE REGIONAL RESOURCES ARE AVAILABLE THROUGHOUT THE COMMUNITY WITHOUT THE AWARENESS AND KNOWLEDGE OF HOW TO EFFICIENTLY USE THE RELIABLE TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS AVAILABLE IT BECOMES DIFFICULT TO UTILIZE THESE SERVICES.WITH 20968 CLIENTS CURRENTLY CERTIFIED FOR RTC PARATRANSIT SERVICE THE CONTINUED DEMAND FOR SERVICE IS GROWING EXPONENTIALLY AND THERE IS AN URGENT NEED FOR EXPANDED AND CREATIVE SOLUTIONS TO REACH THIS POPULATION. SOUTHERN NEVADAS UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS WHO ARE RELIANT ON PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION NEED INNOVATIVE MEANS TO RECEIVE TRAINING AND EDUCATION IN HOW TO EFFICIENTLY USE THE TRANSIT SYSTEM TO ACCESS VITAL RESOURCES. THE CAPITAL INVESTMENT IN A MOBILE LEARNING LAB WILL HELP TO MEET A NEED IN OUR COMMUNITY NOT ONLY FOR DISADVANTAGED GROUPS BUT ALL USERS OF THE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM.RTC HAS BEEN RECENTLY FACED WITH FUNDING CHALLENGES THAT HAVE VASTLY IMPACTED THE AGENCYS SERVICES. WITH THE ONSET OF TRANSPORTATION NETWORK COMPANY (TNC) SERVICE THE AGENCY FACED DECREASED RIDERSHIP WHICH HAS TRANSLATED TO A SIGNIFICANT REVENUE SHORTAGE. THIS APPLICATION IS A PILOT PROGRAM INVESTMENT THAT CANNOT BE REASONABLY FUNDED BY THE FTA FORMULA APPORTIONMENTS AND STATE/LOCAL RESOURCES AS THE FORMULA FUNDING IS ALLOCATED TO CAPITAL INVESTMENTS IN THE REPLACEMENT OF FIXED ROUTE VEHICLES AND REPLACEMENT/EXPANSION OF PARATRANSIT VEHICLES TO SUSTAIN TRANSIT OPERATIONS.THE LAB WILL BE BUILT INSIDE OF A LOW-FLOOR CUTAWAY CNG VEHICLE THAT RTC WILL PROCURE AS PART OF THIS PROJECT. THE VEHICLE WILL BE ACCESSIBLE TO CUSTOMERS EQUIPPED WITH WORKSTATIONS AND OPERATED BY STAFF WHO WILL PROVIDE LEARNING TOOLS TO CUSTOMERS SO THEY CAN EFFICIENTLY TRAVEL THROUGHOUT THE GREATER LAS VEGAS AREA.RTC WILL BRING THE MOBILE LAB TO EACH OF THE PARTNERS AGENCY LOCATIONS ON A ROTATING BASIS TO PROVIDE ON-SITE TRAINING AND COLLABORATING PARTNERS WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO COLLABORATE WITH THE RTC IN PROVIDING INFORMATION ABOUT THEIR RESOURCES AT THE SAME TIME CREATING A MORE EXPANDED ONE-STOP CENTER. REMOVING THE BARRIER FOR CLIENTS WHO ARE REQUIRED TO ACCESS RESOURCES FROM MULTIPLE LOCATIONS IS KEY TO THEIR SUCCESS. ; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: PROJECT BENEFITSTHIS GRANT WILL ALLOW RTC TO CREATE A MOBILE LEARNING LAB TO TEACH TARGETED GROUPS OF CUSTOMERS WHO RELY ON PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION TO ACCESS BASIC NEEDS AND RESOURCES IN OUR COMMUNITY. THE RTC ENVISIONS A LEARNING ENVIRONMENT THAT CAN GO ANYWHERE IN THE COMMUNITY CREATING ADDITIONAL OPPORTUNITIES TO EDUCATE ON PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS PROVIDE TRAINING ON HOW TO LEVERAGE EMERGING TECHNOLOGY TO ACCESS THE VARIOUS OPTIONS AVAILABLE AND ASSIST CUSTOMERS IN ENROLLING IN SERVICES THAT MEET THEIR UNIQUE NEEDS. BENEFITS TO CLARK COUNTY RESIDENTS INCLUDE HELPING THEM BUILD CONFIDENCE AND INDEPENDENCE INCREASE SOCIALIZATION IMPROVE ACCESS TO HEALTH AND WELLNESS OPPORTUNITIES AND ENCOURAGE USAGE OF FIXED-ROUTE TRANSIT OVER PARATRANSIT WHEN POSSIBLE. TEACHING EXISTING RIDERS HOW TO USE CURRENT TECHNOLOGY AND NEW CUSTOMERS HOW TO NAVIGATE ALL OF THEIR MOBILITY OPTIONS WE CAN REMOVE THE BARRIERS THAT ARE KEEPING INDIVIDUALS FROM RECEIVING NEEDED SERVICES AND HELP THEM MAKE INFORMED TRANSPORTATION DECISIONS. REMOVING THESE BARRIERS CAN IMPACT THEIR OVERALL HEALTH AND WELL-BEING BY ENSURING ACCESS TO APPOINTMENTS AND RESOURCES INCLUDING HEALTHCARE AND EMPLOYMENT.RTC PROVIDES ON-SITE MOBILITY TRAINING AND CERTIFICATION AT OUR MOBILITY TRAINING CENTER (MTC) FOR CUSTOMERS WITH A FOCUS ON DISABLED PERSONS INCLUDING THE VISUALLY IMPAIRED. THE MOBILE TRAINING LAB WILL ALLOW US TO CONNECT WITH CUSTOMERS WHO ARE CHALLENGED IN TRAVELING TO THE MTC AND INCREASE AWARENESS OF THE SERVICES THAT ARE OFFERED. RTC CURRENTLY FUNDS TRANSPORTATION TO AND FROM THE MTC FOR INDIVIDUALS APPLYING FOR PARATRANSIT SERVICES. WITH EXPANDING OUR REACH OUT INTO THE COMMUNITY TO CONNECT DIRECTLY WITH DISADVANTAGED POPULATIONS OUR GOALS INCLUDE REDUCING COSTS OF TRANSPORTATION FOR MTC SERVICES INCREASING FIXED-ROUTE RIDERSHIP FOR CUSTOMERS CURRENTLY UTILIZING PARATRANSIT AND LEVERAGING SERVICES OFFERED BY COMMUNITY PARTNERS.EXPECTED OUTCOME: TO IMPROVE ACCESS TO HEALTHCARE AND ESSENTIAL SERVICES FOR DISADVANTAGED POPULATIONS WITHIN CLARK COUNTY THROUGH A 25% INCREASE IN CUSTOMERS TRAINED THROUGH THE MOBILITY LAB ON EMERGING TECHNOLOGY AND THE USE AND BENEFITS OF AFFORDABLE FIXED ROUTE TRANSPORTATION.TRACK FIXED-ROUTE RIDERSHIP FOR CUSTOMERS WHO HAVE PARTICIPATED IN MOBILITY LAB TRAININGS WITH THE GOAL OF 25% OF PREVIOUS NON-RIDERS TRYING FIXED ROUTE FOR THE FIRST TIME.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: BENEFITS TO CLARK COUNTY RESIDENTS INCLUDE HELPING THEM BUILD CONFIDENCE AND INDEPENDENCE INCREASE SOCIALIZATION IMPROVE ACCESS TO HEALTH AND WELLNESS OPPORTUNITIES AND ENCOURAGE USAGE OF FIXED-ROUTE TRANSIT OVER PARATRANSIT WHEN POSSIBLE. TEACHING EXISTING RIDERS HOW TO USE CURRENT TECHNOLOGY AND NEW CUSTOMERS HOW TO NAVIGATE ALL OF THEIR MOBILITY OPTIONS WE CAN REMOVE THE BARRIERS THAT ARE KEEPING INDIVIDUALS FROM RECEIVING NEEDED SERVICES AND HELP THEM MAKE INFORMED TRANSPORTATION DECISIONS. REMOVING THESE BARRIERS CAN IMPACT THEIR OVERALL HEALTH AND WELL-BEING BY ENSURING ACCESS TO APPOINTMENTS AND RESOURCES INCLUDING HEALTHCARE AND EMPLOYMENT.THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS AND COLLABORATION WITH MEMBERS OF THE COORDINATING COUNCIL ON ACCESS AND MOBILITY (CCAM) WE WILL ENHANCE THE AVAILABILITY ACCESSIBILITY AND EFFICIENCY OF TRANSPORTATION FOR SPECIAL POPULATIONS IN OUR COMMUNITY WHO FACE TRANSPORTATION CHALLENGES. VETERANS DISABLED PERSONS MEDICAID RECIPIENTS LOW-INCOME AND DISLOCATED OR DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE UNEMPLOYED AND SEEKING WORK ARE THE CLIENTS WE WILL TARGET FOR MOBILITY IMPROVEMENT DURING THIS PILOT PROGRAM.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

APPLICATION PURPOSE: PURPOSE: 5310 CRRSAA FUNDING TO BE DIRECTED TO ASSIST PUBLIC 5310 ENTITIES TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM AND VEHICLE OPERATIONS INCLUDING PAYROLL AND ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES AND THE PURCHASE OF REPLACEMENT VEHICLES INCURRED ON OR AFTER JANUARY 20 2020 ACROSS THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: PROVIDE FUNDING FOR PROGRAM OPERATING ACTIVITIES (ACTIVITIES INCLUDE SALARIES (PAYROLL) FOR TRANSIT AGENCY OPERATIONS SUPERVISION DRIVERS MECHANICS DISPATCH AND OPERATIONS SUPPORT; OCCUPANCY COSTS; EQUIPMENT AND SUPPLIES; AND VEHICLE COSTS INCLUDING FUEL PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE CLEANING AND SANITIZATION AND REPAIR FOR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES. PROVIDE FUNDING FOR VEHICLE COSTS INCLUDING FUEL PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE CLEANING AND SANITIZATION REPAIR AND REPLACEMENT PARTS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE USE OF FUNDS WILL PROVIDE THE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE 5310 PUBLIC AGENCIES NEED TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE AND SUSTAIN PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICES TO RESIDENTS ACROSS THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO. THE OPERATING PROJECTS WILL INCREASE SERVICE OPTIONS FOR THE PUBLIC NEEDING TRANSPORTATION ACCESS TO EMPLOYMENT EDUCATION TRAINING INDEPENDENT LIVING AND ESSENTIAL HEALTHCARE RELATED SERVICES. ACCESS TO SERVICE IN RURAL COMMUNITIES IS THE MOST OBVIOUS OUTCOME.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: 5310 SUBRECIPIENTS AND THEIR RIDERSHIP NEW MEXICO RESIDENTS VISITORS LOCAL BUSINESSES AND MAJOR EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS WILL BENEFIT FROM WELL-SUPPORTED RELIABLE AND ON-GOING FIXED ROUTE AND DEMAND RESPONSE TRANSIT SERVICES.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: PROVIDE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION FOR NEW MEXICO RESIDENTS TO ACCESS EMPLOYMENT EDUCATION HEALTHCARE SHOPPING AND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES ALSO INCLUDE TRANSPORTATION FOR WORK TRAINING AND EXPERIENCE LIFE SKILLS TRAINING ASSOCIATED WITH SUPERVISED AND SUPPORTED LIVING RESIDENTIAL SERVICES.

FY2019 ICAM $130000 FOR CAPITAL EQUIPMENT AND FOUR TRANSPORTATION VEHICLESCAPACITY BUILDERS INC. (CBI) A NONPROFIT BASED IN FARMINGTON NEW MEXICO WILL LEAD THE NORTHWEST NEW MEXICO TRANSPORTATION ALLIANCE INNOVATIVE COORDINATED ACCESS AND MOBILITY PROJECT TO ADDRESS THE TRANSPORTATION NEEDS INCLUDING NON-EMERGENCY MEDICAL SERVICES OF THE AGING AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES POPULATIONS IN NORTHWEST NEW MEXICO AND MONTEZUMA COUNTY COLORADO. THROUGH THE WORK OF THE TRANSPORTATION ALLIANCE ACCESS TO CARE REDUCED CARE COSTS IMPROVED HEALTHCARE WILL RESULT.THE SOURCE THE LOCAL WILL DERIVED FROM: IN-KIND AND LOCAL FUNDS CBI WILL EXCEED THE REQUIRED 20% LOCAL SHARE WITH A COMMITMENT OF 21.7% OF THE TOTAL PROJECT COST THROUGH DEDICATED USE OF A 9-SEAT VAN (VALUED AT $14000) TWO SMALLER TRANSPORT VANS (ONE VALUED AT $5000 THE SECOND WITH A WHEELCHAIR LIFT VALUED AT $9000) CBI WILL MATCH $8000 TO PHONE NETWORK UNDER MATERIALS SUPPLIES.ICAM REPORTING REQUIREMENTS:IN ACCORDANCE WITH 3006(B)(3)(D) EACH APPLICANT IS TO IDENTIFY SPECIFIC PERFORMANCE MEASURES THE ELIGIBLE PROJECT WILL USE TO QUANTIFY ACTUAL OUTCOMES AGAINST EXPECTED OUTCOMES.HSCR IS A DEMONSTRATION PROGRAM AND FEDERAL PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION LAW (49 U.S.C. 5312(E)(4)57) REQUIRES AN INDEPENDENT EVALUATION NO LATER THAN TWO YEARS AFTER THE DATE ON WHICH A PROJECT RECEIVES ASSISTANCE. FTA WILL PLAN HOW TO CONDUCT THE INDEPENDENT EVALUATION.FTA WILL CONDUCT THE EVALUATIONS OF BOTH THE ICAM AND HSCR PROGRAMS AND COMPILE THE EVALUATION RESULTS WITH SUPPORT THROUGH A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WITH A DESIGNATED TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE CENTER.ON A QUARTERLY BASIS RECIPIENTS ARE EXPECTED TO UPLOAD IN TRAMS THE FOLLOWING REQUIRED REPORTS: MILESTONE PROGRESS REPORTS (MPR) SUBMITTED QUARTERLY. FEDERAL FINANCIAL REPORT (FFR) SUBMITTED AT YEAR END SEPTEMBER 30.IN ADDITION THE NATIONAL AGING AND DISABILITY TRANSPORTATION CENTER (NADTC) WILL COLLECT PERFORMANCE MEASURES (I.E. RIDERSHIP GAPS IN SERVICE FILLED OPERATIONS IMPROVEMENTS) ON A QUARTERLY BASIS FROM ALL ORGANIZATIONS RECEIVING ICAM FUNDS. THESE MEASURES WILL BE USED FOR THE ANNUAL REPORT TO CONGRESS. UPON PROJECT COMPLETION ICAM-FUNDED PROJECTS MUST ALSO SUBMIT A FINAL REPORT. THE CENTER FOR URBAN TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH (CUTR) WILL COLLECT PERFORMANCE MEASURES FROM HSCR RECIPIENTS FOR THE PURPOSE OF THE REQUIRED INDEPENDENT EVALUATION OF THAT PROGRAM.NADTC WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO RECIPIENTS OF ICAM HSCR AND M4A GRANTS. THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WILL FOCUS ON THE DEVELOPMENT AND REPORTING OF PERFORMANCE MEASURES.

NJ TRANSIT IS REQUESTING $7732645 OF FY2020 SECTION 5310 ENHANCED MOBILITY OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM FUNDS. THE TOTAL GRANT AMOUNT WILL BE $7732645 SECTION 5310. THERE IS NO LOCAL MATCH REQUIREMENT AS THE CRRSAA PERMITS ALL UNOBLIGATED SECTION 5310 FUNDING (FY21 AND PRIOR) TO BE OBLIGATED AT A 100-PERCENT FEDERAL SHARE FOR ALL ACTIVITIES ELIGIBLE UNDER THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM. NJ TRANSIT HAS MET THE REQUIRED 55% THRESHOLD FOR SPENDING ON TRADITIONAL 5310 PROJECTS AS OUTLINED IN THE ATTACHED POP.FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $370000 WILL SUPPORT THE PURCHASE OF TWO (2) REPLACEMENT BUS 30 FT.FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $3178500 WILL SUPPORT THE PURCHASE OF EIGHTEEN (18) REPLACEMENT BUS 30FT.FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $750000 WILL SUPPORT THE PURCHASE OF FOUR (4) EXPANSION BUS 30 FT.FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $70000 WILL SUPPORT THE PURCHASE OF ONE (1) EXPANSION VANS.FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $400000 WILL SUPPORT THE THREE (3) MOBILITY MANAGEMENT ACTIVITY.FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $1755000 WILL SUPPORT SIXTEEN (16) OPERATING PROJECTS.FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT $773264 WILL SUPPORT STATE ADMINISTRATION.FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $435881 WILL SUPPORT NJ TRANSIT FORCE ACCOUNT FOR OVERSIGHT FOR VEHICLE PROCUREMENT INSPECTION ACCEPTANCE AND DELIVERY TO THE SUB-RECIPIENTS.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD IS TO ASSIST NJ TRANSIT IN MEETING TRANSPORTATION NEEDS OF THE ELDERLY AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES BY SUPPORTING THE DEMAND RESPONSE AND MOBILITY MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES OF TWENTY-NINE (29) SUBRECIPIENTS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $4368500 WILL BE USED TO PURCHASE TWENTY-FIVE (25) ACCESSIBLE PASSENGER VEHICLES. NJ TRANSIT IS REQUESTING FEDERAL ASSISTANCE IN THE AMOUNT OF $1294000 CMAQ OF FY2022 CONGESTION MITIGATION AND AIR QUALITY IMPROVEMENT (CMAQ) FUNDING FOR TRANSIT RELATED PROJECTS SELECTED BY THE DELAWARE VALLEY REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION (DVRPC). THE DVRPC THE METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATION (MPO) FOR THE SOUTHWESTERN NEW JERSEY REGION REQUESTED APPLICATIONS FROM COUNTIES WITHIN ITS REGION FOR CMAQ-ELIGIBLE LOCAL PROJECTS. OF THOSE RECEIVED AND SELECTED BY A REVIEW COMMITTEE ALL ARE TRANSIT-RELATED AND ALL OF THE APPLICATIONS ARE FOR THE PURCHASE OF VEHICLES REPLACEMENTS. NJ TRANSIT WILL USE TOLL REVENUE EXPENDITURES (TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT CREDITS) IN THE AMOUNT OF $258800 AS CREDIT TOWARD THE NON-FEDERAL MATCHING SHARE.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD IS TO ASSIST NJ TRANSIT IN INITIATING AND PROMOTING SOLUTIONS TO REDUCE CONGESTION MANAGE TRANSPORTATION DEMAND AND IMPROVE AIR QUALITY FOR TWO (2) SUBRECIPIENTS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $1164600 WILL BE USED TO PURCHASE SEVEN (7) REPLACEMENT VEHICLES. ALL SEVEN (7) VEHICLES WILL BE LIFT EQUIPPED AND ALL WILL BE GAS FUELED. THE AIR QUALITY ANALYSES SHOWED THAT GAS POWERED VEHICLES HAVE AIR QUALITY SAVINGS. FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $129400 WILL SUPPORT PROJECT ADMINISTRATION FOR NJ TRANSIT TO OVERSEE DAY-TO-DAY MANAGEMENT OF ACTIVITIES INCLUDING FTA REPORTING REQUIREMENTS VEHICLE PROCUREMENT VEHICLE INSPECTIONS AND PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO THE SUBRECIPIENTS AS NEEDED.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: NJ TRANSIT EXPECTS THAT SUBRECIPIENTS WILL UTILIZE FUNDING IN THIS APPLICATION TO SUPPORT PROJECTS AND SERVICES THAT PROMOTE TRANSIT SOLUTIONS TO REDUCE CONGESTION MANAGE TRANSPORTATION DEMAND AND IMPROVE AIR QUALITY. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: FUNDS IN THIS APPLICATION WILL BE USED TO SERVE THE TRANSIT NEEDS OF INDIVIDUALS IN THE SOUTHWESTERN NEW JERSEY REGION AND STATEWIDE.SUBRECIPIENTS: SUBRECIPIENTS OF FUNDING IN THIS APPLICATION ARE: GLOUCESTER COUNTY MERCER COUNTY.

(CAMDEN) COUNTY OF CUMBERLAND COUNTY OF SALEM COUNTY OF MERCER AND THE ARC/MERCER INC.A PROGRAM OF PROJECTS SPREADSHEET IS ATTACHED IN TRAMS.SUB-RECIPIENTS RECEIVING EXPANSION VEHICLES HAVE THE ABILITY TO HOUSE AND MAINTAIN THE NEW VEHICLES. HOUSING THE VEHICLES DOES NOT MEAN THE VEHICLE IS INSIDE A GARAGE. IN MOST CASES ESPECIALLY THE PUBLIC ENTITIES THE VEHICLE IS STORED ON COUNTY/MUNICIPALITY PROPERTY IN AN OUTSIDE LOT ADJACENT TO A MAINTENANCE FACILITY. IN THE CASE OF SOME OF THE SMALLER NON-PROFIT AGENCIES THE VEHICLE IS PARKED IN THE LOT OF THEIR FACILITY. TITLE TO THE VEHICLES WILL BE IN THE NAME OF THE SUBRECIPIENT WITH NJ TRANSIT LISTED AS FIRST LIEN HOLDER AND PHYSICALLY HOLDING THE TITLE. WHEN THE FEDERAL INTEREST HAS EXPIRED THE LIENS WILL BE RELEASED AND TITLES WILL BE TURNED OVER TO THE SUBRECIPIENT. IN ACCORDANCE WITH FTA REGULATIONS NJ TRANSIT WILL RELEASE LIEN ON TITLE WHEN A VEHICLE MEETS ITS DEFINED USEFUL LIFE AND IS THEREFORE NO LONGER AN ASSET WITH FEDERAL INTEREST. SATISFACTORY CONTINUING CONTROL NJ TRANSIT WILL MAINTAIN THE REQUIRED SATISFACTORY CONTINUING CONTROL OVER THE VEHICLE OPERATING AND/OR MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AWARDS THROUGH PROJECT ADMINISTRATION REGULAR ON-SITE VEHICLE INSPECTIONS AND PROGRAM AUDITS MAINTAINING AN INVENTORY AND INCLUDING REQUIREMENTS AND LANGUAGE IN THE SUBRECIPIENTS CONTRACT. WHEN THE FEDERAL INTEREST HAS EXPIRED ON VEHICLES THE LIEN WILL BE RELEASED AND TITLE WILL BE TURNED OVER TO THE SUBRECIPIENTS.COORDINATIONNJ TRANSIT HAS WORKED WITH THE 21 COUNTIES IN NEW JERSEY TO DEVELOP COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICE TRANSPORTATION PLANS (CHSTP) IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE UNITED WE RIDE INITIATIVE. ALL SUBRECIPIENTS HAVE BEEN PRESENTED TO AND ACCEPTED BY THE DESIGNATED PLANNING LEAD IN EACH COUNTY. IN ADDITION WE HAVE CONFIRMED THAT EACH SUBRECIPIENT IS EITHER NAMED IN THE PLAN OR MEETING A NEED OR GAP IDENTIFIED IN THE PLAN.STATE MANAGEMENT PLAN (SMP) NJ TRANSIT USED THE PROCEDURES SET FORTH IN THE SECTION 5310 SMP FOR SELECTING PROJECTS. THE STATE MANAGEMENT PLAN WAS UPDATED IN JANUARY 2018 AND IS ATTACHED IN TRAMS.STIPTHE PROJECT IS INCLUDED IN THE FY2020-2029 STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM (STIP). THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION AND THE FEDERAL HIGHWAY ADMINISTRATION APPROVED THE STIP ON DECEMBER 5 2019. THE STIP ID FOR THE FY2019 ELDERLY AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES PROGRAM IS T150 PAGE III - 42.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE FUNDING WILL BE OBLIGATED TO SUPPORT MTAS FY2024 OPERATING PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ADA COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND PLANNING ACTIVITIES; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: MTA WILL FUND ANNUAL OPERATING PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ADA COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND PLANNING ACTIVITIES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE THAT WILL ALLOW MTA TO CONTINUE OPERATING FIXED ROUTE DEMAND RESPONSE EXPRESS AND ADA PARATRANSIT SERVICES. PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES WILL ALLOW MTA TO MAINTAIN ITS FLEET AND FACILITIES IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR. MOBILITY MANAGEMENT WILL SUPPORT MTAS CALL CENTER THAT PROVIDES SCHEDULING FOR THE CORE OF MTA DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICE IN MANCHESTER GREATER DERRY-SALEM AND COORDINATION WITH ROCKINGHAM NUTRITION MEALS OF WHEELS. PLANNING ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE SHORT RANGE AND LONG RANGE TRANSIT SERVICE PLANNING.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: CONTINUED OPERATING ASSISTANCE AND PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS AND COMMUTERS WITHIN THE THE GREATER MANCHESTER AND SALEM/DERRY SERVICE AREAS. MTA IS THE LARGEST TRANSIT PROVIDER IN NH PERFORMING FIXED ROUTE PARATRANSIT SERVICE IN GREATER MANCHESTER AREA AND DEMAND RESPONSE AND ROUTE DEVIATION SERVICES IN THE 5 TOWNS OF DERRY LONDONDERRY SALEM HAMPSTEAD AND CHESTER NH; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE THE NASHUA TRANSIT SYSTEM CAPITAL FUNDING FOR CONTRACTED ADA - COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICES UNDER THE NTS AND FIRST TRANSIT CONTRACT AS DEFINED IN SECTION 5 OF THE FTA C9070.1G. THESE 5310 PROGRAM CONTRACTED SERVICES ARE ELIGIBLE UNDER THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM AS CAPITAL EXPENSES AND MEET THE 55% MINIMUM REQUIREMENT. THE ADA SERVICE EXCEEDS THE REQUIRED COMPLEMENTARY SERVICE AUTHORIZED PER THE FTA SECTION 5307 URBANIZED AREA PROGRAM AS ARTICULATED IN CIRCULAR 9030.1E. NTS SHALL ENSURE THAT THESE COSTS HAVE NOT BEEN PREVIOUSLY REIMBURSED.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE EXPENSES UNDER THE NTS AND FIRST TRANSIT CONTRACT AS DEFINED IN SECTION 5 OF THE FTA 9070.1G ALLOWING FOR THE CONTINUED ADA COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICE FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT NTS TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE ADA COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICES FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND THE ELDERLY.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND THE ELDERLY PASSENGERS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE GRAFTON COUNTY SENIOR CITIZENS COUNCIL (GCSCC) WITH ONE REPLACEMENT SMALL ADA CUTAWAY AND ONE CUTAWAY (EXPANSION) TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS. ADDITIONALLY NHDOT REQUESTS STATE ADMIN FUNDS TO ASSIST 5310 AGENCIES WITH TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE INVESTMENT CAPITAL TO REPLACE TWO EIGHT-PASSENGER ADA SMALL GASOLINE CUTAWAYS TO CONTINUE SERVICE FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS; ADDITIONALLY GCSCC WILL USE THE SECOND VEHICLE TO EXPAND SERVICE BETWEEN LYME AND ORFORD NH. NHDOT WILL ALSO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO ALL 5310 AGENCIES WITH THE ADDITION OF THE 5310 STATE ADMIN. FUNDS; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT THE STATE OF NEW HAMPSHIRE SUPPORT GCSCC PROVIDE SERVICE FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS WITHIN THE SERVICE AREA OF GRAFTON COUNTY AND EXPAND SERVICES IN THE NORTH COUNTRY BETWEEN THE TOWNS OF LYME AND ORFORD.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS IN THE STATES RURAL NORTH COUNTRY.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: GRAFTON COUNTY SENIOR CITIZENS COUNCIL CURRENTLY SERVICES THE GRAFTON COUNTY AREA WITH 10 CUTAWAY BUSES. SERVICE LOCATIONS INCLUDE LITTLETON BETHLEHEM FRANCONIA LISBON LYMAN LANDAFF SUGAR HILL MONROE AND EASTON NH. GCSCC WILL ALSO EXPAND SERVICE TO INCLUDE LYME AND ORFORD.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO SUPPORT OPERATING ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES FOR MTA; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE OPERATING AND FOR MTAS FIXED ROUTE AND DEMAND SERVICES IN THE CART SERVICE AREA; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: OPERATING FUNDING WILL COVER NET OPERATING EXPENSES FOR EXISTING SERVICE INCURRED BEGINNING JULY 1ST 2023; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: PROJECT BENEFITSMTA IS THE LARGEST TRANSIT PROVIDER IN NH PERFORMING FIXED ROUTE AND PARATRANSIT SERVICE IN THE GREATER MANCHESTER AREA. BENEFITS INCLUDE CONTINUING TO SUPPORT TRAVEL FOR ESSENTIAL WORKERS GROCERY SHOPPING AND MEDICAL TRIPS. CART SERVICES COVER THE FIVE NEW HAMPSHIRE COMMUNITIES OF SALEM DERRY LONDONDERRY CHESTER AND HAMPSTEAD. SALEM AND HAMPSTEAD ARE IN THE BOSTON URBANIZED AREA. DERRY AND LONDONDERRY ARE IN THE NASHUA URBANIZED AREA. BENEFITS INCLUDE CONTINUING TO SUPPORT TRAVEL FOR ESSENTIAL WORKERS GROCERY SHOPPING AND MEDICAL TRIPS. ; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST FY22 SECTION 5310 STBG FUNDS FLEXED TO FTA IN THE AMOUNT OF $2700000 (THE TWO FHWA TRANSFER REQUEST ARE ATTACHED DATED 4/20/2022 AND 6/28/2022). THE FLEXED HIGHWAY FUNDS WILL BE UTILIZED BY NHDOT TO FUND MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND CONTRACTED SERVICES PROVIDED STATEWIDE THROUGH THE REGIONAL COORDINATING COUNCILS (RCC) LEAD AGENCIES. THESE EIGHT LEAD AGENCIES SERVE ALL OF NEW HAMPSHIRES COUNTIES AND ARE DEDICATED TO PROVIDING ENHANCED COORDINATION OF TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO ALL ELIGIBLE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF NEW HAMPSHIRE.THE REQUEST WILL INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING BREAKDOWN:MOBILITY MGMT. $1100000CONTRACTED SER. $1600000 PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE THE NHDOT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS (EIGHT REGIONAL RCC LEAD AGENCIES) OPERATING ASSISTANCE AND CAPITAL FUNDING TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER CONTRACTED SERVICES THAT WILL SUPPORT ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS DRIVER SALARIES FUEL ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR AND PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE IN ORDER TO CONTINUE SERVICE FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS. FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED FOR MOBILITY MANAGEMENT SERVICES IN NEW HAMPSHIRES EIGHT REGIONAL COORDINATING COUNCIL COUNTIES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT NHDOT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SERVICE FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS WHILE ENHANCING STATEWIDE COORDINATION AMONG TRANSIT AGENCIES AS WELL AS OTHER STATE AND NON-STATE AGENCIES ALLOWING NHDOT TO EXPAND SERVICE TO NH RESIDENTS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS STATEWIDE. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENTS WILL RECEIVE FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO MAINTAIN SERVICES. REGION 1 - TRI-COUNTY COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM SERVING GRAFTON AND COOS COUNTYREGION 2 - MOUNT WASHINGTON VALLEY ECONOMIC COUNCIL SERVING CARROLL GRAFTON AND COOS COUNTYREGION 3 - BELKNAP MERRIMACK COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM SERVING BELKNAP AND MERRIMACK COUNTIESREGION 4 - SOUTHWESTERN COMMUNITY SERVICES SERVING SULLIVAN COUNTYREGION 5 - COUNTY OF CHESHIRE SERVING THE TOWN OF ANTRIM BENNINGTON FRANCESTOWN GREENFIELD GREENVILLE HANCOCK NEW IPSWICH PETERBOROUGH SHARON AND TEMPLE (LOCATED IN HILLSBOROUGH COUNTY)REGION 7 - NASHUA REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION SERVING THE GREATER NASHUA URBANIZED AREA WITHIN HILLSBOROUGH COUNTYREGION 8 - SOUTHERN NEW HAMPSHIRE PLANNING COMMISSION SERVING THE GREATER MANCHESTER AREA WITHIN HILLSBOROUGH AND ROCKINGHAM COUNTIES INCLUDING THE GREATER MANCHESTER AREA (SALEM)REGION 10 - COOPERATIVE ALLIANCE FOR SEACOAST TRANSPORTATION SERVING ROCKINGHAM AND STRAFFORD COUNTIESFEDERAL TRANSIT LAW REQUIRES THAT PROJECTS SELECTED FOR FUNDING UNDER THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM BE INCLUDED IN A LOCALLY DEVELOPED COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT-HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN. ATTACHED IS A DRAFT COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN FOR THE GREATER MANCHESTER-DERRY-SALEM REGION (RCC REGION 8). THE REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION (RPC) ANTICIPATES THE ADOPTION OF THE NEW PLAN ON 9/15/2022. NHDOT AND THE RPC WILL KEEP THE REGIONAL OFFICE INFORMED OF THE STATUS OF APPROVAL FOR THE COORDINATED PLAN.NHDOT EXECUTED THE FFY 2022 CERTIFICATIONS AND ASSURANCES IN TRAMS ON 3/12/2022. ALL ACTIVITIES ARE PROGRAMMED IN THE CURRENT NH STIP. THE NHDOT IS CURRENT WITH ALL CIVIL RIGHTS REQUIREMENTS AND FTA ANNUAL CERTIFICATIONS. ALL ADMINISTRATIVE AND STATUTORY REQUIREMENTS HAVE BEEN MET IN ACCORDANCE WITH 5310 ENHANCED MOBILITY OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES PROGRAM AS ARTICULATED IN FTA CIRCULAR 9070.1G.

MANCHESTER TRANSIT AUTHORITY (MTA) IS REQUESTING $1204368 OF FFY 2021 SECTION 5307/5310 ARPA FUNDING FROM NEW HAMPSHIRE AND NASHUA UZAS. THIS CONSTITUTES 100% OBLIGATION OF ARPA FUNDING AVAILABLE TO MANCHESTER TRANSIT AUTHORITY. THE NEW HAMPSHIRE SPLIT LETTER DATED AUGUST 9 2021 FOR MTA IS ATTACHED AND THE NEGOTIATED SPLIT FOR 5307/5310 FOR NASHUA DATED APRIL 2 2021 IS ATTACHED.THE FOLLOWING FUNDS WILL BE OBLIGATED:SECTION 5307 NEW HAMPSHIRE UZA $1021617SECTION 5307 NASHUA NH-MA UZA $175050SECTION 5310 NASHUA NH-MA UZA $7701PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO SUPPORT OPERATING ASSISTANCE AND PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES FOR MTA.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE OPERATING AND PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE EXPENSES FOR MTAS FIXED ROUTE AND DEMAND SERVICES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT MTA TO MEET PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE STANDARDS AND CONTINUE TO KEEP ROLLING STOCK VEHICLES AND FACILITIES IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS FUNDING WILL ALLOW MTA TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE RELIABLE RESPONSIVE AND SAFE TRANSPORTATION TO THE PUBLIC IN THE GREATER MANCHESTER AND SALEM/DERRY AREAS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONEMTA AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.ACTIVITIES IN THIS GRANT WILL BEGIN ON MAY 1 2022 AND WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE END DATE. PER ARP THE GRANT REQUESTS 100% FEDERAL SHARE AND THE ACTIVITIES IN THIS APPLICATION ARE NOT REQUIRED TO BE PROGRAMMED IN THE LONG-RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLAN OR STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM. FEDERAL TRANSIT LAW REQUIRES THAT PROJECTS SELECTED FOR FUNDING UNDER THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM BE INCLUDED IN A LOCALLY DEVELOPED COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT-HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN. ATTACHED IS A DRAFT COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN FOR THE GREATER MANCHESTER-DERRY-SALEM REGION (RCC REGION 8). THE REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION (RPC) ANTICIPATES ADOPTION OF THE NEW PLAN ON 9/15/2022. MTA AND THE RPC WILL KEEP THE REGIONAL OFFICE INFORMED WITH THE STATUS OF APPROVAL FOR THE COORDINATED PLAN.THE RECIPIENT CERTIFIES THAT IT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS AND CONTRACTORS THAT ARE PROVIDERS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION HAVE NOT FURLOUGHED ANY EMPLOYEES SINCE MARCH 27 2020 (THE ENACTMENT DATE OF THE CARES ACT).

THE MANCHESTER TRANSIT AUTHORITY (MTA) IS REQUESTING $3023168 OF SECTION 5307/5310 FORMULA FUNDS FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ADA ASSISTANCE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND PLANNING ACTIVITIES FOR THE PERIOD JULY 1 2022 TO JUNE 30 2023 (DETAILED DESCRIPTIONS FOR THESE ACTIVITIES ARE INCLUDED IN THE PROGRAM BUDGET). THIS GRANT WILL FUND ACTIVITIES FOR MANCHESTER TRANSIT AUTHORITY AND GREATER DERRY-SALEM COOPERATIVE ALLIANCE FOR REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION (CART). CARTS ACTIVITIES WERE MERGED INTO MTAS OPERATIONS ON 10/01/2019. CARTS BRANDING FOR SERVICE IS BEING MAINTAINED BY MTA IN THE GREATER DERRY-SALEM AREA. MTA IS A DIRECT RECIPIENT OF FTA SECTION 5307 FUNDING THROUGH THE MANCHESTER NH URBANIZED AREA AND CART WAS A DIRECT RECIPIENT OF FTA SECTION 5307 FUNDING THROUGH NASHUA NH-MA URBANIZED AREA AND A RECIPIENT OF FTA SECTION 5307 FUNDING FROM THE BOSTON MA-NH-RI URBANIZED AREA. THE AUTHORITY IS REQUESTING USE OF $3023168 OF FUNDING ACROSS THE FOLLOWING SOURCES. THE NEW HAMPSHIRE SPLIT LETTERS FOR FY2020 (07/20/2020) FY2021 (04/08/2022) ARE ATTACHED. THE MOU LETTERS FOR 2020 AND 2021 BETWEEN MTA/CART NASHUA TRANSIT SYSTEM AND LOWELL REGIONAL TRANSIT AUTHORITY ARE ATTACHED. FFY 2020 5307 NASHUA UZA APPORTIONMENT $235715 FOR CARTFFY 2021 5307 NASHUA UZA APPORTIONMENT $337617 FOR CART FFY 2020 5310 NASHUA UZA APPORTIONMENT $111028 FOR CART FFY2021 5310 NASHUA UZA APPORTIONMENT $45311 FOR CART FFY 2020 5307 NEW HAMPSHIRE SMALL URBAN APPORTIONMENT $2293497 FOR MTA PURPOSE: THE FUNDING WILL BE OBLIGATED TO SUPPORT MTAS FY23 OPERATING PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ADA COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND PLANNING ACTIVITIES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: MTA WILL FUND ANNUAL OPERATING PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ADA COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND PLANNING ACTIVITIES. MANCHESTER TRANSIT AUTHORITY (MTA) WILL USE THESE FUNDS FOR PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE OF ITS VEHICLE FLEET EQUIPMENT AND FACILITIES FOR MTAS FY 2023 FISCAL YEAR RUNNING FROM JULY 1 2022 THROUGH JUNE 30 2023. THE ESTIMATED OPERATING BUDGET AS DEFINED BY NTD FOR FY 2023 IS $5108566 OF WHICH $652500 IS PROJECTED TO CONSIST OF PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE COSTS FOR MECHANICS SALARY/FRINGE BENEFITS MAINTENANCE OF EQUIPMENT AND FACILITIES EXCLUDING FUNDS APPLIED TO WARRANTY RECOVERY. THIS GRANT WILL APPLY FEDERAL FUNDS OF $522000 TO THIS ALLOWABLE SHARE. THE ESTIMATED ADA COST PROJECTED FOR FY 2021 IS $441250 THIS GRANT WILL APPLY $353000 (FY 2020 20% UNDER FAST ACT) OF THE ALLOWABLE SHARE. MTA IS USING 20 PERCENT OF THE AMOUNTS APPORTIONED UNDER SECTION 5307 FOR ADA COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICE AT AN 80 PERCENT FEDERAL SHARE BECAUSE MTA HAS DEMONSTRATED MEETING THE FOLLOWING REQUIREMENTS: (I) PROVIDES AN ACTIVE FIXED ROUTE TRAVEL TRAINING PROGRAM THAT IS AVAILABLE FOR RIDERS WITH DISABILITIES (II) PROVIDES THAT ALL FIXED ROUTE AND PARATRANSIT OPERATORS PARTICIPATE IN A PASSENGER SAFETY DISABILITY AWARENESS AND SENSITIVITY TRAINING CLASS ON AT LEAST A BIENNIAL BASIS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE THAT WILL ALLOW MTA TO CONTINUE OPERATING FIXED ROUTE DEMAND RESPONSE EXPRESS AND ADA PARATRANSIT SERVICES. PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES WILL ALLOW MTA TO MAINTAIN ITS FLEET AND FACILITIES IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR. MOBILITY MANAGEMENT WILL SUPPORT MTAS CALL CENTER THAT PROVIDES SCHEDULING FOR THE CORE OF MTA DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICE IN MANCHESTER GREATER DERRY-SALEM AND COORDINATION WITH ROCKINGHAM NUTRITION MEALS OF WHEELS. MTA IS THE LARGEST TRANSIT PROVIDER IN NH PERFORMING FIXED ROUTE PARATRANSIT SERVICE IN GREATER MANCHESTER AREA AND DEMAND RESPONSE AND ROUTE DEVIATION SERVICES IN THE 5 TOWNS OF DERRY LONDONDERRY SALEM HAMPSTEAD AND CHESTER NH.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/ATHE LOCAL MATCHING FUNDS ARE GENERATED THROUGH ANNUAL APPROPRIATION OF SUBSIDY FROM THE CITY OF MANCHESTER FIVE MEMBER TOWNS OF DERRY SALEM LONDONDERRY HAMPSTEAD AND CHESTER PARTNERSHIPS WITH LOCAL BUSINESSES AND BUS/SHELTER ADVERTISING REVENUE. FEDERAL TRANSIT LAW REQUIRES THAT PROJECTS SELECTED FOR FUNDING UNDER THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM BE INCLUDED IN A LOCALLY DEVELOPED COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT-HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN. ATTACHED IS A DRAFT COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN FOR THE GREATER MANCHESTER-DERRY-SALEM REGION (RCC REGION 8). THE REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION (RPC) ANTICIPATES ADOPTION OF THE NEW PLAN ON 9/15/2022. THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDED IN THIS GRANT ARE INCLUDED IN THE FY2021-2024 ELEMENT OF THE NH STIP APPROVED IN MARCH 2022. MTA IS CURRENT WITH ALL CIVIL RIGHTS SUBMISSIONS. THE NHDOT IS REQUESTING $478379.00 IN FTA SECTION 5310 FUNDS FOR THE REGIONAL COORDINATING COUNCIL (RCC) PROGRAM TO SUPPORT EIGHT STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION LEAD AGENCIES THAT HAVE BEEN APPROVED PER EACH REGIONS RCC. THESE EIGHT LEAD AGENCIES WILL SUPPORT REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS WITH FUNDING ALLOCATED TOWARD CONTRACTED SERVICES AND MOBILITY MANAGEMENT. SUBRECIPIENTS THAT ARE THE LEAD AGENCIES INCLUDE TRI-COUNTY COMMUNITY ACTION (RCC 1) MT. WASHINGTON VALLEY ECONOMIC (RCC 2) COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM (REGION 3) SOUTHWESTERN COMMUNITY SERVICES (RCC 4) COUNTY OF CHESHIRE (RCC 5 6) NASHUA REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION (RCC 7) SOUTHERN NEW HAMPSHIRE PLANNING COMMISSION (RCC 8 9) COOPERATIVE ALLIANCE OF SEACOAST TRANSPORTATION (RCC 10).RURAL - $179786.00- FY20 STATEWIDESMALL URBAN - $230506.00- FY20- STATEWIDEBOSTON UZA - $38087.00- FY21(SPLIT LETTER ATTACHED)NASHUA UZA - $30000.00- FY21TOTAL GRANT REQUEST OF $478379.00ACTIVITIES TO BE FUNDED ARE: CONTRACTED SERVICES EACH REGIONS LEAD AGENCY IS RESPONSIBLE FOR FINDING AND CONTRACTING WITH SMALLER TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS LOCATED WITHIN THE LEAD AGENCIES AREA TO PROVIDE RESIDENTS WITH ACCESS TO TRANSPORTATION SERVICES THAT MEET THE NEEDS OF RESIDENTS SPECIFICALLY RESIDENTS THAT ARE DISABLED AND/OR ELDERLY (60+) WITH TRANSPORTATION TO LOCAL AND LONG-DISTANCE NON-EMERGENCY MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS NUTRITIONAL EMPLOYMENT SOCIAL AND DAILY LIVING NEEDS. MOBILITY MANAGEMENTTHE REGIONAL LEAD AGENCIES PROVIDE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT DUTIES THAT INCLUDE PROVIDING OUTREACH TO RESIDENTS AGENCIES TOWNS AND CITY OFFICIALS REGARDING THE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES PROVIDED BY REGIONAL LEAD AGENCIES AND THEIR CONTRACTED SERVICE PROVIDERS. MOBILITY MGMT. REQUIRES LEAD AGENCIES TO COORDINATE WITH MULTIPLE ENTITIES TO ENSURE RIDERSHIP NEEDS ARE MET. SPECIFICALLY WITH REGARDS TO PROVIDING ACCESS TO MEDICAL SOCIAL LIFE SUSTAINING AND ENRICHING SERVICES IN NEW HAMPSHIRES UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES WHILE EXTENDING ACCESS TO MEDICAL SERVICES IN LOCATIONS THAT DO NOT HAVE ACCESS. THE LEAD AGENCIES ALSO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO THE CONTRACTED SERVICE PROVIDERS AND ENSURE THAT THE CONTRACTED SERVICE PROVIDERS ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FEDERAL AND STATE REQUIREMENTS REGARDING THE FTA 5310 PROGRAM. LOCAL MATCH WILL BE PROVIDED BY APPROVED SUBRECIPIENTS THROUGH CASH AND IN-KIND MATCH. NHDOT EXECUTED ITS FFY 2021 CERTIFICATION AND ASSURANCES IN TRAMS ON 2/19/2021. THE MANCHESTER TRANSIT AUTHORITY (MTA) IS REQUESTING $270038 OF SECTION 5310 FORMULA FUNDS TO BE USED TO PAY FOR MOBILITY MANAGEMENT OVER THE PERIOD: JULY 1 2021 TO JUNE 30 2023. MTA WILL UTILIZE THE FLEXIBILITY AUTHORIZED UNDER CRRSAA THAT ALLOWS UNOBLIGATED 5310 FORMULA FUNDS TO BE UTILIZED AT 100% FEDERAL. BELOW ARE THE DETAILS OF THE ALLOCATIONS BEING UTILIZED IN THIS GRANT (SPLIT LETTERS AND HEAD QUARTERS APPROVAL ATTACHED). FY16 NASHUA NH UZA - $31453 (RECOVERED FROM CART NH-2017-017-02 IN SEPTEMBER 2020 AFTER MERGER)FY17 NASHUA NH UZA - $113899 (RECOVERED FROM CART NH-2019-010-01 IN SEPTEMBER 2020 AFTER MERGER)FY19 NASHUA NH UZA - $124686MTA IS THE LARGEST TRANSIT PROVIDER IN NH PERFORMING FIXED ROUTE PARATRANSIT SERVICE DEMAND RESPONSE AND ROUTE DEVIATION SERVICES FOR THE TOWNS OF MANCHESTER DERRY LONDONDERRY SALEM HAMPSTEAD AND CHESTER NH. TRANSPORTATION ACCESS IS A CRITICAL COMPONENT FOR THE RESIDENTS OF THE REGION AND ALLOWS FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO SUSTAIN THEMSELVES FINANCIALLY SOCIALLY AND LIVE INDEPENDENTLY WITH DIGNITY. THIS GRANT WILL FUND THE EXPENSES ASSOCIATED WITH THE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT CALL CENTER THAT SUPPORTS TRANSPORTATION COORDINATION FOR MANCHESTER NH AND THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES. THE CALL CENTER PROVIDES SCHEDULING FOR MTAS DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICE AND COORDINATION WITH THE ROCKINGHAM NUTRITION MEALS ON WHEELS. THE PROJECT IS INCLUDED IN THE 2016 SOUTHERN NEW HAMPSHIRE COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT-HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN AND DRAFT 2021 PLAN.MTA EXECUTED THE FFY21 CERTIFICATIONS AND ASSURANCES ON 4/12/2021. THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDED IN THIS GRANT ARE INCLUDED IN THE FY21 ELEMENT OF THE NH STIP APPROVED IN JUNE 2020. MTA IS CURRENT WITH ALL CIVIL RIGHTS SUBMISSIONS. ALL ADMINISTRATIVE AND STATUTORY REQUIREMENTS HAVE BEEN MET IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE 5310 ENHANCED MOBILITY OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES PROGRAM GUIDANCE AND APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS CIRCULAR 9070.1G.

GRANT NH-16-X043 PROJECT DESCRIPTIONFFY 2013 AND 2014 SECTION 5310 FORMULA PROGRAM FUNDING.THIS APPLICATION REQUEST IS FOR SECTION 5310 ENHANCED MOBILITY OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES PROGRAM FUNDS (SECTION 5310 FORMULA) TO INCLUDE FFY 2013 RURAL LAPSING FUNDS ($332038) FFY 2013 LARGE URBAN BOSTON UZA LAPSING FUNDS ($79765) FFY 2014 RURAL ($360143) FFY 2014 SMALL URBAN $449948 AND FFY 2014 LARGE URBAN BOSTON UZA ($76065) FOR A TOTAL GRANT AMOUNT OF $1297959. THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE PROCUREMENT OF 30 CAPITAL BUS REPLACEMENTS COMPUTER HARDWARE MISCELLANEOUS EQUIPMENT AND CAPITAL MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AS WELL AS STATE PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION AT 100% FEDERAL SHARE EQUAL TO 10% OF THE STATES TOTAL FFY 2014 SECTION 5310 FORMULA PROGRAM FUNDS APPORTIONMENT FOR RURAL AND SMALL URBAN.RURAL CAPITAL FUNDING IS REQUESTED TO PURCHASE SIX (6) 30 CAPITAL BUS REPLACEMENTS FOR UP TO SIX RURAL TRANSIT PROVIDERS TO BE IDENTIFIED AFTER APPROVAL OF SUBMITTED GRANT APPLICATIONS FOR SOLICITED FUNDING. SMALL URBAN CAPITAL FUNDING IS REQUESTED TO PURCHASE FOUR (4) 30 CAPITAL BUS REPLACEMENTS FOR UP TO FOUR SMALL URBAN TRANSIT PROVIDERS TO BE IDENTIFIED AFTER APPROVAL OF SUBMITTED GRANT APPLICATIONS FOR SOLICITED FUNDING. LARGE URBAN BOSTON UZA CAPITAL FUNDING IS REQUESTED TO PURCHASE ONE (1) 30 CAPITAL BUS REPLACEMENT FOR A BOSTON UZA TRANSIT PROVIDER TO BE IDENTIFIED AFTER APPROVAL OF SUBMITTED GRANT APPLICATIONS FOR SOLICITED FUNDING. THE BUS PROCUREMENTS WILL AID IN THE SPECIAL TRANSPORTATION NEEDS OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE STATE OF NH. PER FTA AND MAP-21 ADA VEHICLES ARE ELIGIBLE FOR 85% FEDERAL FUNDING. NHDOT WILL PROVIDE 7.5% STATE MATCHING FUNDS FOR VEHICLE PROCUREMENTS ONLY. EACH SUB-RECIPIENT WILL BE PROVIDED 85% FEDERAL FUNDING AND 7.5% STATE FUNDING TOWARD THE COST OF A BUS AND THE SUB-RECIPIENT WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR PROVIDING 7.5% CASH MATCH. THE COMPUTER HARDWARE AND MISCELLANEOUS EQUIPMENT PROCUREMENT WILL BE 80% FEDERAL AND 20% CASH MATCH PROVIDED BY THE SUB-RECIPIENT.SECTION 5310 CAPITAL MOBILITY MANAGEMENT FUNDING IS REQUESTED FOR FIVE (5) RURAL SUB-RECIPIENTS THREE (3) SMALL URBAN SUB-RECIPIENTS AND ONE (1) BOSTON UZA SUB-RECIPIENT FOR MOBILITY MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES IN COOPERATION WITH THE STATE COORDINATING COUNCIL FOR COMMUNITY TRANSPORTATION. NH IS DIVIDED INTO NINE COMMUNITY TRANSPORTATION REGIONS AND EACH REGION HAS AN ASSOCIATED REGIONAL COORDINATING COUNCIL (RCC) WHICH IS COMPOSED OF LOCAL TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS HUMAN SERVICE AGENCIES FUNDING AGENCIES AND ORGANIZATIONS CONSUMERS AND REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION STAFF. AVAILABLE SECTION 5310 CAPITAL MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM FUNDS WERE ALLOCATED BY REGION ACCORDING TO A FORMULA BASED ON REGIONAL POPULATIONS OF RESIDENTS OVER 65 AND THOSE BETWEEN THE AGES OF 5-64 WITH DISABILITIES USING CENSUS DATA. APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE 2 YEARS OF OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO THE CITY OF ASHEVILLE AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS FOR TRANSIT OPERATIONS AND IMPLEMENT CAPITAL PROJECTS IN THE ASHEVILLE URBANIZED AREA.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ALL ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS DRIVER SALARIES FUEL TRANSPORTATION AND NUTRITION PROGRAMS FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND THE ELDERLY ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR AND CAPITAL PROJECTS ETC TO CONTINUE TRANSIT OPERATIONS. APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE WINSTON-SALEM URBAN AREAS SUBRECIPIENTS OPERATING AND CAPITAL ASSISTANCE TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS DRIVER SALARIES FUEL ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ETC. IN ORDER TO CONTINUE TRANSIT OPERATIONS. ELIGIBLE TRADITIONAL AND NON-TRADITIONAL SECTION 5310 PROJECT EXAMPLES INCLUDE: ACQUISITION OF TRANSPORTATION SERVICES UNDER A CONTRACT LEASE OR OTHER ARRANGEMENT; TRAVEL TRAINING; VOLUNTEER DRIVER PROGRAMS; INCREMENTAL COSTS FOR PROVIDING SAME DAY OR DOOR-TO-DOOR SERVICE; IMPROVING SIGNAGE AND OTHER WAY-FINDING; AND MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FY2021 5310 FUNDING WILL ALLOW FOR WINSTON-SALEM DOT AND ITS AWARDED SUBRECIPIENTS TO PROVIDE ESSENTIAL TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO OLDER ADULTS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES THAT WOULD OTHERWISE HAVE LITTLE TO NO ACCESS TO TRANSIT AND TRANSPORTATION SERVICES. ; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE WINSTON-SALEM URBAN AREA.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: WINSTON-SALEM MPO SELECTED EIGHT (8) SUB-RECIPIENTS FOR FFY21 FUNDING. THE SELECTED TRADITIONAL PROJECTS INCLUDE FOUR (4) PROJECTS FROM NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS ONE (1) PROJECT FROM GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES AND THREE (3) FOR PROFIT AGENCIES. ALL PROJECTS ARE DERIVED FROM THE CURRENT HUMAN SERVICES COORDINATED PLAN. NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS:FOUR PROJECTS FROM NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS ARE AS FOLLOWS: 1. SHEPHERDS CENTER OF GREATER WINSTON-SALEM WILL USE $163758 IN FEDERAL FUNDS TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO RESPOND TO THE GROWING DEMAND FOR AFFORDABLE RELIABLE AND TIMELY TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND GROCERY SHOPPING ASSISTANCE FOR SENIOR ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE WINSTON-SALEM AND FORSYTH COUNTY AREAS. 2. SHEPHERDS CENTER OF KERNERSVILLE WILL USE $38801 IN FEDERAL FUNDS TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES THAT ARE AFFORDABLE RELIABLE AND TIMELY TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND GROCERY SHOPPING ASSISTANCE FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. 3. THE WORKSHOP OF DAVIDSON INC WILL USE $38801 IN FEDERAL FUNDS TO PROVIDE VOCATIONAL AND LIFE SKILLS TRAINING PROGRAMS FOR ADULTS WITH INTELLECTUAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES. 4. WINSTON-SALEM INDUSTRIES FOR THE BLIND WILL USE $16275 IN FEDERAL FUNDS TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION ASSISTANCE TO AT LEAST 90 EMPLOYEES (PERSONS WITH COMPLETE LOSS OF SIGHT OR VISUALLY IMPAIRED) TRAVELING FROM 7 DIFFERENT COUNTIES EVERY DAY. LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES:ONE PROJECT FROM LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES IS AS FOLLOWS: 1. DAVIDSON COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF SENIOR SERVICES WILL USE $42000 IN FEDERAL FUNDS TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES ENABLING SENIORS IN THE NORTHERN PORTION OF DAVIDSON COUNTY TO GO TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS NUTRITION SITES AND COMMUNITY SOCIAL ACTIVITIES. FOR-PROFIT AGENCIES:THE THREE FOR-PROFIT AGENCIES BELOW ARE OPERATORS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROVIDING SHARED-RIDE SERVICES AND ARE ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE 5310 FUNDING AS SUBRECIPIENTS AND THEIR PROJECTS WILL BE CONSIDERED AS NON-TRADITIONAL PROJECTS. TWO PROJECTS FROM FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS ARE AS FOLLOWS: 1. SUPPORT SYSTEMS OF FORSYTH COUNTY TRANSPORTATION LLC WILL USE $50000 IN FEDERAL FUNDS TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS THE PHARMACY THE GROCERY STORE EDUCATION AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES. 2. HERE-2-THERE VAN SERVICE WILL USE $16275 IN FEDERAL FUNDS TO PROVIDE UNMET TRANSPORTATION TWENTY-FOUR HOUR SERVICES SEVEN DAYS A WEEK FOR LOW INCOME PERSONS INCLUDING HANDICAPPED AND SENIOR CITIZENS SEEKING QUALITY TRANSPORTATION FOR THEIR MEDICAL AND PERSONAL NEEDS THROUGHOUT THE URBAN AREAS OF FORSYTH COUNTY. 3. KWIK TRIP WILL USE $3103 IN FEDERAL FUNDS TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO ELDERLY AND DISABLED PERSONS IN THE WINSTON-SALEM AREA.

THE CITY OF GREENSBORO AS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT IS APPLYING FOR FEDERAL FUNDING UNDER SECTION 5310 IN THE AMOUNT OF $405783 TO SUPPORT ELIGIBLE CAPITAL COSTS. ALL PROJECTS UNDER THIS GRANT ARE DERIVED FROM THE COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES PLAN ADOPTED ON JUNE 26 2019. THE CITY OF GREENSBOROS PROJECT IS A TRADITIONAL CAPITAL 5310 PROJECT AND COMPRISES 95.7% OF THE FEDERAL PORTION OF THE FY22 SECTION 5310 FUNDING (55% OF FUNDING MUST BE ALLOCATED TO TRADITIONAL PROJECTS). GUILFORD COUNTY WILL ACT AS A SUB-RECIPIENT FOR THIS AWARD FOR THE OPERATING ASSISTANCE PROJECT IN THE AMOUNT OF $17500 AS A NONTRADITIONAL 5310 PROJECT THAT COMPRISES 4.3% OF FEDERAL FUNDING OF THE PROJECT TOTAL FY 22 FTA SECTION 5310 FUNDING (UP TO 45% OF SECTION 5310 FUNDING CAN BE ALLOCATED TO NONTRADITIONAL PROJECTS). THE CITY OF GREENSBORO WILL USE THE AMOUNT OF $40578 FOR THE PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION PROJECT.THIS REQUEST IS NOT BEING USED FOR RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT AND THE CITY WILL NOT BE APPLYING INDIRECT COST RATES TO ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS GRANT. THE CITY WILL FOLLOW ALL THIRD-PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE). THE CITY OF GREENSBORO WILL ENSURE THAT CONTRACTORS PROCURED ARE NOT ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE THE CITY OF GREENSBORO CAPITAL WITH FUNDING TO SUPPORT ELIGIBLE CAPITAL AND PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION COST TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE AND ADMINISTRATIVE COSTS IN ORDER TO CONTINUE TRANSIT OPERATIONS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT THE CITY OF GREENSBORO TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SERVICES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT TRANSIT-DEPENDENT SENIORS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES BY PROVIDING ADDITIONAL TRIPS OUTSIDE OF TYPICAL ADA PARATRANSIT SERVICES. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: GUILFORD COUNTY WILL USE ITS ALLOCATION TO SUPPORT ONGOING OPERATING EXPENSES FOR ITS ELDERLY AND DISABLED TRANSPORTATION TRIPS OUTSIDE OF TYPICAL ADA PARATRANSIT SERVICES.

THE CHARLOTTE AREA TRANSIT SYSTEM A DEPARTMENT OF THE CITY OF CHARLOTTE SEEKS TO USE FFY 2020 SECTION 5310 ENHANCED MOBILITY FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $962098 FOR THE CHARLOTTE NORTH CAROLINA REGION. LOCAL MATCHING FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $462784 WILL ALSO BE APPLIED TOWARDS THE PROJECTS.PURPOSE OF AWARD:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO IMPLEMENT PROJECTS THAT INCREASE TRANSPORTATION ACCESS FOR SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES. ALL PROJECTS ARE DERIVED FROM THE COORDINATED PLAN. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION ASSISTANCE FOR PERSONS WHO ARE BLIND AND VISUALLY IMPAIRED TRANSPORTATION ASSISTANCE FOR ELDERLY DISABLED AND OTHER DISADVANTAGED POPULATIONS IN THE CHARLOTTE REGION PROVIDE DEMAND RESPONSE TRANSPORTATION TO UNION AND IREDELL COUNTY RESIDENTS WHO ARE ELDERLY OR HAVE A DISABILITY PURCHASE A NEW AMERICANS WITH DISABILITY ACT (ADA) EQUIPPED VEHICLE AND IMPROVE BUS STOP ACCESS AND EASE OF USE. CATS WILL USE ADMINISTRATIVE FUNDING TO ADMINISTER THE PROGRAM.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:ENHANCED MOBILITY FUNDING WILL BE USED BY VARIOUS SUBRECIPIENTS TO IMPROVE AND ENRICH PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROJECTS IN MECKLENBURG AND SURROUNDING COUNTIES TO MEET THE NEEDS OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE PERSONS IN THE CHARLOTTE-MECKLENBURG AND SURROUNDING COUNTIES WHO HAVE A DISABILITY OR ARE A PART OF OUR AGING POPULATION.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:CATS WILL CONTRACT WITH THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENTS TO DELIVER SERVICES METROLINA ASSOCIATION FOR THE BLIND (MAB) C.W. WILLIAMS COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER INC. (CWWCHC) UNION COUNTY TRANSPORTATION (UCT) IREDELL COUNTY AREA TRANSIT SYSTEM (ICATS) CENTRALINA COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (CCOG) AND UNIVERSAL INSTITUTE FOR SUCCESSFUL AGING OF CAROLINAS (UISAC).THE CITY OF CHARLOTTE IS A DESIGNATED RECIPIENT FOR THE CHARLOTTE REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION PLANNING ORGANIZATION (CRTPO) AND THE LEAD TRANSIT AGENCY FOR THIS AREA. A MINIMUM OF 55% OF THE SECTION 5310 APPORTIONMENT MUST BE DEDICATED TO TRADITIONAL 5310 ACTIVITIES. THIS APPLICATION MEETS THE 55% REQUIREMENT THROUGH THREE (3) TRADITIONAL PROJECTS; BUS STOP IMPROVEMENTS EXPANSION VAN PURCHASE AND MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROJECTS WHICH ACCOUNT FOR 63.8% OF THE FY2020 APPORTIONMENT. THE MAY 2022 NORTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (NCDOT) STATE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM (STIP) PAGES ARE ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION.

RECIPIENT IS APPLYING FOR FFY20 AND FFY21 SECTION 5310 FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $1055386 FEDERAL / $1483760 TOTAL. FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR ENHANCED MOBILITY OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES PROJECTS FOR THE 2021 AND 2022 GRANT APPLICATION CYCLE. PURPOSE: TO ENHANCE THE SAFETY MAINTENANCE CONVENIENCE AND APPEARANCE OF THE TRANSPORTATION NETWORK IN ORDER TO GIVE MORE PEOPLE MORE CHOICES. THE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT SERVICES SECURED THROUGH THE SECTION 5310 GRANT WILL PROVIDE A SAFE AND CONVENIENT PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION ALTERNATIVE FOR THE SENIOR AND DISABLED POPULATIONS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:PROMOTE AND PERFORM TRAVEL TRAINING PROGRAMS THAT EDUCATE PARTICIPANTS ON TRANSIT SCHEDULES FARES AND THE RIGHTS AND RESPONSIBILITIES OF BOTH THE TRANSIT SYSTEM AND THE RIDERS AND FACILITATE/COORDINATE INDIVIDUALIZED TRAVEL TRAINING AND TRIP PLANNING ACTIVITIES THAT ACCESS/GO ON A FIXED ROUTE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION EXPERIENCE. FUNDS ARE ALSO USED TO PROVIDE COORDINATION AND SCHEDULING OF TRANSPORTATION SERVICES THROUGH SUPPORT AND DELIVERY FROM WAKE COUNTYS TRANSPORTATION PROGRAMS TO ALLOW ELDERLY AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS TO BE ACTIVE PARTICIPANTS IN THEIR COMMUNITY ACTIVITIES SUCH AS EMPLOYMENT VOLUNTEERING CIVIC DUTIES SUCH AS VOTING AND OTHER PERSONAL APPOINTMENTS; TO PROVIDE MILEAGE REIMBURSEMENTS STAFFING TECHNOLOGY AND OVERHEAD COSTS TO SUPPORT AND ENHANCE COORDINATION OF THE DOOR-THROUGH-DOOR VOLUNTEER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR SENIORS AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS IN THE RALEIGH-CARY AND OUTLYING/URBANIZED AREAS OF WAKE COUNTY.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:DEVELOPMENT OF VARIOUS PROGRAMS FOR MOBILITY MANAGEMENT CENTRALIZED DISPATCH INTERACTIVE VOICE RESPONSE DATA TRACKING VOLUNTEER DRIVERS COORDINATION AND TRIP PLANNING TRAVEL TRAINING PROGRAMS FOR THE ELDERLY AND DISABLED AS WELL AS ONE-ON-ONE TRAVEL OF TRANSPORTATION FOR THE ELDERLY AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: FUNDING WILL ALLOW NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS PRIVATE OPERATORS AND PUBLIC AGENCIES TO PROVIDE COORDINATED TRANSPORTATION SERVICES THAT ARE PLANNED DESIGNED AND CARRIED OUT TO MEET THE NEEDS OF ELDERLY PERSONS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:RECIPIENT WILL USE FUNDING FOR FIVE SUBRECIPIENTS TO PROVIDE VARIOUS PROGRAMS FOR MOBILITY MANAGEMENT CENTRALIZED DISPATCH INTERACTIVE VOICE RESPONSE DATA TRACKING VOLUNTEER DRIVERS COORDINATION AND TRIP PLANNING TRAVEL TRAINING PROGRAMS FOR THE ELDERLY AND DISABLED AS WELL AS ONE-ON-ONE TRAVEL OF TRANSPORTATION FOR THE ELDERLY AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS. SUBRECIPIENTS:THE ARC OF THE TRIANGLE: $120694 FEDERAL TOTAL PROJECT COST: $150868THE CENTER FOR VOLUNTEER CAREGIVING: $108637 FEDERAL TOTAL PROJECT COST: $217274 COMMUNITY AND SENIOR SERVICES OF JOHNSTON COUNTY: $260601 TOTAL PROJECT COST $321134GOTRIANGLE: $294140 TOTAL PROJECT COST: $347800PEARL TRANSIT CORPORATION: $175370 TOTAL PROJECT COST $350740FUNDS APPLIED FOR IN THIS APPLICATION ARE CONSIDERED LAPSING AND ARE IDENTIFIED AS FOLLOWS: FFY20 IN THE AMOUNT OF $660518 WITH A LAPSE DATE OF 9/30/22. THE PROJECT BREAKDOWN IS AS FOLLOWS: CAPITAL $675435 (FEDERAL) AND $816802 (TOTAL) OPERATING $284007 (FEDERAL) AND $568014 (TOTAL) ADMINISTRATIVE $95944 (FEDERAL AND TOTAL). RECIPIENT HAS MET (BY 70%) THE MINIMUM 55% REQUIREMENT OF THE 5310 APPORTIONMENT BE DEDICATED TO TRADITIONAL 5310 ACTIVITIES. RECIPIENT WILL NOT REQUEST REIMBURSEMENT FOR INDIRECT COSTS. SUBRECIPIENTS WILL UTILIZE ALLOCATION METHOD TO REQUEST REIMBURSEMENT FOR ELIGIBLE EXPENSES UNDER THE AWARD.THE OVERALL START DATE IS THE GRANT AWARD DATE AND THE END DATE WILL BE 3/30/2029.
