PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO UTILIZE THE SECTION 5310 ARP FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $35019 TO PROVIDE 1 YEAR OF OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO ROWAN COUNTY TRANSIT TO ASSIST IN PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS PAYROLL FUEL AND OTHER ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT ROWAN COUNTY TRANSIT TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE OPERATIONS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ROWAN COUNTY TRANSIT AND THE INDIVIDUALS THAT RELY ON ITS SERVICE WILL BENEFIT FROM CONTINUED SERVICES PROVIDING IMPORTANT ACCESS TO TRANSPORTATION FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: ROWAN COUNTY TRANSIT WILL BE THE SUBRECIPIENT PERFORMING THE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. THE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR OPERATING EXPENSES INCURRED BY ROWAN COUNTY TRANSIT TO PROVIDE THESE SERVICES TO SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES.THE RECIPIENT AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.PER ARP THE PROJECT IN THIS APPLICATION IS NOT REQUIRED TO BE PROGRAMMED IN THE LONG-RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLAN STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION PLAN OR STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM.THE OPERATING EXPENSES REQUESTED IN THIS APPLICATION WERE DETERMINED BY ROWAN TRANSIT BASED ON CURRENT OPERATING EXPENSE ESTIMATES. CITY OF CONCORD AND ROWAN TRANSIT UNDERSTANDS THAT THE EXPENSES REQUESTED IN THIS APPLICATION ARE SUBJECT TO REVIEW FOR THEIR REASONABLENESS AS PART OF THE AGENCYS NEXT TRIENNIAL/STATE MANAGEMENT REVIEW.

PURPOSE: THIS GRANT REQUESTS THE USE OF $318000 SECTION 5310 FUNDS APPORTIONED IN 2020 (POTENTIALLY LAPSING - $216474) AND 2021 ($101256). SECTION 5310 ENHANCED MOBILITY FOR SENIOR AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES GRANT FUNDING WILL BE USED FOR: 1) PURCHASE OF SERVICE FROM A PRIVATELY OWNED TRANSPORTATION PROVIDER (CAPITAL EXPENSE) FOR NON-MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION (WORK SCHOOL SHOPPING) FOR ELDERLY AND DISABLED RESIDENTS IN URBAN AREAS OF CUMBERLAND COUNTY NOT SERVED BY FAYETTEVILLE AREA SYSTEM OF TRANSIT (FAST); AND 2) THE CITY/FASTS ADMINISTRATIVE COSTS TO PROVIDE OVERSIGHT OF SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIESACTIVITIES: PURCHASE OF SERVICE ($300000) FROM A PRIVATELY OWNED TRANSPORTATION PROVIDER (CAPITAL EXPENSE) WILL PROVIDE NON-MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION (WORK SCHOOL SHOPPING) FOR ELDERLY AND DISABLED RESIDENTS OF URBAN AREAS OF CUMBERLAND COUNTY NOT SERVED BY FAYETTEVILLE AREA SYSTEM OF TRANSIT (FAST) FOR FY22-23. THIS PROJECT IS A JOINT-VENTURE BETWEEN THE MID-CAROLINA COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS A PUBLIC NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION AND DESIGNATED AREAWIDE AGING AGENCY AND THE CUMBERLAND COUNTY COMMUNITY TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM (CTP). THE 2021 CUMBERLAND COUNTY COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PLAN (ATTACHED) ADDRESSES A HIGH PRIORITY NEED FOR MORE NON-MEDICAL SERVICES FOR THE ELDERLY AND DISABLED. THESE SERVICES WILL BE PROVIDED TO ELDERLY AND DISABLED POPULATIONS WHO LIVE IN THE URBANIZED AREA AND NOT SERVED BY THE CITY OF FAYETTEVILLES FASTTRAC! COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT OR FIXED ROUTE SERVICES. AS PROVIDED BY CRRSSA THESE SERVICES WILL USE 100% FTA SECTION 5310 FUNDING. THE TRADITIONAL PROJECT WILL COMPRISES 94.3% OF THE PROJECT BUDGET. A PROGRAM OF PROJECTS IS ATTACHED.THIS PROJECT WAS SELECTED BY THE FAYETTEVILLE AREA METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATION (FAMPO) IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE APPROVED PROGRAM MANAGEMENT PLAN. THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM MANAGEMENT PLAN (PMP) WAS APPROVED ON AUGUST 11 2015. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS GRANT PROJECT CONTINUES TO SUPPORT AND EXPAND NEEDED SERVICES WITHIN THE FAYETTEVILLE REGION THAT BENEFIT SENIORS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: CUMBERLAND COUNTY 2020 CENSUS DATA INDICATES 12.2% OF ITS POPULATION IS 65 YEARS OF AGE OR OLDER WITH ANOTHER 12.8% ARE LESS THAN 65 YEARS AND HAVE A DISABILITY.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: SUBRECIPIENT WILL BE THE MID-CAROLINA COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (MCCOG) AND SUPPORTS PURCHASE OF SERVICE FROM PRIVATE PROVIDERS BY THE CUMBERLAND COUNTY COMMUNITY TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM. THE GRANT ALSO INCLUDES $18000 FOR THE CITY OF FAYETTEVILLE-TRANSIT FOR GRANT ADMINISTRATION AND SUBRECIPIENT OVERSIGHT ACTIVITIES.

THIS IS AN FFY 21 SECTION 5310 ASP APPLICATION IN THE AMOUNT OF $46084 REPRESENTING A 100% FEDERAL SHARE OF THE TOTAL ELIGIBLE AMOUNT. THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES ARP FUNDING TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS. THE APPLICATION SCOPE OF WORK INCLUDES THE CAPITAL COST OF CONTRACTING FOR THE CITY OF GREENSBORO. THE CITY OF GREENSBORO AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.THE CITY OF GREENSBORO CERTIFIES THAT IT AND ITS CONTRACTOR THAT ARE PROVIDERS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION HAVE NOT FURLOUGHED ANY EMPLOYEES SINCE MARCH 27 2020 (THE ENACTMENT DATE OF THE ARP ACT).PER ARP THE CAPITAL COST OF CONTRACTING IS NOT REQUIRED TO BE PROGRAMMED IN THE LONG RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLAN STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION PLAN OR STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM.THE CITY OF GREENSBORO IS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT OF FTA SECTION 5310 FUNDS. THE CITY WILL FOLLOW ALL THIRD-PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES DEFINED IN FTA CIRCULAR 4220.1F AND WILL ENSURE THAT CONTRACTORS PROCURED ARE NOT ON THE SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST. THE OPERATIONAL EXPENSES REQUESTED IN THIS APPLICATION WERE DETERMINED BY AN ESTIMATION OF INCREASED OPERATING COSTS BY THE CITYS OPERATIONS CONTRACTOR. THE CITY OF GREENSBORO UNDERSTANDS THAT THE EXPENSES REQUESTED IN THIS APPLICATION ARE SUBJECT TO REVIEW FOR THEIR REASONABLENESS AS PART OF THE CITYS NEXT TRIENNIAL REVIEW.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE THE CITY OF GREENSBORO OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR THE CAPITAL COST OF CONTRACTING TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS. THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE IS JULY 1 2021 TO JUNE 30 2022. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ALL ELIGIBLE EXPENSES ASSOCIATED WITH THE CAPITAL COST OF CONTRACTING IN ORDER TO CONTINUE TRANSIT OPERATIONS FOR THE CITYS PARATRANSIT PROGRAM.EXPECTED OUTCOME: FUNDING WILL ALLOW THE CITY OF GREENSBORO TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SERVICE FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS THAT ARE CERTIFIED AS ELIGIBLE USERS FOR THE CITY ADA PROGRAM.SUBRECEPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

THIS GRANT APPLICATION IS FOR SECTION 5310 - ENHANCED MOBILITY OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES PROGRAM FOR FFY19/20. FTA HAS ANNOUNCED ITS ALLOCATION OF $365651 TO WINSTON-SALEM MPO (WSMPO) IN NORTH CAROLINA. THE WINSTON-SALEM MPO COMPLETED A COMPETITIVE PROCESS FOR SELECTION OF THE SUB-RECIPIENTS FOR THIS GRANT. PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE WINSTON-SALEM URBAN AREAS SUBRECIPIENTS OPERATING AND CAPITAL ASSISTANCE TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS DRIVER SALARIES FUEL ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ETC. IN ORDER TO CONTINUE TRANSIT OPERATIONS. ELIGIBLE TRADITIONAL AND NON-TRADITIONAL SECTION 5310 PROJECT EXAMPLES INCLUDE: ACQUISITION OF TRANSPORTATION SERVICES UNDER A CONTRACT LEASE OR OTHER ARRANGEMENT; TRAVEL TRAINING; VOLUNTEER DRIVER PROGRAMS; INCREMENTAL COSTS FOR PROVIDING SAME DAY OR DOOR-TO-DOOR SERVICE; IMPROVING SIGNAGE AND OTHER WAY-FINDING; AND MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FY2020 5310 FUNDING WILL ALLOW FOR WINSTON-SALEM DOT AND ITS AWARDED SUBRECIPIENTS TO PROVIDE ESSENTIAL TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO OLDER ADULTS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES THAT WOULD OTHERWISE HAVE LITTLE TO NO ACCESS TO TRANSIT AND TRANSPORTATION SERVICES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE WINSTON-SALEM URBAN AREA.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:WINSTON-SALEM MPO SELECTED EIGHT (8) SUB-RECIPIENTS FOR FFY20 FUNDING. THE SELECTED TRADITIONAL PROJECTS INCLUDE THREE (3) PROJECTS FROM NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TWO (2) PROJECTS FROM GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES TWO (2) FOR PROFIT AGENCIES AND ONE (1) PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION AGENCY. ALL PROJECTS ARE DERIVED FROM THE CURRENT HUMAN SERVICES COORDINATED PLAN. NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS:THREE PROJECTS FROM NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS ARE AS FOLLOWS: 1. SHEPHERDS CENTER OF GREATER WINSTON-SALEM WILL USE $112000 IN FEDERAL FUNDS TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO RESPOND TO THE GROWING DEMAND FOR AFFORDABLE RELIABLE AND TIMELY TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND GROCERY SHOPPING ASSISTANCE FOR SENIOR ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE WINSTON-SALEM AND FORSYTH COUNTY AREAS. 2. SHEPHERDS CENTER OF KERNERSVILLE WILL USE $46000 IN FEDERAL FUNDS TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES THAT ARE AFFORDABLE RELIABLE AND TIMELY TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND GROCERY SHOPPING ASSISTANCE FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. 3. THE WORKSHOP OF DAVIDSON INC WILL USE $60000 IN FEDERAL FUNDS TO PROVIDE VOCATIONAL AND LIFE SKILLS TRAINING PROGRAMS FOR ADULTS WITH INTELLECTUAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES. LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES:TWO PROJECTS FROM LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES ARE AS FOLLOWS: 1. TOWN OF KERNERSVILLE WILL USE $36000 IN FEDERAL FUNDS TO PROVIDE SAFE DOOR TO DOOR TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TWICE A WEEK TO SENIORS AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS FOR RECREATIONAL AND SOCIAL ACTIVITIES. 2. DAVIDSON COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF SENIOR SERVICES WILL USE $33600 IN FEDERAL FUNDS TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES ENABLING SENIORS IN THE NORTHERN PORTION OF DAVIDSON COUNTY TO GO TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS NUTRITION SITES AND COMMUNITY SOCIAL ACTIVITIES.FOR-PROFIT AGENCIES:THE TWO FOR-PROFIT AGENCIES BELOW ARE OPERATORS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROVIDING SHARED-RIDE SERVICES AND ARE ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE 5310 FUNDING AS SUBRECIPIENTS AND THEIR PROJECTS WILL BE CONSIDERED AS NON-TRADITIONAL PROJECTS. TWO PROJECTS FROM FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS ARE AS FOLLOWS: 1. HERE-2-THERE WILL USE $55000 IN FEDERAL FUNDS TO PROVIDE UNMET TRANSPORTATION TWENTY-FOUR HOUR SERVICES SEVEN DAYS A WEEK FOR LOW INCOME PERSONS INCLUDING HANDICAPPED AND SENIOR CITIZENS SEEKING QUALITY TRANSPORTATION FOR THEIR MEDICAL AND PERSONAL NEEDS THROUGHOUT THE URBAN AREAS OF FORSYTH COUNTY. 2. SUPPORT SERVICES OF FORSYTH COUNTY WILL USE $22000 IN FEDERAL FUNDS TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS THE PHARMACY THE GROCERY STORE EDUCATION AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES. PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROVIDER:ONE PROJECT FROM A PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROVIDER IS AS FOLLOWS:1. THE WINSTON-SALEM TRANSIT AUTHORITY WILL USE $1051 IN FEDERAL FUNDS TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR SENIORS AND ELDERLY INDIVIDUALS AS NEEDED TO MEET TRANSPORTATION GAPS.ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION ARE THE FOLLOWING DOCUMENTS: NCDOT STIP PAGE WITH PROGRAMMED ACTIVITIES PROGRAM OF PROJECTS DOCUMENT DEMONSTRATING THAT 55 PERCENT OR MORE OF FUNDING WILL BE SPENT ON TRADITIONAL 5310 PROJECTS THE HUMAN SERVICES COORDINATION PLAN FOR COMPLIANCE AND THE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT PLAN FOR THE WINSTON-SALEM URBAN AREA. OF THE 5310 PROJECTS MENTIONED 75% (6/8) ARE TRADITIONAL WHILE THE TWO NON-PROFIT AGENCIES CONFIRMED AS OPERATORS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROVIDING SHARED-RIDE SERVICES ARE ELIGIBLE SUBRECIPIENTS OF 5310 FUNDING AND WILL BE CARRYING OUT NON-TRADITIONAL PROJECTS.

THE CITY OF ASHEVILLE IS APPLYING FOR THE FFY2020 SECTION 5310 FUNDS FOR $346676 THAT WILL BE USED IN FUNDING TRADITIONAL AND NON-TRADITIONAL PROJECTS AWARDED THROUGH THE ANNUAL CALL OF PROJECTS (FY2020) MANAGED BY THE FRENCH BROAD RIVER METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATION (FBRMPO). THE PROJECTS ARE LOCATED IN THE ASHEVILLE URBANIZED AREA (AUZA). PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE 2 YEARS OF OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO THE CITY OF ASHEVILLE AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS FOR TRANSIT OPERATIONS AND IMPLEMENT CAPITAL PROJECTS IN THE ASHEVILLE URBANIZED AREA. THE AWARDS WILL BE USED AS FOLLOWS: TRADITION (CAPITAL) PROJECTS: - USE BY THE CITY OF ASHEVILLE FOR ADA PARATRANSIT SERVICE FOR THE AMOUNT OF $102787 - USE BY BUNCOMBE COUNTY FOR THE SUPPLEMENTAL ELDERLY AND DISABLED TRANSPORTATION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (SEDTAP) TRANSPORTATION SERVICE FOR PEOPLE OF DISABILITIES AND THE ELDERLY FOR $102787. NON-TRADITIONAL (OTHER) PROJECTS: - USE BY BUNCOMBE COUNTY FOR THE RIDERSHIP INDEPENDENCE FOR THE DISABLED AND ELDERLY (RIDE) VOUCHER PROGRAM FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND THE ELDERLY FOR $20112. - UTILIZE BY LAND OF SKY FOR THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM FOR $42838 - USE BY MADISON COUNTY FOR THE EXPANDED NUTRITION ACCESS PROGRAM FOR $26058. - UTILIZE BY MADISON COUNTY FOR THE EXPANDED TRANSPORTATION SERVICE TO MARS HILL $17426. PROGRAM SUPPORT AND ADMINISTRATION: - USE BY THE CITY OF ASHEVILLE FOR PROGRAM SUPPORT AND ADMINISTRATION FOR $34688ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ALL ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS DRIVER SALARIES FUEL TRANSPORTATION AND NUTRITION PROGRAMS FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND THE ELDERLY ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR AND CAPITAL PROJECTS ETC TO CONTINUE TRANSIT OPERATIONS. FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED FOR PROGRAM SUPPORT AND ADMINISTRATION. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING AWARDED WILL PERMIT THE CITY OF ASHEVILLE AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS TO CONTINUE PROVIDING TRANSIT OPERATIONS IN THE ASHEVILLE URBANIZED AREA BUNCOMBE AND MADISON COUNTIES TO OFFER TRANSIT SERVICE FOR PASSENGERS TO COMMUTE TO AND FROM WORK MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AT A VARIETY OF MEDICAL FACILITIES AND PARTICIPATE IN SOCIAL AND CULTURAL EVENTS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE CITY OF ASHEVILLE ITS SUBRECIPIENTS AND THEIR RIDERS THAT RELY ON PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICES IN THE ASHEVILLE UZA AND BUNCOMBE COUNTY WILL BENEFIT FROM CONTINUED SERVICE THAT WILL ENABLE WORKERS TO GET TO AND FROM WORK AND PARTICIPATE IN SOCIAL AND CULTURAL EVENTS AS WELL AS TRAVEL TO AND FROM MEDICAL FACILITIES FOR MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS. SUBRECIPIENTS ACTIVITIES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT BUNCOMBE AND MADISON COUNTIES TO CONTINUE OFFERING TRANSIT OPERATIONS TO RIDERS THAT UTILIZE TRANSPORTATION AND NUTRITION SERVICES PROVIDED IN THESE COMMUNITIES AS WELL AS USE THESE SERVICES FOR MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS ATTEND SOCIAL EVENTS AND COMMUTE TO AND FROM WORK. IT WILL ALSO ENABLE LAND OF SKY TO OFFER SERVICES TO CLIENTS THAT PARTICIPATE IN THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IN THE ASHEVILLE UZA.THE TOTAL FEDERAL SHARE REQUESTED IS $346676 AND THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE IS FROM JULY 1 2021 TO JUNE 30 2023.ALL PROJECTS ARE DERIVED FROM THE COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT-HUMAN SERVICE TRANSPORTATION PLAN AND ARE LISTED ON PAGES 38 THROUGH 54. PROJECTS SELECTED ARE PART OF THE OVERALL PROJECT RECOMMENDATIONS LISTED ON PAGES 33 AND 34 AND BROKEN DOWN BY COUNTY ON PAGE 35.OVERALL AWARD START DATE IS THE GRANT AWARD DATE AND THE END DATE IS MARCH 30 2025.ALL PROJECTS ARE PROGRAMMED IN THE NCDOT 2020-2029 STATE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM (STIP) APPROVED IN OCTOBER 2021. THE STIP ID # FOR THE 5310 PROJECTS IN THE STIP IS AS FOLLOWS: TQ-6186 FOR THE 5310 TRADITIONAL PROJECTS TQ-6187 FOR 5310 OTHER PROJECTS AND TQ-7010 FOR PROGRAM SUPPORT AND ADMINISTRATION. ALL THE PROJECTS STIP ID NUMBERS ARE LISTED ON PAGE 20 OF 26 AND ATTACHED IN APPLICATION DOCUMENTS.FREQUENCY OF MILESTONE PROGRESS REPORTS (MPR)ANNUALFREQUENCY OF FEDERAL FINANCIAL REPORTS (FFR)ANNUAL

THESE PROJECTS INCLUDE FUNDS REQUESTED FOR OPERATIONS AND PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION WITH NO SUBSTANTIAL FUNCTIONAL LOCATION OR CAPACITY CHANGE. APPLICATION EXECUTIVE SUMMARYTHIS GRANT REQUESTS THE USE OF $296400 SECTION 5310 FUNDS APPORTIONED IN 2019 (POTENTIALLY LAPSING - $236624) AND 2020 ($59776). SECTION 5310 ENHANCED MOBILITY FOR SENIOR AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES GRANT FUNDING WILL BE USED FOR: 1) PURCHASE OF SERVICE FROM A PRIVATELY OWNED TRANSPORTATION PROVIDER (CAPITAL EXPENSE) FOR NON-MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION (WORK SCHOOL SHOPPING) FOR ELDERLY AND DISABLED RESIDENTS IN URBAN AREAS OF CUMBERLAND COUNTY NOT SERVED BY FAYETTEVILLE AREA SYSTEM OF TRANSIT (FAST); AND 2) CONSTRUCTION OF ACCESSIBLE BUS STOPS AND BUS SHELTERS FOR URBAN AREAS OF HOKE COUNTY.PURCHASE OF SERVICE ($200000) FROM A PRIVATELY OWNED TRANSPORTATION PROVIDER (CAPITAL EXPENSE) WILL PROVIDE NON-MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION (WORK SCHOOL SHOPPING) FOR ELDERLY AND DISABLED RESIDENTS OF URBAN AREAS OF CUMBERLAND COUNTY NOT SERVED BY FAYETTEVILLE AREA SYSTEM OF TRANSIT (FAST) FOR FY21-22. THIS PROJECT IS A JOINT-VENTURE BETWEEN THE MID-CAROLINA COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS A PUBLIC NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION AND DESIGNATED AREAWIDE AGING AGENCY AND THE CUMBERLAND COUNTY COMMUNITY TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM (CTP). THE 2013 CUMBERLAND COUNTY COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PLAN ADDRESSES A HIGH PRIORITY NEED FOR MORE NON-MEDICAL SERVICES FOR THE ELDERLY AND DISABLED. THESE SERVICES WILL BE PROVIDED TO ELDERLY AND DISABLED POPULATIONS WHO LIVE IN THE URBANIZED AREA AND NOT SERVED BY THE CITY OF FAYETTEVILLES FASTTRAC! COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT OR FIXED ROUTE SERVICES. AS PROVIDED BY CRRSSA THESE SERVICES WILL USE 100% FTA SECTION 5310 FUNDING. THE TRADITIONAL PROJECT WILL COMPRISE 67.5% OF THE PROJECT BUDGET.THE SECOND PROJECT WILL HELP CONSTRUCT BUS STOPS AND SHELTERS ALONG PLANNED ROUTES FOR HOKE COUNTYS DEVIATED FIXED ROUTE BUS SYSTEM. THIS PROJECT WILL USE $81400 80% FTA SECTION 5310 FUNDING. THESE PROJECTS WERE SELECTED BY COMPETITIVE PROCESSES CONDUCTED BY THE FAYETTEVILLE AREA METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATION (FAMPO) IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE APPROVED PROGRAM MANAGEMENT PLAN. THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM MANAGEMENT PLAN (PMP) WAS APPROVED ON AUGUST 11 2015. SUB-RECIPIENTS WILL BE THE MID-CAROLINA COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (MCCOG) AND HOKE COUNTY. THE GRANT ALSO INCLUDES $15000 FOR THE CITY OF FAYETTEVILLE-TRANSIT FOR GRANT ADMINISTRATION AND SUB-RECIPIENT OVERSIGHT ACTIVITIES.

THIS GRANT IS FOR SECTION 5310 ENHANCED MOBILITY FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $277537.THE CITY OF GREENSBORO IS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT FOR FY 2021 FTA SECTION 5310 FUNDS. GUILFORD COUNTY TRANSPORTATION AND MOBILITY SERVICES (TAMS) IS A SUB-RECIPIENT UNDER THIS GRANT. ALL PROJECTS UNDER THIS GRANT ARE DERIVED FROM THE COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES PLAN ADOPTED JUNE 26 2019. THE CITY OF GREENSBOROS PROJECT IS A TRADITIONAL CAPITAL 5310 PROJECT AND COMPRISES 77.4% OF FEDERAL FY20 FTA SECTION 5310 FUNDING (55% OF SECTION 5310 FUNDING MUST BE ALLOCATED TO TRADITIONAL PROJECTS). GUILFORD COUNTYS PROJECT IS A NON-TRADITIONAL 5310 PROJECT AND COMPRISES 12.6% OF FEDERAL FY20 FTA SECTION 5310 FUNDING (UP TO 45% OF SECTION 5310 FUNDING CAN BE ALLOCATED TO NON-TRADITIONAL PROJECTS). THE REMAINING 10% OF FY20 SECTION 5310 FUNDING IS ALLOCATED TO PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION.THIS REQUEST IS NOT BEING USED FOR RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT AND THE CITY WILL NOT BE APPLYING INDIRECT COST RATE TO ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS GRANT. THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE FOR ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS GRANT IS DATE OF GRANT AWARD TO MARCH 30 2026.THE CITY OF GREENSBORO WILL FOLLOW ALL THIRD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE). THE CITY OF GREENSBORO WILL ENSURE THAT CONTRACTORS PROCURED ARE NOT ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST.

THE CITY OF CONCORD IS APPLYING FOR THE REMAINING LAPSING FFY19 FUNDS OF $26066 AND FFY20 FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $142928 FOR A TOTAL GRANT APPLICATION AMOUNT OF $168994. THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT A TRADITIONAL PROJECT (55% OF TOTAL APPLICATION) AND A NON-TRADITIONAL PROJECT (35% OF TOTAL APPLICATION) FROM CABARRUS COUNTY TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. THESE PROJECTS WILL USE 10% OF THESE FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $16899 FOR PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION. CABARRUS COUNTYS TRADITIONAL PROJECT WILL BE USING 55% OF THE FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $92947. CABARRUS COUNTYS NON-TRADITIONAL PROJECT WILL BE USING 35% OF THESE FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $59148. THE PROJECT START DATE FOR THESE SERVICES WILL BE THE GRANT AWARD DATE. THE ENDING DATE IS PROJECTED TO BE MARCH 30 2026 OR WHEN THE GRANT FUNDS HAVE BEEN EXHAUSTED. THE CITY OF CONCORD IS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT OF FTA FUNDS IN THE CONCORD UZA. THIS GRANT WILL BE IN SUPPORT OF THE FTA 5310 ENHANCED MOBILITY FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES PROGRAM BY PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO THE TARGET POPULATION. THE NEED FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TRANSPORTATION IS ADDRESSED IN THE LOCALLY COORDINATED TRANSPORTATION PLAN TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES POPULATION WITHIN THE CONCORD UZA.

THIS BUDGET REVISION IS TO EXTEND THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE TO MARCH 30 2023. TMM 05/17/2021THIS GRANT APPLICATION IS FOR SECTION 5310- ENHANCED MOBILITY OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES FOR FY 2018. FTA HAS ANNOUNCED ITS ALLOCATION OF FY 2018 FUNDING FOR THE WINSTON-SALEM MPO (WSMPO) IN NORTH CAROLINA. WSMPO COMPLETED A COMPETITIVE PROCESS FOR SELECTION OF THE SUB-RECIPIENTS FOR THE GRANT. WSMPO SELECTED 5 RECIPIENTS FOR FY 2018 FTA FUNDING FOR $357368. THESE SELECTED PROJECTS INCLUDE PROJECTS FROM 3 NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS 1 GOVERNMENT AGENCY AND 1 PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROVIDER. THE PROJECTS FOR FY 2018 FUNDING INCLUDE: NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS: THE SELECTED NONPROFIT #1 (THE ENRICHMENT CENTER): FOR $10000 FOR THE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR ADULTS AND SENIORS WITH INTELLECTUAL AND DEVELOPMENT DISABILITIES. THESE SERVICES GRANT ACCESS TO COMMUNITY ACTIVITIES THAT OTHERWISE WOULD NOT BE AVAILABLE. THE SELECTED NONPROFIT #2 (THE SHEPHERD CENTER): FOR $155000 FOR TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR OLDER ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE WINSTON-SALEM AND FORYSTH COUNTY SERVICE AREAS. THE EXPANDED SERVICES WILL ADDRESS THE INCREASING DEMAND FOR TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND GROCERY SHOPPING ASSISTANCE.THE SELECTED NONPROFIT #3 (WAKE FOREST BAPTIST-DOWNTOWN HEALTH PLAZA): FOR $8905 FOR TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO SENIOR CITIZENS AND/OR DISABLED PATIENTS NEEDING ACCESS TO CLINIC. GOVERNMENT AGENCY: THE SELECTED GOVERNMENT AGENCY (TOWN OF KERNERSVILLE): FOR $45000 FOR THE DOOR TO DOOR TRANSPORTATION SERVICE FOR SENIOR CITIZENS AND THOSE PERSONS DISABLED. THIS SERVICE IS PROVIDED TWICE A WEEK FOR SHOPPING DINING RECREATIONAL AND SOCIAL ACTIVITIES THAT OTHERWISE MAY NOT BE PROVIDED DUE TO LIMITED MOBILITY OPTIONS. PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROVIDER: THE SELECTED PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROVIDER (WINSTON-SALEM TRANSIT AUTHORITY): FOR $138463 TO SUPPLEMENT THE TRANSIT AUTHORITYS TITLE III PARATRANSIT SERVICE. THESE INCLUDE MEDICAL AND TRANSPORTATION TRIPS FOR THOSE PERSONS 60 YEARS AND OLDER.

THIS GRANT IS SECTION 5310 - ENHANCED MOBILITY OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES PROGRAM FOR FY13-14. FTA HAS ANNOUNCED TO ALLOCATE $337462 TO WINSTON-SALEM MPO (WSMPO) IN NORTH CAROLINA. IT IS NOT REQUIRED UNDER MAP-21 BUT WSMPO HAD CHOSEN TO DO THE COMPETITIVE PROCESS FOR SUBRECIPIENT SELECTION FOR THE GRANT. WSMPO CHOSE EIGHT (8) PROJECTS INCLUDING FOUR PROJECTS FROM NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TWO PROJECTS FROM FOR-PROFIT COMPANIES AND TWO PROJECTS FROM GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES.FOUR PROJECTS FROM NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS ARE AS FOLLOWS.1. HANDSON NORTHWEST NC WILL UTILIZE $69342 TO FUND RECRUITMENT OF 80 VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL DELIVER MEALS AND PROVIDE MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION FOR ELDERLY AND DISABLED PERSONS. THE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO REIMBURSE APPROXIMATELY 400 ACTIVE SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WHO PROVIDE THE SERVICES.2. SHEPHERDS CENTER SEEKS $103000 TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO RESPOND TO THE GROWING DEMAND FOR AFFORDABLE RELIABLE AND TIMELY TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND GROCERY SHOPPING ASSISTANCE FROM OLDER ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES IN FORSYTH COUNTY NC.3. ENRICHMENT CENTER WILL USE $10000 FOR TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR INCLUSIVE COMMUNITY OUTINGS FOR ADULTS AND SENIORS WITH INTELLECTUAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES IN WINSTON-SALEM.4. WAKE FOREST BAPTIST HEALTH WILL UTILIZE $32400 TO OFFER TRANSPORTATION TO DOWNTOWN HEALTH PLAZA PATIENTS OF AGE 65 OR OLDER AND/OR DISABLED PATIENTS NEEDING UNSCHEDULED CLINIC ACCESS.TWO PROJECTS FROM FOR-PROFIT COMPANIES ARE DESCRIBED BELOW.1. GROMEDS INC. SEEKS $39280 TO RUN A SERVICE FOR SENIORS AND DISABLED POPULATIONS FOR MEDICAL AND SOCIAL APPOINTMENTS AND OTHER CRITICAL NEEDS.2. HERE 2 THERE VAN SERVICE INC. WILL UTILIZE $25000 TO PROVIDE TRANSPORT DISABLED POPULATION FOR INDUSTRIE FOR THE BLIND.TWO PROJECTS FROM LOCAL GOVERNMENT ARE FOLLOWING:1. FORSYTH COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF SOCIAL SERVICES WILL USE $30440 TO PROVIDE SERVCES TO THE ELDERLY AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES FOR TRANSPORTATION NEEDS TO DOCTORS APPOINTMENTS GROCEY SHOPPING AND OTHER ERRANDS.2. TOWN OF KERNERSVILLE WILL SPEND $28000 TO OPERATE A SENIOR SHUTTLE SERVICE TWO DAYS A WEEK.PLEASE REFER THE FOLLOWING DOCUMENTS ATTACHED:WINSTON-SALEM_FY2014_SECTION5310_POP.PDFHUMAN_SERVCIES_COORDINATED_PLAN_2008_UPDATED2010.PDFTAC_RESOLUTIONFY14_SECTION5310_SEP2014.PDF2014LEGALAD_FOR_WSDOT_JARC_SECTION5310_AND_WORKSHOP.PDFPMP_MAP21 COMPLIANT_FINAL_MARCH2014.PDFSTIPAMND21_JUNE2014_SIGNED.PDFLETTERTO_NC_GOV_JARCSECTION5310_FY13_14.PDFNC_GOVERNOR_LETTER_DESIGNATED_RECIPIENT_WISTONSALEM_SECTION5307_JUNE2014.PDF

HANDSON NORTHWEST NC WILL UTILIZE $55000 TO FUND RECRUITMENT OF 80 VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL DELIVER MEALS AND PROVIDE MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION FOR ELDERLY AND DISABLED PERSONS. THE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO REIMBURSE APPROXIMATELY 400 ACTIVE SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WHO PROVIDE THE SERVICES.2. SHEPHERDS CENTER SEEKS $145700 TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO RESPOND TO THE GROWING DEMAND FOR AFFORDABLE RELIABLE AND TIMELY TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND GROCERY SHOPPING ASSISTANCE FROM OLDER ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES IN FORSYTH COUNTY NC.3. ENRICHMENT CENTER WILL USE $10000 FOR TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR INCLUSIVE COMMUNITY OUTINGS FOR ADULTS AND SENIORS WITH INTELLECTUAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES IN WINSTON-SALEM.THREE PROJECTS FROM FOR-PROFIT COMPANIES ARE DESCRIBED BELOW.1. NEPAT INC. WILL USE $27500 TO PROVIDE AFTER HOURS WEEKEND AND HOLIDAYS TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO INDIVIDUALS WHO REQUIRE WHEELCHAIR AND SPECIAL NEEDS. 2. GROMEDS INC. SEEKS $13750 TO RUN A SERVICE FOR DISABLED VETERANS TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS OR EMPLOYMENT LOCATIONS.3. HERE 2 THERE VAN SERVICE INC. WILL UTILIZE $16250 TO PROVIDE AN AFFORDABLE DOOR-TO-DOOR TRANSPORTATION SERVICE FOR SENIORS AND DISABLED POPULATION. THEY ARE ALL WHEELCHAIRS ACCESSIBLE AND ACCOMMODATE OXYGEN EQUIPMENT AND SERVICE ANIMALS.ADMINISTRATIVE COST FOR WSDOT:WINSTON-SALEM DOT WILL USE $29763 AS ADMINISTRATIVE COST TO PLAN SUPERVISE MONITOR THE SECTION 5310 GRANT. APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE THE MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS OPERATING ASSISTANCE AND CAPITAL FUNDING TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS CLASSIFIED AS SENIORS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS DRIVER SALARIES FUEL ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR AND PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE IN ORDER TO CONTINUE SERVICE FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS CLASSIFIED AS SENIORS. FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED FOR ELIGIBLE CAPITAL INVESTMENT INCLUDING THE CONTINUED EMPLOYMENT OF A MOBILITY MANAGER AND THE PURCHASE OF SERVICES FROM PUBLIC AND PRIVATE NONPROFIT TRANSIT PROVIDERS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT THE MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SERVICE FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS CLASSIFIED AS SENIORS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS CLASSIFIED AS SENIORS IN THE STATES RURAL SMALL URBAN AREAS AND LARGE URBAN AREAS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENTS WILL RECEIVE OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO MAINTAIN SERVICES: JACKSON MEDICAL MALL FOUNDATION SINGING RIVER HOSPITAL HEALTH SYSTEM SOUTH CENTRAL COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY AND TIMBER HILL REGION IV MENTAL HEALTH. THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENTS WILL RECEIVE CAPITAL FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT: MISSISSIPPI CHRISTIAN FAMILY SERVICES; QUALITY MENTAL HEALTH (D/B/A LIFE HELP); PINE BELT MENTAL HEALTHCARE RESOURCES; REGION ONE MENTAL HEALTH; WARREN YAZOO MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES; NATCHEZ SENIOR CITIZEN MULTI-PURPOSE CENTER; WILLOWOOD DEVELOPMENT CENTER; TIMBER HILLS REGION IV MENTAL HEALTH; JACKSON MEDICAL MALL FOUNDATION; SINGING RIVER HOSPITAL HEALTH SYSTEM; HINDS BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES REGION IX.

STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.PER THE ARPA THE PROJECT(S) IN THIS APPLICATION IS NOT REQUIRED TO BE PROGRAMMED IN THE LONG-RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLAN STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION PLAN OR STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM.MDOT AND ITS SUB-RECIPIENTS (WHEN APPLICABLE) WILL FOLLOW ALL 3RD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE). MDOT AND ITS SUB-RECIPIENTS (WHEN APPLICABLE) WILL ENSURE CONTRACTORS PROCURED WILL NOT BE ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST.THE OPERATIONAL EXPENSES REQUESTED IN THIS APPLICATION WERE DETERMINED BY MDOT. THE MDOT UNDERSTANDS THAT THE EXPENSES REQUESTED IN THIS APPLICATION ARE SUBJECT TO REVIEW FOR THEIR REASONABLENESS AS PART OF THE AGENCYS NEXT TRIENNIAL/STATE MANAGEMENT REVIEW.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE THE MISSISSIPPI DOT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO COVID-19 WHILE PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS CLASSIFIED AS SENIORS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS DRIVER SALARIES FUEL ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ETC. IN ORDER TO CONTINUE TRANSIT OPERATIONS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT THE MISSISSIPPI DOT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SERVICE FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS CLASSIFIED AS SENIORS THAT WOULD OTHERWISE HAVE TO BE CUT DUE TO LACK OF FUNDING. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS CLASSIFIED AS SENIORS IN THE STATES RURAL SMALL URBAN AREAS AND LARGE URBAN AREAS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENTS WILL RECEIVE OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO MAINTAIN SERVICES: TIMBER HILLS REGION IV MENTAL HEALTH TRANSPORTATION; WILLOWOOD DEVELOPMENT CENTER TRANSPORTATION; SINGING RIVER HEALTH SYSTEM TRANSPORTATION; PINEBELT MENTAL HEALTH TRANSPORTATION; COMMUNITY ACTION OF SOUTH MS TRANSPORTATION; CITY OF OXFORD CITY/COUNTY TRANSIT; WARREN YAZOO MENTAL HEALTH TRANSPORTATION; EAST CENTRAL PDD; NORTH CENTRAL PDD; HARRISON COUNTY HUMAN RESOURCE AGENCY; ALCORN COUNTY HUMAN RESOURCE AGENCY; CLIMB-UP REGION III TRANSPORTATION; QUALITY MENTAL HEALTH TRANSPORTATION; ROSE HILL COMMUNITY CENTER; YAZOO COUNTY HUMAN RESOURCE AGENCY; THREE RIVERS PDDAS REQUIRED BY THE 5310 PROGRAM GUIDANCE THE MDOT DOES HEREBY CERTIFY THAT ALL SECTION 5310 PROJECTS THAT WILL BE FUNDED THROUGH THE ATTACHED PROGRAM OF PROJECTS WERE DEVELOPED THROUGH A REGIONAL COORDINATED PLANNING PROCESS. THIS PROCESS INCLUDED COMMUNITY PLANNING AND OUTREACH SESSIONS REGIONAL COORDINATION GROUP MEETINGS AND WORKSHOPS ALONG WITH A STATEWIDE COORDINATION SUMMIT. CONSEQUENTLY MDOT ALSO CERTIFIES THAT THESE PROJECTS ARE DERIVED FROM STRATEGIES INCLUDED IN THE VARIOUS REGIONAL PLANS AND THE STATEWIDE COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT-HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN. THESE STRATEGIES CAN BE FOUND ON PAGES 2-5 OF CHAPTER VII OF THE CURRENT STATEWIDE PLAN. THIS PLAN WAS DEVELOPED WITH THE COOPERATION AND INPUT FROM THE REGIONAL COORDINATION GROUPS. IT WAS ADOPTED BY THE MISSISSIPPI TRANSPORTATION COMMISSION ON JUNE 26 2007. THIS STATEWIDE PLAN WAS DEVELOPED THROUGH A COORDINATED PLANNING PROCESS THAT MEETS THE REQUIREMENTS OF AND IS CONSISTENT WITH THE GUIDANCE CONTAINED IN CHAPTER IV OF FTA CIRCULAR 9070.1G.

MARCH 25 2022THIS APPLICATION WILL APPLY FOR FY2021 AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN (ARPA) 5310 FUNDS IN THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF $60306 (100% FEDERAL). $38267 FEDERAL - GULFPORT UZA $22039 FEDERAL - PASCAGOULA UZA THESE FUNDS WILL BE FOR THE REIMBURSEMENT FOR PM EXPENSES INCURRED PROVIDING DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICE FOR SENIORS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES THAT EXCEED THE ADA MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS DURING THE REMAINDER OF FY2022 (APRIL 2022 - SEPTEMBER 2022). AT THE TIME OF THIS GRANT APPLICATION CTA DOES NOT ANTICIPATE REPLACING ANY PARTS COSTING OVER $5000. IF DURING THE YEAR A VEHICLE NEEDS ENGINE OR TRANSMISSION REPLACEMENT (OR OTHER PARTS MEETING THE THRESHOLD) A DESCRIPTION INCLUDING THE USEFUL LIFE OF THE PART(S) WILL BE IDENTIFIED IN THIS EXTENDED BUDGET DESCRIPTION.CTA CERTIFIES THAT IT AND ITS SUB-RECIPIENTS AND CONTRACTORS THAT ARE PROVIDERS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION HAVE NOT FURLOUGHED ANY EMPLOYEES SINCE MARCH 27 2020 (THE ENACTMENT DATE OF THE CARES ACT). COAST TRANSIT AUTHORITY MEETS THE REQUIRED 55 PERCENT CAPITAL TRADITIONAL SECTION 5310 PROJECTS BY APPLYING 100% ($60306 FEDERAL) OF THE ALLOCATION TO NEW FREEDOM PROJECT ALI 11.7A.00 FOR A PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE. CTA MEETS THE REQUIREMENTS IN FTA C 9070 THAT RECIPIENTS OF SECTION 5310 FUNDS ARE INCLUDED IN A LOCALLY DEVELOPED COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT-HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN. CTA CERTIFIES THAT THE CTA 5310 PROJECT MEETS THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES CONTAINED IN THE SOUTHERN CONNECT REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION COORDINATION ORGANIZATION PLAN. THE PLAN WAS DEVELOPED AND APPROVED THROUGH A PROCESS THAT INCLUDED PARTICIPATION BY SENIORS; INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES; REPRESENTATIVES OF PUBLIC PRIVATE AND NONPROFIT TRANSPORTATION AND HUMAN SERVICE PROVIDERS; AND OTHER MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC. THESE FUNDS WERE PROGRAMMED IN THE FY2019-2022 STIP (SEE ATTACHED).THERE ARE NO LOCAL MATCH FUNDS REQUIRED. THESE FUNDS ARE 100% FEDERAL. AUTHORITY IS A DIRECT RECIPIENT OF THE GULFPORT UZA FUNDS. AUTHORITY IS A DESIGNATED RECIPIENT OF THE PASCAGOULA UZA FUNDS (SEE ATTACHED SPLIT LETTER). FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED WITH THIS GRANT ARE TO CONTINUE TO EXECUTE THE DEMAND-RESPONSIVE SHARED-RIDE SERVICE WHILE ALSO RESURRECTING THE FIXED-FLEX ROUTE ON THE ISLAND OF SAIPAN CNMI. OTHER ACTIVITIES INCLUDE RESPONDING TO CORONAVIRUS SUCH AS VACCINATION TRANSPORTS QUARANTINE TRANSPORTS ETC.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE TO PROVIDE ALTERNATE FORMS OF TRANSPORTATION AND PROVIDE ACCESSIBILITY INTO OUR COMMUNITY - MOST ESPECIALLY FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES THE ELDERLY AND PEOPLE WITH MEDICAL CONDITIONS AND REDUCE THE SPREAD OF CORONAVIRUS IN THE CNMI COMMUNITY.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE CNMI COMMUNITY; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: COTA DOES NOT HAVE ANY SUB-RECIPIENTS AND DOES NOT INTEND TO SUB-AWARD FUNDS.

FTA-C-CAM (COORDINATING COUNCIL ON ACCESS AND MOBILITY) GRANT AWARDEE: SPECIAL PROJECTS: CCAM-DISCRETIONARY FUNDS THE COORDINATING COUNCIL ON ACCESS AND MOBILITY PILOT PROGRAM (C-CAM) AND HUMAN SERVICES COORDINATION RESEARCH (HSCR) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ARE AUTHORIZED UNDER SECTION 3006 (B) OF THE FIXING AMERICAS SURFACE TRANSPORTATION (FAST) ACT (PUB. L. 114-94 DEC. 4 2015) C-CAM FUNDING WILL SUPPORT CAPITAL PROJECTS THAT ADDRESS THE CHALLENGES THE TRANSPORTATION DISADVANTAGED FACE WHEN ADDRESSING HEALTHCARE TO INCREASE ACCESS TO CARE IMPROVE HEALTH OUTCOMES AND REDUCE HEALTHCARE COST WHICH IS THE MISSION OF HEALTHTRAN. HSCR FUNDING SUPPORTS OPERATING AND CAPITAL PROJECTS THAT BUILD UPON IDENTIFIED GAPS IN SERVICES TO IMPROVE SERVICES. SUPPORTING NEW MOBILITY TOOLS IMPROVE MULTI-MODEL CONNECTIVITY ADDRESS ACCESSIBILITY THROUGH TECHNOLOGY IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF THE RIDER EXPERIENCE AND IDENTIFY NEW PRACTICES AND TECHNOLOGY. HEALTHTRAN ADDRESS ALL POINTS OF THE HSCR GOALS THROUGH THE MODEL.MISSOURI RURAL HEALTH ASSOCIATION (MRHA) AGREES THAT IT WILL OPERATE THIS GRANT AS A PILOT FOR UP TO 18 MONTHS FROM THE INITIAL FEDERAL REIMBURSEMENT OF EXPENSES UNDER THIS AWARD. MRHA AGREES TO DEVELOP AN EVALUATION PLAN WITH PERFORMANCE MEASURES OF THE SUCCESS OR FAILURE OF THEIR PROJECT AND DESCRIBE ANY PLANS FOR BROAD-BASED IMPLEMENTATION OF SUCCESSFUL PROJECTS. FTA THROUGH THE NATIONAL AGING AND DISABILITY TRANSPORTATION CENTER WILL REQUEST QUARTERLY DATA REPORTS AND A FINAL REPORT ON THESE PERFORMANCE MEASURES AND PROJECT OUTCOMES. MRHA ACKNOWLEDGES THE RESPONSIBILITY OF PROVIDING QUARTERLY PERFORMANCE MEASURE TRACKING TO NADTC AS WELL AS REQUIRED TRAMS REPORTS AND PROVIDE A FINAL REPORT ONCE ALL ACTIVITIES ARE COMPLETED.PURPOSE: HEALTHTRAN WILL SUPPORT RURAL COMMUNITIES IN IMPROVING HEALTH STATUS THROUGH EDUCATION TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE SERVICE COORDINATION AND MOBILITY MANAGEMENT TO INCREASE TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS SERVICE AND ACCESS. ACTIVITIES: PERFORMANCE MEASURESMRHA WILL WORK WITH UNIVERSITY OF MISSOURI AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS INCLUDING NATIONAL CENTER FOR MOBILITY MANAGEMENT/EASTERSEALS PROJECT ACTION NADTC AND MOBILITY MANAGERS TO IMPLEMENT A MOBILITY MANAGEMENT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE CENTER HOUSED WITHIN THE MISSOURI RURAL HEALTH ASSOC. WEBSITE. BUILDING UPON THE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT CERTIFICATE DEVELOPED THROUGH ICAM FUNDING A MOBILITY MANAGEMENT CERTIFICATION PROCESS WILL BE DESIGNED TO BUILD AND EXPAND THE SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE OF MOBILITY MANAGERS. MRHA WILL PROVIDE RURAL TRANSPORTATION COORDINATION EFFORTS TO RURAL COMMUNITIES AND/OR HEALTH ENTITIES TO ENHANCE ACCESS TO HEALTH AND WELLNESS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THROUGH THE TECHNICAL CENTER AND DEVELOPMENT OF THE CERTIFICATION MRHA EXPECTS TO INCREASE THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS RELATED TO MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND COORDINATION. INCREASING AWARENESS AND ADVOCACY OF TRANSPORTATION NEED PROVIDING RESOURCES OFFERING NETWORKING AND SUPPORT AND PROVIDING TOOLS TO ADDRESS SOLUTIONS AND INCREASE AND/OR IMPROVE TRANSIT OPTIONS TO REDUCE THE ACCESS BARRIER TO HEALTH AND WELLNESS. BUILDING A CERTIFICATION PROGRAM WILL MOVE MISSOURI FORWARD IN MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND PROVIDE A SKILLED WORKFORCE TO BEGIN ADDRESSING TRANSPORTATION BARRIERS ACROSS THE STATE. IN ADDITION TRAINING AND RECOGNITION FOR MOBILITY MANAGERS AND THOSE WHO WORK ON TRANSPORTATION RELATED BARRIERS MAY INCREASE EMPLOYABILITY AND WAGE EARNINGS. INTENDED BENEFICARIES: EDUCATION AND TRAINING COMPONENTS THROUGH THE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT TECHNICAL CENTER WILL BE AVAILABLE TO ALL MISSOURIANS. TRAINEES MAY COME FROM THE HEALTH INDUSTRY SOCIAL SERVICES AND RURAL TRANSIT FIELDS INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO COMMUNITY HEALTH WORKERS PATIENT ADVOCATES CASE MANAGERS TRANSIT SCHEDULERS EMPLOYERS MEDICARE AND MEDICAID CASE WORKERS NAVIGATORS AND THOSE WHO WORK TO REDUCE SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH FOR AT RISK POPULATIONS. THE RURAL COMMUNITIES AND/OR HEALTH ENTITIES RECEIVING RURAL TRANSPORTATION COORDINATION EFFORTS WILL BE IDENTIFIED THROUGH ASSESSMENT AND DETERMINATION OF READINESS TO ADDRESS TRANSPORTATION BARRIERS. THE ENTIRE COMMUNITY WILL BENEFIT HOWEVER AT RISK POPULATIONS SUCH AS SENIORS DISABLED AND LOW INCOME WILL BE THE PRIMARY BENEFICIARIES. HEALTH PROVIDERS NONPROFITS SOCIAL SERVICES AND OTHER AGENCIES/ORGANIZATIONS WHO ARE UNABLE TO GET CLIENTS OR PATIENTS INTO APPOINTMENTS WILL BENEFIT THROUGH INCREASED ACCESS OPTIONS ALLOWING FOR PROGRAMS AND SERVICES TO REACH ADDITIONAL CUSTOMERS.SUBRECIPIENTS: NONE

PURPOSE:IN THIS APPLICATION BI-STATE DEVELOPMENT AGENCY (BSD) IS APPLYING FOR THE FULL APPORTIONMENT OF $352003 OF THE FY2021 CORONAVIRUS RESPONSE AND RELIEF SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS ACT (CRRSAA) APPORTIONMENT TO THE ST LOUIS MO-IL UZA. FUNDS IN THIS APPLICATION ARE BEING PROGRAMMED TO SUPPORT NEW FREEDOM TYPE PROJECTS THAT WERE ADVERSELY AFFECTED BY THE CORONAVIRUS PANDEMIC. THE PROGRAM IS BEING FUNDING AT 100% AND NO LOCAL MATCH FUNDS ARE REQUIRED. A MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING IS IN PLACE BETWEEN BI-STATE DEVELOPMENT THE MISSOURI DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (MODOT) THE ILLINOIS DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (IDOT) AND EAST WEST GATEWAY (EWG) METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATION. UNDER THIS AGREEMENT BI-STATE DEVELOPMENT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE GRANT ADMINISTRATION OF THE SELECTED NEW FREEDOM TYPE OPERATING PROJECTS THAT ARE SELECTED BY EAST WEST GATEWAY. EACH OF THE CO-DESIGNATED RECIPIENTS SEPARATELY APPLIES FOR FUNDING UNDER THE SECTION 5310 APPORTIONMENT AWARDED TO ST. LOUIS MO-IL. A COPY OF THE MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING HAS BEEN UPLOADED TO THE APPLICATION DOCUMENTS SECTION. EAST-WEST GATEWAY CONDUCTED THE SECTION 5310 NEW FREEDOM SOLICITATION PROCESS AND SELECTED EIGHT (8) APPLICATIONS FROM LOCAL TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS REQUESTING ASSISTANCE IN THEIR RECOVERY FROM THE PANDEMIC. OF THESE EIGHT PROJECTS FOUR WERE AWARDED UNDER THE CRRSAA PROGRAM; THREE UNDER THE ARPA PROGRAM; AND ONE OF THESE PROJECTS RECEIVED A COMBINATION OF BOTH CRRSAA AND ARPA FUNDING. THE FIVE (5) PROJECTS RECEIVING CRRSAA FUNDING ARE DETAILED BELOW UNDER SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES. ACTIVITIES ARE DERIVED FROM THE LOCALLY DEVELOPED COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN LAST UPDATED IN MAY 2020 FROM JUNE 2016. THE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT PLAN PREPARED BY EAST-WEST GATEWAY DESCRIBES THE REGIONAL POLICIES AND PROCEDURES FOR ADMINISTERING SECTION 5310 IN THE ST. LOUIS MO-IL UZA. PROJECTS BEING PROGRAMMED IN THIS AWARD ARE INCLUDED IN THE FY2022-2025 TIP APPROVED BY THE EWG BOARD OF DIRECTORS ON OCTOBER 27 2021; THE FY2022-2026 STIP APPROVED NOVEMBER 16 2021; THE ONE DOT LETTER DATED NOVEMBER 18 2021 APPROVES THE STIP AMENDMENT TO INCLUDE THE SECTION 5310 PROJECTS. COPIES OF THESE PLAN DOCUMENTS HAVE BEEN UPLOADED TO THE APPLICATION DOCUMENTS SECTION OF THIS APPLICATION.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE SUBRECIPIENT AGENCIES IDENTIFIED IN THIS APPLICATION WILL UTILIZE CRRSAA FUNDING TO HELP RESPOND TO AND RECOVER FROM THE COVID-19 FEDERAL EMERGENCY THAT BEGAN JANUARY 20 2020. CRRSAA FUNDS WILL SUPPORT OPERATING EXPENSES INCURRED BY SUBRECIPIENT AGENCIES FOR ACTIVITIES UNDERTAKEN TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO THE PANDEMIC AND THE UNFORESEEN OPERATING OBSTACLES IT CREATED. REIMBURSEMENT WILL BE SOUGHT AT 100%; NO LOCAL MATCH IS REQUIRED UNDER THIS PROGRAM. ACTIVITIES SUCH AS ENHANCED CLEANING AND SANITIZING SERVICES RELATED SUPPLIES STAFF WAGES EQUIPMENT FUEL PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT AND THE OFFSET OF ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES WILL BE REIMBURSED UNDER THIS PROGRAM.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:FUNDING PROGRAMMED IN THIS AWARD WILL SUPPORT ALTERNATE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES OPERATED BY LOCAL NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND TRANSIT SERVICE PROVIDERS. THE SERVICES PROVIDED HELP IMPROVE MOBILITY FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES BY REMOVING BARRIERS TO TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND EXPANDING THE TRANSPORTATION MOBILITY OPTIONS AVAILABLE. THE TARGETED POPULATION WILL HAVE ENHANCED ACCESS TO CURBSIDE DOOR-TO-DOOR AND DOOR-THROUGH-DOOR SUPPORTED TRANSPORTATION TO ESSENTIAL SERVICES LIKE HOME WORK SCHOOL GROCERY STORES AND MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND OTHER SERVICES LIKE GENERAL SHOPPING AND ENTERTAINMENT.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:PROGRAMS FUNDED IN THIS AWARD ARE INTENDED TO BENEFIT THE SENIOR POPULATION AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THE FIVE (5) PROJECTS AWARDED FULLY OR PARTIALLY UNDER THE CRRSAA PROGRAM ARE BEING REQUESTED IN THIS APPLICATION AS FOLLOWS:(1) TIP#: 7225A-22SERVICE PROVIDER: CHALLENGE UNLIMITEDPROJECT: COVID-19 RELIEF CHALLENGE UNLIMITEDPROJECT TYPE:OPERATING ASSISTANCETRANSPORTATION SERVICE:DEMAND RESPONSEPROJECT BUDGET: TOTAL: $5623FEDERAL: $5623LOCAL: $0PROJECT SUMMARY:CHALLENGE UNLIMITED IS A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION SERVING MADISON AND ST. CLAIR COUNTIES IN ILLINOIS FOR OVER 60 YEARS. ITS COMMUNITY DAY SERVICES PROGRAM ACCOMMODATES ADULTS WITH INTELLECTUAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES. THE DAY PROGRAM WAS PART OF MANDATORY CLOSURE IN MARCH 2020 DUE TO PANDEMIC. PROGRAM RETURNED TO SERVICE AT REDUCED CAPACITY OF LESS THAN 25% OF PRE-PANDEMIC VOLUME. PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS APPLICATION IS TO OBTAIN FUNDS THAT WILL BE PASSED THROUGH TO SUBRECIPIENT AGENCIES TO SUPPORT PROGRAMS SELECTED FOR FUNDING UNDER THE ARPA SECTION 5310 COVID RELIEF FUNDS. THE ARPA SECTION 5310 COVID RELIEF FUNDS TOTALING $352009 WAS APPORTIONED TO ST. LOUIS MO-IL AREA. $352009 AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN ACT OF 2021 (ARPA) (PUB. L. 11702 MARCH 11 2021)IN THIS APPLICATION BI-STATE DEVELOPMENT AGENCY (BSD) IS APPLYING FOR THE FULL APPORTIONMENT OF $352009 OF THE FY2021 AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN ACT OF 2021 (ARPA) APPORTIONMENT TO THE ST LOUIS MO-IL UZA. FUNDS IN THIS APPLICATION ARE BEING PROGRAMMED TO SUPPORT NEW FREEDOM TYPE PROJECTS THAT WERE ADVERSELY AFFECTED BY THE CORONAVIRUS PANDEMIC. THE PROGRAM IS BEING FUNDING AT 100% AND NO LOCAL MATCH FUNDS ARE REQUIRED. A MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING IS IN PLACE BETWEEN BI-STATE DEVELOPMENT THE MISSOURI DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (MODOT) THE ILLINOIS DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (IDOT) AND EAST WEST GATEWAY (EWG) METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATION. UNDER THIS AGREEMENT BI-STATE DEVELOPMENT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE GRANT ADMINISTRATION OF THE SELECTED NEW FREEDOM TYPE OPERATING PROJECTS THAT ARE SELECTED BY EAST WEST GATEWAY. EACH OF THE CO-DESIGNATED RECIPIENTS SEPARATELY APPLIES FOR FUNDING UNDER THE SECTION 5310 APPORTIONMENT AWARDED TO ST. LOUIS MO-IL. A COPY OF THE MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING HAS BEEN UPLOADED TO THE APPLICATION DOCUMENTS SECTION. EAST-WEST GATEWAY CONDUCTED THE SECTION 5310 NEW FREEDOM SOLICITATION PROCESS AND SELECTED EIGHT (8) APPLICATIONS FROM LOCAL TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS REQUESTING ASSISTANCE IN THEIR RECOVERY FROM THE PANDEMIC. OF THESE EIGHT PROJECTS FOUR WERE AWARDED UNDER THE CRRSAA PROGRAM; THREE UNDER THE ARPA PROGRAM; AND ONE OF THESE PROJECTS RECEIVED A COMBINATION OF BOTH CRRSAA AND ARPA FUNDING. THE FOUR (4) PROJECTS RECEIVING ARPA FUNDING ARE DETAILED BELOW UNDER SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES. ACTIVITIES ARE DERIVED FROM THE LOCALLY DEVELOPED COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN LAST UPDATED IN MAY 2020 FROM JUNE 2016. THE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT PLAN PREPARED BY EAST-WEST GATEWAY DESCRIBES THE REGIONAL POLICIES AND PROCEDURES FOR ADMINISTERING SECTION 5310 IN THE ST. LOUIS MO-IL UZA. COPIES OF THESE PLAN DOCUMENTS HAVE BEEN UPLOADED TO THE APPLICATION DOCUMENTS SECTION OF THIS APPLICATION. ARPA FUNDS WILL SUPPORT OPERATING EXPENSES INCURRED BY SUBRECIPIENT AGENCIES FOR ACTIVITIES UNDERTAKEN TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO THE PANDEMIC AND THE UNFORESEEN OPERATING OBSTACLES IT CREATED. REIMBURSEMENT WILL BE SOUGHT AT 100%; NO LOCAL MATCH IS REQUIRED UNDER THIS PROGRAM. PROJECT DESCRIPTION:THE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR TWO (2) KCATA PROJECTS AND TWELVE (12) SUBRECIPIENT PROJECTS FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND TO PURCHASE UP TO 14 REPLACEMENT VANS AND UP TO 3 VANS FOR EXPANSION PURPOSES. THE NEW VEHICLES FUNDED AT 85%/FEDERAL WILL BE ADA ACCESSIBLE. A CERTIFICATE OF EQUIVALENT SERVICE WILL BE OBTAINED FROM THOSE AGENCIES THAT WILL PURCHASE NON-ADA VEHICLES.UNDER THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM 45% OF THE FUNDS SHOULD BE APPLIED TO NON- TRADITIONAL SECTION 5310 PROJECTS. THOSE PROJECTS ARE LISTED BELLOWS:KCATA REGIONAL TAXI VOUCHER PILOT PROGRAM ($283858/FED) - THIS PROJECT INVOLVES PROVIDING ACCESSIBLE TAXI TRIPS TO SENIORS AND DISABLED PERSONS THROUGHOUT THE 5 COUNTY REGION. THIS PROGRAM SEEKS TO FILL GAPS WHERE SERVICE IS NOT PROVIDED. THE RATIONALE OF THIS PROJECT IS THAT THERE ARE TRANSPORTATION NEEDS TO CERTAIN AREAS AND ON CERTAIN DAYS THAT ARE NOT BEING MET AND TAXI SERVICE CAN FILL THE GAPS.5310 SUBRECIPIENTS:1)CITY OF OLATHE TAXI COUPON/VOUCHER PROGRAM ($525000/FED) OPERATING ASSISTANCETHE CITY PROVIDES A DOOR-TO-DOOR DEMAND RESPONSE TRANSPORTATION SERVICE TO OLATHE SENIOR AND DISABLED CITIZENS. THIS IS THE ONLY LICENSED DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICE IN OLATHE THAT CAN BE ACCESSED 24 HOURS PER DAY 7 DAYS A WEEK. THE CITY OF OLATHE TAXI COUPON/VOUCHER PROGRAM CONTRACTS SERVICES WITH A LOCAL TAXI COMPANY TO PROVIDE SENIORS AND DISABLED CITIZENS AFFORDABLE TRANSPORTATION TO PERSONAL MEDICAL AND WORK DESTINATIONS. 2)CITY OF OLATHE GROUP TRIP ($25000/FED) OPERATING ASSISTANCETHE CITY PROVIDES A DOOR-TO-DOOR DEMAND RESPONSE TRANSPORTATION SERVICE TO OLATHE SENIOR AND DISABLED CITIZENS. THIS IS THE ONLY LICENSED DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICE IN OLATHE THAT CAN BE ACCESSED 24 HOURS PER DAY 7 DAYS A WEEK. THIS PROJECT WOULD EXPAND THE TAXI-CAB COUPON SERVICE TO INCLUDE GROUP TRIPS. THE SERVICE WOULD BE CONTRACTED OUT TO A LOCAL TAXI COMPANY(S) TO PROVIDE GROUP TRIPS TO OUR SENIORS AND DISABLED CITIZENS.3)CITY OF SHAWNEE/CITYRIDE EXPANSION ($24000/FED) OPERATING ASSISTANCECITYRIDE IS A COMMUNITY BASED DOOR-TO-DOOR TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM CURRENTLY FUNDED BY THE CITY OF SHAWNEE KANSAS. ITS PURPOSE IS TO PROVIDE BETTER TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS TO SENIOR CITIZENS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES WHO RESIDE IN THE CITY. MANY ELDERLY AND DISABLED PEOPLE DO NOT HAVE ACCESS TO THE JO SERVICE OPERATED BY JOHNSON COUNTY TRANSIT OR ANY OTHER TRANSIT ON A REGULAR OR CONSISTENT BASIS. THIS IS BECAUSE THE JO LOCATED IN OLATHE KANSAS ONLY SERVES A SMALL PORTION OF THE CITY (TWO COMMUTER BUS LINES). CITYRIDE SERVES THE NEEDS OF THE UNSERVED/UNDERSERVED BY PROVIDING ALTERNATIVE TRANSIT OPTIONS FOR ELIGIBLE SENIOR CITIZENS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES SO THAT THEY CAN MAINTAIN THEIR INDEPENDENCE AND MOBILITY. THE CITY IS SEEKING TO EXPAND RIDERSHIP OF THE CITYRIDE SO THAT MORE ELIGIBLE RIDERS CAN USE THE SERVICE.THE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO OPERATE THE EXISTING SERVICE. THE CITY PLANS TO MORE ACTIVELY PROMOTE THE SERVICE TO ELIGIBLE RIDERS TO GROW THE NUMBER OF THE PEOPLE USING THE SERVICE. THE CITY CHANGED THE RIDER ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA AT THE BEGINNING OF THE YEAR TO INCREASE THE MINIMUM AGE FOR ELIGIBILITY FROM AGE 62 TO 65. THE CITY ALSO ADDED THE JO TRANSIT CENTER AS A LOCATION OUTSIDE OF THE CITY LIMITS SO THAT RIDERS CAN GET TO IT WITHOUT ANY ADDITIONAL COST TO THEM. THIS ADDS MORE TRANSIT OPTIONS BECAUSE THEY CAN GET TO THE BUS SYSTEM MORE EASILY. THE EXPECTED OUTCOME OF THE CITYRIDE EXPANSION PROJECT IS TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF ELIGIBLE SENIOR CITIZENS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES WHO USE THE SERVICE. THE EXPECTED OUTCOME IS THAT AN ADDITIONAL 154 RIDERS WILL BEGIN USING THE PROGRAM OVER A TWO YEAR PERIOD. UNDER THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM 55% OF THE FUNDS SHOULD BE APPLIED TO TRADITIONAL SECTION 5310 PROJECTS. THOSE PROJECTS ARE LISTED BELLOWS:55% TRADITIONAL PROJECTSKCATA - MOBILITY MANAGEMENT/TRAVEL TRAINING PROGRAM ($511648/FED) THIS PROJECT WILL TRAIN PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES AND SENIORS ( 65 YEARS AND UP) ON HOW TO ACCESS ANY OF THE FOUR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM IN THE FIVE COUNTY SERVICE AREA OF JACKSON CLAY PLATTE JOHNSON AND WYANDOTTE COUNTIES AND ESTABLISHING A REGIONAL ELIGIBILITY PROCESS FOR PARATRANSIT SERVICES. THIS PROJECT WOULD ALLOW PARTICIPANTS THE ABILITY TO APPLY FOR PARATRANSIT SERVICE ON ONE APPLICATION AND HAVE ELIGIBILITY GRANTED BY ALL PARTICIPATING SERVICES FOR ADA PARATRANSIT. THIS WILL ALLOW THE PARTICIPANT TO ACCESS NEEDED SERVICES THROUGHOUT THE REGION.5310 SUBRECIPIENTS:1)UNIVERSITY OF KANSAS ($346570/FED) MOBILITY MANAGEMENT .THE UNIVERSITY IS APPLYING FOR 5310 FUNDING TO SUPPORT ONGOING MAINTENANCE OF THE LINKFORCARE SITE AND TO ADD NEW FEATURES THAT WILL MOVE LINKFORCARE CLOSER TO FULFILLING THE GOAL OF A ONE-CALL/ONE-CLICK MOBILITY MANAGEMENT RESOURCE. FEATURES TO BE ADDED INCLUDE: (1) ADDING A CALL-OUT BOX OR OTHER MECHANISM TO PROVIDE INFORMATION ON REACHING THE KCATA CALL CENTER; (2) ADDING TRIP PLANNING FOR FIXED ROUTE SERVICES SUCH AS A LINK TO THE GOOGLE TRANSIT TRIP PLANNER; (3) ADDING TRIP PLANNING FOR NON-FIXED ROUTE SERVICES INCLUDING PARATRANSIT AND NON-ADA SERVICES THAT IS BASED ON STARTING AND DESTINATION ADDRESSES; AND (4) PROVIDING A CUSTOMER SERVICE PHONE NUMBER ON THE SITE TO REACH STAFF AT THE SHEPHERDS CENTER CENTRAL WHO CAN ASSIST WITH LINKFORCARE SEARCHES AND IDENTIFYING SERVICES THAT MAY MEET A CALLERS NEEDS. THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT TO ENSURE CONSUMERS AND PROVIDERS ONLINE ACCESS TO AN INFORMATION SYSTEM THAT INTEGRATES SERVICE AND TRANSPORTATION RESOURCES IN THE KANSAS CITY METRO AREA. LINKFORCARE IS A FREE SEARCHABLE REGIONAL ONLINE DATABASE OF SERVICES IN THE KANSAS CITY METROPOLITAN AREA THAT ALLOWS SERVICE PROVIDERS TO LIST INFORMATION ABOUT THEIR SERVICES ON THE SITE AT NO CHARGE. THE SITE IS TARGETED TO ANYONE IN THE COMMUNITY WHO NEEDS ACCESS TO SERVICES. 2)CONCERNED CARE ($ 22214/FED) - PURCHASE REPLACEMENT VAN TO REPLACE AN OLD VEHICLE THAT HAS MET ITS USEFUL LIFE.CONCERNED CARE (CC) PROVIDES DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICE. IT WORKS WITH INDIVIDUALS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES (MENTAL RETARDATION AUTISM DOWNS SYNDROME ETC.) THAT RESIDE IN CLAY COUNTY MISSOURI THAT QUALIFY AND ARE APPROVED FOR SERVICES BY THE DEPARTMENT OF MENTAL HEALTH THROUGH THE DIVISION OF DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES. THE RIDERSHIP (CONSUMERS) IN THE RESIDENCES (GROUP HOMES ETC.) HAVE ONGOING OPPORTUNITIES TO COMMUNICATE ROUTINELY THEIR NEEDS AND CHOICES DIRECTLY WITH THE STAFF (WHICH ARE ALSO THE VEHICLE DRIVERS) AND THROUGH THE COORDINATED AGENCY RESIDENCES FAMILY CONFERENCES WHEN DECISIONS AND PLANNING IS MADE ACCORDING TO EACH INDIVIDUAL AND THE GROUPS INTERESTS NEEDS ROUTINES AND SCHEDULES. INDIVIDUALS NEEDS AND COMMUNICATIONS AND GOALS ARE ALSO AS PART OF EACH PERSONS INDIVIDUALIZED SERVICE PLAN (ISP). 3)SPECIAL NEIGHBORS INC. CH TRANSPORTATION ($42288/FED) - PURCHASE ONE RAISED ROOF (MODIFIED) VAN TO REPLACE A VEHICLE THAT HAS MET ITS USEFUL LIFE AND IS IN FAIR CONDITION.SPECIAL NEIGHBORS CURRENTLY PROVIDES DOOR-TO-DOOR SERVICE TO 83 INDIVIDUALS AND THIS PROJECT WOULD REPLACE AN EXISTING 5310 VAN. IT IS PRIMARILY USED TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION TO INDIVIDUALS WHO RECEIVE SUPPORTS AT ITS SEMI-INDEPENDENT APARTMENT PROGRAM LOCATED IN INDEPENDENCE. COMMUNITY PROGRAMS SUCH AS SHARE-A-FARE AND DIAL-A-RIDE ARE UTILIZED BUT EACH PROGRAM HAS LIMITATION.THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO REPLACE AN 8 YEAR OLD VAN THAT IS NOT ACCESSIBLE. THE CURRENT VEHICLE HAS 164983 MILES AND IS USED TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES.DUE TO LIMITED PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IN EASTERN JACKSON COUNTY ALL OF THE INDIVIDUALS WE SUPPORT RELY ON SPECIAL NEIGHBORS VEHICLES AND/OR STAFF TO MEET THEIR TRANSPORTATION NEEDS. SN CURRENTLY PROVIDES SUPPORTS TO 83 INDIVIDUALS AND THIS PROJECT WOULD REPLACE LEASED VAN. IT WILL BE PRIMARILY USED TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION TO INDIVIDUALS WHO RECEIVE SUPPORTS AT CARRIAGE HOUSE OUR LADIES GROUP HOME. 4)EITAS ($262066) - PURCHASE UP TO NINE WHEELCHAIR ACCESSIBLE VEHICLES THAT HAVE HIGH MILEAGE AND HIGH MAINTENANCE COSTS. THE VEHICLES TO BE REPLACED HAVE MET THEIR USEFUL LIFE OF 4 YEARS OR 100000 MILES. EITAS PROVIDES DOOR-TO-DOOR TRANSPORTATION SERVICE THAT HAS BEEN PROVIDED BY EITAS SINCE 1995 TO ENABLE PEOPLE WITH SIGNIFICANT DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES A MEANS TO ATTEND WORK AND IMPORTANT SERVICES TO IMPROVE THEIR LIVES AND THEIR COMMUNITY INTEGRATION. THE SERVICES ARE HELPED AND GUIDED BY ONGOING INPUT FROM OUR RIDERS DIRECTED AT PROVIDING BETTER SERVICES AND ACCOMMODATING ALL DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES. EITAS SERVICES RUN MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY FROM 6:00 AM TO 6:00 PM. EITAS IS A MISSOURI SB 40 DD BOARD CURRENTLY PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION SERVICES THAT SERVE OVER 500 PERSONS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES DAILY. EITAS USES 24 FIXED ROUTES THAT PROVIDE DOOR TO DOOR SERVICES FOR EMPLOYMENT DAY SERVICES EDUCATIONAL AND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES.5)JOHNSON COUNTY MENTAL HEALTH TRANSPORTATION (JCMHT)SERVICE ($ 39960 ) PURCHASE TWO REPLACEMENT MINI-VAN FOR ITS EXISTING DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICE. JCMHT SERVICE IS A SUPPORT SERVICE FOR THOSE INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING SERVICES OF ANY KIND FROM THE MENTAL HEALTH CENTER. THE SERVICES ARE DESIGNED TO FILL THE GAPS IN PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES SO THAT PEOPLE SERVED ARE TRANSPORTED TO ALL THEIR IMPORTANT APPOINTMENTS. ONE OF THE GOALS OF THE SERVICE IS TO ASSIST CLIENTS TO BE MORE INDEPENDENT. JCMHT SERVICES CURRENTLY PROVIDE AN AVERAGE OF 2300 RIDES PER MONTH. 72% OF THESE RIDES ARE FOR WORK/SCHOOL AND 28% ARE FOR TRANSPORTATION TO COURT PROBATION DIVERSION FOOD PANTRY GROCERY AND MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS. 6)EASTER SEALS MIDWEST ($29750/FED) - PURCHASE NEW MINI-VAN TO EXPAND EXISTING SERVICE. THE MINI-VAN WILL HAVE A USEFUL LIFE OF 4 YEARS OR 100000 MILES.THE COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS PROGRAM OF EASTER SEALS MIDWEST PROVIDES A DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICE FOR A VARIETY OF PERSON-CENTERED AND COMMUNITY-BASED SUPPORTIVE SERVICES TO ADULTS WITH INTELLECTUAL DEVELOPMENTAL AND PHYSICAL DISABILITIES. THESE SERVICES INCLUDE COMMUNITY LIVING EMPLOYMENT SERVICES AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT ACTIVITIES AS WELL AS TRANSPORTATION TO AND FROM THESE ACTIVITIES. THE SERVICES ENABLE DEVELOPMENTALLY DISABLED ADULTS TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY IN THE COMMUNITIES OF THEIR CHOICE PURSUE/SECURE MEANINGFUL EMPLOYMENT CREATE SOCIAL RELATIONSHIPS REDUCE ISOLATION AND PARTICIPATE IN THE LARGER FABRIC OF COMMUNITY LIFE - BOTH LOCALLY AND REGIONALLY. THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO EXPAND COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS CAPACITY TO PROVIDE SPECIALIZED DEMAND RESPONSE/DOOR-TO-DOOR TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AT NON-TRADITIONAL TIMES AND TO UNDERSERVED AREAS OF THE KC-METRO AREA WHILE IMPROVING OVERALL ACCESS TO EMPLOYMENT-RELATED AND COMMUNITY-BASED ACTIVITIES FOR DISABLED ADULTS. THE VEHICLE WOULD ENABLE COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF CLIENTS FOR WHOM WE PROVIDE EMPLOYMENT AND COMMUNITY-BASED ACTIVITIES. THE VEHICLE WOULD ALSO ENABLE COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALIZED AS WELL AS GROUP TRIPS WHICH ALLOWS INDIVIDUALS TO WORK AND BE INTEGRATED IN UNDERSERVED AREAS OF THE KC-METRO AREA7)CITY OF LIBERTY ($34850/FED) - PURCHASE ONE REPLACEMENT VEHICLE - FUNDING WILL BE UTILIZED TO REPLACE A THIRTEEN (13) YEAR OLD VEHICLE WITH OVER 150000 MILES THAT HAS MET ITS USEFUL LIFE.THIS VEHICLE IS USED TO PROVIDE DOOR TO DOOR SERVICES TO PERSONS AGE 60+ AND AGE 18-59 IF HANDICAPPED. MARC WILL RECEIVE 3.5% (UP TO $85963) OF THE SECTION 5310 ALLOCATION AND KCATA WILL RECEIVE 6.5% (UP TO $159645). KCATA WILL ADMINISTER AND MANAGE THE 5310 PROGRAM. APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS AWARD IS FOR THE PURCHASE OF 11 REPLACEMENT BUSES AND TWO (2) EXPANSION BUSES. FUNDING WILL ALSO SUPPORT TRANSIT COORDINATION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (TCAP) MOBILITY MANAGEMENT ORGANIZATIONS IN THEIR EFFORTS TO IDENTIFY AND REDUCE TRANSPORTATION GAPS STREAMLINE ACCESS TO TRANSPORTATION AND PROVIDE MORE TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS FOR SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES IN THE TWIN CITIES METROPOLITAN AREA.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO BUY 11 REPLACEMENT BUSES AND TWO (2) EXPANSION BUSES. TCAP PROGRAMS WILL PROVIDE TRAVEL TRAINING PROVIDE ONE-STOP TRAVEL INFORMATION FOR TRIP PLANNING PURPOSES IDENTIFY AVAILABLE TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS WITHIN THEIR TRANSPORTATION SERVICE AREA COORDINATE VEHICLE SHARING BETWEEN ORGANIZATIONS AND MANAGE VOLUNTEER DRIVER PROGRAMS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THESE PROGRAMS ARE EXPECTED TO ALLOW NOT-FOR-PROFIT AGENCIES TO PROVIDE SAFE AND MORE RELIABLE TRANSIT SERVICE TO SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES IN THE TWIN CITIES METROPOLITAN AREA AND ENHANCE THE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION EXPERIENCE BY ENCOURAGING COORDINATION AMONG TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS WHICH WILL CREATE GREATER ACCESS AND MOBILITY; ALIGN RESOURCES TO REDUCE INDIVIDUAL RIDE TIMES; AND CREATE OPPORTUNITIES FOR MORE SOCIAL INTERACTIONS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES IN THE TWIN CITIES METROPOLITAN AREA.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: MIDWEST SPECIAL SERVICES INC. NEWTRAX INC. AND RISE INC. WILL WORK WITH STATE OF MINNESOTA STAFF TO PURCHASE VEHICLES FROM THE STATE OF MINNESOTAS COOPERATIVE PURCHASE VENTURE PROGRAM THAT WILL MEET THE INDIVIDUAL SERVICE NEEDS. THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENTS WILL RECEIVE FUNDING FOR MOBILITY MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES WITH THIS GRANT: ANOKA COUNTY DAKOTA COUNTY NEWTRAX INC. SCOTT COUNTY AND WASHINGTON COUNTY. THE TCAP PROGRAMS WILL PROVIDE TRAVEL TRAINING PROVIDE ONE-STOP TRAVEL INFORMATION FOR TRIP PLANNING PURPOSES IDENTIFY AVAILABLE TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS WITHIN THEIR TRANSPORTATION SERVICE AREA COORDINATE VEHICLE SHARING BETWEEN ORGANIZATIONS AND MANAGE VOLUNTEER DRIVER PROGRAMS.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE ONE (1) EXPANSION BUS IN A RURAL AREA OF MINNESOTA AND TO PROVIDE CONTINUED CAPITAL FUNDING FOR SEVEN (7) ONGOING PROJECTS IN SMALL URBAN AND RURAL AREAS OF THE STATE THAT FOCUS ON REDUCING TRANSPORTATION GAPS AND STREAMLINE ACCESS TO TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR FOR THE PURCHASE OF ONE (1) EXPANSION BUS. ADDITIONALLY THE FEDERAL DOLLARS WILL CONTINUE FUNDING FOR SEVEN (7) ON-GOING MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROJECTS. MINNESOTA REFERS TO THESE PROJECTS AS REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION COORDINATING COUNCILS (RTCCS). THE RTCC PROJECTS WILL PROVIDE A VARIETY OF TRANSPORTATION SERVICES INCLUDING COORDINATE VEHICLE SHARING BETWEEN ORGANIZATIONS. THE STATE OF MINNESOTA PROVIDES A VARIETY OF TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR ITS CITIZENS. THESE SERVICES COME IN MANY DIFFERENT FORMS AND ARE ADMINISTERED BY A WIDE RANGE OF ORGANIZATIONS ACROSS THE STATE. THE AVAILABILITY AND ACCESSIBILITY OF THESE SERVICES IS CHALLENGING. THESE CHALLENGES INCLUDE INCONSISTENT ESTABLISHED CONNECTIONS REDUNDANCIES AND OTHER SYSTEM INEFFICIENCIES. FORMALIZED AND INCREASED COORDINATION BETWEEN PROVIDERS AND SERVICE AGENCIES WILL RESULT IN MORE EFFICIENT SYSTEMS OF TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS WHICH WILL PROVIDE CUSTOMERS EASIER ACCESS TO SERVICES THAT MEET THEIR TRAVEL NEEDS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT THE MINNESOTA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS WITH THE BUS PURCHASE AND THE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROJECTS WILL WORK TO STREAMLINE ACCESS TO TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES IN SMALL URBAN AND RURAL AREAS IN MINNESOTA.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: EMPLOYMENT ENTERPRISES INC. IS THE SUBRECIPIENT THAT WILL BE RECEIVING FUNDING TO PURCHASE A VEHICLE IN THIS GRANT. EMPLOYMENT ENTERPRISE INC. WILL WORK WITH STATE OF MINNESOTA STAFF BY UTILIZING THE STATE OF MINNESOTAS COOPERATIVE PURCHASE VENTURE PROGRAM. THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENTS WILL RECEIVE FUNDING FOR MOBILITY MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES WITH THIS GRANT: ARROWHEAD REGIONAL DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION EAST CENTRAL REGIONAL DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION MID-MINNESOTA REGIONAL DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION NORTHWEST REGIONAL DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION REGION FIVE DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION UNITED COMMUNITY ACTION PARTNERSHIP INC. AND HEADWATERS REGIONAL DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION. MOBILITY MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES WILL BE TO COORDINATE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES WITH HUMAN SERVICE AGENCIES AND COUNTY EMERGENCY STAFF WORK WITH NON-TRANSPORTATION ORGANIZATIONS TO ENHANCE MOBILITY OPTIONS IDENTIFY TRANSPORTATION BARRIERS AND SEARCH FOR SOLUTIONS TO OVERCOME THE BARRIERS INCORPORATION OF A CENTRAL TRANSPORTATION DATABASE REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION PLANNING TRANSIT TRAVEL TRAINING EXPAND VOLUNTEER DRIVER PROGRAMS; INVESTIGATE VEHICLE SHARING OPTIONS AND ACT AS A RESOURCE TO ANSWER REQUESTS FOR TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS.

THIS GRANT PROVIDES $2914666 [$523991 FY2018; $1210687 FY2019; $1179988 FY2020] OF SECTION LARGE URBAN 5310 FUNDS FOR MOBILITY MANAGEMENT ACTIVATES IN THE METROPOLITAN TWIN CITIES AREA. $2623200 OF FEDERAL FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR TRANSIT CAPITAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS (TCAPS) FOR TRANSPORTATION COORDINATION EXPENSES FROM JUNE 1 2021 - DECEMBER 31 2023 AND $291466 (10%) WILL BE USED FOR ALLOWABLE STATE PROGRAM ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES. $655800 OF LOCAL MATCH WILL BE PROVIDED BY THE ENTITIES THAT RECEIVE THE FEDERAL FUNDS.PURPOSE OF THE AWARD: FUNDING WILL SUPPORT TCAP MOBILITY MANAGEMENT ORGANIZATIONS IN THEIR EFFORTS TO IDENTIFY AND REDUCE TRANSPORTATION GAPS STREAMLINE ACCESS TO TRANSPORTATION AND PROVIDE MORE TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS FOR SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES IN THE TWIN CITIES METROPOLITAN AREA.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: TCAP PROGRAMS WILL PROVIDE TRAVEL TRAINING PROVIDE ONE-STOP TRAVEL INFORMATION FOR TRIP PLANNING PURPOSES IDENTIFY AVAILABLE TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS WITHIN THEIR TRANSPORTATION SERVICE AREA COORDINATE VEHICLE SHARING BETWEEN ORGANIZATIONS AND MANAGE VOLUNTEER DRIVER PROGRAMS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THESE PROGRAMS ARE EXPECTED TO ENHANCE THE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION EXPERIENCE BY ENCOURAGING COORDINATION AMONG TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS WHICH WILL CREATE GREATER ACCESS AND MOBILITY; ALIGN RESOURCES TO REDUCE INDIVIDUAL RIDE TIMES; AND CREATE OPPORTUNITIES FOR MORE SOCIAL INTERACTIONS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES IN THE TWIN CITIES METROPOLITAN AREA.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: TCAP PROGRAMS WILL PROVIDE TRAVEL TRAINING PROVIDE ONE-STOP TRAVEL INFORMATION FOR TRIP PLANNING PURPOSES IDENTIFY AVAILABLE TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS WITHIN THEIR TRANSPORTATION SERVICE AREA COORDINATE VEHICLE SHARING BETWEEN ORGANIZATIONS AND MANAGE VOLUNTEER DRIVER PROGRAMS.ATTACHMENTS TO THIS APPLICATION INCLUDE THE 2021-2024 MINNESOTA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION STIP APPROVAL LETTER DATED NOVEMBER 23 2020 THE APPLICABLE STIP PROJECT PAGES AND APPLICABLE STIP AMENDMENT APPROVAL LETTERS.

TO PURCHASE A BUS WITH EXTRA WHEEL CHAIR POSITION. THE AMOUNT OF THE FY19 5310 FEDERAL FUNDING IS $72000 AND THE LOCAL SHARE FROM THE TRIBAL ACCOUNT IS $18000 FOR A TOTAL OF $90000. THIS BUS WILL BE AN EXPANSION SERVICE FOR THE ELDERLY AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND WILL MEET THE FTA USEFUL LIFE STANDARDS OF 5 YEARS OF 150000 MILES.IN EXECUTING THIS GRANT THE BOIS FORTE BAND IF CHIPPEWA AGREES TO ABIDE BY SECTION 3011 OF THE FAST ACT (49 U.S.C. 5323(J)(2)(C) REGARDING THE PHASED INCREASE IN DOMESTIC CONTENT UNDER THE BUY AMERICA STATUTE FOR ROLLING STOCK.AS GRANT AGREEMENT INCLUDES AN FTA-FUNDED VEHICLE PURCHASE RECIPIENT AGREES TO COMPLY WITH THE RELATED REQUIREMENT SET FOR IN 49 CFR 26.49(A). SPECIFICALLY RECIPIENT MUST ENSURE AS A CONDITION OF BEING AUTHORIZED TO BID OR PROPOSE IN FTA-ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE PROCUREMENT THAT EACH TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURER CERTIFIED THAT IT COMPLIED WITH DOT REQUIREMENTS FOR SUBMITTING A DBE PROGRAM AND GOAL TO FTA PRIOR TO BIDDING. RECIPIENT IS ALSO REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE NAME OF THE SUCCESSFUL BIDDER AND THE TOTAL DOLLAR VALUE OF THE CONTRACT WITHIN 30 DAYS OF MAKING AN FTA-ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE AWARD USING THE REQUIRED FTA REPORTING TOOL. RECIPIENT UNDERSTAND THAT FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THESE REQUIREMENTS MAY RESULT IN FORMAL ENFORCEMENT ACTION OR APPROPRIATE SANCTION AS DETERMINED BY FTA INCLUDING REIMBURSEMENT OF FTA FUNDS USED FOR THE VEHICLE PROCUREMENT.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT AWARD IS FOR CENTRAL COUNTY TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY TO UTILIZE FUNDS FOR THE REPLACEMENT OF VANS AND CONTINUED SUPPORT OF MOBILITY MANAGEMENT SERVICES WHICH PROVIDE DEMAND RESPONSE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION TO THE KALAMAZOO COUNTY REGION OF MICHIGAN.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE REPLACEMENT OF FOUR (4) VANS AND THE CONTINUATION OF THE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM FOR DEMAND RESPONSE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IN THE KALAMAZOO COUNTY REGION OF MICHIGAN.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THE GRANT AWARD INCLUDE THE REPLACEMENT OF AGING DEMAND RESPONSE VANS AND THE OPERATIONAL SUPPORT FOR THE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT SERVICE PROGRAM.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THE GRANT INCLUDE THE OVERALL COMMUNITY INCLUDING RIDERS FAMILIES OF RIDERS EMPLOYERS AND TAXPAYERS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: CENTRAL COUNTY TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY CONTRACTS WITH APPLE BUS FOR OUR DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICE (REFERRED TO AS METRO CONNECT).

A TOTAL OF $363231 WILL BE USED FOR THE PERIOD OF OCTOBER 2022 THROUGH MARCH 2025 TO ENHANCE MOBILITY FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES INCLUDING $9304 IN FY2021 SECTION 5310 CARRYOVER FUNDS $226945 IN FY2022 SECTION 5310 FUNDS $36422 IN MICHIGAN COMPREHENSIVE TRANSPORTATION FUND (CTF) MATCH FUNDS AND $90560 IN OTHER LOCAL FUNDS FOR: - CAPITAL COST OF CONTRACTING FOR AAATAS GOLDRIDE SERVICE- MOBILITY MANAGEMENT FOR SUBRECIPIENT PEOPLES EXPRESS (PEX)- OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR SUBRECIPIENT PEX- PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE FOR SUBRECIPIENT JEWISH FAMILY SERVICES (JFS) - SOFTWARE FOR SUBRECIPIENT WAVE THE RECIPIENT (AAATA) CERTIFIES THAT AT LEAST 55 PERCENT OF PROGRAM FUNDS ARE BEING USED ON CAPITAL OR TRADITIONAL 5310 PROJECTS WITHIN THIS GRANT APPLICATION AND THE PROJECTS ARE DERIVED FROM THE 2020 SOUTHEAST MICHIGAN ONHAND COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES-TRANSPORTATION PLAN (CHSTP) FOR THE REGIONAL TRANSIT AUTHORITY (RTA) AREA WHICH INCLUDES THE ANN ARBOR URBANIZED AREA. THIS COORDINATED PLAN WAS LOCALLY DEVELOPED AND APPROVED THROUGH AN OPEN PROCESS LED BY THE RTA WITH INPUT FROM THE WASHTENAW COUNTY TRANSPORTATION COORDINATING COUNCIL (TCC) THAT PREVIOUSLY MANAGED THE AREAS COORDINATED PLAN. PLAN DEVELOPMENT INVOLVED SURVEYS AND PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT WITH PARTICIPATION BY SENIORS INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES PUBLIC PRIVATE AND NONPROFIT TRANSPORTATION AND HUMAN SERVICES PROVIDERS AND MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC. THE RTA WILL WORK WITH THE TCC AND LOCAL STAKEHOLDERS TO REGULARLY REVIEW THE NEW CHSTP 5310 PROGRAM MANAGEMENT PLAN AND 5310 PROGRAM OF PROJECTS TO GUIDE A COORDINATED APPROACH TO SERVING SENIORS PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND INDIVIDUALS WITH LOW INCOMES. ATTACHMENTS INCLUDE: EXPORT FROM JOBNET STIP SYSTEM; RTA SPLIT LETTER; RTA CHSTP; AND 5310 PMP;- PURPOSE OF THE AWARD: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO SUPPORT TRANSPORTATION SERVICES THAT ENHANCE MOBILITY FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE ANN ARBOR URBANIZED AREA (UZA) OF MICHIGAN. - ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: SECTION 5310-ELIGIBLE ACTIVITIES TO BE CARRIED OUT UNDER THIS AWARD INCLUDE PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT OPERATIONS CAPITAL COST OF CONTRACTING AND PURCHASE OF SOFTWARE BY NONPROFITS IN THE ANN ARBOR UZA AND AAATA.- EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THROUGH THIS AWARD THE JEWISH FAMILY SERVICES (JFS) CAREVAN PROGRAM WAVE PEOPLES EXPRESS (PEX) AND AAATAS GOLDRIDE ON-DEMAND SERVICE WILL BE ABLE TO CONTINUE OPERATIONS DESIGNED TO MEET THE SPECIALIZED NEEDS OF SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES IN WASHTENAW COUNTY. JFS EXPECTS TO BE ABLE TO TRANSPORT APPROXIMATELY 9000 CLIENTS TO ACCESS ESSENTIAL DESTINATIONS. PEX EXPECTS TO PROVIDE ABOUT 2400 RIDES AND SUPPORT ITS MOBILITY MANAGERS IN TAKING 9000 CALLS PER YEAR TO ENABLE CLIENTS TO REACH FIXED ROUTE STOPS AND KEY DESTINATIONS SUCH AS DIALYSIS APPOINTMENTS. WAVE EXPECTS TO TRANSITION A PILOT SOFTWARE MOBILITY AS A SERVICE PLATFORM TO A PERMANENT PLATFORM WHICH ALLOWS ACCESSIBLE MAPPING REAL TIME INFORMATION AND MOBILE TICKETING THAT HELPS TO SERVICE ITS SENIOR AND DISABLED CLIENTS. AAATAS GOLDRIDE SERVICE EXPECTS UP TO 30000 RIDES TO PROVIDE CURB-TO-CURB TRANSPORTATION SERVICE FOR SENIOR CLIENTS.- INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS AWARD ARE SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES THROUGHOUT THE ANN ARBOR UZA. THE JFS CAREVAN PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE ELDERLY AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS WITH TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS SOCIAL EVENTS AND EMPLOYMENT AND VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES. THIS IS AN FY 2021 SECTION 5310 CRRSAA APPLICATION IN THE AMOUNT OF $39730 REPRESENTING 100% FEDERAL SHARE TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS TO ENHANCE MOBILITY FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES INCLUDING: - $25000 FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR THE CONTINUATION OF CAREVAN PROGRAM FOR SUBRECIPIENT JEWISH FAMILY SERVICES (JFS) - $13440 FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR SUBRECIPIENT PEOPLES EXPRESS TO EXPAND THEIR ON-DEMAND SERVICE FOR SENIORS AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS- $1290 FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR SUBRECIPIENT PEAC TO CONTINUE THEIR TRANSPORTATION TRAINING- PURPOSE OF THE AWARD: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO SUPPORT TRANSPORTATION SERVICES THAT ENHANCE MOBILITY FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE ANN ARBOR URBANIZED AREA (UZA) OF MICHIGAN DURING THE PANDEMIC. - ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: SECTION 5310-ELIGIBLE ACTIVITIES TO BE CARRIED OUT UNDER THIS AWARD INCLUDE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND OPERATIONS BY NONPROFITS IN THE ANN ARBOR UZA.- EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THROUGH THIS AWARD THE JEWISH FAMILY SERVICES (JFS) CAREVAN PROGRAM PEOPLES EXPRESS (PEX) ON-DEMAND SERVICE AND PEAC SCHOOL ACTIVE TRANSPORTATION PROJECT WILL BE ABLE TO CONTINUE OPERATIONS DESIGNED TO MEET THE SPECIALIZED NEEDS OF SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES IN WASHTENAW COUNTY. - INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS AWARD ARE SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES THROUGHOUT THE ANN ARBOR UZA. THE JFS CAREVAN PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE ELDERLY AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS WITH TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS SOCIAL EVENTS AND EMPLOYMENT AND VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES. THE PEOPLES EXPRESS ON-DEMAND SERVICE HELPS FILL TRANSPORTATION GAPS IN THE UZA BY PROVIDING DOOR-TO-DOOR SERVICE THAT ENHANCES ACCESS FOR SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES IN NORTHFIELD PITTSFIELD SUPERIOR LODI SALINE AND YPSILANTI TOWNSHIPS AND THE CITY OF SALINE. THE PEAC SCHOOL ACTIVE TRANSPORTATION PROJECT PROVIDES SPECIALIZED ACTIVE TRANSPORTATION TRAINING FOR YOUNG ADULTS AGES 14-26 WITH COGNITIVE DISABILITIES IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE YPSILANTI AND WASHTENAW INTERMEDIATE SCHOOL DISTRICT SCHOOLS. - SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS AWARD ARE PROGRAMMED TO BE CARRIED OUT BY THREE ELIGIBLE PRIVATE NONPROFIT SUBRECIPIENTS AND BASED ON THE SOUTHEAST MICHIGAN ONHAND COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES-TRANSPORTATION PLAN AND 2022 CALL FOR PROJECTS: JEWISH FAMILY SERVICES OF WASHTENAW COUNTY (OPERATING ASSISTANCE); PEOPLES EXPRESS (MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND OPERATING ASSISTANCE); AND PEAC (OPERATING ASSISTANCE).THESE PROJECTS ARE DERIVED FROM THE 2020 SOUTHEAST MICHIGAN ONHAND COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES-TRANSPORTATION PLAN (CHSTP) FOR THE REGIONAL TRANSIT AUTHORITY (RTA) AREA WHICH INCLUDES THE ANN ARBOR URBANIZED AREA. THIS COORDINATED PLAN WAS LOCALLY DEVELOPED AND APPROVED THROUGH AN OPEN PROCESS LED BY THE RTA WITH INPUT FROM THE WASHTENAW COUNTY TRANSPORTATION COORDINATING COUNCIL (TCC) THAT PREVIOUSLY MANAGED THE AREAS COORDINATED PLAN. PLAN DEVELOPMENT INVOLVED SURVEYS AND PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT WITH PARTICIPATION BY SENIORS INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES PUBLIC PRIVATE AND NONPROFIT TRANSPORTATION AND HUMAN SERVICES PROVIDERS AND MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE REPLACEMENT AND EXPANSION VEHICLES WILL PROVIDE COMFORTABLE AND RELIABLE BUS TRANSPORTATION IN ADDITION TO CUTTING DOWN ON VEHICLE DOWNTIME AND MAINTENANCE COSTS THE REMAINDER OF THE PROJECTS WILL IMPROVE PUBLIC SAFETY EMPLOYEE WORKING CONDITIONS AND BUILDING SAFETY AND EFFICIENCY.
