THIS GRANT PROVIDES FLINT MTA FY2022 5310 FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $565494 WITH A STATE MATCH OF $100123 AND A LOCAL MATCH OF $165000 FOR A PROJECT TOTAL OF $830617. STATE MATCH IS PROVIDED THROUGH MDOT FROM THE COMPREHENSIVE TRANSPORTATION FUND (CTF); THE LOCAL SHARE FOR OPERATING IS PROVIDED THROUGH LOCAL TAX MILEAGES. THIS GRANT WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT SALARIES AND BENEFITS FOR MOBILITY MANAGERS AND SUPPORT OPERATING COSTS FOR ENHANCED SERVICES TO ELDERLY AND ADA ELIGIBLE PASSENGERS. CAPITAL PROJECTS WILL INCLUDE THE PURCHASE OF FORD TRANSITS FOR MTA YOUR RIDE TRANSIT SERVICES. ATTACHMENTS TO THIS GRANT APPLICATION INCLUDES THE TIP FTA STIP APPROVAL LETTER UWP PROGRAM OF PROJECTS COORDINATED TRANSPORTATION PLAN AND THE LONG RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLAN.IN EXECUTING THIS GRANT MTA AGREES TO ABIDE BY SECTION 3011 OF THE FAST ACT (49 U.S.C. 5323(J)(2)(C) REGARDING THE PHASED INCREASE IN DOMESTIC CONTENT UNDER THE BUY AMERICA STATUTE FOR ROLLING STOCK. AS GRANT AGREEMENT INCLUDES AN FTAFUNDED TRANSIT VEHICLE PURCHASE RECIPIENT AGREES TO COMPLY WITH THE RELATED REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN 49 CFR 26.49(A). SPECIFICALLY RECIPIENT MUST ENSURE AS A CONDITION OF BEING AUTHORIZED TO BID OR PROPOSE ON FTAASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE PROCUREMENTS THAT EACH TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURER CERTIFIED THAT IT COMPLIED WITH DOT REQUIREMENTS FOR SUBMITTING A DBE PROGRAM AND GOAL TO FTA PRIOR TO BIDDING. RECIPIENT IS ALSO REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE NAME OF THE SUCCESSFUL BIDDER AND THE TOTAL DOLLAR VALUE OF THE CONTRACT WITHIN 30 DAYS OF MAKING A FTA ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE AWARD USING THE REQUIRED FTA REPORTING TOOL. RECIPIENT UNDERSTANDS THAT FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THESE REQUIREMENTS MAY RESULT IN FORMAL ENFORCEMENT ACTION OR APPROPRIATE ACTION AS DETERMINED BY FTA INCLUDING REIMBURSEMENT OF FTA FUNDS USED FOR THE VEHICLE PROCUREMENT. PURPOSE OF THE AWARD-TO PROVIDE OPERATING SUPPORT FOR TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO THE ELDERLY ELDERLY DISABLED DEVELOPMENTALLY DISABLED AND ADA CERTIFIED PASSENGERS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED- ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED WILL INCLUDE SAME DAY SERVICE NON-EMERGENCY MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION AND RIDES TO WELLNESS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES -TO ALLOW MTA TO SERVE MORE PASSENGERS IN A TIMELY EFFICIENT AND SAFE MANNER.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES- THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE ELDERLY ELDERLY DISABLED DEVELOPMENTALLY DISABLED AND ADA CERTIFIED PASSENGERS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES -TO PROVIDE DOOR TO DOOR SERVICES AND ASSISTANCE ON THE BUS TO THE ELDERLY ELDERLY DISABLED DEVELOPMENTALLY DISABLED AND ADA CERTIFIED PASSENGERS.FLINT MTA CERTIFIES THAT AT LEAST 55 PERCENT OF PROGRAM FUNDS ARE BEING USED ON CAPITAL OR TRADITIONAL 5310 PROJECTS WITHIN THIS GRANT APPLICATION; AND THE PROJECTS ARE DERIVED FROM THE HUMAN SERVICES COORDINATED PLAN.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE THE FULL APPORTIONMENT OF $34528 OF FISCAL YEAR 2021 ARPA SECTION 5310 OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO CENTRAL COUNTY TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY FOR THE PERIOD OF JANUARY 20 2020 THROUGH SEPTEMBER 30 2024. THESE FUNDS MAY BE UTILIZED TO FUND UP TO 100% OF CCTA ELIGIBLE EXPENSES AND WILL BE USED TO COVER OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE INCURRED DUE TO THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. ACTIVITIES IN THIS GRANT WILL INCLUDE PREVENTING PREPARING AND RESPONDING TO CORONAVIRUS. THE SPECIFIC SCOPE OF WORK INCLUDES THE PAYROLL AND OPERATING COSTS OF PUBLIC TRANSIT (INCLUDING THE PAYROLL AND EXPENSES OF PRIVATE PROVIDERS OF PUBLIC TRANSIT). THE EXPECTED OUTCOME OF THESE ACTIVITIES WILL SUPPORT THE AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN (ARP) INTENDED TO IMPROVE DAY-TO-DAY OPERATIONS FOR EMPLOYEES IN PUBLIC SERVICE WITH MINIMIZING EXPOSURE THROUGH CLEANING AND SANITIZATION ACTIVITIES IN COMBATING THE SPREAD OF THE COVID-19 VIRUS.THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES WILL INCLUDE EMPLOYEES AND ESPECIALLY THOSE IN PUBLIC SERVICE ENVIRONMENTS.THERE WILL NOT BE ANY SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES INCLUDED IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION.CENTRAL COUNTY TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.CCTA WILL FOLLOW ALL THIRD-PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE) AND WILL ENSURE CONTRACTORS PROCURED ARE NOT SUSPENDED OR DEBARRED FROM FEDERAL CONTRACTING.PER THE ARPA THE PROJECT IN THIS APPLICATION IS NOT REQUIRED TO BE PROGRAMMED IN THE LONG-RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLAN STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION PLAN OR STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM.

A TOTAL OF $281746 WILL BE USED FOR THE PERIOD OF SEPTEMBER 2021 THROUGH MARCH 2023 TO ENHANCE MOBILITY FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES INCLUDING $21073 IN FY2020 SECTION 5310 CARRYOVER FUNDS $223673 IN FY2021 SECTION 5310 FUNDS AND $37000 IN MICHIGAN COMPREHENSIVE TRANSPORTATION FUND (CTF) MATCH FUNDS FOR: - 1 SMALL REPLACEMENT BUS FOR SUBRECIPIENT JEWISH FAMILY SERVICES (JFS) - PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE FOR SUBRECIPIENT JFS - MOBILITY MANAGEMENT FOR SUBRECIPIENT PEOPLES EXPRESS (PEX) - SOFTWARE FOR SUBRECIPIENT JFS AND - OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR SUBRECIPIENTS JFS PEX AND PEAC. THE RECIPIENT (AAATA) CERTIFIES THAT AT LEAST 55 PERCENT OF PROGRAM FUNDS ARE BEING USED ON CAPITAL OR TRADITIONAL 5310 PROJECTS WITHIN THIS GRANT APPLICATION AND THE PROJECTS ARE DERIVED FROM THE 2020 SOUTHEAST MICHIGAN ONHAND COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES-TRANSPORTATION PLAN (CHSTP) FOR THE REGIONAL TRANSIT AUTHORITY (RTA) AREA WHICH INCLUDES THE ANN ARBOR URBANIZED AREA. THIS COORDINATED PLAN WAS LOCALLY DEVELOPED AND APPROVED THROUGH AN OPEN PROCESS LED BY THE RTA WITH INPUT FROM THE WASHTENAW COUNTY TRANSPORTATION COORDINATING COUNCIL (TCC) THAT PREVIOUSLY MANAGED THE AREAS COORDINATED PLAN. PLAN DEVELOPMENT INVOLVED SURVEYS AND PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT WITH PARTICIPATION BY SENIORS INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES PUBLIC PRIVATE AND NONPROFIT TRANSPORTATION AND HUMAN SERVICES PROVIDERS AND MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC. THE RTA WILL WORK WITH THE TCC AND LOCAL STAKEHOLDERS TO REGULARLY REVIEW THE NEW CHSTP 5310 PROGRAM MANAGEMENT PLAN AND 5310 PROGRAM OF PROJECTS TO GUIDE A COORDINATED APPROACH TO SERVING SENIORS PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND INDIVIDUALS WITH LOW INCOMES. ATTACHMENTS INCLUDE: EXPORT FROM JOBNET STIP SYSTEM; RTA SPLIT LETTER; RTA CHSTP; 5310 PMP; AND SUBRECIPIENT VEHICLE REPLACEMENT SCHEDULE. IN EXECUTING THIS GRANT THE RECIPIENT (AAATA) AGREES TO ABIDE BY SECTION 3011 OF THE FAST ACT (49 U.S.C. 5323(J)(2)(C) REGARDING THE PHASED INCREASE IN DOMESTIC CONTENT UNDER THE BUY AMERICA STATUTE FOR ROLLING STOCK. AS GRANT AGREEMENT INCLUDES AN FTA-FUNDED TRANSIT VEHICLE PURCHASE THE RECIPIENT (AAATA) AGREES TO COMPLY WITH THE RELATED REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN 49 CFR 26.49(A). SPECIFICALLY RECIPIENT MUST ENSURE AS A CONDITION OF BEING AUTHORIZED TO BID OR PROPOSE ON FTA-ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE PROCUREMENTS THAT EACH TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURER CERTIFIED THAT IT COMPLIED WITH DOT REQUIREMENTS FOR SUBMITTING A DBE PROGRAM AND GOAL TO FTA PRIOR TO BIDDING. RECIPIENT IS ALSO REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE NAME OF THE SUCCESSFUL BIDDER AND THE TOTAL DOLLAR VALUE OF THE CONTRACT WITHIN 30 DAYS OF MAKING A FTA- ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE AWARD USING THE REQUIRED FTA REPORTING TOOL. RECIPIENT UNDERSTANDS THAT FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THESE REQUIREMENTS MAY RESULT IN FORMAL ENFORCEMENT ACTION OR APPROPRIATE SANCTION AS DETERMINED BY FTA INCLUDING REIMBURSEMENT OF FTA FUNDS USED FOR THE VEHICLE PROCUREMENT. THE OPERATING ASSISTANCE PROJECT IN THIS APPLICATION INVOKES THE CORONAVIRUS RESPONSE AND RELIEF SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS ACT OF 2021 (CRRSAA) LOCAL SHARE WAIVER FOR PREVIOUSLY APPORTIONED (FY21 AND PRIOR) UNOBLIGATED SECTION 5310 FUNDING TO BE OBLIGATED AT 100-PERCENT FEDERAL SHARE AS DESCRIBED IN CA31 OF THE FTA COVID-19 FAQS.- PURPOSE OF THE AWARD: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO SUPPORT TRANSPORTATION SERVICES THAT ENHANCE MOBILITY FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE ANN ARBOR URBANIZED AREA (UZA) OF MICHIGAN. - ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: SECTION 5310-ELIGIBLE ACTIVITIES TO BE CARRIED OUT UNDER THIS AWARD INCLUDE PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT OPERATIONS AND PURCHASE OF SOFTWARE AND A SMALL REPLACEMENT BUS BY NONPROFITS IN THE ANN ARBOR UZA.- EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THROUGH THIS AWARD THE JEWISH FAMILY SERVICES (JFS) CAREVAN PROGRAM PEAC SCHOOL ACTIVE TRANSPORTATION PROJECT AND PEOPLES EXPRESS (PEX) ON-DEMAND SERVICE WILL BE ABLE TO CONTINUE OPERATIONS DESIGNED TO MEET THE SPECIALIZED NEEDS OF SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES IN WASHTENAW COUNTY. JFS EXPECTS TO BE ABLE TO TRANSPORT APPROXIMATELY 9000 CLIENTS TO ACCESS ESSENTIAL DESTINATIONS WHILE MAINTAINING THE PROGRAMS FLEET AND DISPATCH SOFTWARE. PEAC EXPECTS TO PROVIDE INDIVIDUALIZED TRAVEL-TRAINING INSTRUCTION TO APPROXIMATELY 50 STUDENTS WITH COGNITIVE IMPAIRMENTS HELPING EMPOWER THEM TO LIVE MORE INDEPENDENTLY BY ACCESSING TRANSIT SAFELY. PEX EXPECTS TO PROVIDE ABOUT 2400 RIDES AND SUPPORT ITS MOBILITY MANAGERS IN TAKING 9000 CALLS PER YEAR TO ENABLE CLIENTS TO REACH FIXED ROUTE STOPS AND KEY DESTINATIONS SUCH AS DIALYSIS APPOINTMENTS.- INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS AWARD ARE SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES THROUGHOUT THE ANN ARBOR UZA. THE JFS CAREVAN PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE ELDERLY AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS WITH TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS SOCIAL EVENTS AND EMPLOYMENT AND VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES. THE PEAC SCHOOL ACTIVE TRANSPORTATION PROJECT PROVIDES SPECIALIZED ACTIVE TRANSPORTATION TRAINING FOR YOUNG ADULTS AGES 14-26 WITH COGNITIVE DISABILITIES IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE YPSILANTI AND WASHTENAW INTERMEDIATE SCHOOL DISTRICT SCHOOLS. THE PEOPLES EXPRESS ON-DEMAND SERVICE HELPS FILL TRANSPORTATION GAPS IN THE UZA BY PROVIDING DOOR-TO-DOOR SERVICE THAT ENHANCES ACCESS FOR SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES IN NORTHFIELD PITTSFIELD SUPERIOR LODI SALINE AND YPSILANTI TOWNSHIPS AND THE CITY OF SALINE.- SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS AWARD ARE PROGRAMMED TO BE CARRIED OUT BY THREE ELIGIBLE PRIVATE NONPROFIT SUBRECIPIENTS AND BASED ON THE SOUTHEAST MICHIGAN ONHAND COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES-TRANSPORTATION PLAN AND 2021 CALL FOR PROJECTS: JEWISH FAMILY SERVICES OF WASHTENAW COUNTY (PURCHASE OF ONE SMALL REPLACEMENT BUS TRANSPORTATION AND DISPATCH SOFTWARE PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE AND OPERATING ASSISTANCE); PEOPLES EXPRESS (MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND OPERATING ASSISTANCE); AND PEAC (OPERATING ASSISTANCE).

THE DETROIT DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (DTC) REQUESTS SECTION 5310 FUNDING TO SUPPORT MULTIPLE PROJECTS FOR A TOTAL REQUEST OF $535426 (FEDERAL: $428341 AND COMPREHENSIVE TRANSPORTATION FUND (CTF): $107085). THE SECTION 5310 REQUEST INCLUDES: - FFY 2019 - FEDERAL (80%): $270000 CTF (20%): $67500 TOTAL (100%): $337500. - FFY 2020 - FEDERAL (80%): $158341 CTF (20%): $39585 TOTAL (100%): $197926.THE PROJECTS FUNDED BY FY 2019 AND 2020 INCLUDE: (1) UPGRADING THE CCTV NETWORKS IN STATIONS STAIRWELLS AND ELEVATORS; (2) ACQUIRING CCTV CAMERAS EQUIPMENT; (3) DESIGNING PLANNING ENGINEERING SERVICES; (4) UPGRADING THE PUBLIC ANNOUNCEMENT (PA) SYSTEM EMERGENCY PHONES IN STATIONS AND TRAINS; (5) CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT SERVICES; (6) UPGRADING VISUAL MESSAGE SIGNS IN STATIONS AND TRAINS; AND (7) ALL OTHER SERVICES PROVIDED TO DTC TO SUPPORT THIS INITIATIVE.THE FOLLOWING DOCUMENTS ARE ATTACHED IN TRAMS FOR FISCAL YEARS 2019 AND 2020: (1) DTC STIP PROJECTS; (2) RTA APPORTIONMENT LETTERS; (3) LONG RANGE TIP PROJECTS; (4) SEMCOG REGIONAL WORK PLANS; (5) STIP APPROVAL LETTER; AND (6) RTA CHSTP (PP. 6-2 TO 6-6). PURPOSE OF THE AWARD: SECTION 5310 FUNDING WILL ASSIST DTC IN MODERNIZING THE CCTV NETWORK IN ALL DETROIT PEOPLE MOVER (DMP) PASSENGER STATIONS AND TRAINS. THE TECHNOLOGY IMPROVEMENTS WILL REMOVE BARRIERS THAT PREVIOUSLY MADE NAVIGATING THE LIGHT RAIL SYSTEM MORE DIFFICULT.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: DTC ANTICIPATES PERFORMING A WIDE RANGE OF ACTIVITIES USING SECTION 5310 FUNDING. THESE INCLUDE: (1) UPGRADING THE CCTV NETWORKS IN STATIONS STAIRWELLS AND ELEVATORS; (2) ACQUIRING CCTV CAMERAS EQUIPMENT; (3) DESIGNING PLANNING ENGINEERING SERVICES; (4) UPGRADING THE PUBLIC ANNOUNCEMENT (PA) SYSTEM EMERGENCY PHONES IN STATIONS AND TRAINS; (5) CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT SERVICES; (6) UPGRADING VISUAL MESSAGE SIGNS IN STATIONS AND TRAINS; AND (7) ALL OTHER SERVICES PROVIDED TO DTC TO SUPPORT THIS INITIATIVE. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: BY PERFORMING THE ACTIVITIES ANTICIPATED IN MODERNIZING THE CCTV NETWORK DTC WILL ENHANCE THE RIDING AND TRAVELING EXPERIENCES OF SENIORS INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND ALL OTHER PATRONS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PRIMARY BENEFICIARIES FROM APPLYING SECTION 5310 FUNDING TO UPGRADE THE PASSENGER STATIONS CCTV NETWORK ARE ALL DPM RIDERS MOST NOTABLY SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION: THE MOVING AHEAD FOR PROGRESS IN THE 21ST CENTURY ACT (MAP-21) BLENDED THE NEW FREEDOM PROGRAM WITH THE ELDERLY INDIVIDUALS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES PROGRAM. AS A RESULT OF THE CHANGE A NEW ENHANCED MOBILITY FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES PROGRAM WAS CREATED. THE DETROIT TRANSPORTATION CORPORATION (DTC) IS APPLYING FOR FUNDING UNDER THE NEW FREEDOM PROGRAM. THIS APPLICATION INCLUDES THE FY 2013 AND FY 2014 ALLOCATION. THE FEDERAL ALLOCATION FOR THE DTC FY 2013 FUNDING IS $705800 (20% COMPREHENSIVE TRANSPORTATION FUNDS $176450 AND 100% $882250). THE PROJECTS FOR FY 2013 ARE BUT NOT LIMITED TO 1) UPGRADE AUTOMATED STATION ENTRY DOORS 2) UPGRADE ELEVATOR MONITORING SYSTEMS 3) SENSORY ENHANCEMENTS IN STATIONS AND 4)UPGRADE ADA/BRAILLE ELEVATOR AND STAIRWAY SIGNAGE.THE FEDERAL ALLOCATION FOR THE DTC FY 2014 FUNDING IS $223200 (20% COMPREHENSIVE TRANSPORTATION FUNDS $55800 AND 100% $279000). APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE TRANSIT STOP ACCESS PROJECT IS AN EFFORT TO IMPROVE ACCESS AND ACCESSIBILITY TO PRIORITY BUS STOPS ACROSS THE REGION INCLUDING STOPS USED BY BSOOB TRANSIT.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: A REGIONAL INSPECTOR WILL DETERMINE FINAL DESIGN PLANS FOR PREVIOUSLY IDENTIFIED BUS STOPS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: BSOOB TRANSIT RIDERS WILL BE BETTER ABLE TO IDENTIFY STOPS AND THE BUS STOPS WILL BE EASIER TO ACCESS FOR THOSE NEEDING ADA UPGRADES. STOPS THAT ARE UPGRADED WITH BENCHES OR SHELTERS WILL CREATE A MORE COMFORTABLE SPACE TO WAIT FOR THE BUS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT ALL IN THE AREA WHO USE AND RELY ON PUBLIC TRANSIT TO DO BUSINESS; GO TO WORK OR SCHOOL; DO SHOPPING AND OTHER NECESSARY ERRANDS INCLUDING MEDICAL SERVICES. DISABLED PEOPLE WILL BE BETTER ABLE TO ACCESS BUS STOP LOCATIONS. BSOOB TRANSIT OPERATORS WILL BE BETTER ABLE TO IDENTIFY RIDERS WHO ARE WAITING AT BUS STOPS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NA

PURPOSE: MAINEDOT REQUESTS $187855 OF FFY2020 MOBILITY FOR ALL PILOT PROGRAM GRANT FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE STATE OF MAINE. THE PROJECT ID IS D2020-MFAP-008.THE ORIGINAL GRANT AWARD WAS TO SUPPORT THE PILOT FLEX ROUTE BUS SYSTEM IN PRESQUE ISLE WITH AN EMPHASIS ON TECHNOLOGY AND SAFETY FOR THE INCLUSION OF DISADVANTAGED WITH ENHANCED MOBILITY FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. MAINEDOT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENT AROOSTOOK REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM (ARTS) REQUESTED AND WAS GRANTED A SCOPE CHANGE TO THE ORIGINAL PROJECT (SEE ATTACHED APPROVAL). THE NEW PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE FOLLOWING: ARTS WILL INVEST IN CAPITAL SOFTWARE TECHNOLOGY UPGRADES INITIATE A MARKETING CAMPAIGN TO PROMOTE ARTSS SERVICES AND PROCURE 2 (TWO) ADDITIONAL ACCESSIBLE VEHICLES THAT WILL ENABLE ARTS TO RESPOND MORE QUICKLY AND EFFICIENTLY TO TRANSPORTATION REQUESTS. THE ACTIVITIES WILL ENSURE CONTINUED RELIABLE AND COST-EFFECTIVE TRANSPORTATION TO ITS SERVICE AREA.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: NEW TECHNOLOGY WILL ENABLE LAST-MINUTE SCHEDULING CHANGES TO MEET MORE DEMAND FOR SERVICE; MARKETING EFFORTS WILL INCREASE AWARENESS OF SERVICES IN THE REGION AND ENABLE LOCAL PARTNERSHIPS TO ENHANCE AND INCREASE ACCESS; NEW CAPITAL WILL INCREASE THE FLEET SIZE AND ENSURE THE ABILITY TO MEET TRANSPORTATION DEMANDS FOR THE REGION.INTENDED SUBRECIPIENT: AROOSTOOK REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM INC. (ARTS) REGION 1LOCAL MATCH WILL BE PROVIDED THROUGH THE CAPITAL RESERVE ACCOUNT AT ARTS.MAINEDOT IS CURRENT WITH CIVIL RIGHTS REQUIREMENTS MILESTONE PROGRESS REPORTS AND FINANCIAL STATUS REPORTS. ANNUAL CERTIFICATIONS AND ASSURANCES WERE EXECUTED JANUARY 25 2021. ALL ADMINISTRATIVE AND STATUTORY REQUIREMENTS HAVE BEEN MET.

PURPOSE OF THE AWARD - THE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD IS TO PROVIDE SUBRECIPIENTS WITH FUNDING ASSISTANCE (CAPITAL AND OPERATING) TO IMPROVE MOBILITY FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES BY REMOVING BARRIERS TO TRANSPORTATION SERVICE AND EXPANDING TRANSPORTATION MOBILITY OPTIONS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED - FUNDING WILL COVER CAPITAL AND OPERATING ACTIVITIES. FUNDING FOR CAPITAL EXPENDITURES WILL COVER THE COST OF MOBILITY MANAGEMENT EXPANSION AND REPLACEMENT SMALL BUSES AND LIGHT-DUTY VANS RADIOS AND COMMUNICATION EQUIPMENT AND TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE. FUNDING FOR OPERATING EXPENDITURE WILL COVER DRIVER WAGES ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF TIME FUEL INSURANCE PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE VEHICLE SANITIZATION EQUIPMENT PERSONAL PROTECT EQUIPMENT (PPE) CLEANING SUPPLIES DRIVER SAFETY SHIELDS AND DISINFECTANT SPRAYERS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES - FUNDING HAS BEEN REQUESTED FOR A RANGE OF PROJECTS TO INCLUDE OPERATING ASSISTANCE (E.G. DRIVERS SALARY AND FRINGE BENEFITS) PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE AND REPLACEMENT AND EXPANSION VEHICLES FOR AN IMPROVED RESPONSIVE AND BLENDED TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM THAT ACCOMMODATES SCHEDULED ROUTES ON-DEMAND TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND INCREASED PASSENGER LOADS TO DESTINATIONS THROUGHOUT THE LARGEST LAND AREAS IN MARYLAND. THE ELDERLY AND DISABLED WILL HAVE INCREASED OPPORTUNITIES FOR SOCIALIZATION AND PHYSICAL/MENTAL STIMULATION THE MEANS TO PARTICIPATE IN A WIDE RANGE OF COMMUNITY ACTIVITIES INCLUDING SUPPORTED EMPLOYMENT INDIVIDUAL PLACEMENT ENCLAVES VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES AND MOBILE CREWS AT SCATTERED LOCATIONS AND THE SUPPORT TO MAINTAIN AND OR IMPROVE THEIR FUNCTIONAL LEVELS AND PREVENT PREMATURE OR INAPPROPRIATE INSTITUTIONALIZATION. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES -ELDERLY AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS WHO RELY ON THE THIRTY-SEVEN SUBRECIPIENTS AGENCY TRANSPORTATION SERVICES. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES - THIRTY-SEVEN SUBRECIPIENTS WILL RECEIVE FUNDS FOR REPLACEMENT SMALL BUSES (31 TOTAL); EXPANSION SMALL BUSES (11 TOTAL); REPLACEMENT LIGHT DUTY VANS (21 TOTAL); EXPANSION LIGHT DUTY VANS (2 TOTAL) MOBILITY MANAGEMENT TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM SOFTWARE SECURITY EQUIPMENT CLEANING SUPPLIES COVID SHIELDS DISINFECTANT SPRAYERS AND PPE AND A DIAGNOSTIC SCAN TOOL.5310 FORMULA PROGRAM AT 100% FEDERAL SHARE THE MARYLAND TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (MTA) INTENDS TO USE SECTION 5310 FEDERAL FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE ENHANCED MOBILITY FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES FOR SUBRECIPIENTS WITHIN THE STATE OF MARYLAND. APPLICATION PURPOSE: PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO THE STATE OF MASSACHUSETTS DOT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS FOR EXPENSES INCURRED DURING AND THROUGHOUT THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THIS AWARD WILL PROVIDE OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO THE STATE OF MASSACHUSETTS DOT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS FOR EXPENSES INCURRED DURING AND THROUGHOUT THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. FUNDING WILL PERMIT MASSDOT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SERVICE FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS. ADDITIONALLY THE AWARD WILL SUPPORT STATE ADMINISTRATION COSTS THAT SUPPORT THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT WILL ENHANCE THE MOBILITY OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES THROUGHOUT THE COMMONWEALTH BY FILLING GAPS IN SERVICE. ALL PROJECTS WILL REFLECT NEEDS AND PRIORITIES SPELLED OUT IN THEIR LOCALLY DEVELOPED COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICE TRANSPORTATION PLANS. SUPPORTED SERVICES WILL INCLUDE EXPANDING MICROTRANSIT SERVICES TO SERVE OLDER ADULTS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AS WELL AS SUPPORTING REGIONALIZED VOLUNTEER DRIVER PROGRAMS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS PROJECT WILL ENHANCE THE MOBILITY OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES BY FILLING GAPS IN SERVICE THROUGHOUT THE COMMONWEALTH OF MASSACHUSETTS AND WILL REFLECT THE NEEDS AND PRIORITIES SPELLED OUT IN LOCALLY DEVELOPED COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICE TRANSPORTATION PLANS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE OPERATING SUPPORT FOR NONPROFITS COUNCILS ON AGING AND TRANSIT AUTHORITIES. MASSDOT PUBLISHED THE NOTICE OF FUNDING OPPORTUNITY (NOFO) FOR THIS PROJECT ON APRIL 11 AND OPENED THE APPLICATION PROCESS ON MAY 8. APPLICATIONS ARE DUE ON JUNE 23 2023 WITH FUNDING SELECTIONS MADE LATER IN THE SUMMER.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: ACCESS TO FIXED-ROUTE BUS SERVICE CAN BE A CHALLENGE AND CREATE BARRIERS FOR SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES WHEN THERE ARE DIFFICULTIES NAVIGATING TO AND FROM BUS STOPS AND BOARDING BUSES. IN COLLABORATION WITH THE KENTUCKY TRANSPORTATION CABINET (KYTC) AND LEXINGTON-FAYETTE URBAN COUNTY GOVERNMENT (LFUCG) LEXTRAN WORKS TO IDENTIFY THESE BARRIERS AND ADDRESS THEM. IN DOING SO LEXTRAN WILL USE THE SECTION 5310 FUNDING FOR A SOLAR ILLUMINATION INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECT.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE PROJECT WILL IMPROVE SAFETY VISIBILITY AND ACCESSIBILITY AT 15 BUS STOPS IN FAYETTE COUNTY WITH ON-DEMAND SOLAR LIGHTING INSTALLATIONS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: LEXTRAN CURRENTLY HAS AN INITIATIVE UNDERWAY KNOWN AS THE RIDER AMENITIES AT MANY PLACES (RAMP) PROGRAM WHICH ALLOWS FOR INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS AT STOPS. SUCH IMPROVEMENTS INCLUDE THE ADDITION OF SIDEWALK CONNECTIONS BOARDING PADS BENCHES AND SHELTERS. THIS PROGRAM CONTINUES TO BE SUCCESSFUL IN IMPROVING BUS STOP ACCESSIBILITY. HOWEVER SOME BUS STOP LOCATIONS PROVE DIFFICULT TO CHANGE DUE TO PROPERTY RESTRICTIONS OR LIMITED OR LACK OF PUBLIC RIGHT-OF-WAY. PROVIDING ADDITIONAL VISIBILITY TO AREAS SUCH AS THESE WILL INCREASE THE ACCESSIBILITY AND AVAILABILITY OF THE BUS STOP AS WELL AS ENHANCE PEDESTRIAN AND PASSENGER SAFETY. BY PROVIDING ENHANCED VISIBILITY AND SAFETY UPGRADES AT BUS STOPS IN THE FORM OF NEW LIGHTING THIS PROJECT WILL OPEN ACCESS TO NEW AREAS ESPECIALLY THOSE WITH LIMITATIONS ON IMPROVEMENTS AND ADAPTATIONS TO THE BUILT ENVIRONMENT.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THESE NEW LOCALITIES CAN ALLOW THE ELDERLY AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES TO TRAVEL IN DIFFERENT AND MORE CONVENIENT PATTERNS THROUGHOUT LEXINGTON. LIGHT ACTIVATION BUTTONS INSTALLED AT AN ACCESSIBLE HEIGHT WILL ENSURE THAT ALL PASSENGERS ARE ABLE TO UTILIZE THE EQUIPMENT AND BENEFIT FROM IT. ALL BUS STOPS THAT CAN BE MADE MORE ACCESSIBLE VISIBLE AND SECURE WILL CREATE NEW OPTIONS FOR SERVICE AND IMPROVE THE MOBILITY FOR THE COMMUNITY. FOCUSING ON QUALITY-OF-LIFE LOCATIONS WILL HELP MAKE FIXED-ROUTE TRAVEL A MORE VIABLE OPTION AND DECREASE THE RELIANCE ON ADVANCE SCHEDULING AND RESERVATIONS BOTH REQUIREMENTS OF PARATRANSIT SERVICE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: LEXTRAN WILL NOT BE USING SUBRECIPIENTS FOR THIS PROJECT.

THIS APPLICATION IS FOR 5310 OPERATING FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $197717 AND TRADITIONAL CAPITAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $43937.$197717 WILL BE USED FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE. $43937 WILL BE USED FOR A TRADITIONAL CAPITAL ACQUISITION IN THE FORM OF A SUPPORT VEHICLE TO SUPPORT ADA AND SENIOR SERVICES. THE $197717 OPERATING IS 45% OF THE FFY2019 5310 ALLOCATION FOR KY SMALL URBANIZED AREAS 50000 TO 199999 IN POPULATION DESIGNATED FOR THE TRANSIT AUTHORITY OF CENTRAL KENTUCKY BY THE KENTUCKY TRANSPORTATION CABINET. THE $43937 IS THE REMAINING FUNDS FROM THE 55% TRADITIONAL CAPITAL FUNDS TOTALING $241654 OF WHICH $197717 HAS BEEN ALLOCATED AND COMPLETED IN PRIOR GRANT ID KY-2019-015-01. THE VEHICLE PURCHASED USING THE $43937 IN TRADITIONAL CAPITAL FUNDS WILL HAVE A USEFUL LIFE OF 4 YEARS/ 100000 MILES.THE OPERATING FUNDS WILL BE USED IN FY23. THE CAPITAL FUNDS WILL BE USED BY 3/30/2024.THE FUNDS FOR OPERATING AND FOR CAPITAL ARE 100% FEDERALLY FUNDED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE CRRSAA-FLEXIBILITY. THEREFORE NO STATE OR LOCAL MATCH IS REQUIRED. THIS APPLICATION IS NOT FOR RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT. AN INDIRECT COST RATE WILL NOT BE APPLIED TO ANY ACTIVITIES WITHIN THIS APPLICATION. TACK IS A DIRECT RECIPIENT.GOVERNOR ANDY BESHEAR ISSUED EXECUTIVE ORDER NO. 2020-215 DECLARING A STATE OF EMERGENCY IN RESPONSE TO COVID-19 ON MARCH 6 2020.ALL PROJECTS ARE CONSISTENT WITH A COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN.

THIS GRANT APPLICATION IS FOR SECTION 5310 ENHANCED MOBILITY FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES PROGRAM FORMULA FUNDS IN A TOTAL AMOUNT OF $1037800 ($925898 FEDERAL AND $161203 LOCAL MATCH).IT WILL USE THE BALANCE OF LAPSING FFY 19 SECTION 5310 FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $49301 FEDERAL AND IT WILL USE FFY 20 SECTION 5310 FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $876597 FEDERAL.THIS GRANT APPLICATION USES THE CRRSAA RULE THAT SECTION 5310 FUNDS MAY BE AWARDED AT 100% FEDERAL SHARE WITH ZERO LOCAL MATCH. ALL PROJECTS ARE FUNDED AT 100% FEDERAL SHARE EXCEPT FOR THE TARC PROJECT SUBURBAN WORK TRIPS FOR PARATRANSIT CUSTOMERS OUTSIDE OF THE ADA SERVICE AREA. FUNDING THAT PROJECT AT 100% FEDERAL SHARE WOULD HAVE CAUSED THE OTHER FUNDING TO EXCEED THE 45% MAXIMUM ALLOWED.10% OF THE FFY 2020 APPORTIONMENT ($98652) IS AVAILABLE FOR PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION. IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION TARC IS USING $88787 OF THE $98652 THAT IS AVAILABLE FOR PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION. THE REMAINING $9865 IN FFY 2020 FUNDS AVAILABLE FOR PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION WILL BE CARRIED FORWARD AND WILL BE USED BY TARC FOR PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION IN A FUTURE YEAR.TARC CERTIFIES THAT ALL PROJECTS ARE DERIVED FROM THE KIPDA COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN 2014 (ATTACHED SEE PAGES 3-6 OF LRTP HORIZON 2035) AND ARE PROGRAMMED IN THE KY STIP FY 2019-2022 APPROVED ON 10/11/2018 AND AMENDED FOR LOUISVILLE KY ON FEBRUARY 25 2021 (ATTACHED).ALIS FOR THE 55% MINIMUM 5310 TRADITIONAL FUNDS AMOUNTED TO A TOTAL OF $509224 ($509224 FEDERAL AND $0 LOCAL MATCH) WHICH IS 55.00001% OF THE TOTAL FEDERAL FUNDS THAT ARE BEING AWARDED IN THIS GRANT. THIS MEETS THE REQUIREMENT THAT A MINIMUM OF 55% OF FEDERAL FUNDS MUST BE AWARDED FOR TRADITIONAL PROJECTS. (SEE A DETAILED LIST OF THOSE TRADITIONAL FUNDS ALIS AT THE END OF THE PROJECT DESCRIPTION IN PART 3: PROJECT INFORMATION.)ALIS FOR THE 5310 OTHER FUNDS AMOUNTED TO A TOTAL OF $577857 ($416654 FEDERAL AND $161203 LOCAL MATCH). THE $416654 FEDERAL IS 44.99999% OF THE TOTAL FEDERAL FUNDS THAT ARE BEING AWARDED IN THIS GRANT. THIS MEETS THE REQUIREMENT THAT NO MORE THAN OF 45% OF FEDERAL FUNDS CAN BE AWARDED FOR OTHER PROJECTS. (SEE A DETAILED LIST OF THOSE OTHER FUNDS ALIS AT THE END OF THE PROJECT DESCRIPTION IN PART 3: PROJECT INFORMATION.)COMPETITIVE PROJECT SELECTION PROCESS: TARC IS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT OF SECTION 5310 PROGRAM FUNDS FOR THE LOUISVILLE URBANIZED AREA. TARC CONDUCTED A COMPETITIVE SELECTION PROCESS FOR SECTION 5310 PROJECTS. AN INDEPENDENT IMPARTIAL SELECTION REVIEW COMMITTEE OF FIVE MEMBERS FROM THE COMMUNITY SELECTED THE PROJECTS USING EVALUATION CRITERIA DEVELOPED BY THE RMC. A TOTAL OF 6 PROJECT APPLICANTS ALONG WITH TARC WERE AWARDED FUNDS. MOST PROJECTS INCLUDED FUNDING REQUESTS FOR SEVERAL DIFFERENT TYPES OF ACTIVITY WHICH RESULTED IN A TOTAL OF 18 ALIS. (SEE A DETAILED LIST OF THOSE ALIS AT THE END OF THE PROJECT DESCRIPTION IN PART 3: PROJECT INFORMATION.)THOSE ALIS INCLUDE:1. PURCHASE OF VEHICLES BY SUBRECIPIENTS FOR THEIR SECTION 5310 PROGRAMS WHICH PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHEN PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IS INSUFFICIENT INAPPROPRIATE OR UNAVAILABLE.2. PURCHASE OF PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE FOR THOSE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM VEHICLES.4. PURCHASE OF EQUIPMENT FOR THOSE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM VEHICLES INCLUDING SIGNAGE RADIOS SECURITY CAMERAS AND LIGHTING FOR PARKING LOTS.3. OPERATING EXPENSES FOR THOSE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM VEHICLES.5. OPERATING EXPENSES FOR TRANSIT AUTHORITY OF RIVER CITY (TARC) FOR THE SUBURBAN WORK TRIPS FOR PARATRANSIT CUSTOMERS OUTSIDE OF THE ADA SERVICE AREA PROJECT TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE PARATRANSIT WORK TRIPS FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES WHO LIVE OR WORK OUTSIDE THE ADA SERVICE AREA. (THIS PROJECT IS LISTED AS A SEPARATE PROJECT IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION.)6. STATE OR PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION OF THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM BY TARC INCLUDING SUBRECIPIENT OVERSIGHT.TARC WILL FOLLOW ALL 3RD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE). TARC WILL ENSURE CONTRACTORS PROCURED WILL NOT BE ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST. THIS IS NOT A RESEARCH DEVELOPMENT GRANT. TARC WILL NOT APPLY AN INDIRECT COST RATE TO ANY ACTIVITIES IN THIS GRANT. NO DE MINIMUS RATE WILL BE CHARGED TO THIS GRANT. NO CONSTRUCTION PROJECTS OR CONSTRUCTION WORK WILL BE FUNDED BY THIS GRANT.NEW VEHICLES WILL MEET ALL REQUISITE REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS INCLUDING THOSE ASSOCIATED WITH FEDERAL MOTOR VEHICLE SAFETY STANDARDS CLEAN AIR ACT STANDARDS (CAA) AND THE AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES ACT OF 1990. TARC WILL ENSURE THAT ALL ACCESSIBLE VEHICLES ARE PURCHASED FROM AN FTA APPROVED TVM AND REPORTED TO FTA IN THE NEXT MILESTONE PROGRESS REPORT AFTER VEHICLE VENDOR CONTRACT IS SIGNED. TARC WILL CHECK THE CURRENT LISTING OF TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURERS (TVM) (HTTPS://WWW.TRANSIT.DOT.GOV/REGULATIONS-AND-GUIDANCE/CIVIL-RIGHTS-ADA/ELIGIBLE-TVMS-LIST) TO ENSURE EACH IS LISTED AS A CERTIFIED TVM IN COMPLIANCE WITH FTA REGULATIONS.THESE GRANT ACTIVITIES ARE ALL CATEGORICALLY EXCLUDED UNDER NEPA.THIS GRANT USES LAPSING FUNDS. THE FREQUENCY OF MPRS IS ONE PER YEAR (ANNUAL MPRS).THIS GRANT WILL NOT CAUSE ANY CHANGES TO TARCS FLEET LIST BECAUSE NONE OF THE VEHICLES PURCHASED WITH THESE GRANT FUNDS WILL BE ADDED TO TARCS FLEET. ALL VEHICLES PURCHASED WITH THESE GRANT FUNDS WILL BE PURCHASED BY SUBRECIPIENTS AND ADDED TO THEIR OWN FLEETS. THIS GRANT WILL NOT AFFECT TARCS FLEET LIST IN ANY WAY. SEE ATTACHED DOCUMENTS:1) LRTP SEPARATE PAGES 2) FTA APPROVAL OF TARC 5310 PMP 3) IN 5310 DESIGNATED RECIPIENT LETTER4) KY 5310 DESIGNATED RECIPIENT LETTER5) STIP ADMIN-MOD-13 PAGES FEB 25 2021 - 5310 MARKED6) POP 5310 PROGRAM OF PROJECTS FY19-207) VEHICLES BEING REPLACED

CRRSAA PERMITS ALL UNOBLIGATED NON-CRRSAA SECTION 5310 FORMULA FUNDING (FY21 AND PRIOR) TO BE OBLIGATED AT A 100-PERCENT FEDERAL SHARE FOR ALL ACTIVITIES ELIGIBLE UNDER THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM.WICHITA TRANSIT IS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT FOR SECTION 5310 FUNDS IN THE WICHITA URBANIZED AREA. WICHITA TRANSIT IS IN THE THIRD YEAR OF DISTRIBUTING FUNDS AND HAS AN AGREEMENT WITH WAMPO TO CONDUCT THE SELECTION PROCESS. WAMPO HAS CONDUCTED THAT PROCESS AND PROVIDED WICHITA TRANSIT WITH A RECOMMENDATION FOR FUNDING INCLUDING VEHICLE PURCHASES OPERATING 3RD PARTY CONTRACTING SERVICES TURNKEY SERVICE TURNKEY CONTRACT (CONTRACTOR PROVIDES VEHICLES MAINTENANCE AND TRANSIT SERVICE) AND TRAVEL TRAINING ACTIVITIES. CEREBRAL PALSY FOUNDATION OF KS (CPRF) PROJECTS FOR OPERATING AND VEHICLE REPLACEMENT. PARK CITY SENIOR CENTER FOR VEHICLE REPLACEMENT. CITY OF HAYSVILLE FOR OPERATING. KANSAS ELKS TRAINING CENTER FOR THE HANDICAPPED INC. (KETCH) WITH A VEHICLE REPLACEMENT. SEDGWICK COUNTY (SCDOA) FOR 3RD PARTY CONTRACTING TURNKEY SERVICE AND OPERATING. STARKEY VEHICLE REPLACEMENT. THERE WERE 10 PROJECTS AWARDED TO 8 AGENCIES.WICHITA TRANSIT WILL ALSO USE PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION TO PAY SALARIES OF WAMPO AND TRANSIT STAFF THAT WORK ON THE GRANT AND COVER ANY ICAP CHARGES THAT MAY BE APPLIED.THE GRANT IS FOR ELIGIBLE EXPENSES UNDER SECTION 5310 FUNDING USING CRRSAA RULES FOR OPERATING VEHICLE REPLACEMENT AND 3RD PARTY CONTRACTING SERVICES.THE AGENCIES WILL NOT BE USING FORCE ACCOUNT.WICHITA TRANSIT ISSUED A CALL FOR PROJECTS IN OCTOBER 2020 FOR FY19/20 SECTION 5310 FUNDING. AT THAT TIME CRRSAA FUNDING WAS NOT AVAILABLE AND THEREFORE AGENCIES WERE NOT NOTIFIED OF POTENTIAL FUNDING WITH 100% FEDERAL SHARE. WICHITA TRANSIT INTENDS TO PROVIDE THE VEHICLE PURCHASES OPERATING MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND 3RD PART CONTRACTING ALLOCATIONS AT 100% FEDERAL SHARE TO THE AWARDED SUBRECIPIENTS. APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS IS A FFY 2021 SECTION 5310 CRSSAA FUNDING APPLICATION FOR INDYGO IN THE AMOUNT OF $225051 AT 100% FEDERAL SHARE. THE APPLICATION SCOPE OF WORK INCLUDES OPERATING COSTS TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS FOR INDYGO AND THE SUBRECIPIENT CICOA. THIS FUNDING WILL BE SPLIT BETWEEN INDYGO UTILIZING $60051 AND CICOA UTILIZING $165000 AS A SUBRECIPIENT.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THIS APPLICATIONS SCOPE OF WORK FOR INDYGO INCLUDES OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE SUCH AS SALARIES PARATRANSIT SERVICE FUEL PPE AND CLEANING SERVICES FROM JANUARY 20 2020 THROUGH JUNE 30 2023. THIS ACTIVITY WILL BE CONTINUED WITH THE SECTION 5310 ARPA STIMULUS FUNDING WHICH IS CURRENTLY UNDER IN-2023-005 ONCE CRSSAA FUNDING IS EXHAUSTED. CICOAS SCOPE OF WORK INCLUDES FUNDING FOR OPERATIONAL EXPENDITURES AND LOST REVENUE INCURRED BEGINNING JANUARY 20 2020 UNTIL JULY 31 2021. THE OPERATIONAL EXPENSES WILL INCLUDE COSTS INCURRED TO OPERATE MAINTAIN AND PROVIDE SERVICE. LOST REVENUE WAS DETERMINED BY DOCUMENTATION PROVIDED BY CICOA DURING THE SPECIAL CALL FOR PROJECTS. THESE FUNDS WILL HELP CICOA ALLEVIATE FINANCIAL BURDENS PLACED ON THEM DURING THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. INDYGO WILL NOT BE UTILIZING ANY OF THIS FUNDING FOR PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION OF THE SUBRECIPIENT. THE FEDERAL SHARE IS 100%; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THESE FUNDS WILL BE UTILIZED TO HELP INDYGO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE RELIABLE PARATRANSIT SERVICE TO THE AREA UNTIL THE FUNDING HAS BEEN FULLY EXHAUSTED. THESE FUNDS WILL ALSO BE UTILIZED TO HELP ALLEVIATE SOME OF THE BURDENS CICOA FACED DURING THE PANDEMIC.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: UTILIZING THIS FUNDING FOR OPERATING WILL BENEFIT ALL PARATRANSIT RIDERS IN THE INDIANAPOLIS METROPOLITAN AREA WHICH INCLUDES THE CITY OF INDIANAPOLIS. THIS WILL ALSO BENEFIT CICOA RIDERS AS IT WILL HELP RECOVER FUNDING WHICH CAN BE UTILIZED TO CONTINUE PROVIDING SERVICES.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE SUBRECIPIENTS SCOPE OF WORK INCLUDES OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE AND LOST REVENUE DURING THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC FROM 1/20/2020 TO 7/31/2021. THIS TIMELINE WAS DETERMINED THOUGH A SPECIAL CALL FOR PROJECTS INDYGO RAN AND AWARDED IN 2022. INDYGO WILL NOT BE UTILIZING ANY OF THIS FUNDING FOR PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION OF THE SUBRECIPIENT.

MACOG WILL USE THESE FUNDS FOR THE SECTION 5310 CALL FOR PROJECTS TO PURCHASE REPLACEMENT VEHICLES OFF OF THE STATE QUANTITY PURCHASE AGREEMENT FOR AGENCIES IN THE SOUTH BEND URBANIZED AREA THAT PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHERE ACCESSIBLE PUBLIC TRANSIT IS NOT AVAILABLE INSUFFICIENT OR INAPPROPRIATE. THERE IS ONE CAPITAL PROJECT AND ONE PROJECT ADMINISTRATION. THE BREAKDOWN OF EACH PROJECT IS BELOW: PROJECT 1: REVENUE VEHICLE REPLACEMENT FOR UP TO FOURTEEN (14) LOW-FLOOR MOBILITY VEHICLES TO REPLACE VEHICLES THAT HAVE EXCEEDED THEIR USEFUL LIFE IN YEARS OR MILEAGE. THIS CAPITAL ITEM APPLIES FOR $491351 WITH A COST RATIO OF 80/20. PROJECT 2: PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION COSTS INCLUDING ADMINISTRATION PLANNING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE. THIS CAPITAL ITEM APPLIES FOR $54595 WHICH IS 10% OF THE TOTAL FEDERAL SHARE WITH A COST RATIO OF 100/0.THE FEDERAL SHARE FOR THESE PROJECTS WILL COME FROM THE SOUTH BEND PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION CORPORATIONS (TRANSPO) FFY 2019 AND 2020 SECTION 5310 MONIES (THIS FUNDING WAS TRANSFERRED) AND THE LOCAL SHARE WILL COME FROM THE ELIGIBLE PUBLIC BODIES AND PRIVATE NON-PROFIT CORPORATIONS THAT PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO ELDERLY AND DISABLED PERSONS IN THE SOUTH BEND URBANIZED AREA.IN EXECUTING THIS GRANT THE MACOG AGREES TO ABIDE BY SECTION 3011 OF THE FAST ACT (49 U.S.C. 5323(J)(2)(C) REGARDING THE PHASED INCREASE IN DOMESTIC CONTENT UNDER THE BUY AMERICA STATUTE FOR ROLLING STOCK.AS GRANT AGREEMENT INCLUDES AN FTA-FUNDED TRANSIT VEHICLE PURCHASE RECIPIENT AGREES TO COMPLY WITH THE RELATED REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN 49 CFR 26.49(A). SPECIFICALLY RECIPIENT MUST ENSURE AS A CONDITION OF BEING AUTHORIZED TO BID OR PROPOSE ON FTA-ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE PROCUREMENTS THAT EACH TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURER CERTIFIED THAT IT COMPLIED WITH DOT REQUIREMENTS FOR SUBMITTING A DBE PROGRAM AND GOAL TO FTA PRIOR TO BIDDING. RECIPIENT IS ALSO REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE NAME OF THE SUCCESSFUL BIDDER AND THE TOTAL DOLLAR VALUE OF THE CONTRACT WITHIN 30 DAYS OF MAKING A FTA- ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE AWARD USING THE REQUIRED FTA REPORTING TOOL. RECIPIENT UNDERSTANDS THAT FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THESE REQUIREMENTS MAY RESULT IN FORMAL ENFORCEMENT ACTION OR APPROPRIATE SANCTION AS DETERMINED BY FTA INCLUDING REIMBURSEMENT OF FTA FUNDS USED FOR THE VEHICLE PROCUREMENT. SUPPORTING DOCUMENTS THAT ARE ATTACHED WITH THIS APPLICATION INCLUDE AN APPROVED FY 2020-2024 TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROJECT (TIP) LISTINGS AND LETTER WITH AN APPROVAL DATE OF 7/2/2019 SECTION 5310 DESIGNATED RECIPIENT LETTERS FROM INDOT AND FTA AND A TRANSIT RESOLUTION. A ROLLING STOCK DOCUMENT WITH VEHICLE VIN NUMBERS WILL NOT BE PROVIDED WITH THIS APPLICATION AS THIS GRANT IS BEING USED TO FUND A CALL FOR PROJECTS FOR THE SOUTH BEND UZA THAT TRANSPO USE TO OVERSEE FOR AGENCIES THAT PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO ELDERLY/DISABLED INDIVIDUALS.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: TO BETTER CONNECT PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES SENIORS AND LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS WITH ACCESSIBLE RELIABLE TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS AS WELL AS SEEK TO ADDRESS GAPS AND BARRIERS TO PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION THAT PREVENT INDIVIDUALS FROM USING EXISTING SERVICES.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: HELP IN CREATING A ONE-STOP SHOP WHERE PEOPLE CAN FIND TRANSPORTATION SERVICE THAT MEETS THEIR NEEDS. ESTABLISH A WEBSITE AND RESOURCE GUIDE THAT PROVIDES DETAILS ON THE AVAILABLE SERVICES IN THE REGION (ST. JOSEPH ELKHART MARSHALL AND KOSCIUSKO COUNTIES). PROVIDE A TRAVEL TRAINING PROGRAM WITH THE GOAL OF PROMOTING THE INDEPENDENT TRAVEL OF OLDER ADULTS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES BY PROVIDING ACCESS TO FREE INFORMATION TRAINING AND SUPPORT. THIS FREE PROGRAM WILL BE DESIGNED TO HELP THOSE WHO NEED EXTRA ASSISTANCE IN USING THE REGIONAL BUS SYSTEMS (TRANSPO AND INTERURBAN TROLLEY) IN BOTH ST. JOSEPH AND ELKHART COUNTIES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: TO BETTER CONNECT PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES SENIORS AND LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS WITH ACCESSIBLE RELIABLE TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS AS WELL AS SEEK TO ADDRESS GAPS AND BARRIERS TO PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION THAT PREVENT INDIVIDUALS FROM USING EXISTING SERVICES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES SENIORS/ OLDER ADULTS AND LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CONNECT TWO AREAS OF SIDEWALK NEAR A CITYLINK FIXED-ROUTE TRANSIT STOP FOR A WORKING-CLASS NEIGHBORHOOD IN EAST PEORIA. THIS CAPITAL PROJECT WOULD PROVIDE NEEDED ACCESSIBLE INFRASTRUCTURE FOR RESIDENTS AND BUSINESSES ALIKE ULTIMATELY LEADING TO HIGHER MOBILITY LEVELS OF OLDER ADULTS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES TRAVELING TO AND FROM THIS AREA.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE CITY OF EAST PEORIA WILL BUILD A SIDEWALK NEAR THE RICHLAND NEIGHBORHOOD TO ALLOW FOR HIGHER TRANSIT ACCESSIBILITY. THE SIDEWALK WILL BE BUILT ON THE EAST SIDE OF EDMUND STREET BETWEEN THE CEDAR STREET INTERCHANGE INTERSECTION AND THE RICHLAND STREET INTERSECTION. THERE IS A BUS STOP SLIGHTLY SOUTH OF THE INTERSECTION OF RICHLAND AND EDMUND ON THE EAST SIDE DIRECTLY WHERE THIS SIDEWALK WILL BE PUT IN PLACE. CURRENTLY THE BUS STOP IS NOT ADA ACCESSIBLE; IT HAS A SIGN BUT NO CONCRETE PAD BENCH SHELTER OR OTHER AMENITIES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS CONNECTION WOULD DIRECTLY PROVIDE SAFER AND MORE ACCESSIBLE MOBILITY OPTIONS FOR THE RESIDENTS OF THE RICHLAND NEIGHBORHOOD ADJACENT NEIGHBORHOODS AND ALL INDIVIDUALS WHO LIVE AND WORK NEAR THE RICHLAND AND EDMUND INTERSECTION IN EAST PEORIA. THIS SIDEWALK WILL INCREASE THE ACCESSIBILITY FOR TRANSIT USE FOR SENIORS INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND THE PUBLIC IN THAT AREA OF EAST PEORIA. ONE OF THE EXISTING ADJOINING SIDEWALKS HAS RECENTLY BEEN IMPROVED TO BE ADA-COMPLIANT SO THIS NEW CONNECTION WILL EXTEND THIS ACCESSIBLE WALKING ROUTE TO ALLOW FOR HIGHER MOBILITY OF RESIDENTS AND VISITORS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: INTENDED BENEFICIARIES WOULD BE RESIDENTS OF THE RICHLAND NEIGHBORHOOD WHICH IS MOSTLY ISOLATED BY THE CEDAR ST. EXTENSION. THIS IS A WORKING-CLASS NEIGHBORHOOD THAT CURRENTLY LACKS FIXED-ROUTE MASS TRANSIT SERVICE DUE TO ITS LACK OF POPULATION DENSITY BUT NOT ITS NEED. IT IS ESTIMATED THAT THERE COULD BE UP TO 50 PASSENGERS PER DAY GIVEN THE NEIGHBORHOODS ATTRIBUTES. OF THESE AT LEAST HALF WILL LIKELY BE INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES OR OLDER ADULTS. WITH THE NEWER ADA RAMPS IN THE AREA THIS CONNECTION WOULD PROVIDE AN ADA-COMPLIANT ACCESS ROUTE TO AND FROM THIS NEIGHBORHOOD TO CITYLINK FIXED-ROUTE BUS SERVICE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE PARATRANSIT VEHICLES TO CERTIFIED PUBLIC TRANSIT PROVIDERS AND NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF ILLINOIS THROUGH THE CONSOLIDATED VEHICLE PROCUREMENT (CVP) PROGRAM.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THIS GRANT WILL FUND THE PURCHASE OF ADA-ACCESSIBLE TRANSIT/PARATRANSIT VEHICLES FOR CERTIFIED PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS AND NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS FOR THE TRANSPORTATION OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN ILLINOIS NON-URBANIZED SMALL URBANIZED AREAS AND LARGE URBANIZED AREAS AS SOLICITED VIA IDOTS 2022 CONSOLIDATED VEHICLE PROCUREMENT (CVP) APPLICATION.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PROVIDE MUCH NEEDED PARATRANSIT VEHICLES TO CERTIFIED PUBLIC TRANSIT PROVIDERS AND NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS THROUGHOUT THE STATE FOR THE TRANSPORTATION OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: CERTIFIED PUBLIC TRANSIT PROVIDERS NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND ILLINOIS RESIDENTS WHO RELY ON TRANSPORTATION SERVICES WILL BENEFIT FROM THESE ACCESSIBLE VEHICLES.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENTS WILL RECEIVE VEHICLES UNDER THIS GRANT: CROSSPOINT HUMAN SERVICES; FAYCO ENTERPRISES INC.; GREATER PEORIA MASS TRANSIT DISTRICT; PIONEER CENTER FOR HUMAN SERVICES; AND SPRINGFIELD MASS TRANSIT DISTRICT DBA SANGAMON MTD.THE ILLINOIS DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION RETAINS A LIEN ON EACH VEHICLE FOR THE ENTIRETY OF ITS USEFUL LIFE.

THIS GRANT APPLICATION PROVIDES $113830 OF FY 2020 SECTION 5310 LAPSING FUNDS FOR THE FOLLOWING PROJECTS. THE LOCAL SHARE WILL BE $103457 PROVIDED BY WASHINGTON TOWNSHIP THE CITY OF WASHINGTON AND THE CITY OF PEORIA. ATTACHMENTS TO THIS APPLICATION ARE THE TIP TABLE; IDOT STIP LETTER TO THE FTA DATED FEBRUARY 2 2022; FTA STIP APPROVAL LETTER DATED MARCH 18 2022; FY2020 APPORTIONMENT TABLE; AND SPLIT LETTER (45%/55% WITH IDOT) DATED FEBRUARY 4 2022. BACKGROUND:FOR THE GREATER PEORIA MASS TRANSIT DISTRICT (GPMTD) PROJECT:OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR THE PERIOD JULY 1 2022 TO JULY 1 2024 OR UNTIL FUNDS ARE FULLY EXPENDED (WHICHEVER COMES FIRST) FOR THE EXPANSION OF THE CITYLIFT ADA PARATRANSIT SERVICE TO THE RESIDENTS OF WASHINGTON ILLINOIS WHO CURRENTLY HAVE LIMITED TO NO ACCESS TO PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION. THE RESIDENTS LIVING WITHIN THE ZIP CODE AREA OF 61571 WILL BE ABLE TO UTILIZE GPMTD CITYLIFT SERVICES. THIS WILL ADD WASHINGTON TO CITYLIFTS CURRENT SERVICE AREA WHICH IS THE PEORIA-PEKIN URBANIZED AREA ALLOWING WASHINGTONIANS TO TRAVEL TO THE GREATER REGION AS WELL AS WITHIN THEIR OWN COMMUNITY AND IT WILL ALLOW NON-WASHINGTONIANS TO TRAVEL TO WASHINGTON. FOR THE CITY OF PEORIA DESIGN CONSTRUCTION ENGINEERING PROJECT:GLEN OAK PARK IS A REGIONAL RECREATIONAL HUB THAT CONTAINS MULTIPLE HISTORIC AREAS DATING BACK TO THE LATE 1800S. IT SITS NEAR A RESIDENTIAL AREA THAT IS IN A DISADVANTAGED ECONOMICALLY DISTRESSED LOCATION OF PEORIA. THE INTERSECTION OF ARCADIA AND PROSPECT DIRECTLY ABUTS BOTH GLEN OAK PARK AND THIS RESIDENTIAL AREA. THE CITY OF PEORIA PLANS TO IMPROVE THE INTERSECTION OF ARCADIA AND PROSPECT BY ADDING BUMP OUTS A CENTER REFUGE ISLAND AND RAPID FLASHING BEACONS. THERE IS A BUS STOP AT THIS INTERSECTION.DESIGN CONSTRUCTION ENGINEERING IS NECESSARY TO ENSURE THE SAFETY OF THESE CONSTRUCTION ELEMENTS SO THIS FY20 FUNDING WOULD PAY FOR THIS PROJECT. NOTE THAT THE CONSTRUCTION OF THIS PROJECT IS COVERED BY PREVIOUSLY OBLIGATED GRANTS WHICH WILL INSTEAD BE USED TO FOCUS ON THIS INTERSECTION (FYS 2013 AND 2016; PROJECT NUMBERS IL-16-X012 AND IL-2018-035-01 RESPECTIVELY). THE INITIAL LOCATION OF THESE PREVIOUSLY OBLIGATED FUNDS IS NO LONGER VIABLE AFTER IDOT HAS REQUESTED THE CONSTRUCTION OF A LARGE RETAINING WALL THAT WOULD HAVE BEEN FAR TOO COSTLY FOR THE FUNDS TO COVER. THIS NEW LOCATION IS A MORE VIABLE OPTION. PLEASE NOTE THAT NEPA RE-EVALUATIONS WILL BE REQUESTED TO DETERMINE IF THE PREVIOUS DETERMINATIONS MADE FOR THE ABOVE-MENTIONED GRANTS ARE STILL VALID BEFORE CONDUCTING ANY CONSTRUCTION PROJECTS IN THIS NEW LOCATION.PURPOSE:GPMTD: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO INCREASE THE MOBILITY OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN WASHINGTON ILLINOIS. PEORIA: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO INCREASE THE SAFETY AROUND THIS INTERSECTION NEAR A BUS STOP TO ENSURE THAT TRANSIT RIDERS ESPECIALLY THOSE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER INDIVIDUALS WILL FEEL MORE SECURE AS THEY NAVIGATE THE BUS STOP AREA AND THE INTERSECTION ITSELF. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:GPMTD:OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR THE FOLLOWING:GPMTD WILL EXPAND ITS CITYLIFT SERVICE TO THE CITY OF WASHINGTON ILLINOISGPMTD WILL UTILIZE THEIR EXISTING VEHICLES FOR A PILOT PERIOD IF THIS EXPANSION SERVICE IS DEEMED SUCCESSFUL AND IF THERE ARE ENOUGH MONETARY FUNDS GPMTD WILL EXPAND THIS TO A LONGER TIME PERIODPEORIA:CITY OF PEORIA OFFICIALS WILL CONDUCT DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION ENGINEERING FOR THE FOLLOWING TASKS:ADD A BUMP-OUT ON THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE ARCADIA PROSPECT INTERSECTION IN PEORIAADD A BUMP-OUT ACROSS THE STREET NEAR THE BUS STOP ON THE EAST SIDE OF PROSPECT ACROSS FROM ARCADIAADD A CENTER REFUGE ISLAND ON PROSPECT AVE AT THE LOCATION OF THE BUMP OUTSINSTALL RAPID FLASHING BEACONS AT THIS CROSSINGCONSIDER SIDEWALK IMPROVEMENTS ON THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF PROSPECT AND ARCADIAEXPECTED OUTCOMES:GPMTD:EXPANDED MOBILITY AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES IN WASHINGTON ILLINOIS AND IN TURN THE ENTIRE PEORIA-PEKIN URBANIZED AREA CURRENTLY A WASHINGTON TOWNSHIP-SUBSIDIZED TAXI SERVES PEOPLE 65+; THAT SERVICE ONLY ACCOMMODATES AMBULATORY SENIORS. THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST SECTION 5310 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE CHICAGO UZA-IL CODE 170030 IN THE AMOUNT OF $2484395. FEDERAL FUNDS BROKEN DOWN AS FOLLOWS: $1242198 IN FFY 2020 SECTION 5310 FUNDS FROM CHICAGO UZA-IL CODE 170030 AND $1242197 IN FFY 2021 SECTION 5310 FUNDS ALSO FROM CHICAGO UZA-IL CODE 170030. PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR PACES PHASE VILI REGIONAL CALL CENTER PROJECT WHICH IS A CONTINUATION AND EXPANSION OF REGIONAL CALL CENTER AND MOBILITY MANAGEMENT SERVICES IMPLEMENTED DURING PHASE I-VIL. THIS FUNDING IS A CONTINUATION OF PACE GRANT IL-2018-016 AND WILL PROCEED AFTER PACES CRRSAA 5310 FUNDS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS FUNDING WILL SUPPORT THE OPERATIONS OF THE CALL CENTER BY PROVIDING COMPREHENSIVE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT SERVICES THAT IMPROVE COORDINATION AND OPERATION OF TRANSPORTATION SERVICES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PACE REGIONAL MOBILITY MANAGEMENT CALL CENTER (RMMCC) AND THE NORTH MOBILITY MANAGEMENT CALL CENTER (NMMCC) OVERSEE THE OPERATIONS OF DEDICATED AND NON-DEDICATED SERVICE PROVIDERS UNDER CONTRACT WITH PACE FOR PARATRANSIT SERVICES. THIS FUNDING IS CRITICAL TO THE VIABILITY OF THE CONTINUED OPERATION AND EXPANSION OF CALL CENTER SERVICES WHICH WILL RESULT IN GREATER ACCESS AND MOBILITY. THIS PROJECT MEETS THE GOALS OF THE COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN APPROVED BY THE RTA IN MARCH 2021. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS SERVICE MODEL PROVIDES LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICE PROVIDERS JOB ACCESS AGENCIES AND OTHER ADVOCATE GROUPS ACCESS TO PARATRANSIT AND OTHER VITAL TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES OLDER ADULTS AND OTHER INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE TRANSPORTATION DISADVANTAGED. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONEPACE WILL PROVIDE THE LOCAL MATCH OF $621099 FROM ITS RTA SALES TAX OPERATING BUDGET. THE REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (RTA) IS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT OF SECTION 5310 PROGRAM FUNDS IN THE NORTHEASTERN ILLINOIS REGION AND IS THE LEAD AGENCY IN DEVELOPING THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS. AS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT THE RTA IS RESPONSIBLE FOR COMPETITIVE SELECTION OF PROJECTS AND DEVELOPING A COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN (HSTP). THROUGH RTAS SELECTION PROCESS PACE WAS SELECTED TO RECEIVE SECTION 5310 FUNDING FOR THE PROJECT IN THIS APPLICATION. THIS PROJECT QUALIFIES AS AN ELIGIBLE TRADITIONAL SECTION 5310 PROJECT AND COUNTS TOWARDS THE 55% REQUIREMENT.ATTACHMENTS TO THIS APPLICATION INCLUDE PACES 2020-2021 5310 APPLICATION TO RTA RTAS APPROVAL LETTER RTAS PROGRAM OF PROJECTS THAT LISTS PACES PROJECT RTAS HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION FROM MARCH OF 2021 AND TIP SUPPORT.

THIS GRANT TO THE TRI-COUNTY REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION IN PEORIA ILLINOIS IS FOR SECTION 5310 FUNDS IN THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF $124000 (FY2016-$50392; FY2017-$73608) FOR PROJECTS TO BE IMPLEMENTED DURING THE PERIOD OCTOBER 2018 THROUGH DECEMBER 2020. FUNDS SUPPORT TRANSIT-RELATED SERVICES FOR ELDERLY DISABLED AND GENERAL POPULATIONS IN THE PEORIA IL METROPOLITAN AREA. ACTIVITIES CONSIST OF THE FOLLOWING: THE FIRST IS A PEDESTRIAN REFUGE ISLAND WITH DELINEATOR VISUALS ALONG A HIGH-SPEED FIVE-LANE HIGHWAY TO PROVIDE A SAFE CROSSING FOR PATRONS USING A MASS TRANSIT ROUTE. ALONG WITH THE ISLAND THE PROJECT WILL ADD MUCH NEEDED LIGHTING FOR PEDESTRIAN CROSSING ACTIVITY. THE CITY OF PEORIA WILL CONSTRUCT THE ISLAND AND RELATED IMPROVEMENTS USING $48000 OF FY2016 FTA 5310 FUNDS ALONG WITH $12000 IN CITY MATCHING FUNDS FOR A TOTAL PROJECT COST OF $60000. CONSTRUCTION WILL OCCUR IN THE SUMMER OF 2019. A PRIOR GRANT HAS BEEN AWARDED FOR THIS PROJECT - IL-16-X012-00 WITH A SCOPE THAT WAS ORIGINALLY DETERMINED TO BE A CATEGORICAL EXCLUSION. THIS ADDITIONAL FUNDING WILL NOT ADD NEW ITEMS TO THE SCOPE BUT WILL UPGRADE THOSE ITEMS OF THE SCOPE IN IL-16-X012-00. THE SECOND PROJECT IS A CAPITAL PROJECT TO IMPROVE BUS STOPS THROUGHOUT THE GREATER PEORIA MASS TRANSIT DISTRICT SERVICE AREA. THE PROJECT WILL EXPAND ON A PRIOR BUS SHELTER INSTALLATION PROGRAM WHICH WAS INITIATED AFTER A LARGE NUMBER OF BUS BENCHES WERE REMOVED TO COMPLY WITH ADA ACCESSIBILITY STANDARDS. THIS PROJECT WILL ADDRESS REMAINING ACCESSIBILITY ISSUES BY ADDING CONCRETE BOARDING AND ALIGHTING PADS AS WELL AS ANY ADDITIONAL CONNECTIONS NEEDED TO CONNECT THE PADS TO EXISTING SIDEWALKS. THIS PROJECT WILL BE UNDERTAKEN BY GREATER PEORIA MASS TRANSIT DISTRICT USING $2392 OF FY2016 FTA SECTION 5310 FUNDS PLUS $63608 OF FY2017 FTA SECTION 5310 FUNDS AND MATCHED BY $16500 OF GPMTD PROPERTY TAX LEVY FOR A TOTAL PROJECT COST OF $82500. THE BUS STOP IMPROVEMENTS PROJECT WILL BE UNDERTAKEN FROM JANUARY TO SEPTEMBER 2019. FINALLY $10000 IN FTA FY2017 SECTION 5310 FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION. ALL PROJECTS WERE CHOSEN BASED ON A COMPETITIVE SELECTION PROCESS WITH INPUT FROM THE LOCAL HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN COMMITTEES URBAN MEMBERS AND APPROVED FOR INCLUSION IN THE TIP BY UNANIMOUS VOTE OF THE MPO POLICY COMMITTEE. ATTACHED ARE THE FOLLOWING DOCUMENTS:- PERTINENT PAGE FROM THE FY18-21 TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM (TIP)- STIP APPROVAL LETTERS- PERTINENT PAGES FROM THE FY19 UNIFIED WORK PROGRAM (UWP)- AGREEMENT WITIH IDOT FOR FY19 FHWA FTA PLANNING FUNDS- PROGRAM OF PROJECTSPROJECT UPDATES AS OF 12/18/2020:GREATER PEORIA MASS TRANSIT DISTRICT:THE GREATER PEORIA MASS TRANSIT DISTRICT WILL UPDATE BUS STOPS AND/OR CONNECT THEM TO EXISTING SIDEWALK NETWORKS IN THEIR SERVICE AREA. THIS COULD INCLUDE: IDENTIFYING AND ADDRESSING SIDEWALK GAPS CONNECTING BUS STOPS REPLACING AND UPDATING BUS PADS OR REPLACING AND UPDATING SHELTERS. REVISED END DATE FOR THIS PROJECT: 12/31/2022CITY OF PEORIA:THE CITY OF PEORIA WILL WORK WITH THE GREATER PEORIA MASS TRANSIT DISTRICT TO MOVE AN EXISTING BUS STOP FROM THE EAST SIDE OF WEST WAR MEMORIAL DRIVE AND CANNES DRIVE TO THE EAST SIDE OF THE WEST WAR MEMORIAL DRIVE AND ALLAN ROAD INTERSECTION. THE CITY PLANS TO PROVIDE UPDATED PEDESTRIAN ACCOMMODATIONS AT THE WAR MEMORIAL/ALLEN INTERSECTION INCLUDING A SIGNALIZED CROSS BUS STOP IMPROVEMENTS AND A SIDEWALK ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE ROAD CONNECTING TO THE NEARBY BROOKVIEW APARTMENT COMPLEX WHICH IS CURRENTLY SERVICED BY THAT BUS STOP. CONSTRUCTION OF THIS PROJECT WAS DELAYED LAST YEAR DUE TO A NEPA FINDING THAT A RUSTY PATCHED BUMBLE BEE PATCH EXISTS ON THE WEST SIDE OF WEST WAR MEMORIAL DRIVE. THE CITY HAS WORKED TO ADDRESS THIS ISSUE AND NOW THE CITY HAS A PLAN TO ENSURE THAT THE HABITAT WILL NOT BE NEGATIVELY AFFECTED BY THE INSTALLATION OF THIS NEW SIDEWALK.REVISED END DATE: 12/31/2021

PROGRAM OF PROJECTS DESCRIPTIONTHE UPDATED REGIONAL SECTION 5310 PROGRAM PROJECTS PROPOSES FUNDING FOR THREE DIRECT RECIPIENTS AND FOUR ADDITIONAL SUBRECIPIENT PROJECTS. THE DIRECT RECIPIENTS ARE THE REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (RTA) THE CITY OF CHICAGO AND METRA THE COMMUTER RAIL DIVISION OF THE RTA. THE CITY OF CHICAGO AND METRA WILL APPLY SEPARATELY AND DIRECTLY TO FTA FOR FUNDING. THE RTAS PROJECT AND THE FOUR SUBRECIPIENT PROJECTS FOR LAKE COUNTY DOT LITTLE CITY FOUNDATION RAY GRAHAM ASSOCIATION AND TRINITY SERVICES ARE INCLUDED IN THE AMENDMENT APPLICATION TO FTA.THE ADDITIONS TO THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS EQUAL $4402403. THE PROGRAM SPONSORS INCLUDING THE RTA ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE LOCAL MATCH FOR THEIR INDIVIDUAL PROJECTS. THEY HAVE COMMITTED $1471047 TO MATCH THE REQUESTED $2931356 IN FEDERAL FUNDS. THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS WAS RELEASED AFTER THE RTAS OCTOBER BOARD MEETING FOR A THIRTY-DAY PUBLIC COMMENT PERIOD THAT CONCLUDED ON NOVEMBER 15 2014.SINCE ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF THE REQUEST FOR AN AMENDMENT MAY BE COUNTED TOWARD MEETING THE 55% REQUIREMENT THE RTA HAS AGREED TO INCREASE THE IDOT SUBALLOCATION FOR PARATRANSIT VEHICLES BY $1010130. THE ONE PROJECT ELEMENT IN THIS AMENDMENT REQUEST THAT WILL BE COUNTED TOWARD THE 55% REQUIREMENT IS PART OF THE TRINITY SERVICES PROJECT. THE ELEMENT HAS TWO COMPONENTS: A COMPUTER AND GPS UNITS FOR THEIR SECTION 5310 FUNDED VEHICLES. THE TOTAL AMOUNT BUDGETED FOR THE CAPITAL PROJECT IS $7600 ($6080 FED/$1520 LOCAL)ON NOVEMBER 19 2014 MEETING THE RTA BOARD PASSED AN ORDINANCE THAT APPROVED THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM OF NEW AND EXPANSION PROJECTS AND INCORPORATED ALL APPROVED SECTION 5310 PROJECTS INTO THE COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN(HSTP). THE AMENDMENT REQUEST INCLUDES PROJECTS FOR FOUR SUBRECIPIENTS TWO OF WHICH ARE NEW NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND AN RTA MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROJECT. THIS AMENDMENT REQUEST IS THE CONCLUSION OF THE SECOND STEP OF THE PROCESS. IT WAS A CALL FOR NEW AND EXPANSION PROJECTS THAT WOULD BE COMPETITIVELY SELECTED. AS A RESULT OF THE CALL FOR APPLICATIONS THE RTA RECEIVED ELEVEN APPLICATIONS FOR SECTION 5310 FUNDING. THE PROJECTS WERE THEN EVALUATED FOR ELIGIBILITY AND RANKED BY A PROJECT SELECTION TEAM UTILIZING CRITERIA INCLUDED IN THE HSTP. THE PROJECT INITIALLY CALLS FOR SHIELDS TOWNSHIP TO OPERATE SEPARATELY WHILE THE FREMONT AND CENTRAL LAKE PARTNERS (FREMONT TOWNSHIP LIBERTYVILLE TOWNSHIP VILLAGES OF LIBERTYVILLE AND MUNDELEIN) ARE COMBINED. APPLICATION PURPOSE: DART IS APPLYING FOR 5310 FUNDING FOR NET OPERATING EXPENSES FOR A MICROTRANSIT SERVICE IN ANKENY WHICH HAS REPLACED THE PRIOR ON-CALL SERVICE. THIS SERVICE OFFERS INCREASED SERVICE HOURS AND ALLOWS FOR SAME DAY BOOKING. DART IS ALSO APPLYING FOR 5310 FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT FOR THIRD PARTY CONTRACTED DEMAND RESPONSE/PARATRANSIT SERVICES IN ITS ENTIRE SERVICE AREA.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: DART IS APPLYING FOR FUNDING TO PROVIDE OPERATING ASSISTANCE ON THE NET OPERATING COSTS OF MICROTRANSIT SERVICE IN THE CITY OF ANKENY. DART IS ALSO APPLYING FOR FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT FOR THIRD PARTY CONTRACTED DEMAND RESPONSE/PARATRANSIT SERVICES IN THE ENTIRE SERVICE AREA. INDIRECT COSTS ARE NOT BEING APPLIED TO THIS APPLICATION AND ITS SCOPE OF WORK.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THIS GRANT ARE INCREASED SERVICE RELIABILITY AND SAFETY. THE NEW MICROTRANSIT SERVICE IN THE CITY OF ANKENY PROVIDES AN INCREASED NUMBER OF SERVICE HOURS ALLOWING TRANSIT RIDERS TO MAKE CRITICAL CONNECTIONS TO OTHER SERVICES IN THE DART NETWORK AS WELL AS PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION TO WORK MEDICAL FACILITIES OR GROCERY STORES. DART WILL ALSO CONTINUE TRANSPORTATION COORDINATION IN THE DES MOINES AREA BY UTILIZING THIRD PARTY CONTRACTED SERVICES FOR DARTS DEMAND RESPONSE/PARATRANSIT DIVISION.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS GRANT WILL BENEFIT THE RIDERS OF PUBLIC TRANSIT IN THE GREATER DES MOINES METROPOLITAN AREA.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: DART WILL UTILIZE A COMPLIANT CONTRACTED 3RD PARTY TRANSPORTATION PROVIDER TO DELIVER THE DEMAND RESPONSE /PARATRANSIT SERVICES.

IMPROVING AND PREVENTATIVELY MAINTAINING BUSES SO THAT PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS ARE IN GOOD OPERATING CONDITION AND KEEPING PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR AND IS ESSENTIAL TO SUSTAINING EXISTING TRANSPORTATION SERVICES PROVIDING MOBILITY AND SUPPORTING LIVABLE COMMUNITIES. CONTRACTED SERVICES WILL PROVIDE RELIABLE AND TIMELY PARATRANSIT AND OTHER SERVICES FOR THE ELDERLY AND DISABLED POPULATIONS. ; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THESE PROJECTS WILL BENEFIT SENIOR AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN OF AMES CEDAR RAPIDS CORALVILLE DUBUQUE IOWA CITY SIOUX CITY WATERLOO AND ALSO THE UNIVERSITY OF IOWA (CAMBUS) ALONG WITH REGION 2 AND REGION 10 WHICH SERVES 14 RURAL AREAS IN IOWA. APPLICATION EXECUTIVE SUMMARYPURPOSE OF AWARD:DART IS APPLYING FOR 5310 FUNDING FOR THE PURCHASE OF TWO REPLACEMENT PARATRANSIT VEHICLES (1408 AND 1409) AND NET OPERATING EXPENSES FOR A NEW MICROTRANSIT SERVICE IN ANKENY WHICH WILL REPLACE THE CURRENT ON-CALL SERVICE. THIS NEW SERVICE WILL OFFER INCREASED SERVICE HOURS AND ALLOWS FOR SAME DAY BOOKING. THE LIGHT-DUTY BUSES REPLACEMENTS WILL HAVE A FIVE-YEAR OR 150000 MILE USEFUL LIFE. FUNDING SUMMARY:THIS GRANT INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING FUNDING: FFY2020 5310 FUNDS - $387837 AND LOCAL MATCH OF $141959 TOTALING $529796.SOURCE OF LOCAL MATCH: THE LOCAL MATCH FOR CAPITAL PURCHASES AND CONTRACTED SERVICES ARE PROVIDED VIA OUR ANNUAL TAX LEVY UNDER THE PARATRANSIT BUDGET.GRAND TOTAL FEDERAL FUNDING: $387837LOCAL FUNDS: $141959ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:DART IS APPLYING FOR FUNDING TO PURCHASE TWO REPLACEMENT PARATRANSIT VEHICLES USED IN THE PROVISION OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICE. A PORTION OF THE FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE ON THE NET OPERATING COSTS OF A NEW MICROTRANSIT SERVICE IN THE CITY OF ANKENY. INDIRECT COSTS ARE NOT BEING APPLIED TO THIS APPLICATION AND ITS SCOPE OF WORK.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THIS GRANT ARE INCREASED SERVICE RELIABILITY AND SAFETY. HAVING NEW TRANSIT BUSES IN THE FLEET DECREASES BUS DOWNTIME DUE TO MECHANICAL ISSUES. THE NEW MICROTRANSIT SERVICE IN THE CITY OF ANKENY PROVIDES AN INCREASED NUMBER OF SERVICE HOURS ALLOWING TRANSIT RIDERS TO MAKE CRITICAL CONNECTIONS TO OTHER SERVICES IN THE DART NETWORK AS WELL AS PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION TO WORK MEDICAL FACILITIES OR GROCERY STORES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THIS GRANT WILL BENEFIT THE RIDERS OF PUBLIC TRANSIT IN THE GREATER DES MOINES METROPOLITAN AREA. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE IS NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITY ASSOCIATED WITH THIS GRANT APPLICATION.OTHER INFORMATION:THIS APPLICATION DOES NOT INCLUDE FUNDS FOR RESEARCH AND/OR DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES.DART IS A DESIGNATED RECIPIENT FOR THE SECTION 5310 ENHANCED MOBILITY OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES PROGRAM FUNDS.DUE TO THE TIMING OF THE GRANT DART IS REQUESTING PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY FOR BOTH THE BUSES AND THE OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR THE MICROTRANSIT PROJECT. THE TIP AND PASSENGER TRANSPORTATION PLAN ARE ATTACHED IN THE DOCUMENTS SECTION BUT ARE CURRENTLY BEING AMENDED TO REFLECT THE UPDATED PROJECTS AND AMOUNTS. THIS SHOULD BE APPROVED BY THE END OF APRIL 2022.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THE GRANT IS TO REPLACE A PORTION OF 6 LIGHT DUTY PARATRANSIT VEHICLES THAT HAVE MET THEIR USEFUL LIFE. DART WILL UTILIZE FORMULA 5310 FUNDS FOR THE PURCHASE OF SIX PARTIAL ROLLING STOCK VEHICLES (ALL LESS THAN 30 FEET IN LENGTH AND ARE LIGHT DUTY). INDIRECT COSTS ARE NOT BEING APPLIED TO THIS APPLICATION AND ITS SCOPE OF WORK.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: DART WILL UTILIZE FORMULA 5310 FUNDS FOR THE PURCHASE OF SIX PARTIAL ROLLING STOCK VEHICLES (LIGHT DUTY BUSES); INDIRECT COSTS ARE NOT BEING APPLIED TO THIS APPLICATION AND ITS SCOPE OF WORK. THERE ARE A TOTAL OF 6 LIGHT DUTY BUSES BEING REPLACED ON THIS GRANT ALL OF WHICH ARE 27 - 31 FOOT MEDIUM DUTY MODELS AND THE REPLACEMENTS WILL ALL BE LESS THAN 30 FOOT MODELS. FEDERAL FUNDING IS BEING APPLIED ON THE REPLACEMENT ADA BUSES AT 85%. THE USEFUL LIFE OF THE BUSES WILL BE 5 YEARS OR 150000 MILES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THESE GRANT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE IMPROVED SAFETY SCHEDULE (ON-TIME PERFORMANCE) AND RELIABILITY OF THE FLEET FROM THE REPLACEMENT OF VEHICLES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THESE PROJECTS WILL BENEFIT TRANSIT RIDERS IN THE GREATER DES MOINES METROPOLITAN AREA (DARTS SERVICE AREA); SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES ON THIS GRANT.

PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT: IOWA REQUIRES A PUBLIC HEARING FOR EACH CONSOLIDATED TRANSIT FUNDING APPLICATION. THIS MAY BE COMBINED WITH ANOTHER HEARING. THE PUBLIC HEARING NOTICE IS REQUIRED TO BE PUBLISHED APPROXIMATELY 30 DAYS IN ADVANCE OF THE HEARING IN A NEWSPAPER OF GENERAL CIRCULATION SERVING THE PROJECT AREA. THE NOTICE IS ALSO SUBMITTED TO THE OFFICE OF PUBLIC TRANSIT FOR INCLUSION IN THE PRIVATE SECTOR CLEARINGHOUSE MAILING. AN AFFIDAVIT OF PUBLICATION IS REQUIRED. SO LONG AS ANY COMMENTS MADE AT THE HEARING ARE RECORDED. THE PUBLIC HEARING DOCUMENTATION IS MAINTAINED IN THE SUBRECIPIENTS APPLICATION FILES AND IS AVAILABLE FOR FTA INSPECTION AT ANY TIME.PROJECT DETAILS:THE PROJECTS IN THIS APPLICATION INCLUDE COST OF CONTRACTED SERVICE AS WELL AS THE PURCHASE OF FOUR BUSES AND THREE PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE PROJECTS FOR ADA VEHICLES AND AVL SYSTEMS. PROGRAM OF PROJECTS ATTACHEDPROJECT OUTCOMES:SERVICE RELIABILITY ON-TIME PERFORMANCE AND SAFETY ARE STRONGLY INFLUENCED BY THE CONDITION OF THE CAPITAL ASSETS. NEW RELIABLE TRANSIT BUSES ARE ESSENTIAL FOR SUSTAINING AND INCREASING TRANSIT RIDERSHIP. IMPROVING AND PREVENTATIVELY MAINTAINING BUSES SO THAT PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS ARE IN GOOD OPERATING CONDITION AND KEEPING PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR AND IS ESSENTIAL TO SUSTAINING EXISTING TRANSPORTATION SERVICES PROVIDING MOBILITY AND SUPPORTING LIVABLE COMMUNITIES. CONTRACTED SERVICES WILL PROVIDE RELIABLE AND TIMELY PARATRANSIT AND OTHER SERVICES FOR THE ELDERLY AND DISABLED POPULATIONS. ALL THESE TRANSIT SYSTEMS ARE PUBLIC AGENCIES AND NON-PROFIT.SUBRECIPIENT INFORMATION FOR TRANSIT AGENCIES INCLUDED IN THIS GRANT ALONG WITH OTHER IOWA DOT SUBRECIPIENTS ARE INCLUDED IN THE APPLICATION DOCUMENTS SECTION OF THIS APPLICATION.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS IS AN FFY 2021 SECTION 5310 CRRSAA FUNDING APPLICATION FOR WAIANAE COAST COMPREHENSIVE HEALTH CENTER (WCCHC) RURAL AREAS AND SUBURBAN AREAS IN THE STATE OF HAWAII IN THE AMOUNT OF $162870 REPRESENTING 100% FEDERAL SHARE OF THE TOTAL ELIGIBLE AMOUNT. THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES CRRSAA FUNDING TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS. THE APPLICATION SCOPE OF WORK INCLUDES CRRSAA FUNDING FOR COVID-19 RELATED EXPENSES INCURRED BY WCCHC AND ELIGIBLE AGENCIES OR OPERATORS WITHIN SUBURBAN AND RURAL AREAS IN THE STATE OF HAWAII. THESE EXPENSES INCLUDE OPERATING COSTS PAYROLL AND PURCHASE OF PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT (PPE) AND DISINFECTANT AND SANITIZING SOLUTIONS TO ASSURE THE HEALTH AND SAFETY OF PATRONS. THIS GRANT WILL ALSO MAKE UP FOR LOSS IN REVENUE DUE TO DECLINE IN RIDERSHIP SINCE THE START OF THE PANDEMIC. A SUMMARY AND BREAKDOWN OF THE FUNDING REQUESTED IS PROVIDED BELOW:CRRSAA SECTION 5310 URBANIZED AREA APPORTIONMENT FOR WAIANAE COAST COMPREHENSIVE HEALTH CENTER: $72506CRRSAA SECTION 5310 SUBURBAN AREA APPORTIONMENT FOR ELIGIBLE AGENCIES OR OPERATORS WITHIN THE STATE OF HAWAII: $50954CRRSAA SECTION 5310 RURAL AREA APPORTIONMENT FOR ELIGIBLE AGENCIES OR OPERATORS WITHIN THE STATE OF HAWAII: $39410CRRSAA SECTION 5310 TOTAL FUNDING REQUESTED ON THIS APPLICATION: $162870TOTAL FEDERAL SHARE: $162870 / TOTAL LOCAL MATCH: $0 / TOTAL ELIGIBLE COST: $162870THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST CORONAVIRUS RESPONSE AND RELIEF SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS ACT OF 2021 (CRRSAA) SECTION 5310 FUNDS FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. THE STATE OF HAWAII DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (HDOT) STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION PLANNING OFFICE (STPO) IS APPLYING FOR THE FUNDING ON BEHALF OF THE WEST COAST COMPREHENSIVE HEALTH CENTER (WCCHC) A PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROVIDER FOR URBANIZED AREAS ON THE ISLAND OF OAHU IN HONOLULU COUNTY AS WELL AS ELIGIBLE AGENCIES OR OPERATORS WITHIN SUBURBAN AND RURAL AREAS IN THE STATE OF HAWAII. 1) OPERATING EXPENSES FOR WCCHC AND ELIGIBLE AGENCIES OR OPERATORS WITHIN RURAL AND SUBURBAN AREAS WITHIN THE STATE OF HAWAII OPERATING EXPENSES COVERED BY CARES ARPA AND OTHER FTA GRANTS (IF APPLICABLE) WILL BE TRACKED TO PREVENT DUPLICATION OF REIMBURSEMENT.2) WCCHC RURAL AND SUBURBAN AREAS WITHIN THE STATE OF HAWAII WILL HAVE TO CERTIFY THAT IT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS AND CONTRACTORS THAT ARE PROVIDERS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION HAVE NOT FURLOUGHED ANY EMPLOYEES SINCE JANUARY 20 2020 (THE ENACTMENT DATE OF THE CARES ACT). 3) IF FEDERAL FUNDING IS RECEIVED FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. APPLICATION PURPOSE: ARPA FUNDS WILL REIMBURSE ANY ACTUAL ELIGIBLE EXPENSES INCURRED FROM MAR 1 2022 TO DEC 31 2024 INCLUDING ELIGIBLE EXPENSES THAT MAY HAVE OTHERWISE BEEN OFFSET BY LOST REVENUE AS A RESULT OF THE COVID-19 ECONOMIC DOWNTURN. APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO OBLIGATE ADDITIONAL FUNDING FOR VEHICLES UNDER THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM (ENHANCED MOBILITY OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES).; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THIS GRANT APPLICATION WILL ALLOW AWARD AND DELIVERY OF VEHICLES TO THE SUBRECIPIENTS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PURCHASE OF VEHICLES WILL ALLOW NONPROFIT AGENCIES AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTAL AUTHORITIES (THAT ARE EITHER APPROVED TO COORDINATE SERVICES FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES OR PROVIDE SERVICES WHERE THERE ARE NO NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS READILY AVAILABLE IN THE AREA TO PROVIDE THE SERVICE) TO REPLACE EXISTING VEHICLES THAT HAVE MET THEIR USEFUL SERVICE LIFE OR ADD TO EXISTING SERVICES. BENEFITS INCLUDE GREATER ACCESS FOR ELIGIBLE SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO ESSENTIAL HEALTH SERVICES SHOPPING FOR FOOD AND OTHER ACTIVITIES WHERE COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT IS ESSENTIAL. HDOT WILL PURCHASE VEHICLES ON BEHALF OF THE SUBRECIPIENTS.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS IS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST FY 2021 SECTION 5311 ARP ACT GRANT FUNDS APPORTIONED TO GUAM IN THE AMOUNT OF $912013 FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THIS GRANT APPLIES FOR $912013 IN SECTION 5311 ARP ACT FOR THE GUAM REGIONAL TRANSIT AUTHORITY TO SUPPORT OPERATIONAL COSTS AMOUNTING TO $749283 FOR THE SALARIES BENEFITS AND ADMINISTRATIVE LEAVE OF ITS OPERATIONS PERSONNEL SUCH AS BUS OPERATORS SCHEDULERS/DISPATCHERS AND AUTOMOTIVE SERVICE/MAINTENANCE WORKERS $139428 FOR OTHER OPERATING EXPENSE SUCH AS FUEL $15360 FOR THE PURCHASE OF DESKTOP COMPUTERS AND PROCUREMENT OF ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR INCLUDING PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT CLEANING SUPPLIES AND EQUIPMENT FOR $7942.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: GRTA ANTICIPATES A SAFE EFFECTIVE AND EFFICIENT DELIVERY OF TRANSIT SERVICES TO GRTA CONSTITUENTS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: DURING THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC GRTA CONTINUES TO OPERATE THE MUCH-NEEDED PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICES: THE FIXED-ROUTE AND PARATRANSIT FOR OUR TARGET POPULACE: THE ELDERLY DISABLED AND UNDERPRIVILEGED INDIVIDUALS INCLUDING THE TRANSIT-RIDING POPULATION IN GUAM. THESE TRANSIT SERVICES ARE FOR ESSENTIAL USES SUCH AS PHARMACEUTICAL SERVICES TO FILL AND REFILL MEDICATIONS UNDERGO DIALYSIS SESSIONS MEDICAL SERVICES FOR MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS PURCHASE GROCERIES AND GO TO THE LAUNDROMAT.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: GRTA IS A DIRECT RECIPIENT THEREBY FTA DIRECTLY ALLOCATES FEDERAL FUNDS TO GRTA. MOREOVER GRTA HAS NO SUBRECIPIENTS.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE CONTINUED OPERATIONS OF GRTA DURING THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC IS GRTAS MAIN GOAL. AS A RESULT GRTA UTILIZES THE OPERATING ASSISTANCE FUNDS TO PAY FOR THE SALARIES AND BENEFITS OF BUS OPERATORS DISPATCHERS SCHEDULERS VEHICLE REPAIR/MAINTENANCE WORKERS AND HELPERS.GRTA UTILIZES FEDERAL FUNDING TO PAY FOR EQUIPMENT AND SUPPLIES.GRTA UTILIZES THE GRANT AWARD FUNDS TO REIMBURSE GRTA FOR LOCAL FUNDS USED DURING THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE ACTIVITIES TO BE UNDERTAKEN ARE AS FOLLOWS: 1. CONTINUED TRANSIT OPERATIONS OF ALL GRTAS TRANSIT SERVICES DURING THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. 2. CONTINUED REPAIR AND MAINTENANCE OF GRTAS TRANSIT FLEET.3. PROCUREMENT OF EQUIPMENT AND SUPPLIES NEEDED TO OPERATE GRTAS PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: AN UNIMPEDED TRANSIT OPERATIONS OF GRTAS PUBLIC TRANSIT SYSTEM.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE ELDERLY PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED RESIDENCE OF GUAMINCLUDING THE GENERAL PUBLIC WILL RECEIVE THE BENEFITS OF THIS GRANT AWARD.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: GRTA IS THE DIRECT RECIPIENT OF TJIS GRANT AWARD. THUS GRTA HAS NO SUBRECIPIENTS.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS APPLICATION IS TO APPLY FOR GRANT ASSISTANCE WITH THE RESTORATION OF TRANSIT SERVICES THAT WERE REDUCED DUE TO THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. FUNDS WILL BE DIRECTED TO INCREASE RIDERSHIP FOLLOWING THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC REDUCE TRAVEL TIMES AND MAKE ADJUSTMENTS TO INCREASE THE QUALITY AND FREQUENCY OF TRANSIT SERVICES FOR LOW-INCOME RIDERS AND THOSE IN DISADVANTAGED NEIGHBORHOODS OR COMMUNITIES WHO MAY NEED INCREASED SERVICES TO GET JOBS SHOPPING AND HEALTHCARE.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: TRANSPORTATION OPERATIONS; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: TRANSPORTATION TO CONTINUE SERVICES FOR ELIGIBLE CONSUMERS WITHOUT COST BEING A BARRIER.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SUB RECIPIENTS CONTRACTORS AND SUB-CONTRACTORS; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: ALTERNATIVE AND ENHANCED TRANSPORTATION SERVICES SUCH AS QUALITY OF LIFE HEALTH RELATED AND OTHER NON-STANDARD TRANSPORTATION SERVICES.

THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES CRRSAA FUNDING TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS. THE APPLICATION SCOPE OF WORK INCLUDES THE GA DHS COORDINATED TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM. PURPOSE: THIS APPLICATION IS TO APPLY FOR GRANT ASSISTANCE FOR COSTS RELATED TO OPERATIONS PERSONNEL AND COVID RELATED EXPENSES. FUNDS WILL BE DIRECTED TO PAYROLL AND OPERATIONS OF THE COORDINATED TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM AND PROVIDERS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: TRANSPORTATION OPERATIONS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO CONTINUE TO ELIGIBLE CONSUMERS WITHOUT OPERATIONAL COSTS BEING A BARRIER.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SUB-RECIPIENTS CONTRACTORS AND SUB-CONTRACTORS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: ALTERNATIVE AND ENHANCED TRANSPORTATION SERVICES SUCH AS QUALITY OF LIFE HEALTH RELATED AND OTHER NON-STANDARD TRANSPORTATION SERVICES.COSTS WILL BE EXAMINED AS PART OF TR/SMR.THE RECIPIENT CERTIFIES THAT IT AND ANY SUBRECIPIENT OR CONTRACTOR THAT IS A PROVIDER OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION: (A) ARE CURRENTLY NOT FURLOUGHING ANY EMPLOYEES; (B) HAVE TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT POSSIBLE BROUGHT BACK ANY EMPLOYEES PREVIOUSLY FURLOUGHED AS A DIRECT RESULT OF FINANCIAL CHALLENGES CAUSED BY THE COVID-19 PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY; AND (C) HAVE REHIRED OR POSTED TO REHIRE ANY POSITIONS OF EMPLOYEES WHO WERE LAID OFF AS A RESULT OF FINANCIAL CHALLENGES CAUSED BY THE COVID-19 PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY.THE RECIPIENT AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY

THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST SECTION 5310 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE STATE OF GEORGIA (SMALL URBAN AND RURAL) AS WELL AS THE ATLANTA AUGUSTA COLUMBUS AND SAVANNAH UZAS IN THE AMOUNTS LISTED BELOW: - ATLANTA URBANIZED AREA 200K+: $3491042 - COLUMBUS URBANIZED AREA 200K+: $259419 - AUGUSTA-RICHMOND URBANIZED AREA 200K+: $392034 - SAVANNAH URBANIZED ARE 200K+: $259750 - GA URBANIZED 50K-199K: $1631035 - GA NON-URBANIZED LESS 50K: $2131770 TOTAL: FEDERAL $8073926 STATE SHARE $2018481.00 TOTAL ELIGIBLE COST $10092407 CAPITAL PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROJECTS PLANNED DESIGNED AND CARRIED OUT TO MEET THE NEEDS OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES = 8165047. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO THE ELDERLY AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS WITH 6338541 BEING USED TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES THROUGH GADHS COORDINATED TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM; $1010000 USED FOR CONTRACT MANAGEMENT AND SUB RECIPIENTARC PROJECTS; AND ADMINISTRATIVE PURPOSES = $816505. THE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES IN THE COORDINATED TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM ARE BEING MET BY CONTRACTING WITH THIRD-PARTY CONTRACTORS IN EACH OF THE GEORGIA DEPARTMENT OF HUMAN SERVICES (GADHS) REGIONS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS IN GEORGIAS RURAL AND SMALL URBAN AREAS. THE GADHS TRANSPORTATION SERVICES SECTION IN THE OFFICE OF FACILITIES AND SUPPORT SERVICES (OFSS) ADMINISTERS THE 5310 FUNDS. THE STATE IS DIVIDED INTO TWELVE GADHS REGIONS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE COORDINATED SYSTEM OPERATES THROUGH A SERIES OF PURCHASE OF SERVICE CONTRACTS WITHIN EACH REGION. PROVIDERS ARE A MIX OF GOVERNMENT ENTITIES FOR PROFITS AND PRIVATE NON-PROFITS. IN MANY REGIONS A PRIME CONTRACTOR SUCH AS A REGIONAL COMMISSION PROVIDES OVERALL CONTRACT MANAGEMENT IN COORDINATION WITH THE RTO AND SUB-CONTRACTS WITH ADDITIONAL ENTITIES TO PROVIDE THE TRANSPORTATION IN EACH AREA. EACH REGION HAS A REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION COORDINATING COMMITTEE (RTCC). THE PURPOSE OF THE COMMITTEE IS TO ESTABLISH POLICIES AND PROCEDURES WITHIN EACH REGION. IT IS MADE UP OF REGIONAL DIVISION AND HUMAN SERVICE PROVIDER REPRESENTATION AND OTHERS WITH VESTED INTEREST IN TRANSPORTATION IN EACH AREA. GADHS WILL FOLLOW ALL THIRD-PARTY PROCUREMENT PROCEDURES AS SPELLED OUT BY FTA. GADHS HAS DEVELOPED AND IMPLEMENTED A WEB-BASED TRIP ORDERING AND RECONCILIATION SYSTEM (ETRIPS) THAT ALLOWS FOR THE AUTHORIZED HUMAN SERVICE PROVIDERS TO ENTER CLIENT REGISTRATIONS ORDER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND APPROVE SERVICES AS THEY ARE PROVIDE AS WELL AS ALLOW FOR CONTRACTORS TO SUBMIT THEIR INVOICES.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO IMPLEMENT A RURAL TRANSIT AND HUMAN SERVICES REGIONAL PILOT PROGRAM WITH THE GOAL OF FULLY COORDINATING RURAL TRANSIT HST AND NEMT AT THE REGIONAL COMMISSION LEVEL.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: 1) FULLY COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT HST AND NEMT SERVICE DELIVERY THROUGH A SINGLE REGIONAL COMMISSION-BASED PROVIDER;2) DEVELOPING AND DEPLOYING NEW TECHNOLOGY AND SOFTWARE THAT ENHANCES EXISTING SYSTEMS USED BY GEORGIAS TRANSIT PROVIDERS;3) HIRING A REGIONAL TRANSIT LIAISON TO COORDINATE BETWEEN AGENCIES PROVIDERS AND STAKEHOLDER GROUPS; AND4) IMPLEMENTING A MARKETING CAMPAIGN TO ENHANCE PUBLIC AWARENESS OF REGIONAL TRANSIT SERVICE AVAILABILITY.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: GDOT PROPOSES A REGIONAL PILOT PROGRAM TO FACILITATE FULLY COORDINATED RURAL TRANSIT HST AND NEMT SERVICES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: GDOTS SMALL URBAN AND RURAL SUBRECIPIENTS AND RIDERS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES ARE OUTLINED IN THE PROJECT MILESTONES.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE THE FUNDING FOR CAPITAL OPERATING TO AGENCY AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR THE PROCUREMENT OF SIX (6) TURTLE TOP VEHICLES FOR PARATRANSIT NEIGHBOR LINK SERVICES. IN ADDITION FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE SUBRECIPIENT OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS DRIVER SALARIES FUEL ITEMS HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE-YEAR PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ETC. IN ORDER TO CONTINUE TRANSIT OPERATIONS. NEIGHBORLINK SERVICES WILL CONTINUE TO PROVIDE ENHANCED GEOGRAPHIC COVERAGE FOR SENIORS INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND ADMINISTRATIVE ACTIVITIES TO SUPPORT THE PROGRAM.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL ALLOW LYNX AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE AND ENHANCED SERVICES FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE URBANIZE AREAS OF ORLANDO AND KISSIMMEE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENTS WILL RECEIVE OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO MAINTAIN SERVICES. 1) SENIORS FIRST INC. 2) ASPIRE HEALTH PARTNERS INC. 3) LIFE CONCEPTS DBA QUEST 4) MEALS ON WHEELS AND 5) SPECIAL HEARTS FARM.

FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED FOR ELIGIBLE CAPITAL INVESTMENT INCLUDING THE PURCHASE OF VANS A SEDAN BUSSES AS WELL AS A YARDS AND SHOP REHAB/RENOVATION.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT FDOT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SERVICE FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS THAT WOULD OTHERWISE HAVE TO BE CUT DUE TO LACK OF FUNDING.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENTS WILL RECEIVE OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO MAINTAIN SERVICES: CITY OF PEMBROKE PINES - SOUTHWEST FOCAL POINT SENIOR CENTER; THE MAE VOLEN SENIOR CENTER INC.; WOODHOUSE; CENTRAL FLORIDA REGIONAL PLANNING COUNCIL; BAKER COUNTY COUNCIL ON AGING INC.; ST. JOHNS COUNTY COUNCIL ON AGING INC.; ARC OF MARTIN COUNTY INC.; COUNCIL ON AGING OF ST. LUCIE INC.; SARASOTA COUNTY BOARD OF COUNTY COMMISSIONERS; EASTER SEALS FLORIDA INC.; SPACE COAST CENTER FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING INC D/B/A RESOURCE CENTER FOR DISABILITY SOLUTIONS; ESCAMBIA COUNTY BOARD OF COUNTY COMMISSIONERS; FLAGLER COUNTY PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION; LIGHTHOUSE OF SOUTHWEST FLORIDA INC. THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENTS WILL RECEIVE REPLACEMENT VEHICLES: CITRUS HEALTH NETWORK INC.; OKALOOSA COUNTY BOARD OF COUNTY COMMISSIONERS; LAKE COUNTY BOARD OF COUNTY COMMISSIONERS. THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENT WILL RECEIVE YARD AND SHOP REHAB/RENOVATION: THE MAE VOLEN SENIOR CENTER INC.
