THIS IS A FFY 2021 SECTION 5310 APPLICATION IN THE AMOUNT OF $284123 (100% FEDERAL SHARE) THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES ARP ACT FUNDING TO HELP RESPOND TO AND RECOVER FROM THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE APPLICATION IS FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE ADA PARATRANSIT AND OPERATING EXPENSES ITEMS.ON THURSDAY MARCH 11 2021 PRESIDENT BIDEN SIGNED THE AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN ACT OF 2021 INTO LAW. THE AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN ACT OF 2021 WILL HELP PREVENT SERVICE CUTS PROTECT EMPLOYEES FROM LAYOFFS KEEP RIDERS AND WORKERS SAFE AND STRENGTHEN OUR ECONOMY. TRANSPORTATION WORKERS ARE SERVING ON THE FRONT LINES OF THIS PANDEMIC: DELIVERING THE VACCINE GETTING PEOPLE TO ESSENTIAL JOBS HEALTHCARE AND VACCINE APPOINTMENTS AND PROVIDING GOODS AND SERVICES TO PEOPLE WHO NEED THEM. THE ARP ACT PROVIDES EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE AND PROVIDE EMERGENCY APPROPRIATIONS TO SUPPORT COVID-19 PANDEMIC.THE AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN ACT INCLUDES $30.5 BILLION FOR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION INCLUDING $26.6 BILLION TO BE ALLOCATED BY STATUTORY FORMULAS TO URBAN AND RURAL AREAS TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS AND FOR THE ENHANCED MOBILITY OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND $2.2 BILLION TO FTA GRANT RECIPIENTS IN COMMUNITIES THAT DEMONSTRATE ADDITIONAL PANDEMIC-ASSOCIATED NEEDS. FUNDS WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE AT 100-PERCENT FEDERAL SHARE WITH NO LOCAL MATCH REQUIRED AND PRIMARILY DIRECTED TO OPERATIONS AND PAYROLL. FUNDING WILL BE AVAILABLE TO SUPPORT OPERATING CAPITAL AND OTHER EXPENSES GENERALLY ELIGIBLE UNDER THOSE PROGRAMS AND INCURRED BEGINNING ON JANUARY 20 2020 TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO COVID-19. FUNDS AVAILABLE UNDER THE ARP ACT 2021 ARE AVAILABLE FOR OTHER THAN OPERATING ACTIVITIES IF AGENCY CERTIFIES THAT IT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS AND CONTRACTORS THAT PROVIDERS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION HAVE NOT FURLOUGHED ANY EMPLOYEES SINCE MARCH 27 2020LYNX FFY21 ARP ACT SEC 5310 FUNDING APPLICATION IS AS FOLLOWS:ARP ACT FUNDING FORMULA FOR ORLANDO UZA$ 230479ARP ACT FUNDING FORMULA FOR KISSIMMEE UZA $53644 ==============================================================GRANT TOTAL FOR LYNX $ 284123==============================================================DESIGNATED RECIPIENT STATEMENT: THE CENTRAL FLORIDA REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (LYNX) IS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT OF THE FFY 2021 SECTION 5310 ARP ACT FUNDS.LYNX WILL BE UTILIZING THE ARP ACT FUNDS AS FOLLOWS:PROJECT 1: ORLANDO1) 30.09.08 EMERGENCY RELIEF OPERATING ASSISTANCE $ 1152402) 30.09.08 EMERGENCY RELIEF OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO SUB-RECIPIENTS$ 115239____________________________________________________________________PROJECT 1: SUB-TOTAL $ 230479 ___________________________________________________________PROJECT 2: KISSIMMEE1) 30.09.08 EMERGENCY RELIEF OPERATING ASSISTANCE $268222) 30.09.08 EMERGENCY RELIEF OPERATING ASSISTANCE SUB-RECIPIENTS $26822_______________________________________________________________PROJECT 2: SUB-TOTAL $ 53644================================================TOTAL ARP ACT FUNDING (P1 AND P2) $284123 ==============================================ARP ACT FUNDS WILL SUPPORT LYNX IN GENERAL OPERATING EXPENSES NORMALLY ELIGIBLE UNDER SECTION 5307 AND 5311 PROGRAM AND CAPITAL EXPENSES TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO COVID-19 ON OR AFTER JANUARY 20 2020. THE PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY START DATE FOR ARP FUNDING IS JANUARY 20 2020. AALL PROJECTS ARE CONSISTENT WITH A COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO SUPPORT OPERATING EXPENSES INCURRED BEGINNING ON JANUARY 20 2020 TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO COVID-19.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR OPERATING EXPENSES ARE THOSE COSTS NECESSARY TO OPERATE MAINTAIN AND MANAGE A PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: LYNX WILL PROVIDE THE RIDERSHIP TO ENHANCED MOBILITY OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIESINTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL HAVE RELIABLE RIDE. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: YESTHE LYNX CERTIFIES THAT IT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS AND CONTRACTORS THAT ARE PROVIDERS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION HAVE NOT FURLOUGHED ANY EMPLOYEES SINCE MARCH 27 2020.LYNX UNDER OPERATING ACTIVITIES WILL CHARGE ALL OPERATING EXPENSES FOR THE AGENCY (NET FARE REVENUES) THAT OCCUR ON OR AFTER JANUARY 20 2020. IN GENERAL OPERATING EXPENSES ARE THOSE COSTS NECESSARY TO OPERATE MAINTAIN AND MANAGE A PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM. OPERATING EXPENSES USUALLY INCLUDE SUCH COSTS AS: SALARIES WAGES INCLUDING ADMINISTRATIVE LEAVE SUCH AS LEAVE FOR EMPLOYEES DUE TO REDUCTION IN SERVICE OR LEAVE REQUIRED FOR A QUARANTINED WORKER; FRINGE BENEFITS; SERVICES PROVIDED BY OUTSIDE AGENCIES; FUEL; MATERIALS SUPPLIES INCLUDING PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT AND CLEANING SUPPLIES; UTILITIES; CASUALTY LIABILITY INSURANCE; PURCHASE TRANSPORTATION SERVICE WHICH INCLUDES PARATRANSIT NEIGHBOR LINK; MISCELLANEOUS EXPENSES; INTEREST EXPENSES; LEASES AND ANY ITEM HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR DEEMED NECESSARY TO RUN THE LYNX TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM.THE OPERATIONAL EXPENSES REQUESTED IN THIS APPLICATION WERE DETERMINED BY USING AN ACCOUNTING SYSTEM THAT IS CONSISTENT WITH THE USOA FOLLOWING C. 9030.1E OPERATING EXPENSE WORKSHEET ALL OPERATING EXPENSES (AFTER SUBTRACTING FARE REVENUES) ARE ELIGIBLE UNDER SECTION 5307 THAT ARE INCURRED ON OR AFTER JANUARY 20 2020. THE FOLLOWING CATEGORIES WERE USED FOR OPERATING EXPENSES: 1) OPERATING ASSISTANCE; 2) ADA PARATRANSIT OPERATING EXPENSES. THIS IS A FFY 2021 SECTION 5310 APPLICATION IN THE AMOUNT OF $230476 (100% FEDERAL SHARE) THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES CRRSAA ACT FUNDING TO HELP RESPOND TO AND RECOVER FROM THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE APPLICATION IS FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE.ON SUNDAY DECEMBER 27 2020 PRESIDENT TRUMP SIGNED THE CORONAVIRUS RESPONSE AND RELIEF SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS ACT (CRRSAA) OF 2021 PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY WAS SIGNED INTO LAW. THE CRRSAA ACT PROVIDES EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE AND PROVIDE EMERGENCY APPROPRIATIONS TO SUPPORT COVID-19 PANDEMIC.FTA IS ALLOCATING $50 MILLION IN SUPPLEMENTAL FUNDS FOR ENHANCED MOBILITY OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES (SECTION 5310 FORMULA GRANTS). FUNDING WILL BE PROVIDED AT A 100 PERCENT FEDERAL SHARE WITH NO LOCAL MATCH REQUIRED AND WILL BE AVAILABLE TO SUPPORT OPERATING EXPENSES INCURRED BEGINNING ON JANUARY 20 2020 TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO COVID-19.LYNX FY21 CRRSAA SEC 5310 FUNDING APPLICATION IS AS FOLLOWS:CRRSAA FUNDING FORMULA FOR ORLANDO $ 230476THE PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY START DATE FOR CRRSAA FUNDING IS JANUARY 20 2020DESIGNATED RECIPIENT STATEMENT: THE CENTRAL FLORIDA REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (LYNX) IS THE DIRECT RECIPIENT OF THE FY 2021 SECTION 5310 CRRSAA ACT FUNDS.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO SUPPORT OPERATING EXPENSES INCURRED BEGINNING ON JANUARY 20 2020 TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO COVID-19.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR OPERATING EXPENSES ARE THOSE COSTS NECESSARY TO OPERATE MAINTAIN AND MANAGE A PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: LYNX WILL PROVIDE THE RIDERSHIP TO ENHANCED MOBILITY OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIESINTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL HAVE RELIABLE RIDE. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: YESLYNX WILL BE UTILIZING THE CRRSAA ACT FUNDS AS FOLLOWS:PROJECT 1: 1) 30.09.08 EMERGENCY RELIEF OPERATING ASSISTANCE - $1237652) 30.09.08 EMERGENCY RELIEF OPERATING ASSISTANCE SUBRECIPIENTS - $106711 __________________________________________________________TOTAL CRRSAA FUNDING $230476==============================================CRRSAA ACT FUNDS WILL SUPPORT LYNX AND HUMAN SERVICE AGENCIES IN GENERAL OPERATING EXPENSES NORMALLY ELIGIBLE UNDER SECTION 5310 TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO COVID-19 ON OR AFTER JANUARY 20 2020. THE LYNX CERTIFIES THAT IT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS AND CONTRACTORS THAT ARE PROVIDERS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION HAVE NOT FURLOUGHED ANY EMPLOYEES SINCE MARCH 27 2020.LYNX UNDER OPERATING ACTIVITIES WILL CHARGE ALL OPERATING EXPENSES FOR THE AGENCY (NET FARE REVENUES) THAT OCCUR ON OR AFTER JANUARY 20 2020. IN GENERAL OPERATING EXPENSES ARE THOSE COSTS NECESSARY TO OPERATE MAINTAIN AND MANAGE A PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM. OPERATING EXPENSES USUALLY INCLUDE SUCH COSTS AS: SALARIES WAGES INCLUDING ADMINISTRATIVE LEAVE SUCH AS LEAVE FOR EMPLOYEES DUE TO REDUCTION IN SERVICE OR LEAVE REQUIRED FOR A QUARANTINED WORKER; FRINGE BENEFITS; SERVICES PROVIDED BY OUTSIDE AGENCIES; FUEL; MATERIALS SUPPLIES INCLUDING PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT AND CLEANING SUPPLIES; UTILITIES; CASUALTY LIABILITY INSURANCE; PURCHASE TRANSPORTATION SERVICE WHICH INCLUDES PARATRANSIT NEIGHBOR LINK; MISCELLANEOUS EXPENSES; INTEREST EXPENSES; LEASES AND ANY ITEM HAVING A USEFUL LIFE OF LESS THAN ONE YEAR DEEMED NECESSARY TO RUN THE LYNX TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM.THE OPERATIONAL EXPENSES REQUESTED IN THIS APPLICATION WERE DETERMINED BY USING AN ACCOUNTING SYSTEM THAT IS CONSISTENT WITH THE USOA FOLLOWING C. 9030.1E OPERATING EXPENSE WORKSHEET ALL OPERATING EXPENSES (AFTER SUBTRACTING FARE REVENUES) ARE ELIGIBLE UNDER SECTION 5310 THAT ARE INCURRED ON OR AFTER JANUARY 20 2020. THE FOLLOWING CATEGORIES WERE USED FOR OPERATING EXPENSES: 1) ADA PARATRANSIT OPERATING EXPENSES. THE LYNX UNDERSTANDS THAT THE EXPENSES REQUESTED IN THIS APPLICATION ARE SUBJECT TO REVIEW FOR THEIR REASONABLENESS AS PART OF THE AGENCYS NEXT TRIENNIAL MANAGEMENT REVIEW. FEMA STATEMENT OR OTHER FEDERAL AGENCY STATEMENT: LYNX AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. SHOULD FEMA FUNDS BE MADE AVAILABLE LYNX WILL REPORT TO FTA AND DEDUCT FEMA REIMBURSEMENTS FROM ELIGIBLE EXPENSES. ADDITIONALLY THE CIVIL RIGHTS PROGRAM STATUS IS IN REVIEW BY FTA.

THIS IS AN FFY 2021 SECTION 5310 CRRSAA APPLICATION IN THE AMOUNT OF $591353 REPRESENTING 100% FEDERAL SHARE OF THE TOTAL ELIGIBLE AMOUNT. THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES CRRSAA FUNDING TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS. THE APPLICATION SCOPE OF WORK INCLUDES 6 PROJECTS FOUR WITH OPERATING EXPENSES TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION TO VACCINATION SITES AND 2 FOR OPERATING EXPENSES RELATED TO CONTINUING OR RESTARTING DIRECT TRANSPORTATION SERVICES. THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT CERTIFIES THAT IT AND ANY SUBRECIPIENT OR CONTRACTOR THAT IS A PROVIDER OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION: (A) INTEND TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT POSSIBLE TO USE CARES ACT OR CRRSAA FUNDS TO BRING BACK ANY EMPLOYEES PREVIOUSLY FURLOUGHED AS A DIRECT RESULT OF FINANCIAL DIFFICULTIES CAUSED BY THE COVID-19 PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY; (B) INTEND TO USE CARES ACT OR CRRSAA FUNDS TO REHIRE ANY POSITIONS OF EMPLOYEES WHO WERE LAID OFF AS A DIRECT RESULT OF FINANCIAL CHALLENGES CAUSED BY THE COVID-19 PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY; AND (C) WILL EXPLAIN HOW THEY HAVE SPENT CARES ACT OR CRRSAA FUNDS ON PAYROLL OPERATIONS OR PAYROLL AND EXPENSES OF PRIVATE PROVIDERS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT POSSIBLE. THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.PER THE CRRSAA THE PROJECT(S) IN THIS APPLICATION IS/ARE NOT REQUIRED TO BE PROGRAMMED IN THE LONG-RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLAN STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION PLAN OR STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM.

BUDGET REVISION#2 (SEPTEMBER 2022): THE WASHINGTON METROPOLITAN AREA TRANSIT AUTHORITY (WMATA) IS REQUESTING A MODIFICATION TO THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE END DATE FROM DECEMBER 30 2022 TO DECEMBER 30 2023. THE PROCUREMENT SOLICITATION FOR VANS WAS FURTHER DELAYED BASED ON INDUSTRY FEEDBACK. MILESTONES WILL BE UPDATED TO REFLECT THE NEW PROCUREMENT SCHEDULE AND VAN DELIVERY IN THE NEXT REPORTING CYCLE. BUDGET REVISION # 1 (NOVEMBER 2021): THE WASHINGTON METROPOLITAN AREA TRANSIT AUTHORITY (WMATA) IS REQUESTING A BUDGET REVISION TO DC-2020-007 TO REALLOCATE FUNDS FROM LABOR TO THE NEXT GENERATION REPLACEMENT VAN. THIS REVISION WILL REDUCE THE LOCAL MATCH TO $157059 FOR A TOTAL AWARDED AMOUNT OF $1047059.00. THIS BUDGET REVISION REQUIRES A CHANGE TO THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE TO REFLECT THE CURRENT DELIVERY DATE OF THE NEXT GENERATION VANS. THE AWARD END DATE IS MODIFIED FROM MARCH 31 2022 TO DECEMBER 30 2022. DELIVERY OF VANS IS EXPECTED TO BE COMPLETE IN METROS FY2023. POTENTIAL SUPPLY CHAIN AND DELIVERY DELAYS MAY IMPACT THE PROGRAM; THIS IS A NATIONWIDE ISSUE RELATED TO COVID19 IMPACTING AUTO MANUFACTURING AND TECHNOLOGY INDUSTRIES.ORIGINAL:THE WASHINGTON METROPOLITAN AREA TRANSIT AUTHORITY (WMATA) IS APPLYING $850000 (FEDERAL) IN FFY19 SECTION 5310 ENHANCED MOBILITY OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES PROGRAM TO FUND A PORTION OF WMATAS METRO ACCESS FLEET REPLACEMENT PROGRAM. THE REPLACEMENT PROGRAM INCLUDES THE PURCHASE OF 100 VEHICLES. THE FEDERAL SHARE IS 85 PERCENT FOR THE ACQUISITION OF VEHICLES FOR PURPOSES OF COMPLYING WITH OR MAINTAINING COMPLIANCE WITH ADA. IT IS ESTIMATED THAT THIS FUNDING WILL PROVIDE THE REPLACEMENT OF APPROXIMATELY 10 NEXT GENERATION PARATRANSIT VEHICLES. METRO IS ALSO SEEKING $40000 (50% FEDERAL AND 50% LOCAL) IN OPERATING COSTS TO SUPPORT ABILITIES-RIDE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM WHICH WAS LAUNCHED IN 2018. THE ABILITIES-RIDE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT OFFERS SAME DAY ADVANCE SCHEDULING AND ON-DEMAND SERVICE TO BRING GREATER OPTIONS TO SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES.THE NON-FEDERAL SHARE WILL BE PROVIDED BY THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA THE STATE OF MARYLAND AND PARTICIPATING JURISDICTIONS IN THE COMMONWEALTH OF VIRGINIA. THIS PROJECT IS DERIVED FROM THE COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICE TRANSPORTATION PLAN WHICH WAS APPROVED BY THE METROPOLITAN WASHINGTON COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS TRANSPORTATION PLANNING BOARD IN 2018. THE PLAN WAS UPDATED TO GUIDE FUNDING DECISIONS FOR THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) SECTION 5310 ENHANCED MOBILITY FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES PROGRAM. THE MWCOG IS THE SECTION 5310 DESIGNATED RECIPIENT AND ADOPTED THE RECOMMENDED AWARD/ALLOCATION OF 5310 FUNDS ON JANUARY 22 2020 (SPLIT LETTER ATTACHED TO APPLICATION).

THE CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (CTDOT) IS REQUESTING A COMBINED TOTAL OF $6796640 OF FFY 2020 FFY 2021 SECTION 5310 FUNDS. PURPOSE OF AWARD:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE CTDOT AND ITS SUBRECIPIENTS WITH OPERATING ASSISTANCE AND CAPITAL FUNDING TO PROVIDE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OLDER ADULTS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: - VEHICLE PROCUREMENT - CTDOT WILL UTILIZE THE GREATER NEW HAVEN TRANSIT DISTRICT VEHICLE PROCUREMENT CONTRACT THAT IS OPEN FOR 5 YEARS. THERE ARE FIFTY-NINE (59) VEHICLES PROPOSED FOR AWARD. ALL VEHICLES WILL BE ADA ACCESSIBLE AND PURCHASED FROM A CERTIFIED TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURER (TVM). EACH BUS SUBRECIPIENT WILL RECEIVE 100% FEDERAL FUNDING. EACH VAN SUBRECIPIENT WILL RECEIVE A FEDERAL SHARE OF 80% OF THE TOTAL PROJECT COST. - MOBILITY MANAGEMENT THREE (3) MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROJECTS ARE PROPOSED FOR AWARD. EACH SUBRECIPIENT OF MOBILITY MANAGEMENT FUNDING WILL RECEIVE A FEDERAL SHARE OF 80% OF THE TOTAL PROJECT COST. - OPERATING ASSISTANCE - THERE ARE SEVENTEEN (17) NONTRADITIONAL OPERATING PROJECTS PROPOSED FOR AWARD. TWO (2) SUBRECIPIENTS OF OPERATING ASSISTANCE WILL RECEIVE 100% FEDERAL FUNDING. FIFTEEN (15) SUBRECIPIENTS OF OPERATING ASSISTANCE WILL RECEIVE A FEDERAL SHARE OF 50% OF THE TOTAL PROJECT COST.- STATE ADMINISTRATION PER THE ATTACHED LETTER THE COMMISSIONER OF THE CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION HAS CERTIFIED THAT FUNDS APPORTIONED FROM SMALL URBANIZED AND RURAL AREAS MAY BE USED FOR PROJECTS SERVING ANOTHER AREA OF THE STATE IF ALL OBJECTIVES OF THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM ARE BEING MET IN THE SPECIFIED AREAS. FUNDS MAY ALSO BE TRANSFERRED FROM SMALL URBANIZED TO RURAL AND VICE VERSA ONCE ALL VIABLE APPLICATIONS IN THOSE AREAS HAVE BEEN INCLUDED IN THE GRANT PROPOSAL. THIS BI-DIRECTIONAL TRANSFER OF FUNDS ALLOWS CTDOT TO MAXIMIZE FUNDING AND AWARD ADDITIONAL PROJECTS IN THE URBANIZED AREA (200000 OR LESS) OF GREATEST NEED. INTERSTATE SPLIT AGREEMENTS HAVE RESULTED IN CONNECTICUT RECEIVING: - $187636 SPRINGFIELD MA UZA ($93481 IN FFY 2020 AND $94155 IN FFY 2021)- $64581 WORCESTER MA UZA ($32065 IN FFY 2020 AND $32516 IN FFY 2021)- $1565582 - BRIDGEPORT/STAMFORD UZA ($776593 IN FFY 2020 AND $788989 IN FFY 2021)- $1760014 - HARTFORD UZA ($879342 IN FFY 2020 AND $880672 IN FFY 2021)- $1067591 - NEW HAVEN UZA ($531115 IN FFY 2020 AND $536476 IN FFY 2021)- $390067 - NEW LONDON UZA ($194116 IN FFY 2020 AND $195951 IN FFY 2021)- $1157786 - SMALL URBAN UZA ($578607 IN FFY 2020 AND $579179 IN FFY 2021)- $603383 - RURAL UZA ($298861 IN FFY 2020 AND $304522 IN FFY 2021)A NEW LOCALLY COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN WAS COMPLETED IN DECEMBER 2021. THE PLAN WAS CREATED AS PART OF A YEAR-LONG PLANNING PROCESS AND INVOLVED INPUT FROM STAKEHOLDERS IN EACH OF THE STATES FIVE (5) REGIONS (NORTH CENTRAL SOUTH CENTRAL NORTHWEST SOUTHWEST AND EASTERN) TO IDENTIFY OPPORTUNITIES FOR IMPROVEMENT IN TRANSPORTATION IMPACTING INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS EARNING LOW-INCOME. STAKEHOLDERS INCLUDED REGIONAL COUNCILS OF GOVERNMENTS MOBILITY MANAGERS COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TRANSIT PROVIDERS AND RIDERS. A TRANSPORTATION BARRIER SURVEY WAS ALSO CREATED TO SOLICIT FEEDBACK AND DISTRIBUTED VIRTUALLY TO ALLOW FOR REMOTE PARTICIPATION DURING THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (CTDOT) IS REQUESTING $3261248 OF FFY19 SECTION 5310 FUNDS. FUNDS ARE FROM THE FOLLOWING UZAS:$837072 - CONNECTICUT 5310 (RURAL SMALL UZAS)$2302668 - CONNECTICUT (LARGE UZAS)$90558 SPRINGFIELD MA UZA (LARGE)$30950 WORCESTER MA UZA (LARGE)THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR: - VEHICLES- PROCUREMENT OF THIRTY-SEVEN (37) VEHICLES UTILIZING THE GREATER NEW HAVEN TRANSIT DISTRICT VEHICLE PROCUREMENT CONTRACT THAT IS OPEN FOR 5 YEARS. EACH SUBRECIPIENT WILL RECEIVE THE APPROPRIATE FEDERAL SHARE 80% OF THE TOTAL PROJECT COST. - MOBILITY MANAGEMENT TWO (2) MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROJECTS ARE PROPOSED FOR AWARD. EACH SUBRECIPIENT OF MOBILITY MANAGEMENT WILL RECEIVE THE APPROPRIATE FEDERAL SHARE 80% OF THE TOTAL PROJECT COST. - OPERATING ASSISTANCE - THERE ARE TEN (10) NONTRADITIONAL OPERATING PROJECTS PROPOSED FOR AWARD. EVERY SUBRECIPIENT OF OPERATING ASSISTANCE WILL RECEIVE THE APPROPRIATE FEDERAL SHARE 50% OF THE TOTAL PROJECT COST.- CONTRACTED SERVICE ONE (1) CONTRACTED SERVICE PROJECT IS PROPOSED FOR AWARD. THE SUBRECIPIENT WILL RECEIVE THE APPROPRIATE FEDERAL SHARE 80% OF THE TOTAL PROJECT COST. - STATE ADMINISTRATION PER THE ATTACHED LETTER THE COMMISSIONER OF THE CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION HAS CERTIFIED THAT FUNDS APPORTIONED FROM SMALL URBANIZED AND RURAL AREAS MAY BE USED FOR PROJECTS SERVING ANOTHER AREA OF THE STATE IF ALL OF THE OBJECTIVES OF THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM ARE BEING MET IN THE SPECIFIED AREAS. FUNDS CAN BE TRANSFERRED FROM SMALL URBAN UZA TO RURAL AND VICE VERSA ONCE ALL VIABLE APPLICATIONS IN THOSE AREAS HAVE BEEN INCLUDED IN THE GRANT PROPOSAL. THIS BI-DIRECTIONAL TRANSFER OF FUNDS ALLOWS CTDOT TO MAXIMIZE FUNDING AND AWARD ADDITIONAL PROJECTS IN THE URBANIZED AREA (200000 OR LESS) OF GREATEST NEED.A SINGLE STATEWIDE LOCALLY COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN WAS CREATED BASED ON FIVE REGIONAL PLANNING PROCESSES. CTDOT WAS RECENTLY GRANTED AN EXTENSION OF THEIR CURRENT COORDINATED PLAN THROUGH DECEMBER 31 2021 (LETTER ATTACHED). EACH REGION WORKED AS A GROUP TO PRIORITIZE THE STRATEGIES FOR FUNDING IN THEIR REGION AND APPROVED THE PLAN. THE PRECEDENT FOR USING THESE AREAS WAS ESTABLISHED DURING THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE STATE JOB ACCESS REVERSE COMMUTE (JARC) PROGRAM. THESE REGIONS ARE:1.EASTERN NORWICH-NEW LONDON URBANIZED AREA AND NON-URBANIZED AREA INCLUDING WINDHAM. PLAN APPROVAL DATE: 5/14/092.NORTH CENTRAL HARTFORD URBANIZED AREA INCLUDING NEW BRITAIN AND MIDDLETOWN. PLAN APPROVAL DATE: 4/22/093.NORTHWEST COMBINATION OF SMALL URBANIZED AREA AND NON-URBANIZED AREA INCLUDING DANBURY WATERBURY AND TORRINGTON. PLAN APPROVAL DATE: 5/4/094.SOUTH CENTRAL NEW HAVEN URBANIZED AREA INCLUDING MILFORD AND MERIDEN. PLAN APPROVAL DATE: 5/1/095.SOUTHWEST BRIDGEPORT/STAMFORD URBANIZED AREA INCLUDING NORWALK. PLAN APPROVAL DATE: 4/28/09

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE DENVER REGIONAL COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (DRCOG) REQUESTS $3376424 IN LARGE URBAN SECTION 5310 FUNDING FOR THE DENVER-AURORA LARGE URBANIZED AREA FROM FFY21 22 AND 23 APPORTIONMENTS. THIS APPLICATION WILL FUND OPERATING MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND CAPITAL PROJECTS IN THE DENVER-AURORA URBANIZED AREA THAT BENEFIT OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: ACTIVITIES INCLUDE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND OPERATING ASSISTANCE PROVIDED BY ELIGIBLE ENTITIES IN THE URBANIZED AREA. IN ADDITION DRCOG PLANS TO RETAIN A PORTION OF THE FUNDING TO FUND AN INTERNAL MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM WHICH WILL INCLUDE TRAVEL TRAINING COORDINATION AND PURCHASED TRANSIT SERVICES. PROJECTS FUNDED IN THIS APPLICATION ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN AND THE ATTACHED POP. DRCOG WILL RETAIN 10% OF THE TOTAL FY2023 APPORTIONMENT ($292914) FOR PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION TO SUPPORT SUBRECIPIENT OVERSIGHT AND MANAGEMENT.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PROVIDE OPERATING AND MOBILITY MANAGEMENT SUPPORT TO SPECIALIZED TRANSIT PROVIDERS IN THE REGION. ALL PROJECTS WILL DIRECTLY ASSIST PROVIDERS IN PROVIDING SERVICE TO OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. OPERATING PROJECTS WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT TO HUMAN SERVICE TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS TO PROVIDE TRIPS TO INDIVIDUALS IN NEED.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ALL PROJECTS WILL DIRECTLY IMPACT OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE REGION BY SUPPORTING ACCESS TO RESOURCE THROUGH TRANSIT SERVICES AND COORDINATION ACTIVITIES IN THE REGION.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: FUNDING IN THE APPLICATION WILL BE PASSED THROUGH TO 5 SUBRECIPIENTS: VIA MOBILITY CITY OF LAKEWOOD DOUGLAS COUNTY LARADON HALL SOCIETY AND THE DENVER REGIONAL MOBILITY AND ACCESS COUNCIL. THE FUNDING WILL BE PASSED THROUGH TO THESE ELIGIBLE ENTITIES TO FUND OPERATING AND MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROJECTS IN THE REGION.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS APPLICATION APPLIES FOR $740666 THE FULL APPORTIONMENT OF FFY2022 FORMULA SECTION 5310 FUNDS AVAILABLE TO THE COLORADO SPRINGS UZA. THE FUNDING IS PROVIDED AT THE 80% FEDERAL SHARE FOR CONTRACT MOBILITY SERVICES AND 100% FOR PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE APPLICATION INCLUDES $666600 FOR CONTRACTED MOBILITY SERVICES WITH QUALIFIED TRADITIONAL SERVICE PROVIDERS AND $74066 (THE 10% ALLOWABLE OF THE APPORTIONMENT) TO REIMBURSE PPACG FOR ADMINISTERING THE SEC 5310 PROGRAM. THE PROJECT OF CONTRACT MOBILITY SERVICES IS FUNDED AT AN 80% FEDERAL SHARE. THE 55% TRADITIONAL SERVICES REQUIREMENT IS MET.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS APPLICATION FUNDS THE PROVISION OF COORDINATED SPECIALIZED MOBILITY SERVICES FOR INDIVIDUALS WHO CANNOT USE COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICES DUE TO LOCATION OR LEVEL OF ASSISTANCE NEEDED.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SENIORS AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS THROUGHOUT THE COLORADO SPRINGS URBANIZED AREA. ; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: SUBRECIPIENTS WILL PROVIDE MOBILITY SERVICES TO INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND SENIORS IN THE COLORADO SPRINGS URBANIZED AREA. THE SUBRECIPIENTS ARE SILVER KEY SENIOR SERVICES AND DISABILITY SERVICES INC. DBA ENVIDA.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS APPLICATION APPLIES FOR FFY2021 SECTION 5310 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE CITY OF FORT COLLINS IN THE AMOUNT OF $237539 (FULL APPORTIONMENT). TRANSFORT WILL UTILIZE 79 PERCENT OF FUNDING TOWARDS TRADITIONAL CAPITAL PROJECTS AND 21 PERCENT TOWARDS OTHER ELIGIBLE CAPITAL AND OPERATING EXPENSES THUS MEETING THE REQUIREMENT OF AT LEAST 55 PERCENT OF FUNDS TO BE UTILIZED TOWARDS TRADITIONAL 5310 EXPENSES. ; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: PROJECT #1) CAPITAL COST OF CONTRACTING - CONTINUATION OF TRANSFORTS DIAL A TAXI PROGRAM TO BRIDGE TRANSPORTATION BETWEEN LOVELAND AND FORT COLLINS. PRE AWARD AUTHORITY WILL NOT BE USED.PROJECT #2) PARATRANSIT RIDER SURVEY. PRE AWARD AUTHORITY IN THE AMOUNT OF $120000 WILL BE USED FOR ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED FROM MARCH 2021 THROUGH JANUARY 2022.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: PROVIDING THE CONTINUED DIAL-A -TAXI SERVICE WILL BRIDGE THE GAP LEFT BY ADA PARATRANSIT SERVICE BY ALLOWING PARTICIPANTS TO BOOK SAME DAY TRIPS TRIPS OUT OF THE SERVICE AREA AND TRIPS OUTSIDE OF NORMAL SERVICE TIMES.BY CONDUCTING A PARATRANSIT RIDER SURVEY TRANSFORT WILL BETTER UNDERSTAND HOW TO IMPROVE THE DIAL-A-RIDE AND DIAL-A-TAXI PROGRAM FOR ITS CLIENTS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: TRANSFORT RIDERS SPECIFICALLY SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL BENEFIT FROM THE PROJECTS WITHIN THIS AWARD.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES WILL BE PERFORMED UNDER THIS AWARD.

PURPOSE: THIS APPLICATION APPLIES LAPSING FFY2020 SECTION 5310 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE CITY OF FORT COLLINS IN THE AMOUNT OF $226000 (FULL APPORTIONMENT). TRANSFORT WILL UTILIZE 65 PERCENT OF FUNDING TOWARDS TRADITIONAL CAPITAL PROJECTS AND 35 PERCENT TOWARDS OTHER ELIGIBLE CAPITAL AND OPERATING EXPENSES THUS MEETING THE REQUIREMENT OF AT LEAST 55 PERCENT OF FUNDS TO BE UTILIZED TOWARDS TRADITIONAL 5310 EXPENSES. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:PROJECT #1) PURCHASE AND INSTALLATION OF TWENTY (20) SOLAR LIGHTS TO BE PLACED AT BUS STOPS IN THE TRANSFORT SERVICE AREA. PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY WILL BE USED FOR $20480 FOR THIS PROJECT THAT WAS COMPLETED 12/31/2021.PROJECT #2) BUS STOP IMPROVEMENTS - REPLACE FIVE (5) GLASS PANELS AT BUS STOPS. PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY IN THE AMOUNT OF $16140 WILL BE USED FOR THIS PROJECT THAT WAS COMPLETED 06/01/2021.PROJECT #3) PURCHASE SOFTWARE LICENSES TO BE PLACED IN VEHICLES USED FOR PARATRANSIT SERVICE. PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY IN THE AMOUNT OF $8256 WILL BE USED FOR THIS PROJECT THAT WAS COMPLETED 03 /01/2021.PROJECT #4) OPERATING ASSISTANCE - CONTINUATION OF TRANSFORTS DIAL A TAXI PROGRAM TO BRIDGE TRANSPORTATION BETWEEN LOVELAND AND FORT COLLINS. PROJECT #5) CAPITAL - ADA UPGRADES TO BUS STOPS AND THE DOWNTOWN TRANSIT CENTER IN ORDER TO MEET AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES ACT (ADA) COMPLIANCE.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:PROJECTS TO IMPROVE THE SAFETY OF BUS STOPS WILL IMPROVE THE ACCESSIBILITY TO THE TRANSIT SYSTEM FOR RIDERS INCLUDING SENIORS AND THOSE WITH DISABILITIES. PROVIDING WELL LUMINATED BUS STOPS IN AREAS THAT DO NOT HAVE OTHER LIGHTING WILL ASSIST VISUALLY IMPAIRED PEOPLE AND INCREASE THE LEVEL OF SAFETY AT THE STOPS. REPLACING GLASS PANELS WITH ALUMINUM WILL ELIMINATE THE ISSUE OF BROKEN GLASS AROUND BUS STOPS WHICH CAN PREVENT A PERSON UTILIZING A MOBILITY DEVICE FROM ACCESSING THE STOP. UPGRADING BUS STOP PADS AND THE DOWNTOWN TRANSIT CENTER TO MEET ADA COMPLIANCE WILL ALLOW FOR ALL RIDERS TO ACCESS PUBLIC TRANSIT NO MATTER THEIR AGE OR ABILITY. IT WILL ALSO ASSIST IN BRINGING TRANSFORTS BUS STOPS TO 100% ADA COMPLIANCE.PROVIDING THE CONTINUED DIAL-A -TAXI SERVICE WILL BRIDGE THE GAP LEFT BY ADA PARATRANSIT SERVICE BY ALLOWING PARTICIPANTS TO BOOK SAME DAY TRIPS TRIPS OUT OF THE SERVICE AREA AND TRIPS OUTSIDE OF NORMAL SERVICE TIMES.BENEFICIARIES: TRANSFORT RIDERS SPECIFICALLY SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL BENEFIT FROM THE PROJECTS WITHIN THIS AWARD.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/ALOCAL MATCHING FUNDS WILL BE SOURCED FROM TRANSIT SERVICES FUNDS THAT WERE APPROPRIATED THROUGH THE 2019/2020 BUDGETING FOR OUTCOMES (BFO) PROCESS AND ARE AVAILABLE.THE PROJECTS IN THIS APPLICATION ARE INCLUDED IN THE REGIONAL ITS ARCHITECTURE PLAN. THE FOLLOWING DOCUMENTS ARE ATTACHED TO THIS AWARD: THE STIP PROJECT LISTING AND APPROVAL LETTER COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN.

PURPOSE:THE DENVER REGIONAL COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (DRCOG) REQUESTS $2441067 OF THE FEDERAL FISCAL YEAR (FFY) 2022 5310 LARGE URBAN FUNDS FOR THE DENVER-AURORA URBANIZED AREA. THE FUNDING REQUESTED REPRESENTS A PORTION OF THE FULL APPORTIONMENT OF THE FFY2022 5310 FUNDING FOR THE DENVER-AURORA URBANIZED AREA. TOTAL APPORTIONED FUNDS WERE $2808695 WHICH LEAVES $367628 UNOBLIGATED. THIS APPLICATION WILL FUND OPERATIONS AND MOBILITY MANAGEMENT FOR THE PERIOD OF JANUARY 1 2022 THROUGH JUNE 30 2023. ADDITIONAL ACTIVITIES INCLUDE MISCELLANEOUS CAPITAL PROJECTS AND PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION AS DESCRIBED BELOW AND IN THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS (POP). ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND OPERATING ASSISTANCE PROVIDED BY ELIGIBLE ENTITIES IN THE URBANIZED AREA. IN ADDITION THIS APPLICATION INCLUDES FUNDING FOR THE PURCHASE OF REPLACEMENT VEHICLES FOR HUMAN SERVICE TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS AND SIDEWALK IMPROVEMENTS TO IMPROVE ACCESS TO THE FIXED-ROUTE TRANSIT SYSTEM NEAR SENIOR HOUSING COMPLEXES AND A SENIOR CENTER IN THE CITY OF ENGLEWOOD. PROJECTS FUNDED IN THIS APPLICATION ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN AND THE ATTACHED POP. DRCOG WILL RETAIN 10% OF THE TOTAL APPORTIONMENT FOR PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION TO SUPPORT SUBRECIPIENT OVERSIGHT AND MANAGEMENT. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:FUNDING WILL PROVIDE OPERATING AND MOBILITY MANAGEMENT SUPPORT TO SPECIALIZED TRANSIT PROVIDERS IN THE REGION. IN ADDITION CAPITAL PROJECTS WILL IMPROVE ACCESS AND RELIABILITY OF SPECIALIZED TRANSIT SERVICES. ALL PROJECTS WILL DIRECTLY ASSIST HUMAN SERVICE TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS ABILITY TO SERVE OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE REGION.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:ALL PROJECTS WILL DIRECTLY IMPACT THE SERVICES PROVIDED TO OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. PROJECTS WILL IMPROVE ACCESS TO TRANSIT SERVICES WHICH ALLOWS OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO ACCESS RESOURCES IN THEIR COMMUNITIES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THIS APPLICATION WILL PROVIDE FUNDS TO THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENTS: VIA MOBILITY LARADON HALL SOCIETY CITY OF LAKEWOOD CITY OF ENGLEWOOD DOUGLAS COUNTY AND DENVER REGIONAL MOBILITY ACCESS COUNCIL. THE FUNDS WILL BE PASSED THROUGH TO THESE ELIGIBLE SUBRECIPIENTS FOR TRANSIT CAPITAL OPERATING AND MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROJECTS THAT SUPPORT OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES CONSISTENT WITH THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS (POP) ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION. OTHER:THIS APPLICATION DOES NOT MEET THE 55% REQUIREMENT FOR TRADITIONAL SERVICES. DRCOG COMMITS TO MEETING THIS REQUIREMENT WITH THE FUTURE AMENDMENT TO THIS APPLICATION.PREAWARD AUTHORITY IS REQUESTED FOR OPERATING AND MOBILITY MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES STARTING ON JANUARY 1 2022 IN THE AMOUNT OF $1712795 (WHICH IS THE TOTAL FOR THESE TWO ACTIVITIES). DRCOG HAS USED THE PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY GRANTED IN CIRCULAR 9070.1G TO AWARD FUNDING TO PROJECTS AS OF JANUARY 1 2022. THESE PROJECTS ARE CONSISTENT WITH DRCOGS CALL FOR PROJECTS IN THE SUMMER OF 2020 WHEN DRCOG ISSUED CONTRACTS FOR THE CALENDAR YEAR 2021.REQUIRED POP STIP AND ENVIRONMENTAL DOCUMENTATION IS ATTACHED.

PURPOSE:THIS APPLICATION APPLIES FOR $513162 WHICH IS THE FULL APPORTIONMENT OF FFY2021 FORMULA SECTION 5310 FUNDS AVAILABLE TO THE COLORADO SPRINGS UZA. THE FUNDING IS PROVIDED AT THE 100% FEDERAL MATCHING RATIO AS PERMITTED BY CRRSAA.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE APPLICATION INCLUDES $461846 FOR CONTRACTED MOBILITY SERVICES WITH QUALIFIED TRADITIONAL SERVICE PROVIDERS AND $51316 (THE 10% ALLOWABLE OF THE APPORTIONMENT) TO REIMBURSE PPACG FOR ADMINISTERING THE SEC 5310 PROGRAM. THE ACTIVITIES IN THIS APPLICATION ARE FUNDED AT A 100% FEDERAL MATCH. PER THE CRRSAA UNOBLIGATED SECTION 5310 FORMULA FUNDING (FY21 AND PRIOR) MAY BE OBLIGATED AT A 100-PERCENT FEDERAL SHARE FOR ALL ACTIVITIES ELIGIBLE UNDER THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM. THE OVERALL PERFORMANCE PERIOD FOR THIS AWARD IS AUGUST 1 2022 THROUGH JULY 29 2023 (WITH MOBILITY SERVICES TO CONCLUDE JUNE 30 2023). THE 55% TRADITIONAL SERVICES REQUIREMENT IS MET.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS APPLICATION FUNDS THE PROVISION OF COORDINATED SPECIALIZED MOBILITY SERVICES FOR INDIVIDUALS WHO CANNOT USE COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICES DUE TO LOCATION OR LEVEL OF ASSISTANCE NEEDED. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:SENIORS AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS THROUGHOUT THE COLORADO SPRINGS URBANIZED AREA. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:PPACG CONCLUDED THE ANNUAL SUBRECIPIENT SELECTION PROCESS ON MAY 22 2022. AS A RESULT TWO AGENCIES WERE SELECTED TO RECEIVE TRADITIONAL FORMULA FUNDS TO PROVIDE MOBILITY SERVICES IN THE COLORADO SPRINGS UZA: SILVER KEY SENIOR SERVICES AND ENVIDA. (NOTE: ENVIDAS PROJECT IS CLASSIFIED AS A CATEGORY B PROJECT. ENVIDA HAS NOT MET ALL FEDERAL STATUTORY OR ADMINISTRATIVE REQUIREMENTS TO RECEIVE THIS AWARD BUT PPACG ANTICIPATES ENVIDA WILL MEET THE REQUIREMENTS DURING THE AWARD PERIOD. THE AWARD TO ENVIDA WILL NOT BE ISSUED UNTIL ALL REQUIREMENTS ARE MET.)THE SUBRECIPIENTS SELECTED USE ROUTE MATCH TO COORDINATE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR INDIVIDUALS SEEKING ASSISTANCE. THIS HELPS THEM BE EFFICIENT AND ENSURE THE NEEDS OF EACH PERSON REQUESTING A RIDE ARE MET. IN ADDITION THE FFY21 FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER EXPENSES ASSOCIATED WITH PROVIDING MOBILITY SERVICES TO SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. OTHER INFORMATION:THE ACTIVITIES IN THIS APPLICATION ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN.ASSOCIATED DOCUMENTATION IS ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION INCLUDING THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS AND STIP/TIP PAGES.

THIS APPLICATION REQUESTS FY21 ARP SECTION 5310 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE STATE OF COLORADO RURAL AREAS FOR THE AMOUNT OF $65000 (PARTIAL APPORTIONMENT) REPRESENTING 100% FEDERAL SHARE OF THE TOTAL ELIGIBLE AMOUNT. CDOT WILL APPLY FOR THE REMAINING APPORTIONMENT OF $52165 THROUGH A FUTURE AMENDMENT. THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES ARP FUNDING TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS.PURPOSE: COLORADO DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (CDOT) WILL UTILIZE ARP FUNDING TO SUPPORT TRANSIT SERVICE FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN LA PLATA COUNTY COLORADO.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS APPLICATION INCLUDES ONE PROJECT TO PROVIDE OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR ONE TRANSIT AGENCY IN RURAL COLORADO. DETAILS ARE INCLUDED IN THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS (POP) IN THE APPLICATION DOCUMENTS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE SELECTED PROJECT WILL SUPPORT A 5310 TRANSIT PROVIDER IN SOUTHWEST COLORADO RURAL AREAS AS THEY CONTINUE TO RECOVER FROM THE IMPACTS OF THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC AND MAINTAIN TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS FOR SENIOR AND DISABLED COMMUNITY MEMBERS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: TRANSIT RIDERS ESPECIALLY SENIORS AND DISABLED COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN LA PLATA COUNTY IN SOUTHWEST COLORADO.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: ONE SUBRECIPIENT IN THE COLORADO RURAL AREA OF LA PLATA COUNTY SOUTHWEST CENTER FOR INDEPENDENCE WAS SELECTED TO RECEIVE FUNDS FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE.CDOT HAS VERIFIED THE ONE RECIPIENT UNDER THIS APPLICATION IS ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE FTA-5310 FUNDING.CDOT AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.PER ARP GUIDELINES THE PROJECT IN THIS APPLICATION IS NOT REQUIRED TO BE PROGRAMMED IN THE LONG-RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLAN STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION PLAN OR STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM.CDOT FURLOUGH EMPLOYEES SINCE MARCH 27 2020 (THE ENACTMENT DATE OF THE CARES ACT) AND AS REQUIRED BY THE CARES ACT AND SUBSEQUENT STIMULUS FUNDING TO SUPPORT RECOVERY FROM THE CORONAVIRUS PANDEMIC THESE FUNDS ARE BEING USED FOR OPERATING AND PAYROLL PURPOSES ONLY.THIS GRANT USES PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY FOR CONTRACTING PURPOSES AS OF 04/26/2022 $12512 WILL BE ENTERED INTO THE INITIAL FFR AS AN UNLIQUIDATED OBLIGATION BALANCE.

THIS APPLICATION REQUESTS FY21 SECTION 5310 ARP FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE STATE OF COLORADO IN THE SMALL URBANIZED AREAS FOR THE AMOUNT OF $201092 (FULL APPORTIONMENT) REPRESENTING 100% FEDERAL SHARE OF THE TOTAL ELIGIBLE AMOUNT. PURPOSE: COLORADO DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (CDOT) WILL UTILIZE ARP FUNDING TO PREVENT PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO CORONAVIRUS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS APPLICATION INCLUDES ONE PROJECT TO PROVIDE OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR 1 TRANSIT AGENCY IN COLORADO SMALL UZA AREA OF BOULDER. DETAILS ARE INCLUDED IN THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS (POP) IN THE APPLICATION DOCUMENTS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE SELECTED PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE BOULDER SMALL URBAN AREA 5310 TRANSIT PROVIDER TO CONTINUE TO RECOVER FROM THE IMPACTS OF THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC AND MAINTAIN TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS FOR SENIOR AND DISABLED COMMUNITY MEMBERS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: TRANSIT RIDERS ESPECIALLY SENIORS AND DISABLED COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN COLORADO SMALL UZA AREA OF BOULDER.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: ONE SUBRECIPIENT IN THE SMALL URBAN AREA OF COLORADO VIA MOBILITY SERVICES IN BOULDER WAS SELECTED TO RECEIVE FUNDS FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE.CDOT HAS VERIFIED THE SUBRECIPIENT SELECTED UNDER THIS APPLICATION IS ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE FTA-5310 FUNDING.CDOT AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.PER ARP GUIDELINES THE PROJECT IN THIS APPLICATION IS NOT REQUIRED TO BE PROGRAMMED IN THE LONG-RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLAN STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION PLAN OR STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM.CDOT FURLOUGHED EMPLOYEES SINCE MARCH 27 2020 (THE ENACTMENT DATE OF THE CARES ACT) AND AS REQUIRED BY THE CARES ACT AND SUBSEQUENT STIMULUS FUNDING TO SUPPORT RECOVERY FROM THE CORONAVIRUS PANDEMIC THESE FUNDS ARE BEING USED FOR OPERATING AND PAYROLL PURPOSES ONLY.THIS GRANT USES PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY FOR CONTRACTING PURPOSES AS OF 5/3/2022 $201092 WILL BE ENTERED INTO THE INITIAL FFR AS AN UNLIQUIDATED OBLIGATION BALANCE.

STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.PER CRRSAA GUIDELINES THE PROJECT IN THIS APPLICATION IS NOT REQUIRED TO BE PROGRAMMED IN THE LONG-RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLAN STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION PLAN OR STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM. ADDITIONALLY PER CRRSAA GUIDELINES THERE IS NO LIMIT TO HOW MUCH FUNDS CAN BE SPENT ON OPERATING ASSISTANCE.CDOT FURLOUGHED EMPLOYEES SINCE MARCH 27 2020 (THE ENACTMENT DATE OF THE CARES ACT) AND AS REQUIRED BY THE CARES ACT AND SUBSEQUENT STIMULUS FUNDING TO SUPPORT RECOVERY FROM THE CORONAVIRUS PANDEMIC THESE FUNDS ARE BEING USED FOR OPERATING AND PAYROLL PURPOSES ONLY.THIS GRANT USES PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY FOR CONTRACTING PURPOSES AS OF 04/20/2022 $61167 WILL BE ENTERED INTO THE INITIAL FFR AS AN UNLIQUIDATED OBLIGATION BALANCE.

PURPOSE: CDOT WILL APPLY A TOTAL OF $827095 IN FFY20 AND FFY21 FUNDS FOR SELECTED 2021 SECTION 5310 RURAL TRANSIT PROJECTS. FUNDS WILL ASSIST WITH MEETING THE TRANSPORTATION NEEDS OF ELDERLY AND DISABLED RIDERS IN RURAL AREAS AROUND CO.APPLIED IN THIS APPLICATION:FFY 2020 5310 RURAL FUNDS: $126171 (REMAINING APPORTIONMENT) FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE FFY 2021 5310 RURAL FUNDS: $700924 (FULL APPORTIONMENT) FOR CAPITAL MOBILITY MANAGEMENT OPERATING AND STATE ADMINISTRATIVE ACTIVITIES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: 1) ROLLING STOCK- VEHICLE REPLACEMENTS $112356 (FTA)2) MOBILITY MANAGEMENT $398048 (FTA)3) OPERATING ASSISTANCE $268425 (FTA)4) STATE/PROGRAM ADMIN $48266 (FTA)EXPECTED OUTCOMES: TO MAINTAIN TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN RURAL COLORADO.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN RURAL COLORADO.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: ELEVEN SUB-RECIPIENTS IN COLORADO RURAL AREAS HAVE BEEN SELECTED FOR AWARDS IN SUPPORT OF RURAL TRANSIT FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES INCLUDING: 1) COMMUNITY OPTIONS INC.; 2) CITY OF DURANGO; 3) MONTROSE COUNTY SENIOR CITIZENS TRANSPORTATION INC.; 4) NORTH FRONT RANGE MPO; 5) NORTHWEST COLORADO COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (NWCCOG); 6) SOUTHEAST COLORADO ENTERPRISE DEVELOPMENT INC.; 7) SOUTHWEST COLORADO COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS; 8) COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS INC.; 9) DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES RESOURCES CENTER; 10) NORTHWEST COLORADO CENTER FOR INDEPENDENCE (NWCCI); AND 11) SOUTHWEST CENTER FOR INDEPENDENCE. CDOT HAS VERIFIED THAT ALL SUB-RECIPIENTS UNDER THIS APPLICATION ARE ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE FTA 5310 FUNDS.PROGRAM REQUIREMENTS:FFY 2020 5310 RURAL FUNDING IN THIS APPLICATION WHEN ADDED TO THE FFY 2020 5310 RURAL FUNDS FROM GRANT CO-2021-028 TOTAL APPROXIMATELY: 72.43% FOR TRADITIONAL CAPITAL PROJECTS - SATISFYING THE MINIMUM 55% REQUIREMENT AND 8.89% FOR STATE ADMINISTRATION - SATISFYING THE 10% MAXIMUM THRESHOLD. THIS GRANT DOES NOT INCLUDE ANY ADDITIONAL FY 2020 5310 FUNDS FOR STATE ADMIN.FY 2021 5310 RURAL FUNDS IN THIS APPLICATION TOTAL APPROXIMATELY:72.82% FOR TRADITIONAL CAPITAL PROJECTS - SATISFYING THE MINIMUM 55% REQUIREMENT AND 6.89% FOR STATE ADMIN - SATISFYING THE 10% MAXIMUM THRESHOLD.PLEASE REFER TO THE DETAILED PROGRAM REQUIREMENT CALCULATIONS FOR BOTH FY 2020 AND 2021 5310 RURAL FUNDS IN THE POP.ALL PROJECTS ARE CONSISTENT WITH LOCAL TRANSPORTATION HUMAN SERVICE COORDINATION TRANSIT PLANS; AND ALL VEHICLES HAVE MET CDOTS USEFUL LIFE CRITERIA. PLEASE SEE THE POP FOR FURTHER DETAILS. PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY IS USED FOR THIS GRANT BACK TO 1/1/2021. AS OF 7/28/2021 ALL ALIS HAVE INCURRED EXPENSES USING PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY IN THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF $198223 (FTA AMOUNT). THE DETAIL BREAKDOWNS ARE LISTED AS FOLLOWING:1) 11.7L.00 MOBILITY MANAGEMENT $128760;2) 30.09.01 OPERATING ASSISTANCE $69463.THE FUNDS INCLUDED IN THIS APPLICATION (FFY 2020 AND 2021 5310 RURAL PROGRAM) ARE INCLUDED IN THE CURRENT CDOTS SFY 2022-2025 STIP DOCUMENT UNDER THE ROLLED COLUMN UNDER THE IDENTIFIER SST6727 FOR ALL 5310 RURAL POOLED ACTIVITIES.

PURPOSE: CDOT WILL APPLY A TOTAL OF $1337660 IN FFY20 (REMAINING APPORTIONMENT) AND FFY21 (FULL APPORTIONMENT) FUNDS FOR SELECTED 2021 SECTION 5310 TRANSIT PROJECTS IN COLORADO SMALL URBAN AREAS. FUNDS WILL ASSIST FOUR SMALL URBAN AREAS IN MEETING THE TRANSPORTATION NEEDS OF ELDERLY AND DISABLE RIDERS IN THEIR COMMUNITIES. APPLIED IN THIS APPLICATION:FFY20 SMALL URBAN FUNDS: $157838 (REMAINING FY20 5310 SMALL URBAN APPORTIONMENT - APPLIED TO OPERATING EXPENSES)FFY21 SMALL URBAN FUNDS: $1179822 (FY21 FULL 5310 SMALL URBAN APPORTIONMENT - APPLIED TO ALL OTHER EXPENSES)ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS GRANT INCLUDES FOUR SCOPE ACTIVITIES:1) ROLLING STOCK- VEHICLE REPLACEMENTS2) MOBILITY MANAGEMENT3) OPERATING ASSISTANCE4) STATE/PROGRAM ADMINEXPECTED OUTCOMES: MAINTAIN TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS FOR SENIOR AND DISABLED COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN COLORADO SMALL URBAN AREAS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: RESIDENTS IN THE FOUR SMALL URBAN AREAS IN COLORADO.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: FOUR SUBRECIPIENTS IN THE COLORADO SMALL URBAN AREAS OF MESA COUNTY DENVER/BOULDER PUEBLO AND NORTH FRONT RANGE COMMUNITIES/GREELEY WERE SELECTED TO RECEIVE FUNDS FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AND VEHICLE REPLACEMENTS. PROGRAM REQUIREMENTS:FFY21 5310 SMALL URBAN FUNDS IN THIS APPLICATION TOTAL APPROXIMATELY:- 61.06% FOR TRADITIONAL CAPITAL PROJECTS SATISFYING THE MINIMUM 55% REQUIREMENT- 30.15% FOR NON-TRADITIONAL - OPERATING PROJECTS AND - 8.8% FOR STATE ADMIN SATISFYING THE 10% MAXIMUM ADMIN REQUIREMENT.FFY20 5310 SMALL URBAN FUNDS - ALSO IN CO-2021-028-00- 94.6% FOR TRADITIONAL CAPITAL PROJECTS - SATISFYING THE MINIMUM 55% REQUIREMENT (SPLIT BETWEEN THIS APPLICATION AND CO-2021-028)- 5.40% FOR STATE ADMIN - SATISFYING THE 10% MAXIMUM THRESHOLD - IN CO-2021-028 NO STATE ADMIN APPLIED IN THIS APPLICATIONCDOT HAS VERIFIED ALL SUBRECIPIENTS UNDER THIS APPLICATION ARE ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE FTA-5310 FUNDING; ALL PROJECTS ARE CONSISTENT WITH LOCAL TRANSPORTATION HUMAN SERVICE COORDINATION TRANSIT PLANS; AND ALL VEHICLES HAVE MET CDOTS USEFUL LIFE CRITERIA. PLEASE REFER TO THE POP FOR FURTHER DETAILS.THESE FFY 2020 AND FFY2021 5310 SMALL URBAN PROGRAM FUNDS ARE INCLUDED IN CDOTS SFY 2022-2025 STIP DOCUMENT UNDER THE IDENTIFIER SST6732 FOR ALL 5310 SMALL URBAN POOLED ACTIVITIES.PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY IS SELECTED FOR JANUARY THROUGH AUGUST 2021 IN THE AMOUNT OF APPROXIMATELY $891773 AS OF 8/1/2021.

PURPOSE:THE DENVER REGIONAL COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENT (DRCOG) REQUESTS $327397 IN 5310 LARGE URBAN FUNDS FOR THE DENVER-AURORA URBANIZED AREA FROM THE CORONAVIRUS RESPONSE AND RELIEF SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS ACT (CRRSAA). THIS REPRESENTS THE FULL APPORTIONMENT OF 5310 CRRSAA FUNDING FOR THE DENVER-AURORA URBANIZED AREA. AS THIS IS A CRRSAA APPLICATION FEDERAL FUNDS ARE PROVIDED AT 100% AND NO LOCAL MATCH IS REQUIRED. THE APPLICATION WILL FUND ACTIVITIES ORGANIZED IN TWO PROJECTS: MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AT $168428 AND OPERATIONS AT $158969.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE FUNDS WILL BE PASSED THROUGH TO ELIGIBLE SUBRECIPIENTS FOR TRANSPORTATION PROJECTS THAT SUPPORT OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE FTA GUIDANCE THAT THE RELIEF FUNDING IS PRIORITIZED FOR OPERATING AND SALARY EXPENSES DRCOG INTENDS TO AWARD THE FUNDING ONLY TO OPERATING AND MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROJECTS THAT RECEIVED FUNDING FROM DRCOGS LAST CALL FOR PROJECTS FOR REGULAR SECTION 5310 FUNDING FOR THE DENVER-AURORA LARGE URBANIZED AREA IN SUMMER OF 2020. THIS PROGRAM OF PROJECTS MIRRORS THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS FOR OPERATING AND MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROJECTS UNDER THE 5310 FORMULA AWARD (#CO-2021-021-00). THESE ACTIVITIES ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES PLAN AND THE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT PLAN APPROVED BY FTA.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THESE PROJECTS WILL HELP PROVIDERS OF SPECIALIZED TRANSIT FOR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE REGION TO SUPPORT THE GROWTH BACK TOWARD PRE-PANDEMIC SERVICE LEVELS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:TRANSIT PATRONS THAT ARE OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: PROJECTS FUNDED IN THIS APPLICATION ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN AND THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS (ATTACHED). FEDERAL EMERGENCY RELIEF FUNDING IS TO BE AWARDED WITHOUT MATCH REQUIRED TO THE SUBRECIPIENTS AS OUTLINED IN THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS. INTENDED SUBRECIPIENTS INCLUDE THE DENVER REGIONAL MOBILITY AND ACCESS COUNCIL DOUGLAS COUNTY GOVERNMENT CITY OF LAKEWOOD LARADON HALL SOCIETY FOR EXCEPTIONAL CHILDREN AND ADULTS AND VIA MOBILITY SERVICES.OTHER INFORMATION:THE RECIPIENT AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION IS ATTACHED INCLUDING THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS AND THE PMP APPROVAL LETTER. PER CRRSAA THE ACTIVITIES FUNDED BY THIS APPLICATION ARE NOT REQUIRED TO BE PROGRAMMED IN THE LONG-RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLAN STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION PLAN OR STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM.PLEASE NOTE: THERE IS OVERLAP IN THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE TO DRCOGS ARP AWARD (#CO-2021-043-00). THIS IS REQUESTED AS THE AVAILABLE ARP AND CRRSAA APPORTIONMENTS ARE INSUFFICIENT INDIVIDUALLY TO COVER ELIGIBLE EXPENSES WITHIN THE PERIOD. DRCOG WILL ENSURE THERE IS NO DUPLICATION OF PAYMENT FOR THE SAME EXPENSES.

PURPOSE:THIS APPLICATION APPLIES FOR $494923 -- THE FULL APPORTIONMENT OF FFY2020 FORMULA SECTION 5310 FUNDS AVAILABLE TO THE COLORADO SPRINGS UZA -- AT THE 100% FEDERAL MATCHING RATIO AS PERMITTED BY CRRSAA.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE APPLICATION INCLUDES $445431 FOR CONTRACTED MOBILITY SERVICES WITH QUALIFIED TRADITIONAL SERVICE PROVIDERS AND $49492 (THE 10% ALLOWABLE OF THE APPORTIONMENT) TO REIMBURSE PPACG FOR ADMINISTERING THE SEC 5310 PROGRAM. THE ACTIVITIES IN THIS APPLICATION ARE FUNDED AT A 100% FEDERAL MATCH. PER THE CRRSAA UNOBLIGATED SECTION 5310 FORMULA FUNDING (FY21 AND PRIOR) MAY BE OBLIGATED AT A 100-PERCENT FEDERAL SHARE FOR ALL ACTIVITIES ELIGIBLE UNDER THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM. THE OVERALL PERFORMANCE PERIOD FOR THIS AWARD IS OCTOBER 1 2021 THROUGH OCTOBER 31 2022. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS APPLICATION FUNDS THE PROVISION OF COORDINATED SPECIALIZED MOBILITY SERVICES FOR INDIVIDUALS WHO CANNOT USE COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICES DUE TO LOCATION OR LEVEL OF ASSISTANCE NEEDED. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:SENIORS AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS THROUGHOUT THE COLORADO SPRINGS URBANIZED AREA. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:PPACG CONCLUDED THE ANNUAL SUBRECIPIENT SELECTION PROCESS ON JUNE 17 2021. AS A RESULT THREE AGENCIES WERE SELECTED TO RECEIVE CRRSAA ARP AND TRADITIONAL FORMULA FUNDS TO PROVIDE MOBILITY SERVICES IN THE COLORADO SPRINGS UZA: EL PASO FOUNTAIN SENIOR CITIZEN PROGRAM SILVER KEY SENIOR SERVICES AND ENVIDA. THE SUBRECIPIENTS SELECTED USE ROUTE MATCH TO COORDINATE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO INDIVIDUALS SEEKING ASSISTANCE. THIS HELPS THEM BE EFFICIENT AND ENSURE THE NEEDS OF EACH PERSON REQUESTING A RIDE ARE MET. IN ADDITION THE FFY20 FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER EXPENSES ASSOCIATED WITH PROVIDING MOBILITY SERVICES TO SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. THESE ACTIVITIES ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN.OTHER INFORMATION: ALL REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION IS ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS PMP APPROVAL LETTER AND STIP/TIP PAGES.

BUDGET REVISION NO. 2 MARCH 2022: A NEGOTIATED INDIRECT COST RATE AGREEMENT WAS FINALIZED IN NOVEMBER 2021. THE NEGOTIATED INDIRECT COST RATE OF 37.9% IS FOR AN EFFECTIVE PERIOD OF JULY 1 2021 TO JUNE 30 2022. THE DENVER REGIONAL COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (DRCOG) REQUESTS TO ADJUST THE INDIRECT COST RATE FOR THIS AWARD AND TRANSFER FUNDS FROM PROJECT 2 TO PROJECT 3 DUE TO AN ADJUSTMENT OF POP #1 AND ADDING POP #10 WITHIN THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS. AN UPDATE POP AND SIGNED IDC RATE AGREEMENT ARE ATTACHED TO THE AWARD. DRCOG ALSO REQUESTS THAT THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE OF THIS AWARD BE ADJUSTED TO 09/30/2023. THE CHANGE IN THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS OUTLINED ABOVE WILL EXTEND BEYOND THE CURRENT PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE END DATE. IN ADDITION POP ITEM #5 IS BEHIND SCHEDULE. THIS ITEM IS BEING EXTEND AN ADDITIONAL YEAR TO ALLOW THE SUBRECIPIENT TO EVALUATE NEW SOFTWARE AND USE THIS FUNDING TO PURCHASE THE SOFTWARE. DUE TO THE SHIFTS IN OVERALL POP SCHEDULES THE BUDGET PERIOD FOR PROJECT 1 - PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION IS EXTENDED.-------------------------------------------------------------------BUDGET REVISION NO. 1 JUNE 2021: THE DENVER REGIONAL COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENT (DRCOG) REQUESTS TO REDUCE THE PROJECT PERIOD FOR INDIRECT COSTS WITHIN PROJECT 1 - DRCOG PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION FROM A START DATE OF APRIL 1 2021 TO JULY 1 2021. A PROVISIONAL INDIRECT COST RATE OF 42.8% FOR AN EFFECTIVE PERIOD OF JULY 1 2021 TO JUNE 30 2022 IS ATTACHED TO THE AWARD.-------------------------------------------------------------------ORIGINAL AWARD: THE DENVER REGIONAL COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENT (DRCOG) REQUESTS $1939052 IN FEDERAL FISCAL YEAR (FFY) 2021 5310 LARGE URBAN FUNDS FOR THE DENVER-AURORA URBANIZED AREA. THIS REPRESENTS THE FULL APPORTIONMENT OF THE FFY2021 5310 FUNDING FOR THE DENVER-AURORA URBANIZED AREA. THE FUNDS WILL BE PASSED THROUGH TO ELIGIBLE SUBRECIPIENTS FOR TRANSPORTATION PROJECTS THAT SUPPORT OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES CONSISTENT WITH THE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS ARISING FROM DRCOGS CALL FOR PROJECTS CONDUCTED IN THE SUMMER OF 2020. THE INTENTION OF DRCOGS CALL FOR PROJECTS WAS TO AWARD PROJECTS FOR FUNDING THROUGH JUNE 30 2022. THIS IS TO ALIGN THE SUBRECIPIENT BUDGET PERIODS WITH OTHER FUNDING THAT SUPPORTS TRANSIT SERVICES FOR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. DRCOG INTENDED THAT FFY21 FUNDING WOULD BE AWARDED TO SUBRECIPIENTS AND SPENT BY DECEMBER 31 2021. SUBRECIPIENT AGREEMENTS WILL INCLUDE AN OPTION TO RENEW FOR THE PERIOD OF JANUARY 1 2022 - JUNE 30 2022 WHICH MAY INCLUDE ADDING MONEY FROM FFY22 APPORTIONMENTS OR REALLOCATING FUNDING IN FFY21.SUBRECIPIENT AWARDS INCLUDE AWARDS FOR MOBILITY MANAGEMENT EXPENSES AND CONTRACTED OPERATING ASSISTANCE PROVIDED BY ELIGIBLE ENTITIES IN THE URBANIZED AREA. IN ADDITION FUNDS WILL GO FOR THE PURCHASE OF REPLACEMENT VEHICLES AND ON-DEMAND SOFTWARE UPDATES FOR HUMAN SERVICE TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS. DRCOG WILL RETAIN 10% OF THE FULL APPORTIONMENT AS PERMITTED FOR PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION. THIS WILL SUPPORT SUBRECIPIENT OVERSIGHT AND CONTRACT MANAGEMENT. THE CORONAVIRUS RESPONSE RELIEF AND SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS ACT WAIVED REQUIREMENTS FOR 5310 PROGRAMS TO PROVIDE LOCAL MATCHING FUNDS. AS SUCH AWARDS TO SUBRECIPIENTS WILL BE AWARDED WITHOUT LOCAL MATCH REQUIRED AT 100% FEDERAL MATCH. APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS GRANT WILL FUND THE PURCHASE OF APPROXIMATELY THREE (3) ADA ACCESSIBLE LESS THAN 30-FOOT REPLACEMENT BUSES INCLUDING SECURITY SURVEILLANCE SYSTEMS. THE VEHICLES WILL BE USED FOR TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR THE ELDERLY AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES WHO ARE OTHERWISE UNABLE TO UTILIZE OUR REGULAR FIXED-ROUTE SERVICE.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL ASSIST IN THE COST OF REPLACEMENT VEHICLES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL ALLOW FOR TIMELY REPLACEMENT OF VEHICLES. TRANSPORTATION SERVICES WILL BE MORE RELIABLE FOR PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES AND THE ELDERLY DUE TO NEW VEHICLES BEING PLACED IN SERVICE AND REDUCING BREAKDOWNS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: RIDERS OF OUR PARATRANSIT SERVICE INCLUDING ELIGIBLE SENIORS PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES AND WHEELCHAIR USERS WITHIN THE SANTA ROSA SERVICE AREA THAT CANNOT ACCESS OUR FIXED ROUTE SERVICE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE $85207 TO SOCIAL SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS AND TRANSIT OPERATORS FOR OPERATING ASSISTANCE PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION AND PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE IN RESPONSE TO CORONAVIRUS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER PROJECTS SELECTED BY VCTC ON A COMPETITIVE BASIS ENCOMPASSING ELIGIBLE OPERATING EXPENSES SUCH AS DRIVER SALARIES FUEL MAINTENANCE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT STAFF AND SOFTWARE MAINTENANCE ETC. TO PROVIDE SOCIAL SERVICE TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT VENTURA COUNTY ORGANIZATIONS TO PROVIDE EXPANDED TRANSPORTATION SERVICES OPTIONS FOR PERSONS WHO ARE SENIORS AND/OR PERSONS WHO HAVE DISABILITIES BEYOND WHAT IS REQUIRED TO BE PROVIDED UNDER THE AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES ACT.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THESE PROJECTS ARE TARGETED TOWARDS PERSONS WHO ARE SENIORS AND/OR PERSONS WHO HAVE DISABILITIES.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: TWO SUBRECIPIENTS INCLUDING COUNTY AREA AGENCY ON AGING AND THE THOUSAND OAKS SENIOR NUTRITION RIDESHARE FOR OPERATING EXPENSES AND PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION.

CALTRANS IS APPLYING THIS FLEXIBILITY AS PROVIDED BY CRRSAA FOR THIS GRANT. ALL PROJECTS WOULD BE 100% FEDERALLY FUNDED WITH NO LOCAL MATCH PROVIDED.AFTER AWARD EXECUTION FFY 2021 LARGE UZA APPORTIONMENTS IN THE AMOUNTS SHOWN BELOW WILL REMAIN AVAILABLE FOR FUTURE OBLIGATION.ANTIOCH (UZA #062650): $ 104415 SAN FRANCISCO (UZA #060060): $ 414000 SANTA ROSA (UZA #062250):$ 212077 =================================TOTAL: $ 730492* PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD IS TO ASSIST TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS THAT SUPPORT SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHO HAVE SPECIALIZED TRANSPORTATION NEEDS.* ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL COVER ACQUISITION OF BUSES VANS AND OTHER EQUIPMENT; PERFORMANCE OF MOBILITY MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES; OPERATION OF SPECIALIZED TRANSPORTATION SERVICES; AND GRANT MANAGEMENT AND SUBRECIPIENT OVERSIGHT ACTIVITIES PERFORMED BY CALTRANS.* EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL ALLOW THE CONTINUED SUPPORT OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHO HAVE SPECIALIZED TRANSPORTATION NEEDS.* INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES ACROSS CALIFORNIA.* SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENTS WILL RECEIVE FUNDING ASSISTANCE FOR THE FOLLOWING PROJECT TYPES UNDER THIS GRANT:PURCHASES OF VEHICLES AND EQUIPMENT MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROJECTS FOR THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENTS.OPERATING ASSISTANCETHE PROGRAM OF PROJECTS (POP) SHOWING PROJECT DETAILS FOR EACH APPORTIONMENT ARE ATTACHED AS PDF DOCUMENTS IN TRAMS. ALL PROJECTS IDENTIFIED IN THIS APPLICATION ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE APPLICABLE COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICE PLAN(S).THE RECIPIENT AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.THE RECIPIENT CERTIFIES THAT IT AND ANY SUBRECIPIENT OR CONTRACTOR THAT IS A PROVIDER OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION: (A) INTEND TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT POSSIBLE TO USE CARES ACT OR CRRSAA FUNDS TO BRING BACK ANY EMPLOYEES PREVIOUSLY FURLOUGHED AS A DIRECT RESULT OF FINANCIAL DIFFICULTIES CAUSED BY THE COVID-19 PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY; (B) INTEND TO USE CARES ACT OR CRRSAA FUNDS TO REHIRE ANY POSITIONS OF EMPLOYEES WHO WERE LAID OFF AS A DIRECT RESULT OF FINANCIAL CHALLENGES CAUSED BY THE COVID-19 PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY; AND (C) WILL EXPLAIN HOW THEY HAVE SPENT CARES ACT OR CRRSAA FUNDS ON PAYROLL OPERATIONS OR PAYROLL AND EXPENSES OF PRIVATE PROVIDERS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT POSSIBLE.

THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST FY 2020 SECTION 5310 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE LOS ANGELES/LONG BEACH/ANAHEIM UZA#60020 IN THE AMOUNT OF $7959.BELOW IS A SUMMARY OF THE REQUEST:FEDERAL FUNDS: FY 2020 5310 FUNDS FROM LA/LB/ANA UZA#60020: $7959NON USDOT MATCH: $0TOTAL PROJECT COST: $7959START DATE IS: 10/1/2022END DATE IS: 09/30/2025PER CA31 OF THE FTAS CORONAVIRUS DISEASE 2019 (COVID-19) FAQS THE CRRSAA WAIVES THE REQUIREMENT FOR LOCAL SHARE FOR PREVIOUSLY APPORTIONED (FY21 AND PRIOR) UNOBLIGATED SECTION 5310 FUNDS. ANY UNOBLIGATED SECTION 5310 FUNDS MAY BE OBLIGATED AT A 100% FEDERAL SHARE. THESE FY20 FUNDS WILL BE OBLIGATED AT 100% FEDERAL SHARE. (HTTPS://WWW.TRANSIT.DOT.GOV/FREQUENTLY-ASKED-QUESTIONS-FTA-GRANTEES-REGARDING-CORONAVIRUS-DISEASE-2019-COVID-19)THESE FUNDS ARE INCLUDED IN THE SUBALLOCATION IDENTIFIED IN THE SPLIT LETTER DATED MAY 4 2020 AND ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION. THESE FUNDS ARE PROGRAMMED IN THE 2021 FTIP #LA0G1123 AMENDMENT #21-21 APPROVED ON APRIL 29 2022. THE CONCURRENCE LETTER IS ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION. PURPOSE:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE $7959 IN FY 2020 SECTION 5310 FUNDS FOR THE LOS ANGELES/LONG BEACH/ANAHEIM UZA #60020 FOR THE LOS ANGELES COUNTY WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AGING COMMUNITY SERVICES (WDACS) FOR THEIR VOLUNTEER DRIVER MILEAGE REIMBURSEMENT (VDMR) PROGRAM AND THEIR TAXICAB SERVICES PROGRAM (TSP). FUNDING FOR THESE PROGRAMS IS NEARLY DEPLETED DUE TO THE INCREASING COSTS FOR TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND THE ADDITIONAL FUNDS WILL HELP FILL THE FUNDING GAP SO THEY CAN CONTINUE ADMINISTERING THESE PROGRAMS FOR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE FOLLOWING OPERATING ACTIVITY WILL BE PERFORMED BY WDACS:- UTILIZE OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR THREE (3) YEARS TO ADMINISTER ITS TRANSPORTATION PROGRAMS FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE FY 2020 SECTION 5310 FUNDS WILL SUPPORT WDACS OPERATING EXPENSES ELIGIBLE UNDER THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM. THE FUNDS WILL HELP ENSURE THAT WDACS VDMR AND TSP TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM CONTINUING OPERATING SO THAT SAFE TRANSIT SERVICES REMAIN AVAILABLE FOR RIDERS TRAVELING TO JOBS HEALTH CARE AND OTHER ESSENTIAL SERVICES AS PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS CONTINUE TO FACE CHALLENGES DUE TO COVID-19.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE PROJECT IS PLANNED DESIGNED AND CARRIED OUT TO MEET THE SPECIFIC NEEDS OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WITHIN LOS ANGELES COUNTY TO PROVIDE THEM WITH SAFE AND RELIABLE ACCESSIBLE TRANSPORTATION. THE OPERATING PROJECT EXCEEDS ADA REQUIREMENTS DECREASES RELIANCE ON ADA COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICE AND PROVIDES TRANSPORTATION ALTERNATIVES TO ASSIST SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THE FOLLOWING ONE SUBRECIPIENT WILL RECEIVE OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO MAINTAIN SERVICES:1.LOS ANGELES COUNTY WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AGING COMMUNITY SERVICES (WDACS): ADMINISTER TRANSPORTATION PROGRAMS FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES FOR THREE (3) YEARS.A COPY OF THIS APPLICATION WILL BE SUBMITTED TO THE STATE OFFICE OF PLANNING AND RESEARCH PURSUANT TO EXECUTIVE ORDER NO. 12372. METRO CERTIFIES THAT THE SECTION 5310 FUNDS WERE FAIRLY AND EQUITABLY ALLOCATED TO ELIGIBLE SUB-RECIPIENTS. METRO CERTIFIES THAT THIS PROJECT RECOMMENDED FOR SECTION 5310 FUNDING IS INCLUDED IN THE LOCALLY DEVELOPED 2021-2024 COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT-HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN FOR LOS ANGELES COUNTY (COORDINATED PLAN) THAT WAS DEVELOPED AND APPROVED (JUNE 24 2021) THROUGH A PROCESS THAT INCLUDED PARTICIPATION FROM REPRESENTATIVES OF PUBLIC PRIVATE AND NONPROFIT TRANSPORTATION AND HUMAN SERVICE PROVIDERS AND BY SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES.

THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN ACT OF 2021 (ARPA) FUNDING APPORTIONED TO THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM FOR THE LOS ANGELES/LONG BEACH/ANAHEIM UZA#60020 IN THE AMOUNT OF $1254836.THE LOS ANGELES COUNTY METROPOLITAN TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (METRO) ACTING AS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT OF SECTION 5310 FUNDS ALLOCATED TO LARGE URBANIZED AREAS (UZAS) IN LOS ANGELES COUNTY WITHIN LOS ANGELES-LONG BEACH-ANAHEIM (UZA 60020) LANCASTER-PALMDALE (UZA 63510) AND SANTA CLARITA (UZA 60020) SUBMITS THIS APPLICATION ON BEHALF OF ITS SECTION 5310 SUBRECIPIENTS. BELOW IS A SUMMARY OF THE REQUEST:FEDERAL FUNDS: FY21 5310 FUNDS (ARPA FUNDING) FROM LA/LB/ANA UZA#60020: $1254836NON USDOT MATCH: $0TOTAL PROJECT COST: $1254836CONSISTENT WITH THE AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN ACT OF 2021 (ARPA) THESE FUNDS ARE OBLIGATED AT 100% FEDERAL SHARE.PROJECTS ARE NOT REQUIRED TO BE IN THE FTIP AS THEY DO NOT INVOLVE SUBSTANTIAL CHANGES TO THE FUNCTION LOCATION OR CAPACITY OF THE ASSETS INVOLVED.PURPOSE:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE $1254836 IN SECTION 5310 ARPA FUNDS FOR THE LOS ANGELES/LONG BEACH/ANAHEIM UZA #60020 FOR THE IMPLEMENTATION OF FIVE OPERATING PROJECTS (FIVE ALIS) FOR THE PERIOD OF JANUARY 20 2020 TO SEPTEMBER 30 2025. THE FUNDING IS CONSISTENT WITH THE SUBALLOCATION IDENTIFIED IN THE SPLIT LETTER DATED JUNE 24 2021 AND ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO OFFSET SOME OF THE IMPACTS OF COVID-19 ON TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS ELIGIBLE OPERATIONS BY SUPPORTING OPERATING EXPENSES INCLUDING PAYROLL EXPENSES ELIGIBLE UNDER THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE FUNDS WILL COVER OPERATING EXPENSES TO IMPLEMENT EXPAND MAINTAIN AND REIMBURSE FOR TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND PURCHASE AND/OR REIMBURSE FOR PPE SUPPLIES AND/OR SERVICES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE ARPA SUPPLEMENTAL FUNDS WILL SUPPORT OPERATING EXPENSES INCLUDING PAYROLL EXPENSES ELIGIBLE UNDER THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM INCURRED ON OR AFTER JANUARY 20 2020. THE FUNDS WILL HELP ENSURE THAT SAFE TRANSIT SERVICES REMAIN AVAILABLE FOR RIDERS TRAVELING TO JOBS HEALTH CARE AND OTHER ESSENTIAL SERVICES AS PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS CONTINUE TO FACE CHALLENGES DUE TO COVID-19 AND ITS LASTING IMPACTS TO TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE PROJECTS ARE PLANNED DESIGNED AND CARRIED OUT TO MEET THE SPECIFIC NEEDS OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WITHIN LOS ANGELES COUNTY TO PROVIDE THEM WITH SAFE AND RELIABLE ACCESSIBLE TRANSPORTATION. THE OPERATING PROJECTS INCLUDE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROJECTS THAT EXCEED ADA REQUIREMENTS IMPROVE ACCESS TO FIXED-ROUTE SERVICES AND DECREASE RELIANCE ON ADA COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICE PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION ALTERNATIVES TO ASSIST SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES HELP PROVIDE AWARENESS KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS OF PUBLIC AND ALTERNATIVE TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS AVAILABLE IN THEIR COMMUNITIES AND PROVIDE COVID-19 SUPPORT SERVICES FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THE FOLLOWING FIVE (5) SUBRECIPIENTS WILL RECEIVE OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO REIMBURSE FOR MAINTAIN IMPLEMENT AND/OR EXPAND SERVICES:1.CITY OF GLENDALE: SUSTAINED DIAL-A-RIDE OPERATIONS FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES DURING THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. 2.CITY OF PASADENA: COVID-19 PPE AND FOOD BANK TRIPS PROVIDED TO SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES DURING THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.3.ALTAMED HEALTH SERVICES: NINE (9) MONTHS OF FLEET BUS MAINTENANCE AND FUEL FOR ALTAMEDS PACE PROGRAM. 4.PIH GOOD SAMARITAN HOSPITAL: CONTINUE ITS TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM BY FUNDING ONE (1) FTE MOBILITY MANAGER FOR TWO (2) YEARS. 5.LOS ANGELES COUNTY WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AGING COMMUNITY SERVICES (WDACS): ADMINISTER TRANSPORTATION PROGRAMS FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES FOR THREE (3) YEARS.A COPY OF THIS APPLICATION WILL BE SUBMITTED TO THE STATE OFFICE OF PLANNING AND RESEARCH PURSUANT TO EXECUTIVE ORDER NO. 12372. METRO CERTIFIES THAT THE SECTION 5310 FUNDS WERE FAIRLY AND EQUITABLY ALLOCATED TO ELIGIBLE SUB-RECIPIENTS. METRO CERTIFIES THAT ALL PROJECTS RECOMMENDED FOR SECTION 5310 FUNDING ARE INCLUDED IN THE LOCALLY DEVELOPED 2021-2024 COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT-HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN FOR LOS ANGELES COUNTY (COORDINATED PLAN) THAT WAS DEVELOPED AND APPROVED (JUNE 24 2021) THROUGH A PROCESS THAT INCLUDED PARTICIPATION FROM REPRESENTATIVES OF PUBLIC PRIVATE AND NONPROFIT TRANSPORTATION AND HUMAN SERVICE PROVIDERS AND BY SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES.METRO AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.

INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE PROJECTS ARE PLANNED DESIGNED AND CARRIED OUT TO MEET THE SPECIFIC NEEDS OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WITHIN LOS ANGELES COUNTY TO PROVIDE THEM WITH SAFE AND RELIABLE ACCESSIBLE TRANSPORTATION. THE OPERATING PROJECTS INCLUDE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROJECTS THAT EXCEED ADA REQUIREMENTS IMPROVE ACCESS TO FIXED-ROUTE SERVICES AND DECREASE RELIANCE ON ADA COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICE PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION ALTERNATIVES TO ASSIST SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES HELP PROVIDE AWARENESS KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS OF PUBLIC AND ALTERNATIVE TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS AVAILABLE IN THEIR COMMUNITIES AND PROVIDE COVID-19 SUPPORT SERVICES FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THE FOLLOWING SIX (6) SUBRECIPIENTS WILL RECEIVE OPERATING ASSISTANCE TO IMPLEMENT AND/OR EXPAND SERVICES:1.FAME ASSISTANCE CORPORATION: IMPLEMENT A NEW FREE AND SAFE TRANSPORTATION SERVICE FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. 2.LOS ANGELES JEWISH HOME FOR THE AGING: INCREASE DRIVER CAPACITY BY ADDING THREE (3) FULL-TIME DRIVERS AND PURCHASING PPE SUPPLIES FOR TWO (2) YEARS.3.POMONA VALLEY TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (PVTA): INCREASE TRANSPORTATION ACCESS BY FUNDING ONE (1) FTE TRAVEL TRAINER FOR THREE (3) YEARS.4.CITY OF EL MONTE: REINSTATE AND EXPAND A TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM FOR SENIORS/DISABLED FOR TWO (2) YEARS.5.LOS ANGELES COUNTY WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AGING COMMUNITY SERVICES (WDACS): ADMINISTER TRANSPORTATION PROGRAMS FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES FOR THREE (3) YEARS.6.WESTSIDE PACIFIC VILLAGES: COORDINATION OF TRANSPORTATION SERVICES PROVIDED DURING THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC AND TO CONTINUE THOSE SERVICES.A COPY OF THIS APPLICATION WILL BE SUBMITTED TO THE STATE OFFICE OF PLANNING AND RESEARCH PURSUANT TO EXECUTIVE ORDER NO. 12372. METRO CERTIFIES THAT THE SECTION 5310 FUNDS WERE FAIRLY AND EQUITABLY ALLOCATED TO ELIGIBLE SUB-RECIPIENTS. METRO CERTIFIES THAT ALL PROJECTS RECOMMENDED FOR SECTION 5310 FUNDING ARE INCLUDED IN THE LOCALLY DEVELOPED 2021-2024 COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT-HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN FOR LOS ANGELES COUNTY (COORDINATED PLAN) THAT WAS DEVELOPED AND APPROVED (JUNE 24 2021) THROUGH A PROCESS THAT INCLUDED PARTICIPATION FROM REPRESENTATIVES OF PUBLIC PRIVATE AND NONPROFIT TRANSPORTATION AND HUMAN SERVICE PROVIDERS AND BY SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES.METRO AGREES THAT IF IT RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA) OR THROUGH A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY THROUGH THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT A DIFFERENT FEDERAL AGENCY OR INSURANCE PROCEEDS FOR ANY PORTION OF A PROJECT ACTIVITY APPROVED FOR FTA FUNDING UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IT WILL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO FTA AND REIMBURSE FTA FOR ANY FEDERAL SHARE THAT DUPLICATES FUNDING PROVIDED BY FEMA ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY OR AN INSURANCE COMPANY.

THIS GRANT WILL ASSIST IN FUNDS TO PROCURE CONTRACTOR SERVICES FOR THE PROVISION OF ADA COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICE IN THE SIX (6) DIFFERENT SERVICE AREAS ACCESS SERVICES OPERATES WITHIN LOS ANGELES COUNTY. THIS PROJECT WILL FUND CONTRACTED SERVICE FOR THE PERIOD BETWEEN JULY 1 2022 THROUGH JUNE 30 2023. FEDERAL FUNDING FOR THE PROJECT INCLUDED IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION IS PROVIDED BY THE FOLLOWING:SURFACE TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM (STP) FLEXIBLE FUNDS TRANSFERRED TO 5310 FROM THE LOS ANGELES-LONG BEACH-SANTA ANA UZA #60020: $73000000.TOTAL SECTION FHWA TRANSFER TO 5310 FFY 2022 LOS ANGELES-LONG BEACH-SANTA ANA UZA: $73000000OVERALL GRANT FUNDING: TOTAL FEDERAL FUNDS (88.53%): $73000000TOTAL LOCAL MATCH (11.47%): $9457924TOTAL PROJECT COST: $82457924ACCESS SERVICES IS HEREBY SUBMITTING THIS GRANT APPLICATION IN SUPPORT OF THE FOLLOWING CAPITAL PROJECTS:THIS GRANT APPLIES $73000000 OF STP FUNDS (FHWA TRANSFER TO 5310) TO PROCURE CONTRACTOR SERVICES FOR THE PROVISION OF ADA COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICE IN THE SIX (6) DIFFERENT SERVICE AREAS ACCESS SERVICES OPERATES WITHIN LOS ANGELES COUNTY. THIS PROJECT WILL FUND CONTRACTED SERVICE FOR THE PERIOD BETWEEN JULY 1 2022 THROUGH JUNE 30 2023.IN THE FUTURE ACCESS SERVICES WILL FLEX FHWA SURFACE TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM (STP) DOLLARS INTO SECTION 5307 URBANIZED FORMULA FUNDS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:FUNDS WILL COVER AND BE USED TO PROCURE CONTRACTOR SERVICES FOR THE PROVISION OF ADA COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICE IN THE SIX (6) DIFFERENT SERVICE AREAS ACCESS OPERATES WITHIN LOS ANGELES COUNTY. THIS PROJECT WILL FUND CONTRACTED SERVICE FOR THE PERIOD BETWEEN JULY 1 2022 THROUGH JUNE 30 2023. ACCESS SERVICES IS A PUBLIC TRANSIT AGENCY THAT PROVIDES AMERICAN WITH DISABILITIES ACT (ADA) COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICE PURSUANT TO THE LOS ANGELES COUNTY COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT HUMAN SERVICES PLAN. ACCESS SERVICES IS ALSO THE DESIGNATED LOS ANGELES COUNTY CONSOLIDATED TRANSPORTATION SERVICE AGENCY (CTSA) PURSUANT TO GOVERNMENT CODE 15975. THE CORE PURPOSE OF THE CTSA DESIGNATION IS TO FOSTER AND PROMOTE COORDINATION OF TRANSIT SERVICES IN THE COUNTY. THIS ACTIVITY WAS DERIVED FROM THE COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT HUMAN SERVICES PLAN IN THAT IT MEETS THE NEEDS OF SENIORS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES AS IDENTIFIED IN THE PLAN. THE ACTIVITY WILL ALSO BE CONSISTENT AS ACCESS PROVIDES ADA COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICE TO CUSTOMERS IN THE LOS ANGELES BASIN INCLUDING SANTA CLARITA AND ANTELOPE VALLEY. ACCESS SERVICES IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT PUBLIC AGENCY THAT OPERATES ADA COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICE ON BEHALF OF FORTY-FIVE PUBLIC FIXED ROUTE OPERATORS INCLUDING L.A. METRO AND LOCAL AND MUNICIPAL PUBLIC TRANSIT AGENCIES. A LISTING OF ACCESS SERVICES MEMBER AGENCIES HAS BEEN UPLOADED TO TRAMS UNDER RECIPIENT DOCUMENTS. LOS ANGELES COUNTY SPANS OVER 4700 SQUARE MILES OF WHICH 1950 SQUARES MILES IS ACCESS SERVICE AREA. THIS VAST SERVICE AREA PROMPTED ACCESS IN 1994 TO ASSESS THE BEST METHOD IN DELIVERING AN EFFICIENT AND EFFECTIVE COORDINATED ADA COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICE MODEL. DUE TO THE SIZE OF THE SERVICE AREA INCLUDING TAKING INTO CONSIDERATION ASPECTS OF IMPLEMENTING A COORDINATED ADA COMPLEMENTARY SYSTEM SIX (6) SERVICE AREAS WERE ESTABLISHED. THE INCEPTION OF THE SIX (6) SERVICE REGIONS PROMPTED SIX (6) DIFFERENT CONTRACTORS WITH EACH SERVICE REGION COMPETITIVELY BID AND PROCURED. THIS SERVICE MODEL HAS BEEN PROVEN EFFECTIVE IN OVER 20 YEARS THAT ACCESS HAS OPERATED AS IT ALLOWS ACCESS SERVICES TO EFFICIENTLY MANAGE ADA COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICES IN LOS ANGELES COUNTY. IN ADDITION THE COORDINATED EFFORTS INCLUDING SERVICE DESIGN ENCOURAGED BY THE ORIGINAL ADA PARATRANSIT REGULATIONS PROVIDES CONVENIENCE AND EASE FOR PARATRANSIT CUSTOMERS IN THE LOS ANGELES COUNTY BASIN WHO ARE ABLE TO ENJOY TRANSFER-FREE PARATRANSIT SERVICE FOR THEIR TRIPS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL ALLOW THE CONTINUED OPERATION OF ADA COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICES ON BEHALF OF LOS ANGELES COUNTYS 45 FIXED TRANSIT OPERATORS. THE ANNUAL CONTRACT COST TO PROVIDE ADA COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT SERVICES THROUGHOUT LOS ANGELES COUNTY IS BUDGETED AT $176512083 AND IS PROVIDED BY ACCESS SERVICE PROVIDER CONTRACTORS. ACCESS SERVICES PROVIDES SERVICE THROUGHOUT LOS ANGELES COUNTY IN THE FOLLOWING 6 SERVICE AREAS:1.SOUTHERN REGION2.NORTHERN REGION3.EASTERN REGION4.WEST- CENTRAL REGION5.SANTA CLARITA REGION6.ANTELOPE VALLEY REGIONINTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE INTENDED BENEFICIARES ARE THE PARATRANSIT CUSTOMERS IN ACCESS SERVICE REGIONS. ACCESS SERVICES CONTRACTS WITH SIX PARATRANSIT PROVIDERS IN THE: NORTHERN EASTERN SOUTHERN AND WEST-CENTRAL REGIONS OF LOS ANGELES COUNTY INCLUDING SANTA CLARITA AND ANTELOPE VALLEY. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:NONE.
