THIS AWARD WILL BE USED BY CITY OF FRESNO DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION FRESNO ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES COMMISSION UNITED CEREBRAL PALSY CENTRAL CALIFORNIA WESTCARE CALIFORNIA AND INSPIRATION TRANSPORTATION TO PURCHASE VEHICLES TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. PROJECT 1: FRESNO AREA EXPRESS WILL BE USING $430080 IN FTA FUNDING AND $107520 IN LOCAL FUNDS FOR A TOTAL OF $537600 TO PURCHASE FOUR (4) REPLACEMENT PARATRANSIT CUTAWAY BUSES INCLUDING ACCESSIBILITY EQUIPMENT AND RADIOS AND THREE (3) PARATRANSIT SEDANS.THESE NEW PARATRANSIT CUTAWAY BUSES WILL BE REPLACING THE FOLLOWING VEHICLES:# VIN # MILEAGE11FDFE4FS9EDA99201 23297321FDFE4FS0EDB18024 25609131FDFE4FS1EDB18016 2460524 1FDFE4FS8EDB18028 274918TO KEEP THE PROPER SPARE RATIO THESE VEHICLES WILL BE DISPOSED OF SHORTLY AFTER THE TIME THE NEW BUSES PURCHASED WITH THESE SECTION 5310 FUNDS ARE READY TO BE PUT IN SERVICE.THE THREE NEW PARATRANSIT SEDANS WILL BE USED TO EXPAND FAXS FLEET OF VEHICLES. FAX TYPICALLY UTILIZES A SMALL NUMBER OF SEDANS IN OUR PARATRANSIT VEHICLE FLEET. ALTHOUGH SEDAN SERVICE HAS BEEN TEMPORARILY SUSPENDED DUE TO COVID-RELATED SOCIAL DISTANCING RESTRICTIONS IT WILL SOON BE BACK IN PLACE ONCE PLEXIGLASS SAFETY BARRIERS ARE INSTALLED TO PROTECT THE DRIVERS AND PASSENGERS. THE SEDANS ARE USED TO TRANSPORT ANY ELIGIBLE HANDY RIDE PASSENGER WHO IS NOT CONFINED TO A WHEELCHAIR OR MOBILITY DEVICE (SUCH AS PERSONS WITH VISUAL IMPAIRMENTS THOSE WHO USE CANES OR WALKERS OR THOSE WITH SEIZURE OR NEUROLOGICAL DISORDERS THAT PREVENT THEM FROM DRIVING) WHICH ALLOWS THE LARGER CUTAWAYS TO BE RESERVED FOR TRIPS THAT SERVE THOSE WHO REQUIRE USE OF WHEELCHAIR LIFTS AND SECUREMENTS. THE EXPANSION SEDANS WILL INCREASE ACCESS TO SERVICE REDUCE WAIT TIMES INCREASE PARATRANSIT ON-TIME PERFORMANCE AND ALLOW FOR INCREASED DAILY TRIPS. THESE IMPROVEMENTS WILL HELP MITIGATE THE NEGATIVE EFFECTS OF COVID-RELATED CAPACITY CONSTRAINTS. PROJECT 2: FRESNO ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES COMMISSION WILL BE USING $270219 IN FTA FUNDING WITH $54044 IN TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT CREDITS TO PURCHASE THREE (3) PARATRANSIT CUTAWAY BUSES WITH ADA EQUIPMENT. THESE NEW VEHICLES WILL BE REPLACING THE FOLLOWING VEHICLES: #VIN # MILEAGE11FDXE45536DB1882029541921FDXE455X7DB4384531167231FD4E45588DA59754320095TO KEEP THE PROPER SPARE RATIO THESE VEHICLES WILL BE DISPOSED OF SHORTLY AFTER THE TIME THE NEW BUSES PURCHASED WITH THESE SECTION 5310 FUNDS ARE READY TO BE PUT IN SERVICE.PROJECT 3: UNITED CEREBRAL PALSY ASSOCIATION OF CENTRAL CALIFORNIA (UCPCC) WILL BE USING $187950 IN FTA FUNDING WITH $37590 IN TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT CREDITS TO PURCHASE TWO (2) PARATRANSIT CUTAWAY BUSES WITH ADA EQUIPMENT. THESE BUSES WILL BE USED TO EXPAND THEIR FLEET. UCPCC HAS A WAITLIST OF 14 STUDENTS WHO NEED TRANSPORTATION TO THEIR DAY PROGRAM SITES. THESE NEW BUSES WILL ALLOW UCPCC TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO THESE STUDENTS. PROJECT 4: WESTCARE CALIFORNIA INC. WILL BE USING $111082 IN FTA FUNDING WITH $22216 IN TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT CREDITS TO PURCHASE TWO (2) CLASS V RAISED TOP VAN WITH A MODIFICATION FOR A CURBSIDE FRONT ENTRY AND NAVIGATION SYSTEM. THESE PARATRANSIT VANS WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO WESTCARES EXPANDING NUMBER OF CLIENTS AND THE ADDITIONAL RIDES THEY REQUIRE. THE INCREASED NUMBER OF VEHICLES WILL ALSO REDUCE WAIT TIMES FOR THEIR CLIENTS.PROJECT 5: INSPIRATION TRANSPORTATION WILL BE USING $185645 IN FTA FUNDING WITH $37129 IN TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT CREDITS TO PURCHASE AN ELECTRIC PARATRANSIT VAN.THIS VAN WILL BE USED TO INCREASE THEIR FLEET OF VEHICLES PROVIDING PARATRANSIT SERVICE TO SECTIONS OF THE CITY OF FRESNO THAT ARE THE MOST DISPROPORTIONATELY BURDENED BY MULTIPLE SOURCES OF POLLUTION.

FUNDING FOR THE PROJECT INCLUDED IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION IS PROVIDED BY THE FOLLOWING APPORTIONMENT YEARS AND URBANIZED AREAS (UZAS):SECTION 5310 FFY 2019 LANCASTER-PALMDALE (UZA #63510): $1359 SECTION 5310 FFY 2019 SANTA CLARITA (UZA #61770): $65940 TOTAL ADDITIONAL FUNDS: $67299PURPOSE OF THE AWARD THE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE TRANSFER TRIPS PROGRAM WHICH PROVIDES MOBILITY OPTIONS FOR SENIORS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE OUTLYING AREAS OF LANCASTER-PALMDALE AND SANTA CLARITA.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED THIS GRANT APPLIES $67299 OF FY19 5310 FUNDS TO CONTINUE THE TRANSFER TRIP PROGRAM FOR THE PERIOD OF JUNE 24 2021 THROUGH OCTOBER 31 2022. THE TRANSFER TRIPS PROGRAM WAS IMPLEMENTED TO ADDRESS THE GAPS IN TRANSIT SERVICE BETWEEN AREAS OF LANCASTER-PALMDALE SANTA CLARITA AND LOS ANGELES BASIN. THE SERVICE PROVIDES SEAMLESS SERVICE AND CONNECTIVITY INTO THE LOS ANGELES BASIN AREA FOR ACCESS ELIGIBLE CUSTOMERS IN THE LANCASTER-PALMDALE AND SANTA CLARITA AREAS. THE ADDITIONAL 5310 FUNDS ENABLES CRITICAL TRANSPORTATION BETWEEN THE LANCASTER-PALMDALE SANTA CLARITA AND LA BASIN AREAS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES THE TRANSFER TRIPS PROGRAM PROVIDES. CRITICAL TRANSPORTATION BETWEEN THE LANCASTER-PALMDALE SANTA CLARITA AND LA BASIN AREAS TO SENIORS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILTIES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE SENIORS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES IN LOS ANGELES COUNTY.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES ACCESS SERVICES DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.THIS PROJECT IS INCLUDED IN THE ADOPTED COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN 2021 - 2024 AND 55 PERCENT OF APPROPRIATED FUNDS HAVE BEEN USED FOR TRADITIONAL CAPITAL PROJECTS.

THE LOS ANGELES COUNTY METROPOLITAN TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (METRO) ACTING AS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT OF SECTION 5310 FUNDS ALLOCATED TO LARGE URBANIZED AREAS (UZA) IN LOS ANGELES COUNTY WITHIN LOS ANGELES-LONG BEACH-ANAHEIM (UZA 60020) LANCASTER-PALMDALE (UZA 63510) AND SANTA CLARITA (UZA 60020) SUBMITS THIS GRANT APPLICATION FOR SECTION 5310 FEDERAL FUNDS OF $1115715 CONSISTENT WITH THE SUBALLOCATION IDENTIFIED IN THE TWO SPLIT LETTERS DATED AUGUST 29 2019 AND MAY 4 2020 AND ATTACHED TO THIS AMENDMENT.PURPOSE OF THE AWARD:METRO SUBMITS THIS FEDERAL SECTION 5310 PROJECT ADMINISTRATION GRANT APPLICATION FOR PROGRAM SUPPORT ADMINISTRATION FUNDS OF $1115715 TO CONTINUE PROVIDING ADMINISTRATION PLANNING AND TECHNICAL SUPPORT TO ALL LA COUNTY SECTION 5310 SUBRECIPIENTS AND CONTINUE OVERSEEING THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THEIR SOLICITED AND AWARDED SECTION 5310 PROGRAM OF PROJECTS. METRO IS INCLUDING FUNDS MADE AVAILABLE TO LA COUNTY FROM FEDERAL FISCAL YEAR (FFY) 19-20 SECTION 5310 FORMULA APPORTIONMENTS TO LARGE URBANIZED AREAS (UZAS) IN LOS ANGELES COUNTY TOTALING $1115715 AS FOLLOWS: FFY20 SECTION 5310 LOS ANGELES-LONG BEACH-ANAHEIM (UZA #60020): $1055598FFY19 SECTION 5310 LANCASTER-PALMDALE (UZA #63510): $34795FFY19 SECTION 5310 SANTA CLARITA (UZA #61770): $25322TOTAL SECTION 5310: $1115715ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:OPERATING ASSISTANCE- PROGRAM SUPPORT ADMINISTRATIONTHESE PROGRAM SUPPORT ADMINISTRATION FUNDS WILL ALLOW METRO TO CONTINUE TO OVERSEE IMPLEMENTATION OF SECTION 5310 FUNDED PROJECTS BY SUBRECIPIENTS AND PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE GUIDANCE AND ADMINISTRATION SUPPORT TO THE LOS ANGELES COUNTYWIDE 5310 SUBRECIPIENTS IN ANY CAPACITY AS A RESULT OF THE VARIOUS SOLICITATION FOR PROPOSALS AND AWARDS CONDUCTED BY METRO. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:METRO WILL CONTINUE TO OVERSEE IMPLEMENTATION OF SECTION 5310 FUNDED PROJECTS BY LOS ANGELES COUNTY SECTION 5310 SUBRECIPIENTS AND CONTINUE DEVELOPING AND RELEASING NEW SECTION 5310 SOLICITATIONS EVERY 2-3 YEARS TO ENSURE NEW AND/OR EXPANDED SECTION 5310 PROJECTS CONTINUE IN LOS ANGELES COUNTY. METRO WILL CONTINUE TO CONDUCT TECHNICAL WORKSHOPS PERFORM ALL OVERSIGHT ACTIVITIES PROVIDE TECHNICAL PROCUREMENT GUIDANCE AND ASSISTANCE AND ATTEND ANY NECESSARY MEETINGS WITH SUBRECIPIENTS. METRO STAFF WILL ATTEND ANY TRAININGS MADE AVAILABLE BY FTA IN ORDER TO UPDATE EXISTING KNOWLEDGE OF THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM AND IN TURN COMMUNICATE THIS TO THE LOS ANGELES COUNTY SUBRECIPIENTS. METRO WILL CONTINUE TO WORK WITH THE SUBRECIPIENTS TO COMPLETE ALL REQUIRED REPORTING FOR THE PROGRAM.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:METRO WILL PROVIDE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM SUPPORT TO ITS 60+ SECTION 5310 SUBRECIPIENT AGENCIES IN LOS ANGELES COUNTY. THROUGH THIS SUPPORT METROS 60+ SUBRECIPIENT AGENCIES WILL BE ABLE TO SUCCESSFULLY IMPLEMENT THEIR FEDERALLY COMPLIANT PROJECTS TO ASSIST HUNDREDS OF THOUSANDS OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WITHIN LOS ANGELES COUNTY. APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE METROPOLITAN TRANSIT SYSTEM (MTS) OPERATES A TRADITIONAL FIXED-ROUTE BUS AND LIGHT RAIL SYSTEM. ALL RAIL CARS AND BUSES ARE RAMP OR LIFT EQUIPPED IN FULL COMPLIANCE WITH THE AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES ACT (ADA). MTS ALSO OPERATES A PARATRANSIT DIVISION MTS ACCESS FOR THOSE RIDERS WITH DISABILITIES WHO HAVE BEEN CERTIFIED AS FUNCTIONALLY UNABLE TO USE FIXED-ROUTE SERVICE. MTS ACCESS PROVIDES COMPLEMENTARY SERVICES THAT MIRROR THE LEVEL OF MTS REGULAR FIXED-ROUTE SERVICE BEING OFFERED WITHIN A MILE RADIUS OF A BUS ROUTE OR BUS OR TROLLEY STATION.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: ENHANCE SCHEDULING RESERVATION AND FARE PAYMENT TECHNOLOGY AS WELL AS INCLUDE THE OPTION OF A MOBILE APPLICATION TO BETTER ASSIST MTSS AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES ACT (ADA) PARATRANSIT SERVICE CUSTOMERS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THESE ENHANCEMENT PROJECT IS PART OF MTS ONGOING COMMITMENT TO PROVIDE SERVICE TO THE DISABILITY COMMUNITY.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ABOUT 570 SQUARE MILES OF THE URBANIZED AREAS OF SAN DIEGO COUNTY AS WELL AS THE RURAL PARTS OF EAST COUNTY 3240 TOTAL SQUARE MILES. SERVING APPROXIMATELY 3 MILLION PEOPLE IN SAN DIEGO COUNTY AS WELL AS VISITORS AND NEIGHBORING NAVAL STATION.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THIS RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUB-AWARD FUNDS.

FUNDING FOR THE PROJECT INCLUDED IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION IS PROVIDED BY THE FOLLOWING APPORTIONMENT YEAR AND URBANIZED AREAS (UZAS):FFY2021 SECTION 5310 LOS ANGELES/LONG BEACH/ANAHEIM (UZA #60020): $1767692FFY2021 SECTION 5310 MISSION VIEJO/LAKE FOREST/SAN CLEMENTE (UZA #60680): $523688TOTAL FFY2021 SECTION 5310: $2291380TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT CREDITS: $458276TOTAL ELIGIBLE PROJECT COST: $2291380THE LOCAL SHARE IS PROVIDED BY TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT CREDITS (TDCS). BECAUSE TDCS DO NOT ALLOCATE ACTUAL MONEY TOWARD PROJECT EXPENSES A 100% FEDERAL SHARE IS REFLECTED WHERE THE CREDITS ARE APPLIED.PURPOSETHE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SUPPORT OPERATING COSTS FOR ADA PARATRANSIT SERVICE IN ORANGE COUNTY CALIFORNIA.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMEDTHE ORANGE COUNTY TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY IS HEREBY SUBMITTING THIS GRANT APPLICATION IN SUPPORT OF THE FOLLOWING PROJECT:1) CAPITAL COST OF CONTRACTING FOR ACCESS SERVICES - NON-FIXED ROUTE PARATRANSIT OPERATING ASSISTANCETHIS GRANT APPLIES $2291380 IN FFY2021 SECTION 5310 FUNDS FOR PARATRANSIT OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR THE PERIOD 10/1/21 THROUGH 9/30/23. FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT THE ACCESS SERVICE CONTRACT WITH MV TRANSPORTATION TO PROVIDE NON-FIXED ROUTE PARATRANSIT TRANSPORTATION. THE 5-YEAR ACCESS SERVICE CONTACT WITH MV TRANSPORTATION STIPULATES THAT MV TRANSPORTATION PROVIDES MAINTENANCE AND PARATRANSIT SERVICE WHILE OCTA PROVIDES THE VEHICLES FOR CONTRACTED SERVICE OF THE REVENUE FLEET VEHICLES OWNED BY OCTA. THE TOTAL COST OF THE ACCESS SERVICE CONTRACT FOR THE 24-MONTH PERIOD IS APPROXIMATELY $48.5 MILLION. OCTA IS APPLYING $2291380 IN FTA SECTION 5310 FUNDS TOWARDS THIS COST. PLEASE NOTE ADDITIONAL FUNDING FOR ACCESS SERVICES IS INCLUDED IN GRANT FAIN # 1682-2020-16-P1 FOR A TOTAL OF $4475458 IN FFY21 SECTION 5339 AND GRANT FAIN #1682-2020-13-P1 FOR A TOTAL OF $12028663 IN FFY2021 SECTION 5307. AMONG THE THREE APPLICATIONS $18795501 IN TOTAL WILL BE REQUESTED WHICH IS 39% OF THE CONTRACT AMOUNT.THE PROJECT INCLUDED IN THIS APPLICATION (CAPITAL COST OF CONTRACTING FOR ACCESS SERVICES) IS INCLUDED IN A LOCALLY DEVELOPED COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT-HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLAN. A MINIMUM OF 55% OF THE ANNUAL UZA APPORTIONMENT WILL BE SPENT ON TRADITIONAL CAPITAL PROJECTS THAT ARE PANNED DESIGNED AND CARRIED OUT TO MEET THE SPECIAL NEEDS OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHEN PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IS INSUFFICIENT INAPPROPRIATE OR UNAVAILABLE.EXPECTED OUTCOMESTHIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO ENSURE OCTA CAN CONTINUE TO PROVIDE TRANSIT MOBILITY AND ACCESS TO THE ORANGE COUNTY COMMUNITY WITH PHYSICAL OR COGNITIVE LIMITATIONS THAT PREVENT THEM FROM UTILIZING THE PUBLIC FIXED-ROUTE BUS SERVICE IN ADDITION TO IMPROVING AIR QUALITY AND PROVIDING RELIABLE TRANSIT SERVICE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIESTHE BENEFICIARIES ARE THE ORANGE COUNTY COMMUNITY WITH PHYSICAL OR COGNITIVE LIMITATIONS THAT PREVENT THEM FROM UTILIZING THE PUBLIC FIXED-ROUTE BUS SERVICE IN ADDITION THE IMPROVEMENTS TO AIR QUALITY WILL BENEFIT ALL RESIDENTS OF ORANGE COUNTY.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIESOCTA DOES NOT INTEND TO SUB-AWARD FUNDS.

THE SFMTA WILL USE A TOTAL OF $421099 OF FY 2019 5310 MOBILITY OF SENIOR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES FORMULA FUNDS FOR THE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROJECT. THE MATCHING FUNDS OF $84220 WILL COME FROM TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT CREDITS. THE TOTAL PROJECT COSTS ARE $421099.THE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROJECT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR CONTINUED AND EXPANDED OPERATIONS OF THE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT CENTER A ONE-STOP CENTER FOR OLDER ADULTS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES (AS WELL AS THEIR FAMILY FRIENDS AND CAREGIVERS) TO RECEIVE INDIVIDUALIZED TRANSPORTATION INFORMATION REFERRALS AND ASSISTANCE. THE PROGRAM WILL INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: - MAKE IT EASIER FOR INDIVIDUALS TO FULLY UNDERSTAND THEIR OPTIONS BY SERVING AS AN INFORMATION CLEARINGHOUSE AND ALSO PROVIDING RIDERS WITH ASSISTANCE ENROLLING IN OR LEARNING HOW TO UTILIZE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES. - HIRE TWO NEW STAFF MEMBERS TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF POSSIBLE OUTREACH EVENTS AND TRAVEL TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES FOR OLDER ADULTS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES IN SAN FRANCISCO; - DEVELOP NEW CONTENT INCLUDING PRINTED COLLATERAL ONLINE CONTENT AND IN-PERSON OUTREACH AND TRAINING CURRICULUM TO ASSIST RIDERS IN UNDERSTANDING THEIR OPTIONS IN MULTIPLE LANGUAGES; AND - IDENTIFY GAPS AND DEVELOP AND ADMINISTER PROGRAMS AND SERVICES TO FILL THEM SUCH AS RECREATIONAL TRIPS SHOPPING SHUTTLES AND THE PEER ESCORT PROGRAM.

ACCORDINGLY STAFF MUST ACT IN THE BEST INTEREST OF THE AGENCY AND MAKE ORDER DECISIONS WHEN CHASSIS AND OR BUILD SLOTS BECOME AVAILABLE AVOIDING ADDITIONAL DELAYS. SECTION 5310 CA16-X064-GRANT THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA DIVISION OF MASS TRANSPORTATION IS SUBMITTING SECTION 5310 GRANT CA16-X064 FOR FY 2013 AND 2014 APPORTIONMENTS. THIS GRANT INCLUDES EIGHTY-TWO (82) CAPITAL PROJECTS MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROJECTS OPERATING PROJECTS PLUS ADMINISTRATIVE COSTS FOR A TOTAL OF $13467117. TOLL CREDITS WILL BE USED MAKING PROJECTS 100% FEDERALLY FUNDED. THESE PROJECTS ARE ALL INCLUDED IN A LOCALLY DEVELOPED COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT-HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLANS; AND THESE PLANS WERE DEVELOPED THROUGH A PROCESS THAT INCLUDED REPRESENTATIVES OF PUBLIC PRIVATE AND NONPROFIT TRANSPORTATION AND HUMAN SERVICES PROVIDERS. THE CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION STATE MANAGEMENT PLAN FOR FTA SECTION 5310 HAS BEEN SUBMITTED AND APPROVED BY FTA.OF THE EIGHTY-TWO (82) PROJECTS ALLOCATED SIXTEEN (16) ARE MOBILITY MANAGEMENT PROJECTS; TWENTY-FIVE (25) ARE OPERATING ASSISTANCE PROJECTS; AND FORTY-ONE (41) ARE CAPITAL PROJECTS AND INCLUDE: FIFTY-FOUR (54) ARE RURAL AGENCIES TWENTY-TWO (22) ARE SMALL URBAN AGENCIES AND SIX (6) URBAN/RURAL MIXED AGENCY. SIXTY-SIX (66) ARE NON-PROFIT AGENCIES EIGHTEEN (18) ARE PUBLIC AGENCIES.CURRENTLY NO PLANNING ACTIVITIES ARE PROGRAMMED BUT COULD OCCUR AT A LATER TIME. THESE PLANNING ACTIVITIES WILL COMPLY WITH THE RULES FOR USE OF 10% OF THE FUNDS. ALL EIGHTY-TWO (82) OF THE PROJECTS ARE IN CAT A. DAILY TRIPS AVERAGE FROM 150 TO 200 TRIPS PER DAY. 3. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: 55 DIALYSIS PATIENTS ARE SERVED DAILY FROM MONDAY TO SATURDAY. THE GRANT WILL PROVIDE FUNDS TO OPERATE THE TRANSPORTATION ACTIVITIES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL HAVE ACCESS TO MUCH NEEDED TRANSPORTATION AS FIXED ROUTE AND PARATRANSIT IS LIMITED IN THE MOBILE AL URBAN AREA.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL HAVE ACCESS TO MUCH NEEDED TRANSPORTATION AS FIXED ROUTE AND PARATRANSIT IS LIMITED IN THE MOBILE AL URBAN AREA.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE INDEPENDENT LIVING CENTER IS THE SUBRECIPIENT OF THE FUNDS. THE FUNDS WILL PROVIDE FOR THE DAILY OPERATIONS OF TRANSPORTATION.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE A PORTION OF FY22 FTA 5310 FUNDS FOR THE MOBILE URBAN AREA TO SUBRECIPIENTS TO CONTINUE ACTIVITIES FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. THIS APPLICATION IS FOR A TOTAL OF $503566 IN FY22 FTA 5310 FUNDS TO THE MOBILE URBAN AREA. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE CAPITAL COST OF THREE VEHICLES FOR THREE AGENCIES: THE CITY OF SARALAND; INDEPENDENT LIVING CENTER; AND MOBILE FIRST CHURCH OF THE NAZARENE COLORS OF LOVE ASSISTED VAN TRANSPORT PROGRAM. FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR THE PURCHASE OF VEHICLES AT 80% FTA 5310 FUNDS AND A 20% MATCH FROM LOCAL FUNDS. THERE WILL ALSO AN OPERATING AWARD FOR MOBILE FIRST CHURCH OF THE NAZARENE COLORS OF LOVE ASSISTED VAN TRANSPORT PROGRAM IN THE AMOUNT $5000 FEDERAL DOLLARS THAT WILL BE MATCHED AT 50% BY MOBILE FIRST CHURCH OF THE NAZARENE COLORS OF LOVE ASSISTED VAN TRANSPORT PROGRAM.. THE SOUTH ALABAMA REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION WILL RECEIVE $17300 FUNDING FOR ADMINISTRATION OF THE GRANT AT 100% FUNDING.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT THE AGENCIES TO CONTINUE AND EXPAND SAFE OPERATIONS FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES THAT WOULD OTHERWISE HAVE TO BE CUT DUE TO LACK OF FUNDING.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE CITY OF SARALAND THE INDEPENDENT LIVING CENTER AND COLORS OF LOVE ASSISTED VAN TRANSPORT PROGRAM.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: ALL OF THE ACTIVITIES IN THE GRANT WILL BE CARRIED OUT THROUGH THE SUBRECIPIENTS.BIL MOBILE URBAN AREA 5310 FUNDS IS THE FUNDING SOURCE FOR THIS GRANT.
